GluteusMaximus/WalkingAnkleGrab.preparation: Stand on one foot. Grasp foot with both hands by raising inside of foot upward with knee pointing outward; opposite hand grasps heal and near hand grasps shin, just above ankle.
GluteusMaximus/WalkingAnkleGrab.execution: Pull foot and lower leg upward until stretch is felt in hip. Release and step forward with stretched leg. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue by alternating stretch and step between each leg until specific distance is covered or desired number of repetitions have been completed.

HipAbductors/SeatedHipInternalRotator.name: Seated Hip Internal Rotator Stretch
HipAbductors/SeatedHipInternalRotator.execution: Sit on floor or mat and cross lower leg over thigh of straight leg.

HipAbductors/SeatedHipInternalRotatorCha.name: Seated Hip Internal Rotator Stretch (chair or bench)
HipAbductors/SeatedHipInternalRotatorCha.execution: Sit on chair or end of bench and cross legs with outside of ankle on lower thigh.

HipAbductors/SeatedHipInternalRotatorBen.name: Seated Hip Internal Rotator Stretch (bent leg under)
HipAbductors/SeatedHipInternalRotatorBen.execution: Sit on floor or mat and place extended leg on top of inside of bent lower leg positioned perpendicular.

HipAbductors/StandingIliotibial.name: Standing Iliotibial Stretch
HipAbductors/StandingIliotibial.execution: Stand erect with legs crossed, outsides of feet together.

HipAbductors/SquattingIliotibial.name: Squatting Iliotibial Stretch
HipAbductors/SquattingIliotibial.execution: Stand with feet together and side toward wall, arm's length away. Place hand on wall and opposite hand on hip.

HipAbductors/SidePretzel.name: Side Pretzel Stretch
HipAbductors/SidePretzel.execution: Sit on side of thigh on floor or mat with knees bent. Position bent knee of upper leg behind foot of lower leg. Position chest facing floor with both hands on floor; arms somewhat extended and torso nearly inline with upper thigh.

Hamstrings/LyingVerticalHamstring.name: Lying Vertical Hamstring Stretch
Hamstrings/LyingVerticalHamstring.preparation: Lie on floor with one leg extending up onto side of wall or column and other leg bent with foot on floor. One way this can be position can be achieved in a single motion is by sitting on floor with back of one shoulder against end of wall or column. Rotate body 90° onto back while swinging one leg up onto side of wall or column, ending up with back on floor and head positioned away from wall.
Hamstrings/LyingVerticalHamstring.execution: Straighten elevated knee until slight stretch is felt in back of thigh. If no stretch is felt, slowly straighten bent leg until slight stretch is felt in back of thigh. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg on opposite side of wall or column.
Hamstrings/LyingVerticalHamstring.comments: Those with greater than average hamstring flexibility may not find this stretch to be effective. In which case, an alternative stretch would be more suitable.

HipAdductors/BentoverAdductorMagnus.name: Bent-over Adductor Magnus Stretch
HipAdductors/BentoverAdductorMagnus.execution: Stand with one foot on chair or bench. Bend over.

HipAbductors/WallIliotibial.name: Wall Iliotibial Stretch
HipAbductors/WallIliotibial.execution: Stand with feet together and side toward wall, slightly greater than arm's length away. Place closest hand on wall and opposite hand on hip.

HipAdductors/KneelingAdductorMagnus.name: Kneeling Adductor Magnus Stretch
HipAdductors/KneelingAdductorMagnus.execution: Kneel with one foot on floor or mat. Position torso to inside of upper thigh with hands on floor.

HipAdductors/KneelingGroin.name: Kneeling Groin Stretch
HipAdductors/KneelingGroin.execution: Kneel with feet pointed out to sides. Place forearms and hands on floor.

HipAdductors/LyingAdductorMagnus.name: Lying Adductor Magnus Stretch
HipAdductors/LyingAdductorMagnus.execution: Lie supine on floor or mat. Raise knees and grasp back of thighs behind knees.

HipAdductors/LyingGroin.name: Lying Groin Stretch
HipAdductors/LyingGroin.execution: Lie on floor or mat. Place soles of feet together on floor close to body with knees far apart.

HipAdductors/KneelingSideLunge.name: Kneeling Side Lunge Stretch
HipAdductors/KneelingSideLunge.execution: Kneel on floor or mat. Place one foot pointing out and somewhat perpendicular to opposite kneeling leg.

HipAdductors/LyingGroinTowel.name: Lying Groin Stretch (towel)
HipAdductors/LyingGroinTowel.preparation: Loop towel or strap around foot and grasp ends with hand on same side of body. Lie supine on floor or mat with legs bent. With free foot on floor, extend bonded leg vertically while keeping hold of towel or strap. Extend free arm away from body.
HipAdductors/LyingGroinTowel.execution: Lower bonded leg out to side while controlling its descent and position with arm. Hold stretch. Repeat on opposite side.

HipAdductors/PCGroin.name: Lever Groin Stretch
HipAdductors/PCGroin.preparation: Sit on seat in forward position. Place hands through wrist straps. Hold lower bar with overhand grip. Position soles of feet together on top edge of shin pad.
HipAdductors/PCGroin.execution: Push and lower seat back. Hold stretch.

HipAdductors/MachSeatedGroin.name: Lever Seated Groin Stretch
HipAdductors/MachSeatedGroin.execution: Sit on apparatus with each leg on adjacent platforms.

HipAdductors/LyingWallGroin.name: Lying Wall Groin Stretch
HipAdductors/LyingWallGroin.execution: Sit on floor with hip and thigh against wall. Lift back of legs up against wall by pivoting on hips and lying on back. Place back of legs against wall.

HipAdductors/PNFBentLeg.name: PNF Bent Leg Groin Stretch
HipAdductors/PNFBentLeg.execution: Instruct participant to lie on floor or mat. Ask them to place soles of feet together on floor close to body with knees apart. Kneel close to participant and place hands on insides of participant's knees.

HipAdductors/SeatedGroin.name: Seated Groin Stretch (chair or bench)
HipAdductors/SeatedGroin.execution: Sit on end of chair or bench. Place legs as far apart as possible with knees bent approximately 90 degrees and feet flat on floor pointing same direction as knees. Lean over and position upper forearms inside lower thighs near knees.

HipAdductors/SeatedAdductorMagnus.name: Seated Adductor Magnus Stretch (chair or bench)
HipAdductors/SeatedAdductorMagnus.execution: Straddle and sit on chair or bench with feet far apart and feet on floor.

HipAdductors/PNFStraightLeg.name: PNF Straight Leg Groin Stretch
HipAdductors/PNFStraightLeg.execution: Instruct participant to lie on floor or mat with legs positioned straight up, slightly apart. Grasp participant's ankle from inside.

Hamstrings/PCHamstring.name: Lever Seated Hamstring Stretch
Hamstrings/PCHamstring.preparation: Sit on seat in forward position with lower leg on shin pad, feet on foot rest. Place hands through wrist straps. Hold lower bar with overhand grip.
Hamstrings/PCHamstring.execution: Push and lower seat back. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg.
Hamstrings/PCHamstring.comments: To intensify stretch, hold upper bar. Those with longer upper thigh may need to deliberately keep extended leg straight, position hips further back on seat, or perform alternative stretch.

HipAdductors/SeatedAdductorMagnusFloor.name: Seated Adductor Magnus Stretch
HipAdductors/SeatedAdductorMagnusFloor.execution: Sit on floor or mat with feet far apart and knees bent approximately 90 degrees. Reach forward grasp bottom of feet.

HipAdductors/SeatedGroinApparatus.name: Seated Groin Stretch (on apparatus)
HipAdductors/SeatedGroinApparatus.execution: Sit on platform facing adjustable handles. Spread legs apart and place inside of legs on outer surface of padded stumps. Straighten knees, grasp handles, and sit upright.

HipAdductors/SeatedSingleLegAdductorMagn.name: Seated Single Leg Adductor Magnus Stretch
HipAdductors/SeatedSingleLegAdductorMagn.execution: Sit on floor or mat and place outside of flexed leg on floor. Over that leg, position opposite leg with foot flat on floor and back of heel against shin.

HipAdductors/SquattingGroin.name: Squatting Groin Stretch
HipAdductors/SquattingGroin.execution: Stand with feet pointed approximately 45° outward. Squat down completely with knees pointed outward over toes. Place palms of hands on floor with inside of upper arm positioned against inner thigh.

HipAdductors/SeatedGroinFloor.name: Seated Groin Stretch
HipAdductors/SeatedGroinFloor.execution: Sit on floor or mat with soles of feet together on floor and close to body. Grasp feet with both hands and position elbows on inside of lower legs.

HipAdductors/SideLunge.name: Side Lunge Stretch
HipAdductors/SideLunge.execution: Stand with feet far apart, toes pointed 45° outward.

HipAdductors/StandingGroin.name: Standing Groin Stretch
HipAdductors/StandingGroin.execution: Stand next to upper thigh height surface off to side. Hold onto elevated surface or other stable structure for balance and place inner side of nearest bent lower leg on elevated surface.

HipExternalRotators/LyingHipExternalRota.name: Lying Hip External Rotator Stretch
HipExternalRotators/LyingHipExternalRota.execution: Lie on floor or mat and with one leg straight and other leg bent approximately 90 degrees out to side.

HipExternalRotators/LyingPiriformis.name: Lying Piriformis Stretch
HipExternalRotators/LyingPiriformis.execution: Lie on floor or mat with feet on floor and knees bent approximately 90 degrees. Cross thighs by lacing back of knee on thigh of other leg. Lift legs and hug both thighs locking both hands together behind knee of lower leg.

HipExternalRotators/PNFLyingPiriformis.name: PNF Lying Piriformis Stretch
HipExternalRotators/PNFLyingPiriformis.execution: Instruct participant to lie on floor or mat with legs bent. Stand near their feet facing them. Assist them crossing their thighs, placing outside of one knee close to top of their other knee. Bend over participant's hips, position their foot of closest bent leg on your chest or shoulder while grasping their lower leg, in addition to knee of opposite leg with other hand.

HipExternalRotators/PNFSeatedPiriformis.name: PNF Seated Piriformis Stretch
HipExternalRotators/PNFSeatedPiriformis.execution: Instruct participant to sit on floor or mat, reclining back with support of both arms behind body, and feet on floor and knees bent. Have them cross their thighs by placing back of knee on thigh of other leg. Ask them position foot on floor closer to hip. Place your hands on back of participants shoulders or position your chest on participant's upper back and your hands under participant's lower thighs.

HipExternalRotators/LyingPiriformisMod.name: Lying Piriformis Stretch (single leg)
HipExternalRotators/LyingPiriformisMod.execution: Lie on floor or mat. Lift one leg and grasp ankle and knee with both hands.

HipExternalRotators/SeatedHipExternalRot.name: Seated Hip External Rotator Stretch
HipExternalRotators/SeatedHipExternalRot.execution: Sit on floor or mat and with one leg straight and other leg bent approximately 90 degrees out to side.

Hamstrings/SoldierKick.name: Soldier Kick
Hamstrings/SoldierKick.preparation: Stand and step forward with left foot.
Hamstrings/SoldierKick.execution: Next step, extend left arm forward while swinging right leg up so foot touches or comes close to hand. Lower right leg. Repeat with same sequence on opposite side. Continue by alternating between each side until specific distance is covered or desired number of repetitions have been completed.

Hamstrings/SoldierKickIntermittent.name: Soldier Kick (intermittent)
Hamstrings/SoldierKickIntermittent.preparation: Stand and step forward with left foot.
Hamstrings/SoldierKickIntermittent.execution: Next step, extend left arm forward while swinging right leg up so foot touches or comes close to hand. Lower right leg, then take two steps, with left and right legs. Repeat with same sequence on opposite side. Continue by alternating between each side followed by double steps until specific distance is covered or desired number of repetitions have been completed.

HipExternalRotators/SeatedPiriformis.name: Seated Piriformis Stretch
HipExternalRotators/SeatedPiriformis.execution: Sit on floor or mat, reclining back with support of both arms behind body, and feet on floor and knees bent approximately 90 degrees. Cross thighs by placing back of knee on thigh of other leg. Grasp lower leg.

HipFlexors/LungingBench.name: Lunging Hip Flexor Stretch (on bench)
HipFlexors/LungingBench.preparation: Stand facing away from end of bench. Place one leg back on bench making contact with rear forefoot foot and knee.
HipFlexors/LungingBench.execution: Slowly lunge forward by continuing to bend forward leg. With chest high, straighten hip of rear leg by driving hips down and forward. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite side.
HipFlexors/LungingBench.comments: Legs should be far enough apart to keep knee from traveling too far beyond forward foot. Keep torso upright and forward foot flat on floor. Tensor Fasciae Latae can be emphasized by crossing rear leg inward behind forward leg while keeping hip of rear leg positioned same height of opposite hip.

HipFlexors/BentoverLungeHipFlexor.name: Bent-over Lunging Hip Flexor Stretch
HipFlexors/BentoverLungeHipFlexor.execution: Kneel down and position one leg extended behind. Balancing with hands positioned on floor to sides. Rear knee is extended off floor. Body weight is supported on both forefeet.

HipFlexors/LungingHipFlexor.name: Lunging Hip Flexor Stretch
HipFlexors/LungingHipFlexor.execution: Lunge with one foot far behind other foot.

HipExternalRotators/SeatedPiriformisChai.name: Seated Piriformis Stretch (chair or bench)
HipExternalRotators/SeatedPiriformisChai.execution: Sit on chair of bench with feet on floor and knees bent approximately 90 degrees. Cross thighs by placing back of knee on thigh of other leg. Grasp lower leg.

HipFlexors/Standing.name: Standing Hip Flexor Stretch
HipFlexors/Standing.execution: Stand facing bench or elevated platform, approximately legs length away. Place one foot on bench or platform.

HipFlexors/LyingHipFlexor.name: Lying Hip Flexor Stretch
HipFlexors/LyingHipFlexor.execution: Lie on tall bench with thigh hanging down off end or side of bench. Raise opposite thigh toward side of torso. Hook hand around inside of upper thigh. Grasp elbow with opposite hand and keep arms close to body.

HipFlexors/KneelingHipFlexor.name: Kneeling Hip Flexor Stretch
HipFlexors/KneelingHipFlexor.execution: Lunge forward with knee on padded mat. Position foot beyond forward knee. Place hands on knee.

Infraspinatus/Bentover.name: Bent-over Infraspinatus Stretch
Infraspinatus/Bentover.execution: Place both hands on waist with thumbs facing forward. Bend over so torso is parallel to floor.

Infraspinatus/Broomstick.name: Broom Stick Infraspinatus Stretch
Infraspinatus/Broomstick.preparation: Grasp pole at one end and position overhead with other end of pole behind opposite arm. Grasp other end of pole with hand positioned below elbow. Position elbow of lower arm close to height of shoulder.
Infraspinatus/Broomstick.execution: Pull upper end of pole forward so shoulder is internally rotated. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite arm.
Infraspinatus/Broomstick.comments: Before pulling pole forward, attempt to orientate pole as vertical as possible and elbow of lower arm as close to lateral of shoulder as possible.

Infraspinatus/Prone.name: Prone Infraspinatus Stretch
Infraspinatus/Prone.preparation: Lie prone on mat or floor. Extend arms out to each side on floor.  Bend elbows 90º and position back of hands to sides of body.
Infraspinatus/Prone.execution: Lower bend arms toward floor and hold stretch.
Infraspinatus/Prone.comments: Upper arms will end up perpendicular to torso while forearms will be parallel.

HipFlexors/SLLungingHipFlexor.name: Sled Kneeling Hip Flexor Stretch
HipFlexors/SLLungingHipFlexor.execution: Straddle machine and grasp handles for support. Place foot on lower platform under podium and other lower leg on padded support behind.

Infraspinatus/SeatedBentover.name: Seated Bent-over Infraspinatus Stretch
Infraspinatus/SeatedBentover.execution: Sit on bench or chair. Place both hands on waist with thumbs facing forward. Lean over and rest torso on thighs.

Infraspinatus/SideLyingTeresMinor.name: Side Lying Teres Minor Stretch
Infraspinatus/SideLyingTeresMinor.execution: Lie down on side on mat or floor. Position arm on floor with bent elbow positioned forward on mat and hand above elbow. With other hand, grasp back of wrist.

Infraspinatus/SideLying.name: Side Lying Infraspinatus Stretch
Infraspinatus/SideLying.execution: Lie supine on mat or floor with knees bent approximately 90 degrees. Position hand under side of waist, palm down.

LatissimusDorsi/BentoverFloor.name: Bent-over Lat Stretch
LatissimusDorsi/BentoverFloor.execution: Kneel on mat or floor. Extend arms well beyond knees and place forearms on floor.

Infraspinatus/Supine.name: Supine Infraspinatus Stretch
Infraspinatus/Supine.preparation: Lie supine on mat or floor with legs bent and feet on floor. Bend elbows 90º and position to side of shoulders with back of upper arm on floor.
Infraspinatus/Supine.execution: Keeping elbows bend at a right angles, push forearms downward toward floor and hold stretch.

LatissimusDorsi/Bar.name: Bar Lat Stretch
LatissimusDorsi/Bar.execution: Standing distance facing bar approximately lower chest height. Grasp bar with both hands. Lean body forward so bar is behind/under bar and arms are to sides of head. Feet are keep away from bar.

LatissimusDorsi/Bentover.name: Bent-over Lat Stretch (on chair or bench)
LatissimusDorsi/Bentover.execution: Kneel in front of chair on floor or mat. Place inside of crossed arms on end of chair and position head between arms.

LatissimusDorsi/PNFOverhead.name: PNF Overhead Lat Stretch
LatissimusDorsi/PNFOverhead.execution: Instruct participant to stand or sit on floor, chair, or bench and place arm overhead. Standing behind participant, grasp their wrist and position their forearm behind their head.

LatissimusDorsi/Overhead.name: Overhead Lat Stretch
LatissimusDorsi/Overhead.comments: Put one arm overhead. Grasp elbow or wrist overhead with other hand.

LatissimusDorsi/SeatedSideReach.name: Seated Side Reach Lat Stretch
LatissimusDorsi/SeatedSideReach.execution: Sit on bench or floor. Place one arm down to side on bench or floor, slightly behind for support. Put opposite arm overhead.

LatissimusDorsi/Supine.name: Supine Lat Stretch
LatissimusDorsi/Supine.preparation: Pull arms toward floor and back sides of head. Hold stretch.
LatissimusDorsi/Supine.execution: Stretch can also be performed with feet on floor and legs bent if participant is sensitive to spinal hyperextension.

LatissimusDorsi/StandingSideReach.name: Standing Side Reach Lat Stretch
LatissimusDorsi/StandingSideReach.execution: Stand with feet far apart. Place one arm on side of thigh. Put opposite arm overhead.

Obliques/LyingBentLeg.name: Lying Bent Leg Oblique Stretch
Obliques/LyingBentLeg.execution: Lie supine on floor or mat. Bend knees and place feet flat on floor.

LatissimusDorsi/Wall.name: Wall Lat Stretch
LatissimusDorsi/Wall.execution: Standing toward wall. Bend over and place palms of hands on wall, approximately shoulder width and waist height.

Obliques/SeatedBentLeg.name: Seated Bent Leg Oblique Stretch
Obliques/SeatedBentLeg.execution: Sit on floor or mat. Lean back slightly and place arms behind body with hands on floor for support. Bend knees and hips and place feet flat on floor.

Obliques/LyingCrossover.name: Lying Crossover Stretch
Obliques/LyingCrossover.execution: On floor or mat, lie supine with arms extended to sides. Lift one leg straight up.

Obliques/Pretzel.name: Pretzel Stretch
Obliques/Pretzel.execution: Sit on floor or mat with knees straight. Place one foot on floor to outside of other knee. Turn torso toward side of bent knee supporting body with extended arm behind. Place elbow of opposite arm to outside of bent knee.

PectoralisMinor/BenchAngel.name: Bench Angel
PectoralisMinor/BenchAngel.preparation: Lie prone on bench with legs bent and feet on bench. Position arms straight to each side of head pointed away from feet with palms facing up.
PectoralisMinor/BenchAngel.execution: Slowly move arms apart, out to each side, while pushing shoulders down into bench and keeping arms as low as possible. Continue pulling arms toward body until hands are out to sides of hips without allowing shoulders to raise up off bench. Slowly return arms to starting position while keeping shoulder pushed down against bench. Repeat.
PectoralisMinor/BenchAngel.comments: This dynamic shoulder girdle stretch can inprove shoulder mobility, enhance shoulder girdle posture, and decrease risk of injury for those with

PectoralisMinor/Doorway.name: Doorway Modified Chest Stretch
PectoralisMinor/Doorway.execution: Stand at end of wall or in doorway facing perpendicular to wall. Place front of shoulder and inside of bent arm on surface of wall. Position bent elbow around same height of shoulder. Position both feet back behind original stance.

PectoralisMinor/Towel.name: Towel Shoulder Girdle Stretch
PectoralisMinor/Towel.execution: Grasp large towel or rope with very wide overhand grip, approximately length of arm to opposite elbow. Raise towel over head.

PectoralisMinor/Lying.name: Lying Shoulder Girdle Stretch
PectoralisMinor/Lying.preparation: Lie supine with soles of feet on floor, hips and knees bent. Bend elbows and position back of arms against floor or mat with elbows to sides.
PectoralisMinor/Lying.execution: Push shoulders, forearms, and back of hand into floor or mat and slowly move arms toward sides of head. Still pushing shoulders and back of arms into floor, slowly arms toward sides.
PectoralisMinor/Lying.comments: This dynamic shoulder girdle stretch exercises rhomboids and trapezius isometrically while stretching pectoralis minor and major. It can be prescribed for

Quadriceps/Kneeling.name: Kneeling Quadriceps Stretch
Quadriceps/Kneeling.execution: Kneel with knee on padded mat and other foot positioned forward. Place hands on knee. Grasp other hand under top of foot.

Quadriceps/LungingBench.name: Seated Quadriceps Stretch
Quadriceps/LungingBench.preparation: Sit with right thigh and hip on one side of bench or chair. Allow left knee to point down while grasping top ankle or forefoot behind with left hand.
Quadriceps/LungingBench.execution: Pull ankle or forefoot to rear end and straighten hip by moving knee backwards. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite side.
Quadriceps/LungingBench.comments: Alternatively, hip may be initially extended, then ankle can be slowly pulled towards rear end. With either technique, do not allow knee to flare outward to side.

Quadriceps/ProneLying.name: Lying (prone) Quadriceps Stretch
Quadriceps/ProneLying.execution: Lie prone on mat or floor. Grasp top ankle or forefoot behind.

Quadriceps/PNFProneLying.name: PNF Lying (prone) Quadriceps Stretch
Quadriceps/PNFProneLying.execution: Instruct participant to lie prone on mat or floor. Straddle participant facing toward feet. Knee beside participant with leg extended over or just above participant's hips. Bend participant's near knee and place hand under participant's upper leg and opposite hand on ankle.

Quadriceps/SideLying.name: Lying (side) Quadriceps Stretch
Quadriceps/SideLying.execution: Lie on one side. Grasp top ankle or forefoot behind. Pull ankle or forefoot to rear end.

Quadriceps/Standing.name: Standing Quadriceps Stretch
Quadriceps/Standing.preparation: Stand and touch wall or stationary object for balance. Grasp top ankle or forefoot behind.
Quadriceps/Standing.execution: Pull ankle or forefoot to rear end and straighten hip by moving knee backward. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite side.
Quadriceps/Standing.comments: Alternatively, hip may be initially extended, then ankle can be slowly pulled towards rear end. With either technique, do not allow knee to flare outward to side. If low back is sensitive to hyperextension, hip should be postured in more neutral position than demonstrated. If knee is not completely flexed,

Quadriceps/StandingGroinApparatus.name: Standing Quadriceps Stretch (on apparatus)
Quadriceps/StandingGroinApparatus.preparation: Stand facing slightly away from adjustable shelf positioned upper thigh to hip height. Grasp support for balance. With assistance from other hand, position foot on shelf behind hip. Grasp supports with both hands and stand upright.
Quadriceps/StandingGroinApparatus.execution: Bend supporting knee slightly while positioning hip back closer to heel. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite side.
Quadriceps/StandingGroinApparatus.comments: If low back is sensitive to hyperextension, hips should be postured in more neutral position than demonstrated by positioning shelf lower and bending supporting knee more. If knee is not completely flexed,

Quadriceps/StandingPlatform.name: Standing Quadriceps Stretch (on platform)
Quadriceps/StandingPlatform.preparation: Stand facing slightly away from upper thigh to hip height platform. Position foot on platform behind hip and balance on one leg. Place hands on hips.
Quadriceps/StandingPlatform.execution: Bend supporting knee while positioning hip back closer to heel. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite side.
Quadriceps/StandingPlatform.comments: If balance is an issue, arms can be extended back so hands can be placed on platform on each side. If knee is not completely flexed,

RectusAbdominis/Kneeling.name: Kneeling Abdominal Stretch
RectusAbdominis/Kneeling.execution: Kneel on floor or mat with hips straight. Place hands on back of hips

Quadriceps/StandingTowel.name: Standing Quadriceps Stretch (towel)
Quadriceps/StandingTowel.preparation: With foot on bench or floor place towel around ankle. Grasp both ends of towel behind ankle with closest hand. Stand on opposite leg and touch wall or stationary object with other arm for balance.
Quadriceps/StandingTowel.execution: Pull foot to rear end with towel and straighten hip by moving knee backward. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite side.
Quadriceps/StandingTowel.comments: Alternatively, hip may be initially extended, then ankle can be slowly pulled towards rear end. With either technique, do not allow knee to flare outward to side. If low back is sensitive to hyperextension, hip should be postured in more neutral position than demonstrated. If knee is not completely flexed

RectusAbdominis/Prone.name: Lying (Prone) Abdominal Stretch
RectusAbdominis/Prone.execution: Lie prone on mat or floor. Position hands on floor to sides of shoulders.

RectusAbdominis/Supine.name: Lying (supine) Abdominal Stretch
RectusAbdominis/Supine.execution: Lie supine on mat or floor with arms extended overhead and legs straight.

Rhomboids/FixedBar.name: Fixed Bar Rhomboids Stretch
Rhomboids/FixedBar.execution: Stand facing very close to stationary bar. Grasp stationary bar with both hands just below chest height.

Rhomboids/Hugging.name: Hugging Stretch
Rhomboids/Hugging.execution: Cross both arms and place both hands behind shoulders of opposite arms.

Soleus/Bentover.name: Pike Bent Leg Calf Stretch
Soleus/Bentover.execution: There are number of ways to enter into this stretch:

Soleus/FloorBoard.name: Floor Board Bent Knee Calf Stretch
Soleus/FloorBoard.execution: Face wall with both knees slightly bent. Position fore foot on wall with heel on floor.

Soleus/Kneeling.name: Kneeling Calf Stretch
Soleus/Kneeling.execution: Kneel on lower leg. Place foot of opposite leg flat on floor.

Soleus/Lunging.name: Lunging Bent Knee Calf Stretch
Soleus/Lunging.execution: Stand with one leg far forward and other leg extended back with knees straight. Both feet are positioned directly forward.

HipExternalRotators/PCPiriformis.name: Lever Piriformis Stretch
HipExternalRotators/PCPiriformis.preparation: Sit on seat in forward position with lower leg on shin pad, feet on foot rest. Place hands through wrist straps. Hold upper bar with overhand grip, both hands left of center. Position left leg extended toward right center.
HipExternalRotators/PCPiriformis.execution: Push and lower seat back. Repeat with opposite leg.
HipExternalRotators/PCPiriformis.comments: Low back may be stretched if hips and low back muscles are tight.

Soleus/Seated.name: Seated Bent Leg Calf Stretch
Soleus/Seated.execution: Sit of floor or mat. Place heel on floor or mat with bent knee upright. Grasp top of forefoot.

Soleus/SingleLegBentover.name: Single Leg Pike Bent Leg Calf Stretch
Soleus/SingleLegBentover.execution: Step forward with one front forward. Bend over and place hands on floor well in front of forward foot with arms straight. Bend rear leg and place rear foot flat on floor.

Soleus/Step.name: Step Bent Knee Calf Stretch
Soleus/Step.execution: Position toes and balls of feet on stair step or calf block with arches and heels extending off. Place support leg up to higher steps. Use railing or wall for balance. Bend rear knee.

Soleus/Wall.name: Wall Bent Knee Calf Stretch
Soleus/Wall.execution: Place both hands on wall with arms extended. Lean against wall with one leg bent forward and other leg extended back. Bend rear knee slightly, positioned foot directly forward, and place heal to floor.

HipFlexors/PCHipFlexor.name: Lever Hip Flexor Stretch
HipFlexors/PCHipFlexor.preparation: Flip seat all way back. Stand facing bar with supporting foot slightly forward under, or near apparatus. Grasp handle bars for support. Place top of other foot back on top edge of shin pad.
HipFlexors/PCHipFlexor.execution: Squat down with back straight while straightening hip of rear leg by pushing hips forward. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite side.
HipFlexors/PCHipFlexor.comments: Keep foot away from fully extended hip to keep emphasis on Iliopsoas. See

Soleus/Towel.name: Towel Bent Leg Calf Stretch
Soleus/Towel.execution: Sit of floor or mat. With both ends of towel or band in each hand, place towel or band under foot.

Subscapularis/Broomstick.name: Broom Stick Subscapularis Stretch
Subscapularis/Broomstick.preparation: Grasp end of pole with one hand. Flip pole over upper arm. Position bent arm to side of body with other end of pole behind arm. Reach across body as far as possible with opposite arm and grasp lower end of pole. Position elbow at height of shoulder with pole positioned on back side of upper arm.
Subscapularis/Broomstick.execution: Pull lower end of pole forward and upward so shoulder is externally rotated. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite arm.
Subscapularis/Broomstick.comments: Before pulling pole forward and upward, attempt to orientate pole as vertical as possible and elbow of upper arm as close to lateral of shoulder as possible.

Subscapularis/Doorway.name: Doorway Subscapularis Stretch
Subscapularis/Doorway.execution: Stand at end of wall or in doorway facing perpendicular to wall. Bent elbow and place inside of forearm on surface of wall. Position bent elbow just below height of shoulder. Place far leg forward and near leg back.

Splenius/Neck.name: Neck Extensor Stretch
Splenius/Neck.execution: Bow head forward with jaw shut. Depress chin into top of sternum.

TibialisAnterior/Kneeling.name: Kneeling Shin Stretch
TibialisAnterior/Kneeling.execution: Kneel on both knees with buttocks over both heels and feet extend back.

TibialisAnterior/Lying.name: Lying Shin Stretch
TibialisAnterior/Lying.execution: Lie on one side. Grasp top forefoot behind.

LatissimusDorsi/PCUnderhand.name: Lever Lat Stretch
LatissimusDorsi/PCUnderhand.preparation: Sit on seat in forward position with lower legs on shin pad, feet on foot rest. Place hands through wrist straps. Hold upper bar with underhand grip.
LatissimusDorsi/PCUnderhand.execution: Push and lower seat back. Hold stretch.
LatissimusDorsi/PCUnderhand.comments: To intensify stretch, look up or to one side.

TibialisAnterior/Standing.name: Standing Shin Stretch
TibialisAnterior/Standing.execution: Stand and touch wall or stationary object for balance. Grasp forefoot behind.

TibialisAnterior/Seated.name: Seated Shin Stretch
TibialisAnterior/Seated.execution: Sit on chair or bench and cross lower leg over thigh of opposite leg. Place one hand above ankle and other hand on top of your foot.

Triceps/PNFOverhead.name: PNF Overhead Triceps Stretch
Triceps/PNFOverhead.execution: Instruct participant to stand or sit on floor, chair, or bench and place arm overhead. Standing behind participant, grasp their wrist and position their forearm against upper arm.

TrapeziusUpper/Chair.name: Chair Trapezius Stretch
TrapeziusUpper/Chair.preparation: Sit on chair slightly angled to right. Position legs far apart with feet on floor. Bend over slightly to grasp back of front right chair leg with left hand.
TrapeziusUpper/Chair.execution: Pull up on chair leg by position torso more upright while allowing left shoulder to be pulled downward. Hold stretch. Repeat on opposite side while sitting slightly angled to left.

WristExtensors/Kneeling.name: Kneeling Wrist Extensor Stretch
WristExtensors/Kneeling.execution: Kneel on floor or mat. Flex wrists and place tops of hand on floor with fingers pointing toward knees.

Triceps/Overhead.name: Overhead Triceps Stretch
Triceps/Overhead.execution: Put one arm overhead. Position forearm as close as possible to upper arm. Grasp elbow overhead with other hand.

TrapeziusUpper/Trap.name: Upper Trapezius Stretch
TrapeziusUpper/Trap.preparation: Grasp wrist or hand from behind and pull arm to opposite side.
TrapeziusUpper/Trap.execution: Tilt head away from lowered shoulder by positioning ear toward front of opposite shoulder. Hold stretch. Repeat to other side.

Triceps/Towel.name: Towel Triceps Stretch
Triceps/Towel.execution: Grasp near end of towel or rope. Position towel behind head so towel dangles down behind body. Reach behind back or waist with opposite hand and grasp opposite end of towel. Position upper arm close to back side of head.

WristFlexors/Kneeling.name: Kneeling Wrist Flexor Stretch
WristFlexors/Kneeling.execution: Kneel on floor or mat. Place palms of hand on floor with fingers pointing toward knees.

WristFlexors/Single.name: Single Arm Wrist Flexor Stretch
WristFlexors/Single.execution: With palm facing downward, grasp underside of fingers with other hand and straighten elbow.

WristFlexors/Praying.name: Praying Wrist Flexor Stretch
WristFlexors/Praying.execution: Place palms together in front of body. Point fingers toward neck.

WristFlexors/Seated.name: Seated Wrist Flexor Stretch
WristFlexors/Seated.execution: Sit on floor. Place palms on floor to sides, behind hips with fingers pointing to back.

WristExtensors/Single.name: Single Arm Wrist Extensor Stretch
WristExtensors/Single.execution: With palm facing downward, pull wrist and fingers downward toward forearm.

Quadriceps/PCQuad.name: Lever Quadriceps Stretch
Quadriceps/PCQuad.execution: Flip seat all way back. Stand facing bar with supporting foot slightly forward under, or near apparatus. Grasp handle bars for support. Place top of other foot back on top edge of shin pad.

PectoralisMinor/Wall.name: Wall Angel
PectoralisMinor/Wall.preparation: Position back against wall. Place feet away from wall, slightly bending hips and knees. Bend elbows and position back of arms against wall with elbows to sides.
PectoralisMinor/Wall.execution: Push shoulders and back of arms and hands into wall and slowly raise arms as high as possible. Still pushing shoulders arms, slowly lower arms to starting position.
PectoralisMinor/Wall.comments: This dynamic shoulder girdle stretch can inprove shoulder mobility, enhance shoulder girdle posture, and decrease risk of injury for those with

Quadriceps/WalkingQuadStretch.name: Walking Quadriceps Stretch
Quadriceps/WalkingQuadStretch.preparation: Stand and step forward with left foot.
Quadriceps/WalkingQuadStretch.execution: Standing on left foot, position right foot behind and grasp it with right hand. Pull right heel toward right glute while pulling right knee down and back. Release right foot, step forward with right foot, and repeat on left side while standing on right foot. Continue by alternating between each side until specific distance is covered or desired number of repetitions have been completed.
Quadriceps/WalkingQuadStretch.comments: Pull knee in if it initially flares outward to side. This

BackGeneral/BBUnderhandBentOverRow.name: Barbell Underhand Bent-over Row
BackGeneral/BBUnderhandBentOverRow.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with underhand grip.
BackGeneral/BBUnderhandBentOverRow.execution: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/BBUnderhandBentOverRow.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See

BackGeneral/BBCloseGripBentOverRow.name: Barbell Close Grip Bent-over Row
BackGeneral/BBCloseGripBentOverRow.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
BackGeneral/BBCloseGripBentOverRow.execution: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/BBCloseGripBentOverRow.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See

BackGeneral/BWSupineRowFeetElevated.name: Inverted Row (feet elevated)
BackGeneral/BWSupineRowFeetElevated.preparation: Lay on back under fixed horizontal bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Place back of heels on elevated surface.
BackGeneral/BWSupineRowFeetElevated.execution: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/BWSupineRowFeetElevated.comments: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. Placing back of heels on elevated surface is optional. This exercise is typically performed without added resistance, although additional weight can be placed on belly or pelvis. Partner can add and remove weight, and keep weight from sliding off belly. Resistance can be reduced by raising bar and positioning heels on floor. See

BackGeneral/BWSupineRowHigh.name: Inverted Row (high bar)
BackGeneral/BWSupineRowHigh.preparation: Stand facing arms length away from waist to head height horizontal bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Position body under bar with legs, hips and spine straight. Arms should be straight, approximately perpendicular to body. Heels should make contact with floor.
BackGeneral/BWSupineRowHigh.execution: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/BWSupineRowHigh.comments: Bar height can be adjusted to vary resistance. See

BackGeneral/BWSupineRowHips.name: Inverted Row (on hips)
BackGeneral/BWSupineRowHips.preparation: Lay on back with belly under fixed horizontal bar. Bend knees and position feet on floor. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
BackGeneral/BWSupineRowHips.execution: Keeping hips on floor and low back straight, pull torso up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/BWSupineRowHips.comments: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See

BackGeneral/BWSupineRow.name: Inverted Row
BackGeneral/BWSupineRow.preparation: Lay on back under fixed horizontal bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
BackGeneral/BWSupineRow.execution: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/BWSupineRow.comments: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See

BackGeneral/BBBentOverRow.name: Barbell Bent-over Row
BackGeneral/BBBentOverRow.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
BackGeneral/BBBentOverRow.execution: Pull bar to upper waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/BBBentOverRow.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See

BackGeneral/CBAlternatingHighRow.name: Cable Alternating Seated High Row
BackGeneral/CBAlternatingHighRow.preparation: Sit and grasp cable stirrups one with each hand. Lean back slightly allowing arms, shoulders, and torso to be pulled forward under weight on cables.
BackGeneral/CBAlternatingHighRow.execution: Pull one cable stirrup to side. Pull shoulder back, push chest forward, and rotate body slightly toward pulling arm. Return until arm is extended and torso faces forward. Pull with opposite arm alternating between each side. Repeat.
BackGeneral/CBAlternatingHighRow.comments: Rotation of torso as shown is optional. Quadratus Lumborum and Obliques act as stabilizers if waist is not rotated as demonstrated. Hamstrings and Gluteus Maximus act as stabilizers if seat is not available and legs are propped forward.

BackGeneral/CBInclineRow.name: Cable Incline Row
BackGeneral/CBInclineRow.preparation: Sit on incline and place feet on lower bar, or foot platform. Slide hips down by bending knees. Bend over and grasp cable attachment. Slide hips back, positioning knees with slight bend.
BackGeneral/CBInclineRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to waist while straightening back upright. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/CBInclineRow.comments: Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

BackGeneral/CBLyingRow.name: Cable Lying Row
BackGeneral/CBLyingRow.preparation: Straddle head of bench and grasp stirrups on two high pulley cables. Lie on bench with stirrups in each hand and arms extended upward.
BackGeneral/CBLyingRow.execution: Pull stirrups down to each side of chest until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched upward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/CBLyingRow.comments: Pulleys should not be too far apart, as they are on standard cable crossover machines. Stirrups on pulleys should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward when arms extend. Pull shoulder blades together when completing pull. Other rowing exercises should be considered if resistance required begins to exceed upper body weight since back will begin to raise up off of bench.

BackGeneral/CBOneArmHighRow.name: Cable One Arm Seated High Row
BackGeneral/CBOneArmHighRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on platform or secured bench close to cable attachment. Bend forward and grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Slide hips back by positioning knees with slight bend. Allow arm, shoulder, and torso to be pulled forward under weight on cable.
BackGeneral/CBOneArmHighRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side of torso, straightening back and leaning back slightly. Pull shoulder back and push chest forward during contraction. Return until arm is extended and torso is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
BackGeneral/CBOneArmHighRow.comments: It is optional to bend lower back forward during stretch and pull it upright during contraction. If torso does not bend forward, Erector Spinae acts as stabilizer muscle. See

BackGeneral/CBOneArmBentoverRow.name: Cable One Arm Bent-over Row
BackGeneral/CBOneArmBentoverRow.preparation: Grasp cable stirrup. Step back away from pulley, with foot on same side as exercising arm, positioned out to side well behind forward foot. Bend over with hand on nearby bar or above knee for support. Keep back straight and knees slightly bent. Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward.
BackGeneral/CBOneArmBentoverRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side of torso, pulling shoulder back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
BackGeneral/CBOneArmBentoverRow.comments: Supporting hand can also be placed on nearby bar, available on some pulley machines. Hamstrings and Gluteus Maximus stabilize near top of movement on forward leg.

BackGeneral/CBOneArmKneelingRow.name: Cable Kneeling Row
BackGeneral/CBOneArmKneelingRow.preparation: Place right knee on lower pad (positioned to right side) with foot of other leg slightly back out to side and knee slightly bent. Place right forearm on right side of upper pad and grasp handle. Grasp cable stirrup below with left hand. Allow left shoulder to be pulled forward without spinal rotation.
BackGeneral/CBOneArmKneelingRow.execution: Pull stirrup up to side until elbow travels beyond surface of back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched downward. Repeat and continue with opposite side.
BackGeneral/CBOneArmKneelingRow.comments: Allow scapula to articulate, but do not rotate torso.

Biceps/BWUnderhandSupineRow.name: Inverted Biceps Row
Biceps/BWUnderhandSupineRow.preparation: Lay on back under fixed horizontal bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
Biceps/BWUnderhandSupineRow.execution: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
Biceps/BWUnderhandSupineRow.comments: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See

BackGeneral/CBOneArmRow.name: Cable One Arm Seated Row
BackGeneral/CBOneArmRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on platform or secured bench in order to grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Position hips back with knees slightly bent   . Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward.
BackGeneral/CBOneArmRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side of torso, slightly twisting through waist. Pull shoulder back and push chest forward during contraction. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
BackGeneral/CBOneArmRow.comments: It is optional to bend lower back forward during stretch and pull it upright during contraction. If low back is kept still, Erector Spinae acts as synergist muscle. Also see

Biceps/BWUnderhandSupineRowHigh.name: Inverted Biceps Row (high bar)
Biceps/BWUnderhandSupineRowHigh.preparation: Stand facing arms length away from waist to head height horizontal bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Position body under bar with legs, hips and spine straight. Arms should be straight, approximately perpendicular to body. Heels should make contact with floor with feet about perpendicular to legs.
Biceps/BWUnderhandSupineRowHigh.execution: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
Biceps/BWUnderhandSupineRowHigh.comments: Bar height can be adjusted to vary resistance. See

BackGeneral/CBOneArmStandingRow.name: Cable Standing Row
BackGeneral/CBOneArmStandingRow.preparation: Stand to side of medium height, rotating pulley. Place hand shoulder height or slightly lower on support bar with arm straight. Place foot nearest supporting arm forward with knee slightly bent and opposite foot back. Grasp cable stirrup with one hand, allowing shoulder to be pulled forward under weight on cable.
BackGeneral/CBOneArmStandingRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side of torso while pulling shoulder back, arching spine, and pushing chest forward. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
BackGeneral/CBOneArmStandingRow.comments: Stirrup handle should be behind supporting bar. Few pulley units have vertical support bar (for supporting hand) far enough back from pulley to allow full range of motion and adequate pulley rotation to allow it to be aligned with line of pull. If pulley unit does not allow for this configuration, consider placing sturdy prop (for supporting hand) in front of pulley, far back enough to allow full range of motion. Also see

BackGeneral/CBOneArmStandingLowRow.name: Cable Standing Low Row
BackGeneral/CBOneArmStandingLowRow.preparation: Stand to side of low pulley. Place hand on support bar with arm straight. Place foot nearest supporting arm forward with knee slightly bent and opposite foot back. Grasp cable stirrup with one hand, allowing shoulder to be pulled forward under weight on cable.
BackGeneral/CBOneArmStandingLowRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side of torso while pulling shoulder back, arching spine, and pushing chest forward. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

BackGeneral/CBOneArmTwistingHighRow.name: Cable Twisting Seated High Row
BackGeneral/CBOneArmTwistingHighRow.execution: Sit on seat or bench. Bend forward and grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward with twist through waist.

BackGeneral/CBOneArmStrBackHighRow.name: Cable One Arm Straight Back Seated High Row
BackGeneral/CBOneArmStrBackHighRow.preparation: Sit on seat or bench. Bend forward and grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Position torso upright allowing shoulder to be pulled forward under weight on cable.
BackGeneral/CBOneArmStrBackHighRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side of torso while pulling shoulder back, arching spine, and pushing chest forward. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
BackGeneral/CBOneArmStrBackHighRow.comments: If two high pulleys are available, consider using opposite pulley as arm exercised. If pulley is far away enough, it is optional to bend lower back forward during stretch and pull it upright during contraction. See

BackGeneral/CBOneArmTwistingRow.name: Cable Twisting Seated Row
BackGeneral/CBOneArmTwistingRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on platform or secured bench close to cable attachment. Bend forward and grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Slide hips back by positioning knees with slight bend. Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward with forward bend and twist through waist.
BackGeneral/CBOneArmTwistingRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side, extending and twisting through waist. Pull shoulders back and sit upright while pushing chest forward during contraction. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat and perform exercise with opposite arm.

BackGeneral/CBSeatedHighRow.name: Cable Seated High Row
BackGeneral/CBSeatedHighRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench or platform in order to   grasp cable attachment. Place feet on vertical platform. Slide hips back positioning knees with slight bend. Allow weight on cable to pull torso forward while stretching arms and shoulders upward.
BackGeneral/CBSeatedHighRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to waist and lean back slightly. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until torso, arms, and shoulders pulled forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/CBSeatedHighRow.comments: It is optional to bend lower back forward during stretch and pull it upright during contraction. If low back is kept still, Erector Spinae acts as synergist muscle. Also see exercise on

BackGeneral/CBSeatedRow.name: Cable Seated Row
BackGeneral/CBSeatedRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on seat or bench in order to   grasp cable attachment. Place feet on vertical platform. Slide hips back positioning knees with slight bend.
BackGeneral/CBSeatedRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to waist while straightening lower back. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/CBSeatedRow.comments: Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

BackGeneral/CBStandingTwistingHighRow.name: Cable Twisting Standing High Row
BackGeneral/CBStandingTwistingHighRow.preparation: Stand facing high pulley positioned slightly above head level. Grasp stirrup with one hand and step back so arm is straight. With leg of opposite side as loaded arm, plant forefoot far back on floor. Slightly bend knee of forward leg, same direction as foot. Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward with twist through waist.
BackGeneral/CBStandingTwistingHighRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side of torso and rotate body toward side of pulling arm. Pull shoulder back and push chest forward. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
BackGeneral/CBStandingTwistingHighRow.comments: In standing position, both spinal rotation and hip rotation contribute to body's rotation. Because rear leg is only supported by forefoot, hip of forward leg is utilized (hip

BackGeneral/CBStraightBackInclineRow.name: Cable Straight Back Incline Row
BackGeneral/CBStraightBackInclineRow.preparation: Sit on incline and place feet on lower bar, or foot platform. Slide hips down by bending knees. Bend over and grasp cable attachment. Slide hips back, positioning knees with slight bend. Straighten lower back so it is approximately perpendicular to incline.
BackGeneral/CBStraightBackInclineRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to waist. Pull shoulders back and lift chest by arching back. Return until arms are extended, back is straight and perpendicular to incline, and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.

BackGeneral/CBStraightBackSeatedRow.name: Cable Straight Back Seated Row
BackGeneral/CBStraightBackSeatedRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench with feet on foot bar or vertical platform. Grasp close grip cable attachment. Straighten torso   upright and slide hips back so knees are slightly bent.
BackGeneral/CBStraightBackSeatedRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to waist. Pull shoulders back and lift chest by arching back. Return until arms are extended, back is straight, and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.

BackGeneral/CBWideGripSeatedRow.name: Cable Wide Grip Seated Row
BackGeneral/CBWideGripSeatedRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on platform in order to grasp cable attachment. With awider than shoulder width grip, slide hips back positioning knees with slight bend.
BackGeneral/CBWideGripSeatedRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to waist while pulling torso upright.   Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/CBWideGripSeatedRow.comments: Begin with light weight and additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

BackGeneral/CBWideGripStrBackSeatedRow.name: Cable Wide Grip Straight Back Seated Row
BackGeneral/CBWideGripStrBackSeatedRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench or platform in order to grasp cable bar attachment. With wider than shoulder width overhand grip, straighten torso upright and slide hips back until knees are only   slightly bent.
BackGeneral/CBWideGripStrBackSeatedRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to waist. Pull shoulders back and lift chest by arching back. Return until arms are extended, back is straight, and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.

BackGeneral/CamberedBarLyingRow.name: Cambered Barbell Lying Row
BackGeneral/CamberedBarLyingRow.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp cambered barbell below with overhand grip.
BackGeneral/CamberedBarLyingRow.execution: Pull bar to upper waist or lower chest. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/CamberedBarLyingRow.comments: Bench should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward without barbell hitting floor.

BackGeneral/DBBentOverRow.name: Dumbbell Bent-over Row
BackGeneral/DBBentOverRow.preparation: Kneel over side of bench by placing knee and hand of supporting arm on bench. Position foot of opposite leg slightly back to side. Grasp dumbbell from floor.
BackGeneral/DBBentOverRow.execution: Pull dumbbell to up to side until it makes contact with ribs or until upper arm is just beyond horizontal. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched downward. Repeat and continue with opposite arm.
BackGeneral/DBBentOverRow.comments: Allow scapula to articulate but do not rotate torso in effort to throw weight up. Torso should be close to horizontal. Positioning supporting knee and/or arm slightly forward or back will allow for proper levelling of torso. Torso may be positioned lower to allow for heavier dumbbell to make contact with floor, if desired.

BackGeneral/DBInclineRow.name: Dumbbell Incline Row
BackGeneral/DBInclineRow.preparation: Lie chest down on slightly inclined bench. Grasp dumbbells below.
BackGeneral/DBInclineRow.execution: Pull dumbbells to sides until upper arm is just beyond height of back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/DBInclineRow.comments: Bench should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward without dumbbells hitting floor. Lying on

BackGeneral/DBLyingRow.name: Dumbbell Lying Row
BackGeneral/DBLyingRow.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp dumbbells below.
BackGeneral/DBLyingRow.execution: Pull dumbbells to sides until upper arm is just beyond horizontal or height of back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/DBLyingRow.comments: Bench should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward without dumbbells hitting floor. Exercise can also be performed on

BackGeneral/LVAlternatingNarrowGripSeate.name: Lever Alternating Narrow Grip Seated Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVAlternatingNarrowGripSeate.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVAlternatingNarrowGripSeate.execution: Pull one lever back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.

BackGeneral/LVAlternatingSeatedHighRow.name: Lever Alternating Seated High Row
BackGeneral/LVAlternatingSeatedHighRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVAlternatingSeatedHighRow.execution: Pull one lever handle back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
BackGeneral/LVAlternatingSeatedHighRow.comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.

BackGeneral/LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhand.name: Lever Alternating Underhand Seated Row
BackGeneral/LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhand.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhand.execution: Pull one lever handle back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
BackGeneral/LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhand.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.

BackGeneral/LVAlternatingWideGripSeatedR.name: Lever Alternating Wide Grip Seated Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVAlternatingWideGripSeatedR.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVAlternatingWideGripSeatedR.execution: Pull one lever back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.

BackGeneral/LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhand.name: Lever Alternating Underhand Seated Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhand.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhand.execution: Pull one lever back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
BackGeneral/LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhand.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.

BackGeneral/LVBBBentOverRow.name: Lever Barbell Bent-over Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVBBBentOverRow.preparation: Stand with toes under bar facing fulcrum. Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVBBBentOverRow.execution: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVBBBentOverRow.comments: Exact stance from bar will depend upon height of fulcrum and length of lever. Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See

BackGeneral/LVBentOverRowH.name: Lever Bent-over Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVBentOverRowH.execution: With lever handles to sides, bend knees slightly and bend over with back straight. Grasp lower handles.

BackGeneral/LVCloseGripInclineRow.name: Lever Close Grip Incline Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVCloseGripInclineRow.preparation: Lie chest on inclined platform and grasp lever close grip handles.
BackGeneral/LVCloseGripInclineRow.execution: Pull lever up as high as possible. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVCloseGripInclineRow.comments: Near top arch upper back and pull shoulders back as shown. To maximize back involvement, position body on pad or grip so wrists follow elbows.

BackGeneral/LVCloseGripTBarRow.name: Lever Close Grip T-bar Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVCloseGripTBarRow.execution: Bend knees slightly and bend over lever handles with back straight. Grasp parallel lever handles.

BackGeneral/LVCloseGripTBarRowLM.name: Lever Close Grip T-bar Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVCloseGripTBarRowLM.execution: Bend knees slightly and bend over lever handles with back straight. Grasp parallel lever handles.

BackGeneral/LVInclineRow.name: Lever Incline Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVInclineRow.preparation: Lie chest on inclined platform and grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVInclineRow.execution: Pull lever up as high as possible. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVInclineRow.comments: Near top arch upper back and pull shoulders back as shown. To maximize back involvement, position body on pad or grip so wrists follow elbows. Some

BackGeneral/LVOneArmBentOverRow.name: Lever One Arm Bent-over Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVOneArmBentOverRow.preparation: Kneel over side of bench facing loaded side of lever bar by placing knee and hand of supporting arm on bench. Position foot of opposite leg slightly back to side, straddling bar. Grasp bar from floor, several inches under barbell plates.
BackGeneral/LVOneArmBentOverRow.execution: Pull lever bar up to side until bar contacts shoulder or just until elbow travels behind height of back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched downward. Repeat and continue with opposite arm.
BackGeneral/LVOneArmBentOverRow.comments: Allow scapula to articulate but do not rotate torso in effort to throw weight up. Lever base shown attaches to standard Olympic barbell. Improvising by placing barbell in corner may cause excessive wear on floor and floor board, or wall.

BackGeneral/LVNarrowGripSeatedRowH.name: Lever Narrow Grip Seated Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVNarrowGripSeatedRowH.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVNarrowGripSeatedRowH.execution: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVNarrowGripSeatedRowH.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

BackGeneral/LVOneArmStandingRow.name: Lever One Arm Standing Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVOneArmStandingRow.preparation: Place hand on support bar and grasp lever far forward. Place foot on side of moving arm on foot support and position opposite foot behind.
BackGeneral/LVOneArmStandingRow.execution: Pull lever to side while twisting torso toward opposite side. Pull shoulder back and push chest forward during contraction. Return until arm is extended and torso is pulled toward original direction. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
BackGeneral/LVOneArmStandingRow.comments: Unique apparatus designed and built by

BackGeneral/LVSeatedHighRow.name: Lever Seated High Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVSeatedHighRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedHighRow.execution: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedHighRow.comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. Also see

BackGeneral/LVSeatedHighRowC.name: Lever Seated High Row
BackGeneral/LVSeatedHighRowC.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedHighRowC.execution: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedHighRowC.comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. Also see Hammer Equipment Lever Seated High Row,

BackGeneral/LVSeatedHighRowB.name: Lever Seated High Row
BackGeneral/LVSeatedHighRowB.preparation: Sit on seat and position thighs under pad. Lean  forward  and grasp lever handles above.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedHighRowB.execution: Pull lever down while leaning back slightly. As elbows travel to sides, lift chest slightly and pull shoulders and elbows back. Return until arms are extended and body and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedHighRowB.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow for full range of motion. Also see Lever Seated

BackGeneral/LVSeatedLowRow.name: Lever Seated Low Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVSeatedLowRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand/neutral grip.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedLowRow.execution: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedLowRow.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend. See exercise on

BackGeneral/LVSeatedRow.name: Lever Seated Row
BackGeneral/LVSeatedRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Push foot lever if available. Grasp narrower parallel grip handles.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedRow.execution: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedRow.comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

BackGeneral/LVSeatedRowNoPad.name: Lever Seated Row (no chest pad)
BackGeneral/LVSeatedRowNoPad.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles with each hand. Place feet on vertically angled platform. Slide hips back with knees slightly bent.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedRowNoPad.execution: Pull handles to waist while straightening torso upright. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedRowNoPad.comments: Exercise is performed on apparatus with no chest pad, in contrast to

BackGeneral/LVSeatedRowNoPadPL.name: Lever Seated Row (no chest pad, plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVSeatedRowNoPadPL.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles with each hand. Place feet on vertically angled platform. Slide hips back with knees slightly bent.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedRowNoPadPL.execution: Pull handles to waist while straightening torso upright. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedRowNoPadPL.comments: Exercise is performed on apparatus with no chest pad, in contrast to

BackGeneral/LVSeatedUnderhandRow.name: Lever Underhand Seated Row
BackGeneral/LVSeatedUnderhandRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedUnderhandRow.execution: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedUnderhandRow.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

BackGeneral/LVSeatedUnderhandRowH.name: Lever Underhand Seated Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVSeatedUnderhandRowH.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedUnderhandRowH.execution: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedUnderhandRowH.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend. Also see

BackGeneral/LVSeatedUnderhandRowS.name: Lever Underhand Seated Row
BackGeneral/LVSeatedUnderhandRowS.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedUnderhandRowS.execution: Pull lever handles back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVSeatedUnderhandRowS.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.

BackGeneral/LVStraightBackSeatedRowNoPad.name: Lever Straight Back Seated Row (no chest pad)
BackGeneral/LVStraightBackSeatedRowNoPad.execution: Sit on seat with feet positioned on foot bar or platform. Grasp handles with each hand. Position torso upright with knees bent slightly.

BackGeneral/LVStraightBackSeatedRowNoPad.name: Lever Straight Back Seated Row (no chest pad, plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVStraightBackSeatedRowNoPad.execution: Sit on seat with feet positioned on foot bar or platform. Grasp handles with each hand. Position torso upright with knees bent slightly.

BackGeneral/LVTBarRow.name: Lever T-bar Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVTBarRow.execution: Bend knees slightly and bend over lever handles with back straight. Grasp lever handles with shoulder width to wide overhand grip.

BackGeneral/LVTBarRowLM.name: Lever T-bar Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVTBarRowLM.execution: Bend knees slightly and bend over lever handles with back straight. Grasp lever handles with shoulder width to wide overhand grip.

BackGeneral/LVWideGripBentOverRowH.name: Lever Wide Grip Bent-over Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVWideGripBentOverRowH.preparation: With lever handles to sides, bend knees slightly and bend over with back straight. Grasp wider handles.
BackGeneral/LVWideGripBentOverRowH.execution: Pull lever handles up to sides. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVWideGripBentOverRowH.comments: Torso should be kept as close to horizontal while allowing for full arm extension. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See

BackGeneral/LVWideGripSeatedRow.name: Lever Wide Grip Seated Row
BackGeneral/LVWideGripSeatedRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp outer lever handles with overhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVWideGripSeatedRow.execution: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVWideGripSeatedRow.comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

BackGeneral/LVWideGripSeatedRowH.name: Lever Wide Grip Seated Row (high bar, plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVWideGripSeatedRowH.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVWideGripSeatedRowH.execution: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVWideGripSeatedRowH.comments: When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

BackGeneral/SMBentOverRow.name: Smith Bent-over Row
BackGeneral/SMBentOverRow.execution: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.

BackGeneral/LVWideLowGripSeatedRowH.name: Lever Wide Grip Seated Row (plate loaded)
BackGeneral/LVWideLowGripSeatedRowH.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
BackGeneral/LVWideLowGripSeatedRowH.execution: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/LVWideLowGripSeatedRowH.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

BackGeneral/STBentKneeInvertedRow.name: Suspended Bent-knee Inverted Row
BackGeneral/STBentKneeInvertedRow.preparation: Position suspension handles higher than arms' length above floor. Sit on floor and grasp handles. Hang shoulders under handles with arms straight, back and hips straight, with knees bent and feet flat on floor.
BackGeneral/STBentKneeInvertedRow.execution: Pull body up so sides of chest make contact with handles while keeping body straight. Return until arms are extended straight and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/STBentKneeInvertedRow.comments: Handles should be positioned to allow for full arm extension, no lower. Instead of mounting from a seated or lying position, position can be assumed by stepping back with handles grasped in each hand until arms are straight forward. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back and under suspension handles. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright, minimizing contact with ground. See

BackGeneral/STRow.name: Suspended Row
BackGeneral/STRow.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Position body and legs straight at desired angle, hanging from handles with arms straight.
BackGeneral/STRow.execution: Pull body up so sides of chest make contact with handles while keeping body and legs straight. Return until arms are extended straight and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/STRow.comments: At higher angles, feet can be placed flat on floor. When angled further back, only heels may contact floor with forefeet raising upward. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright.

BackGeneral/STInvertedRow.name: Suspended Inverted Row
BackGeneral/STInvertedRow.preparation: Position suspension handles higher than arms' length above floor. Sit on floor and grasp handles. Position body supine hanging from handles with arms straight, shoulders under handles, body straight, and back of heels on floor.
BackGeneral/STInvertedRow.execution: Pull body up so sides of chest make contact with handles while keeping body straight. Return until arms are extended straight and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BackGeneral/STInvertedRow.comments: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See

BackGeneral/STPowerPull.name: Suspended Power Pull
BackGeneral/STPowerPull.preparation: Grasp suspension handle(s) with one hand. Step back until handle is chest height when held to side of chest. Facing suspension apparatus with feet shoulder width apart, point other arm and its shoulder forward, parallel with angle of strap.
BackGeneral/STPowerPull.execution: Rotate body and extended arm, reaching outward while lowering body downward by extending arm holding onto handle. Extend arms and shoulders in-line with suspension strap so body is angled back to one side. Return by raising body back upward in opposite motion, reaching outward and toward suspension strap while pulling handle back to side of chest until body is upright and arm parallel with angle of strap. Repeat and continue with opposite side.
BackGeneral/STPowerPull.comments: This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings. Some suspension trainer brands allow independent use of only one handle, whereas, more popular brands require either anchoring unused handle within stirrup of gripped handle or grasping both handles with one hand.

BackGeneral/WTSupineRow.name: Weighted Inverted Row
BackGeneral/WTSupineRow.execution: Lay on back under fixed horizontal bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Place back of heels on elevated surface.

Biceps/BBCurl.name: Barbell Curl
Biceps/BBCurl.preparation: Grasp bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
Biceps/BBCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Biceps/BBCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Exercise can also be performed with

Biceps/BBDragCurl.name: Barbell Drag Curl
Biceps/BBDragCurl.preparation: Grasp bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
Biceps/BBDragCurl.execution: Raise barbell straight up so elbows travel back as elbows flex. Follow contour of hips and waist. As elbows continues to flex, begin bringing elbows forward when forearms rises past horizontal position. Continue upward over chest until forearms are perpendicular. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
