Biceps/BBDragCurl.comments: Bringing elbows back forward, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical, permits a relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Exercise can also be performed with EZ barbell, in which case, making it also known as

Biceps/CBAlternatingCurl.name: Cable Alternating Curl
Biceps/CBAlternatingCurl.preparation: Stand between or facing double low pulleys. Grasp stirrups to each side, palms facing forward.
Biceps/CBAlternatingCurl.execution: Pull one stirrup up forward and upward toward shoulder while keeping elbow stationary. Return until arm is fully extended. Repeat on other arm, alternating between sides.
Biceps/CBAlternatingCurl.comments: When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearm to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Pulleys should not be too far apart. Also see

Biceps/CBAlternatingSeatedCurl.name: Cable Alternating Seated Curl
Biceps/CBAlternatingSeatedCurl.preparation: Sit on seat situated between two low pulleys down to each side. Grasp stirrups in each hand, palms facing forward.
Biceps/CBAlternatingSeatedCurl.execution: Pull one stirrup up toward shoulder while keeping elbow stationary. Return until arm is fully extended. Repeat with other arm, alternating between sides.
Biceps/CBAlternatingSeatedCurl.comments: When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearm to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Pulleys should not be too far apart. Cables can be positioned under shoulders with ad hoc or customized set up. See

Biceps/CBBarCurl.name: Cable Bar Curl
Biceps/CBBarCurl.preparation: Grasp low cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Stand close to cable bar.
Biceps/CBBarCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Biceps/CBBarCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel slightly forward, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Platform can be placed in front of feet to rest cable bar in between sets. See

Biceps/CBCurl.name: Cable Curl
Biceps/CBCurl.preparation: Grasp low pulley cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Stand close to pulley.
Biceps/CBCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Biceps/CBCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

Biceps/CBCurlStirrups.name: Cable Curl (with stirrups)
Biceps/CBCurlStirrups.preparation: Stand between or facing double low pulleys. Grasp stirrups to each side, palms facing forward.
Biceps/CBCurlStirrups.execution: Pull stirrups forward and upward toward shoulders while keeping elbows stationary. Return until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Biceps/CBCurlStirrups.comments: When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearm to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Pulleys should not be too far apart.

Biceps/CBSeatedCurl.name: Cable Seated Curl
Biceps/CBSeatedCurl.preparation: Sit on seat situated between two low pulleys down to each side. Grasp stirrups in each hand, palms facing forward.
Biceps/CBSeatedCurl.execution: Pull both stirrups up toward shoulders while keeping elbows stationary. Return until arms are fully extended and repeat.
Biceps/CBSeatedCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Pulleys should not be too far apart. Cables can be positioned under shoulders with ad hoc or customized set up. Also see

Biceps/CBOneArmCurl.name: Cable One Arm Curl
Biceps/CBOneArmCurl.preparation: Face low pulley and grasp stirrup cable attachment to one side with underhand grip.
Biceps/CBOneArmCurl.execution: With elbow to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Biceps/CBOneArmCurl.comments: An alternative method is to stand facing with side of exercise arm toward low pulley. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see

Biceps/CBSupineCurl.name: Cable Supine Curl
Biceps/CBSupineCurl.preparation: Sit on floor with feet or heels against pulley machine. Grasp low pulley cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Lie back on floor with arms to sides.
Biceps/CBSupineCurl.execution: With elbows to side, pull bar until elbows are flexed. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Biceps/CBSupineCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel upward, slightly allowing forearms to be no more than horizontal in this lying posture. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see

Biceps/DBCurl.name: Dumbbell Curl
Biceps/DBCurl.preparation: Position two dumbbells to sides, palms facing in, arms straight.
Biceps/DBCurl.execution: With elbows to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.
Biceps/DBCurl.comments: Biceps may be exercised alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see

Biceps/DBInclineCurl.name: Dumbbell Incline Curl
Biceps/DBInclineCurl.preparation: Sit back on 45-60 degree incline bench. With arms hanging down straight, position two dumbbells with palms facing inward.
Biceps/DBInclineCurl.execution: With elbows back to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.
Biceps/DBInclineCurl.comments: This exercise may be performed by alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see

Biceps/DBSeatedCurl.name: Dumbbell Seated Curl
Biceps/DBSeatedCurl.preparation: Sit on end of bench with dumbbell in each hand and legs together. Position dumbbells with palms facing inward and arms hanging down straight.
Biceps/DBSeatedCurl.execution: With elbows back to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.
Biceps/DBSeatedCurl.comments: This exercise may be performed by alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see

Biceps/LVAlternatingCurl.name: Lever Alternating Curl
Biceps/LVAlternatingCurl.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles with underhand grip.
Biceps/LVAlternatingCurl.execution: Raise lever on handle until elbow is fully flexed with back of upper arm remaining on pad. Lower handle until arm is fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate movement between sides.

Biceps/LVCurl.name: Lever Curl
Biceps/LVCurl.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles with underhand grip.
Biceps/LVCurl.execution: Raise lever handles until elbows are fully flexed with back of upper arm remaining on pad. Lower handles until arm is fully extended. Repeat.

WeightExercises/BlockSnatch.name: Block Snatch
WeightExercises/BlockSnatch.preparation: Stand over barbell on blocks with balls of feet positioned under bar hip width or slightly wider than hip width apart. Squat down and grip bar with very wide overhand grip. Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
WeightExercises/BlockSnatch.execution: Pull bar up off blocks by extending hips and knees while keeping back arched. When barbell passes knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping bar as close to legs as possible. When bar passes upper thighs, allow it to contact thighs. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to pull up to sides, keeping them over bar as long as possible. Aggressively pull body under bar. Catch bar at arm's length while moving into squat position. As soon as barbell is caught on locked out arms in squat position, squat up into standing position with barbell over head.
WeightExercises/BlockSnatch.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to mid-thigh position. Slowly lower bar with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical. The advanced athlete may

Brachialis/BBPreacherCurl.name: Barbell Preacher Curl
Brachialis/BBPreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. Grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
Brachialis/BBPreacherCurl.execution: Raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachialis/BBPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/BBProneInclineCurl.name: Barbell Prone Incline Curl
Brachialis/BBProneInclineCurl.preparation: Lie prone on incline bench with shoulders near top of incline. Knees can rest on seat or legs can be straddled to sides. From low rack or partner, grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
Brachialis/BBProneInclineCurl.execution: Raise bar until arms are flexed. Lower barbell until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachialis/BBProneInclineCurl.comments: The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/BBStandingPreacherCurl.name: Barbell Standing Preacher Curl
Brachialis/BBStandingPreacherCurl.preparation: Placing back of arms on pad with one foot forward, grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
Brachialis/BBStandingPreacherCurl.execution: Raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachialis/BBStandingPreacherCurl.comments: Body should be positioned to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/CBAlternatingPreacherCurl.name: Cable Alternating Preacher Curl
Brachialis/CBAlternatingPreacherCurl.preparation: Grasp cable stirrups with each hand. Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad with palms up.
Brachialis/CBAlternatingPreacherCurl.execution: Raise one stirrup upward toward shoulder of same arm. Lower stirrup until arm is fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue alternating between arms.
Brachialis/CBAlternatingPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allowarm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arms should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/CBConcentrationCurl.name: Cable Concentration Curl
Brachialis/CBConcentrationCurl.preparation: Facing low pulley cable, sit on seat or bench with legs apart to each side. Grasp stirrup attachment. Place upper arm against inner thigh.
Brachialis/CBConcentrationCurl.execution: Pull stirrup to front of shoulder until elbow is completely flexed. Lower stirrup until arm is fully extended. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Brachialis/CBConcentrationCurl.comments: The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/CBOneArmPreacherCurl.name: Cable One Arm Preacher Curl
Brachialis/CBOneArmPreacherCurl.preparation: Grasp cable stirrup. Sit on preacher bench placing back of arm on pad with palm up.
Brachialis/CBOneArmPreacherCurl.execution: Raise stirrup upward toward shoulder of same arm. Lower stirrup until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
Brachialis/CBOneArmPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/CBOneArmStandingPreacherCurl.name: Cable One Arm Standing Preacher Curl
Brachialis/CBOneArmStandingPreacherCurl.preparation: Standing behind standing preacher bench and grasp cable stirrup. Place back of arm on pad with palm up.
Brachialis/CBOneArmStandingPreacherCurl.execution: Raise stirrup upward toward shoulder of same arm. Lower stirrup until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
Brachialis/CBOneArmStandingPreacherCurl.comments: Stirrup can be hung from one side of rack for easier access. Feet can be staggered and bent slightly (if needed) to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/CBPreacherCurlStirrups.name: Cable Preacher Curl (stirrups)
Brachialis/CBPreacherCurlStirrups.preparation: Grasp cable stirrups with each hand. Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad with palms up.
Brachialis/CBPreacherCurlStirrups.execution: Raise both stirrups upward toward shoulders. Lower stirrups until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
Brachialis/CBPreacherCurlStirrups.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arms should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/CBPreacherCurl.name: Cable Preacher Curl
Brachialis/CBPreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. Grasp cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
Brachialis/CBPreacherCurl.execution: Raise cable bar toward shoulders. Lower cable bar until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachialis/CBPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/CBProneInclineCurl.name: Cable Prone Incline Curl
Brachialis/CBProneInclineCurl.execution: Lie prone on incline bench with shoulders near top of incline. Knees can rest on seat or legs can be straddled to sides. Grasp cable attachment with shoulder width underhand grip.

Brachialis/CBStandingPreacherCurl.name: Cable Standing Preacher Curl
Brachialis/CBStandingPreacherCurl.preparation: Stand behind preacher bench. Grasp cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Position back of arms on pad.
Brachialis/CBStandingPreacherCurl.execution: Raise cable bar toward shoulders. Lower cable bar until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachialis/CBStandingPreacherCurl.comments: Feet can be staggered and bent slightly (if needed) to allow armpit to rest near top of pad.   Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/DBConcentrationCurl.name: Dumbbell Concentration Curl
Brachialis/DBConcentrationCurl.preparation: Sit on bench. Grasp dumbbell between feet. Place back of upper arm to inner thigh. Lean into leg to raise elbow slightly.
Brachialis/DBConcentrationCurl.execution: Raise dumbbell to front of shoulder. Lower dumbbell until arm is fully extended. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Brachialis/DBConcentrationCurl.comments: The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/DBPreacherCurl.name: Dumbbell Preacher Curl
Brachialis/DBPreacherCurl.preparation: Grasp dumbbell and sit on preacher bench. With arm bent and palm facing shoulder, place back of arm down on pad.
Brachialis/DBPreacherCurl.execution: Lower dumbbell until arm is fully extended. Raise dumbbell until forearm is vertical. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Brachialis/DBPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/DBProneInclineCurl.name: Dumbbell Prone Incline Curl
Brachialis/DBProneInclineCurl.preparation: Lie prone on incline bench with shoulders near top of incline. Knees can rest on seat or legs can be straddled to sides. From elevated platform or partner, grasp dumbbell and position palms forward.
Brachialis/DBProneInclineCurl.execution: Raise dumbbells until arms are flexed. Lower dumbbells until arms are fully extended. Repeat.

Brachialis/DBStandingPreacherCurl.name: Dumbbell Standing Preacher Curl
Brachialis/DBStandingPreacherCurl.preparation: With dummbell in hand, arm bent, and palm facing shoulder, place back of arm on pad.
Brachialis/DBStandingPreacherCurl.execution: Lower dumbbell until arm is fully extended. Raise dumbbell until forearm is vertical. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Brachialis/DBStandingPreacherCurl.comments: Body should be positioned to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/DBStandingPreacherCurlIncline.name: Dumbbell Standing Preacher Curl (on incline bench)
Brachialis/DBStandingPreacherCurlIncline.preparation: Stand behind incline bench adjusted 45º to 55º. With dumbbell in hand, arm bent, and palm facing shoulder, place back of arm on pad.
Brachialis/DBStandingPreacherCurlIncline.execution: Lower dumbbell until arm is fully extended. Raise dumbbell until forearm is vertical. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Brachialis/DBStandingPreacherCurlIncline.comments: Dumbbell Preacher Curl can be performed on back of incline bench if

Brachialis/LVAlterPreacherCurlHigh.name: Lever Alternating Preacher Curl (arms high)
Brachialis/LVAlterPreacherCurlHigh.preparation: Sit on curl machine. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Align elbows at same pivot point as fulcrum of lever while placing back of arms up on pads.
Brachialis/LVAlterPreacherCurlHigh.execution: Pull one lever handle toward shoulder. Return handle until arm is fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue alternating movement between arms.
Brachialis/LVAlterPreacherCurlHigh.comments: Back of upper arms should remain on pad throughout movement. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), elbows can be positioned further away from primary fulcrum. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/LVAlterPreacherCurlHighPL.name: Lever Alternating Preacher Curl (arms high, plate loaded)
Brachialis/LVAlterPreacherCurlHighPL.preparation: Sit on curl machine. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Align elbows at same pivot point as fulcrum of lever while placing back of arms up on pads.
Brachialis/LVAlterPreacherCurlHighPL.execution: Pull one lever handle toward shoulder. Return handle until arm is fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue alternating movement between arms.
Brachialis/LVAlterPreacherCurlHighPL.comments: Back of upper arms should remain on pad throughout movement. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), elbows can be positioned further away from primary fulcrum. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/LVPreacherCurl.name: Lever Preacher Curl
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on curl machine placing back of arms on pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Align elbows at same pivot point as fulcrum of lever.
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurl.execution: Raise lever handles toward shoulders. Lower handles until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), it is not as essential to position elbows in-line with the primary fulcrum, as would otherwise be required. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlH.name: Lever Preacher Curl (plate loaded)
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlH.preparation: Sit on curl machine placing back of arms on pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Align elbows at same pivot point as fulcrum of lever.
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlH.execution: Raise lever handles toward shoulders. Lower handles until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlH.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. If no resistance is experienced during initial range of motion, make sure seat is adjusted to allow for back of arm to be positioned flush against arm pad. If resistance is still not experienced, consider keeping wrists in a slight flexed position to compensate. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), it is not as essential to position elbows in-line with the primary fulcrum, as would otherwise be required. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlHighPL.name: Lever Preacher Curl (arms high, plate loaded)
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlHighPL.preparation: Sit on curl machine. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Align elbows at same pivot point as fulcrum of lever while placing back of arms up on pads.
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlHighPL.execution: Pull lever handles toward shoulders. Return handles until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlHighPL.comments: Back of upper arms should remain on pad throughout movement. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), it is not as essential to position elbows in-line with the primary fulcrum, as would otherwise be required.

Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlHigh.name: Lever Preacher Curl (arms high)
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlHigh.preparation: Sit on curl machine. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Align elbows at same pivot point as fulcrum of lever while placing back of arms up on pads.
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlHigh.execution: Pull lever handles toward shoulders. Return handles until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlHigh.comments: Back of upper arms should remain on pad throughout movement. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), it is not as essential to position elbows in-line with the primary fulcrum, as would otherwise be required.

Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlNoSeat.name: Lever Standing Preacher Curl
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlNoSeat.preparation: Stand behind arm pad and face lever handles on opposite side. Place one foot forward under arm pad and opposite foot back on foot bar. Lean over arm pads and grasp   handles with slightly narrower than shoulder width underhand grip. Squat down and position back of upper arms on arm pads.
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlNoSeat.execution: Raise lever handles toward shoulders. Lower handles until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlNoSeat.comments: Position armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. Notice that this machine has secondary lever so elbows are not aligned with primary fulcrum. This particular machine also features weight pack that can be positioned closer or further away from fulcrum thereby making resistance easier or harder. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlNoSeatPL.name: Lever Standing Preacher Curl (plate loaded)
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlNoSeatPL.preparation: Stand behind arm pad and face lever handles on opposite side. Place one foot forward under arm pad and opposite foot back on foot bar. Lean over arm pads and grasp handles with slightly narrower than shoulder width underhand grip. Squat down and position back of upper arms on arm pads.
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlNoSeatPL.execution: Raise lever handles toward shoulders. Lower handles until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachialis/LVPreacherCurlNoSeatPL.comments: Position armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. Notice that this machine has secondary lever so elbows are not aligned with primary fulcrum. Also see

Brachioradialis/BBReverseCurl.name: Barbell Reverse Curl
Brachioradialis/BBReverseCurl.preparation: Grasp bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
Brachioradialis/BBReverseCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachioradialis/BBReverseCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

Brachialis/STArmCurl.name: Suspended Arm Curl
Brachialis/STArmCurl.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body is reclined back. Position palms up or slightly inward.
Brachialis/STArmCurl.execution: Bring handles toward shoulders by flexing arms, while keeping elbows pointed forward. Return by straightening arms and repeat.
Brachialis/STArmCurl.comments: Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright. Also known as Suspended Biceps Curl, arguably somewhat of a misnomer. The positioning of arms, with elbows high, places short head (medial head) of Bicep Brachii in

Brachioradialis/BBReversePreacherCurl.name: Barbell Reverse Preacher Curl
Brachioradialis/BBReversePreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. Grasp curl bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
Brachioradialis/BBReversePreacherCurl.execution: Raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
Brachioradialis/BBReversePreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad.

Brachioradialis/BBStandingReversePreache.name: Barbell Standing Reverse Preacher Curl
Brachioradialis/BBStandingReversePreache.preparation: Place back of arms on pad with one foot forward. Grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
Brachioradialis/BBStandingReversePreache.execution: Raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
Brachioradialis/BBStandingReversePreache.comments: Body should be positioned to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad.

Brachioradialis/CBBarReverseCurl.name: Cable Bar Reverse Curl
Brachioradialis/CBBarReverseCurl.preparation: Grasp cable bar with shoulder width overhand grip. Stand close to cable bar.
Brachioradialis/CBBarReverseCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachioradialis/CBBarReverseCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel slightly forward, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

Brachioradialis/CBHammerCurl.name: Cable Hammer Curl
Brachioradialis/CBHammerCurl.preparation: Grasp cable rope with palms facing inward. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
Brachioradialis/CBHammerCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise rope forward and upward with both arms until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachioradialis/CBHammerCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

Brachioradialis/CBReverseCurl.name: Cable Reverse Curl
Brachioradialis/CBReverseCurl.preparation: Grasp cable bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
Brachioradialis/CBReverseCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Brachioradialis/CBReverseCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward, slightly allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

Brachioradialis/CBReversePreacherCurl.name: Cable Reverse Preacher Curl
Brachioradialis/CBReversePreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. Grasp cable bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
Brachioradialis/CBReversePreacherCurl.execution: Raise cable bar toward shoulders. Lower cable bar until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
Brachioradialis/CBReversePreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad. At bottom position, weight stack in use should not make contact with remaining weight stack.

Brachioradialis/CBStandingReversePreache.name: Cable Standing Reverse Preacher Curl
Brachioradialis/CBStandingReversePreache.preparation: Stand behind preacher bench. Grasp cable bar with shoulder width overhand grip. Position back of arms on pad.
Brachioradialis/CBStandingReversePreache.execution: Raise cable bar toward shoulders. Lower cable bar until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
Brachioradialis/CBStandingReversePreache.comments: Feet can be staggered and bent slightly (if needed) to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad. At bottom position, weight stack in use should not make contact with remaining weight stack.

Brachioradialis/DBHammerCurl.name: Dumbbell Hammer Curl
Brachioradialis/DBHammerCurl.preparation: Position two dumbbells to sides, palms facing in, arms straight.
Brachioradialis/DBHammerCurl.execution: With elbows to sides, raise one dumbbell until forearm is vertical and thumb faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with alternative arm.
Brachioradialis/DBHammerCurl.comments: The biceps may be exercised alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

Brachioradialis/LVHammerPreacherCurl.name: Lever Hammer Preacher Curl
Brachioradialis/LVHammerPreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on curl machine placing back of arms on pad. Grasp lever handles and position grips with thumb side up. Align elbows at near same pivot point as fulcrum of lever.
Brachioradialis/LVHammerPreacherCurl.execution: Raise lever handles toward shoulders, maintaining palms in grip. Lower handles until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
Brachioradialis/LVHammerPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad. If machine has secondary lever, elbows can be positioned further away from primary fulcrum.

Brachioradialis/LVReverseCurl.name: Lever Reverse Curl
Brachioradialis/LVReverseCurl.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles with overhand grip. Position elbows to sides so they are in line with lever's fulcrum.
Brachioradialis/LVReverseCurl.execution: Raise lever handles until elbows are fully flexed with back of upper arm remaining on pad. Lower handles until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
Brachioradialis/LVReverseCurl.comments: The biceps may be exercised alternating or simultaneous. If machine does not provide support for back of arm, keep elbows from traveling back, particularly during initial flexion.

Brachioradialis/LVReversePreacherCurl.name: Lever Reverse Preacher Curl
Brachioradialis/LVReversePreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on curl machine placing back of arms on pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand grip. Align elbows at near same pivot point as fulcrum of lever.
Brachioradialis/LVReversePreacherCurl.execution: Raise lever handles toward shoulders. Lower handles until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
Brachioradialis/LVReversePreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad. If machine has secondary lever, elbows can be positioned further away from primary fulcrum.

DeltoidAnterior/BBBehindNeckPress.name: Barbell Behind Neck Press
DeltoidAnterior/BBBehindNeckPress.preparation: Grasp barbell with overhand grip from rack or
DeltoidAnterior/BBBehindNeckPress.execution: from floor. Position bar behind neck.
DeltoidAnterior/BBBehindNeckPress.comments: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return behind neck and repeat.

DeltoidAnterior/BBFrontRaise.name: Barbell Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/BBFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp barbell with overhand grip with elbows straight or slightly bent.
DeltoidAnterior/BBFrontRaise.execution: Raise barbell forward and upward until upper arms are above horizontal. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/BBFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

DeltoidAnterior/BBInclineFrontRaise.name: Barbell Incline Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/BBInclineFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp barbell with shoulder width overhand grip. Lie supine on upper portion of 45 degree incline bench with legs straight. Position barbell on top of upper thighs.
DeltoidAnterior/BBInclineFrontRaise.execution: With elbows straight or slightly bent, raise barbell up and over shoulders until uppers arm are vertical. Lower barbell to upper thigh and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/BBInclineFrontRaise.comments: Movement can also be performed on old fashioned incline bench without seat.

DeltoidAnterior/BBSeatedMilitaryPress.name: Barbell Seated Military Press
DeltoidAnterior/BBSeatedMilitaryPress.preparation: Grasp barbell with slightly wider than shoulder width overhand grip from rack. Position bar near upper chest.
DeltoidAnterior/BBSeatedMilitaryPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return to upper chest and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/BBSeatedMilitaryPress.comments: Set barbell on forward rack slightly below shoulder height so bar may be more easily unracked and racked. Position seat so bar does not hit uprights but close enough to easily mount and rack. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/BBMilitaryPress.name: Barbell Military Press
DeltoidAnterior/BBMilitaryPress.execution: barbell from floor with overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder width. Position bar in front of neck.
DeltoidAnterior/BBMilitaryPress.comments: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower to front of neck and repeat.

DeltoidAnterior/BBReclinedShoulderPress.name: Barbell Reclined Shoulder Press
DeltoidAnterior/BBReclinedShoulderPress.preparation: Sit on Incline bench angled at 70° to 80°. Grasp barbell with slightly wider than shoulder width overhand grip from rack. Lean back on reclined back pad with bar positioned near upper chest.
DeltoidAnterior/BBReclinedShoulderPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return to upper chest and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/BBReclinedShoulderPress.comments: Reclined position can be used instead of

DeltoidAnterior/BBShoulderPress.name: Barbell Shoulder Press
DeltoidAnterior/BBShoulderPress.preparation: Grasp barbell with slightly wider than shoulder width overhand grip from rack. Position bar near upper chest.
DeltoidAnterior/BBShoulderPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return to upper chest and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/BBShoulderPress.comments: Set barbell on forward rack slightly below shoulder height so bar may be more easily mounted and racked. Position seat so bar does not hit uprights but close enough to easily mount and rack. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/BWDeclinePikePress.name: Elevated Pike Press
DeltoidAnterior/BWDeclinePikePress.preparation: Stand between two incline benches positioned side by side slightly apart at end nearest head. Place hands on ends of benches and straighten arms. Position forefeet on opposite ends of bench. Raise rear end high up with arms, back, and knees straight.
DeltoidAnterior/BWDeclinePikePress.execution: Lower head between ends of benches by bending arms. Push body back up to original position by extending arms. Repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/BWDeclinePikePress.comments: Keep knees and back straight. A slight curve (spinal flexion) is acceptable if

DeltoidAnterior/BWHandstandPressBench.name: Handstand Push-up (between benches)
DeltoidAnterior/BWHandstandPressBench.preparation: Stand facing wall between two benches positioned side by side, slightly apart, and slightly away and perpendicular to wall. Place hands on ends of benches closest to wall. Place forefeet on bench and kick lower body up to handstand position with arms and legs straight. Maintain balance with lower body against wall.
DeltoidAnterior/BWHandstandPressBench.execution: Lower head between ends of benches by bending arms. Push body back up to original position by extending arms. Repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/BWHandstandPressBench.comments: Benches must be secured to prevent sliding on floor. Also, each benches' base of support should be under edge of bench where hand is placed to prevent bench toppling under body weight. Falling from inverted position may result in very serious injury. Also known as Elevated Handstand Push-up.

DeltoidAnterior/BWHandstandPushupParalle.name: Handstand Push-up (on parallettes)
DeltoidAnterior/BWHandstandPushupParalle.preparation: Stand facing parallette bars. Squat down and grasp bars with elbows bent and tucked. Bend forward, position head low, and kick feet up with legs bent so torso is in forward angled inverted position. While maintaining balance extend legs over body with spine hyperextended.
DeltoidAnterior/BWHandstandPushupParalle.execution: While maintaining body balanced over bars, push inverted body up by extending arms until straight. Lower body down by bending arms until shoulders are close to bars. Repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/BWHandstandPushupParalle.comments: Alternatively, mount can be achieved by bending over bars with knees slightly bent and arms straight, then raising legs up straight overhead. Falling from inverted position may result in very serious injury. Also known as Elevated Handstand Push-up.

DeltoidAnterior/BWPikePress.name: Pike Press
DeltoidAnterior/BWPikePress.preparation: Kneel on two benches positioned side by side slightly apart at end nearest head. Place hands on ends of benches. With forefeet on opposite ends of bench, raise rear end high up with arms, back, and knees straight. Adjust feet so they are somewhat close to hands while keeping back and legs straight.
DeltoidAnterior/BWPikePress.execution: Lower head between ends of benches by bending arms. Push body back up to original position by extending arms. Repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/BWPikePress.comments: Pike Press (for front delts) differs from

DeltoidAnterior/CBAlternatingFrontRaise.name: Cable Alternating Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/CBAlternatingFrontRaise.preparation: Stand with low double pulleys behind. Grasp stirrup attachments, one in each hand. Stand away from pulley slightly with arms back somewhat at side and elbows straight or slightly bent.
DeltoidAnterior/CBAlternatingFrontRaise.execution: Raise one stirrup forward and upward until upper arm is well above horizontal. Lower and repeat with opposite arm, alternating between arms.
DeltoidAnterior/CBAlternatingFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion or when stirrup or cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

DeltoidAnterior/CBAlternatingSeatedFront.name: Cable Alternating Seated Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/CBAlternatingSeatedFront.preparation: Sit on seat above twin cable pulleys. Grasp stirrups on each side. Sit upright with arms straight down to each side with palms facing back.
DeltoidAnterior/CBAlternatingSeatedFront.execution: Raise one stirrup forward and upward until upper arm is well above horizontal. Lower and repeat with opposite arm. Continue by alternating raises between sides.
DeltoidAnterior/CBAlternatingSeatedFront.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion or when stirrup or cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

DeltoidAnterior/CBBarBehindNeckPress.name: Cable Bar Behind Neck Press
DeltoidAnterior/CBBarBehindNeckPress.preparation: Stand facing cable bar, mounted on each side to upper waist height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip upper chest height. Stand directly between both cable pulleys with one foot forward and other foot back. Push cable bar over head and position cable bar behind neck or rest on shoulders.
DeltoidAnterior/CBBarBehindNeckPress.execution: Press cable bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return behind neck and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/CBBarBehindNeckPress.comments: Exercise may also be performed seated, straddling bench or on weight chair with back support.

DeltoidAnterior/CBBarFrontRaise.name: Cable Bar Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/CBBarFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp cable bar with overhand grip with elbows straight or slightly bent.
DeltoidAnterior/CBBarFrontRaise.execution: Raise cable bar forward and upward until upper arms are above horizontal. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/CBBarFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

DeltoidAnterior/CBBarMilitaryPress.name: Cable Bar Military Press
DeltoidAnterior/CBBarMilitaryPress.preparation: Stand facing cable bar, mounted on each side to upper waist height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder width. Position cable bar upper chest height. Stand directly between both cable pulleys with one foot forward and other foot back.
DeltoidAnterior/CBBarMilitaryPress.execution: Press cable bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return to upper chest and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/CBBarMilitaryPress.comments: Feet may be positioned shoulder width apart or one foot in front of other with forward leg slightly bent (as shown). Upper chest assists (instead of side delts) since grip is slightly narrower and chest is high with low back arched back slightly.

DeltoidAnterior/CBBarShoulderPress.name: Cable Bar Shoulder Press
DeltoidAnterior/CBBarShoulderPress.preparation: Stand facing cable bar mounted on each side to upper waist height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip and position upper chest height. Stand directly between both cable pulleys with one foot forward and other foot back.
DeltoidAnterior/CBBarShoulderPress.execution: Press cable bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return to upper chest and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/CBBarShoulderPress.comments: Exercise may also be performed seated, straddling bench or on weight chair with back support. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/CBFrontRaise.name: Cable One Arm Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/CBFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp stirrup attachment. Stand away from pulley slightly with arm back somewhat at side and elbow straight or slightly bent.
DeltoidAnterior/CBFrontRaise.execution: Raise stirrup forward and upward until upper arm is well above horizontal. Lower and repeat. Repeat with opposite arm.
DeltoidAnterior/CBFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion or when stirrup or cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

DeltoidAnterior/CBFrontRaiseRope.name: Cable One Arm Front Raise (with rope)
DeltoidAnterior/CBFrontRaiseRope.preparation: Grasp end of Triceps Rope Cable attachment with one hand so that protruding end is in contact with side of hand (thumb and index finger). Stand away from   pulley with arm back at side and elbow straight.
DeltoidAnterior/CBFrontRaiseRope.execution: Raise stirrup forward and upward until arm is well above horizontal or cable makes contact with underside of upper arm. Lower and repeat. Repeat with opposite arm.
DeltoidAnterior/CBFrontRaiseRope.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion or when cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt within shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. However, thumbs up position with external rotation of the shoulder (AKA: 'Open Can') as compared to palms down position with shoulder internal rotation may increase range of motion of shoulder flexion before subacromial impingement is experienced. This positioning also decreases Lateral Deltoid involvement while increasing Clavicular Pectoralis activation.

DeltoidAnterior/CBSeatedFrontRaise.name: Cable Seated Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/CBSeatedFrontRaise.preparation: Sit on seat above twin cable pulleys. Grasp stirrups on each side. Sit upright with arms straight down to each side with palms facing back.
DeltoidAnterior/CBSeatedFrontRaise.execution: Raise stirrups forward and upward until upper arms are well above horizontal. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/CBSeatedFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion or when stirrup or cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

DeltoidAnterior/CBShoulderPress.name: Cable Shoulder Press
DeltoidAnterior/CBShoulderPress.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp stirrups from low to medium low position from each side. Position stirrups to each side of shoulders with elbows down to sides and stirrups above or slightly narrower than elbows.
DeltoidAnterior/CBShoulderPress.execution: Push stirrups upward until arms are extended overhead. Return stirrups to sides of shoulders and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/CBShoulderPress.comments: Wrists maintain their approximate position above each elbow throughout movement.

DeltoidAnterior/CBStandingShoulderPress.name: Cable Standing Shoulder Press
DeltoidAnterior/CBStandingShoulderPress.preparation: Stand between two low to medium height pulleys. Grasp cable stirrups from each side. Position stirrups to each side of shoulders with elbows down to sides and stirrups above or slightly narrower than elbows.
DeltoidAnterior/CBStandingShoulderPress.execution: Push stirrups upward until arms are extended overhead. Return stirrups to sides of shoulders and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/CBStandingShoulderPress.comments: Wrists maintain their approximate position above each elbow throughout movement. Feet may be positioned apart to each side or one foot back as shown. Cable pulleys should be much closer together than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.

DeltoidAnterior/CBTwistingOverheadPress.name: Cable Twisting Overhead Press
DeltoidAnterior/CBTwistingOverheadPress.execution: Stand beside low to medium height pulley. Grasp cable stirrup. Position stirrup to front of shoulder with elbow down to side. Place opposite hand on hip. With feet wide apart, squat down slightly.

DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternatingFrontRaise.name: Dumbbell Alternating Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternatingFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbells in both hands. Position dumbbells in front of upper legs with elbows straight or slightly bent.
DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternatingFrontRaise.execution: Raise one dumbbell forward and upward with palms positioned downward until upper arm is above horizontal. Lower and repeat with opposite arm, alternating between arms.
DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternatingFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement. Also see

DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternInclineFrontRais.name: Dumbbell Alternating Incline Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternInclineFrontRais.preparation: Grasp dumbbells and lie supine on upper portion of 45 degree incline bench with legs straight. Position dumbbells downward below each shoulder.
DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternInclineFrontRais.execution: With elbows straight or slightly bent, raise one dumbbell forward, up and over shoulder until upper arm is vertical. Lower dumbbell down to starting position. Repeat raise with other arm, alternating between sides.
DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternInclineFrontRais.comments: Movement can also be performed on old fashion incline bench without seat.

DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternatingFullCanSeat.name: Dumbbell Alternating Full Can Seated Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternatingFullCanSeat.preparation: Sit on end of bench with dumbbell in each hand and legs together. Position dumbbells with palms facing inward and arms hanging down straight.
DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternatingFullCanSeat.execution: Raise one dumbbell forward and upward until upper arm is above horizontal. Lower to original vertical position. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating movement pattern between arms.
DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternatingFullCanSeat.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule, which may be slightly higher than which is felt in the

DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternatingSeatedFront.name: Dumbbell Alternating Seated Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternatingSeatedFront.preparation: Sit on end of bench with dumbbell in each hand and legs together. Position dumbbells with palms facing inward and arms hanging down straight.
DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternatingSeatedFront.execution: Raise one dumbbell forward and upward while turning palms downward as soon as dumbbell clears thigh. Continue raising dumbbell until upper arm is above horizontal. Lower and turn palms inward while dumbbells travels past thigh until arm is in original vertical position. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating movement pattern between arms.
DeltoidAnterior/DBAlternatingSeatedFront.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule, which may be slightly higher than which is felt in the palms down version. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement. Also see

DeltoidAnterior/DBArnoldPress.name: Dumbbell Arnold Press
DeltoidAnterior/DBArnoldPress.preparation: Stand with two dumbbells position in front of shoulders, palms facing body and elbows under wrists.
DeltoidAnterior/DBArnoldPress.execution: Initiate movement by bringing elbows out to sides. Continue to raise elbows outward while pressing dumbbells overhead until arms are straight. Lower to front of shoulders in opposite pattern and repeat.

DeltoidAnterior/DBFullCanSeatedFrontRais.name: Dumbbell Full Can Seated Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/DBFullCanSeatedFrontRais.preparation: Sit on end of bench with dumbbell in each hand and legs together. Position dumbbells with palms facing inward and arms hanging down straight.
DeltoidAnterior/DBFullCanSeatedFrontRais.execution: Raise dumbbells forward and upward until upper arms are above horizontal. Lower to original vertical position and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/DBFullCanSeatedFrontRais.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule, which may be slightly higher than which is felt in the

DeltoidAnterior/DBFrontRaise.name: Dumbbell Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/DBFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbells in both hands. Position dumbbells in front of upper legs with elbows straight or slightly bent.
DeltoidAnterior/DBFrontRaise.execution: Raise dumbbells forward and upward until upper arms are above horizontal. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/DBFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement. Also see

DeltoidAnterior/DBOneArmShoulderPress.name: Dumbbell One Arm Shoulder Press
DeltoidAnterior/DBOneArmShoulderPress.preparation: Stand with dumbbells positioned near shoulder with elbow below wrists.
DeltoidAnterior/DBOneArmShoulderPress.execution: Press dumbbell upward until arm is extended overhead. Lower to side of shoulder and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/DBOneArmShoulderPress.comments: Torso can lean away for balance as shown or torso can maintain upright posture. Also see

DeltoidAnterior/DBReclinedShoulderPress.name: Dumbbell Reclined Shoulder Press
DeltoidAnterior/DBReclinedShoulderPress.preparation: Position dumbbells to each side of shoulders with elbows below wrists. Lean back on back pad angled 70 to 80 degrees.
DeltoidAnterior/DBReclinedShoulderPress.execution: Press dumbbells upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower to sides of upper chest and repeat.

DeltoidAnterior/DBSeatedFrontRaise.name: Dumbbell Seated Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/DBSeatedFrontRaise.preparation: Sit on end of bench with dumbbell in each hand and legs together. Position dumbbells with palms facing inward and arms hanging down straight.
DeltoidAnterior/DBSeatedFrontRaise.execution: Raise dumbbells forward and upward while turning palms downward as soon as dumbbells clear thighs. Continue raising dumbbells until upper arms are above horizontal. Lower dumbbells and turn palms inward while dumbbells travels past thighs until arms are in original vertical position. Repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/DBSeatedFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement. Also see

DeltoidAnterior/DBShoulderPress.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
DeltoidAnterior/DBShoulderPress.preparation: Position dumbbells to each side of shoulders with elbows below wrists.
DeltoidAnterior/DBShoulderPress.execution: Press dumbbells upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower to sides of shoulders and repeat.

DeltoidAnterior/LVAlternatingShoulderPre.name: Lever Alternating Shoulder Press
DeltoidAnterior/LVAlternatingShoulderPre.preparation: Set and grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
DeltoidAnterior/LVAlternatingShoulderPre.execution: Press one lever upward until arm is extended overhead. Lower to original position. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue by alternating movement between arms.
DeltoidAnterior/LVAlternatingShoulderPre.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/LVBBBehindNeckPress.name: Lever Barbell Behind Neck Press (plate loaded)
DeltoidAnterior/LVBBBehindNeckPress.preparation: Sit on bench with bar positioned behind shoulders, also facing away from fulcrum. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
DeltoidAnterior/LVBBBehindNeckPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower bar behind neck and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/LVBBBehindNeckPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/LVBehindNeckPressH.name: Lever Behind Neck Press (plate loaded)
DeltoidAnterior/LVBehindNeckPressH.preparation: Sit back on seat. Grasp lever bars to each side with overhand grip.
DeltoidAnterior/LVBehindNeckPressH.execution: Press levers upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/LVBehindNeckPressH.comments: Exercise can also be performed on certain lever shoulder presses by facing away from machine. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/LVBBShoulderPress.name: Lever Barbell Shoulder Press (plate loaded)
DeltoidAnterior/LVBBShoulderPress.preparation: Sit on bench with bar positioned in front of shoulders. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
DeltoidAnterior/LVBBShoulderPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower bar to front of shoulders and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/LVBBShoulderPress.comments: Pull head back slightly so bar does not head. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/LVFrontRaise.name: Lever One Arm Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/LVFrontRaise.preparation: Stand with lever to side, fulcrum approximately shoulder height and handle just below hip. Grasp lever handle with elbow straight or slightly bent.
DeltoidAnterior/LVFrontRaise.execution: Raise lever handle forward and upward until upper arm is well above horizontal. Lower and repeat. Repeat with opposite arm.
DeltoidAnterior/LVFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on individual range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement. Exercise is performed on

DeltoidAnterior/LVMilitaryPressH.name: Lever Military Press (plate loaded)
DeltoidAnterior/LVMilitaryPressH.preparation: Set and grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
DeltoidAnterior/LVMilitaryPressH.execution: Press lever until arms are extended upward. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/LVMilitaryPressH.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/LVOneArmShoulderPress.name: Lever One Arm Shoulder Press (plate loaded)
DeltoidAnterior/LVOneArmShoulderPress.preparation: Stand to one side, near loaded end of barbell, opposite of landmine lever. Lift end of barbell and position near shoulder with underhand grip. Stand with feet far apart (leg on same side of loaded arm is back and opposite leg is forward and bent).
DeltoidAnterior/LVOneArmShoulderPress.execution: Press end of barbell upward and forward until arm is extended. Lower to shoulder and repeat. Repeat with opposite side.
DeltoidAnterior/LVOneArmShoulderPress.comments: Keep back straight when lifting end of barbell from floor. Also see

DeltoidAnterior/LVReclinedShoulderPress.name: Lever Reclined Shoulder Press
DeltoidAnterior/LVReclinedShoulderPress.preparation: Lie on back pad facing up. Grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
DeltoidAnterior/LVReclinedShoulderPress.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/LVReclinedShoulderPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/LVReclinedShoulderPressP.name: Lever Reclined Shoulder Press (plate loaded)
DeltoidAnterior/LVReclinedShoulderPressP.preparation: Lie on back pad facing up. Grasp lever handles on each side with overhand grip.
DeltoidAnterior/LVReclinedShoulderPressP.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/LVReclinedShoulderPressP.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/LVReclinedShoulderPressP.name: Lever Reclined Parallel Grip Shoulder Press
DeltoidAnterior/LVReclinedShoulderPressP.preparation: Lie on back pad facing up. Grasp parallel lever handles on each side.
DeltoidAnterior/LVReclinedShoulderPressP.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/LVReclinedShoulderPressP.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/LVShoulderPress.name: Lever Shoulder Press
DeltoidAnterior/LVShoulderPress.preparation: Set and grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
DeltoidAnterior/LVShoulderPress.execution: Press lever upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/LVShoulderPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/LVShoulderPressParGrip.name: Lever Shoulder Press (parallel grip)
DeltoidAnterior/LVShoulderPressParGrip.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp parallel bar grips in front of shoulders on each side.
DeltoidAnterior/LVShoulderPressParGrip.execution: Press lever upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/LVShoulderPressParGrip.comments: Parallel grip can be used for variety or when flexibility does not permit standard overhand grip further back.

DeltoidAnterior/LVShoulderPressH.name: Lever Shoulder Press (plate loaded)
DeltoidAnterior/LVShoulderPressH.preparation: Set and grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
DeltoidAnterior/LVShoulderPressH.execution: Press lever upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/LVShoulderPressH.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/SLShoulderPressParGrip.name: Sled Shoulder Press (parallel grip)
DeltoidAnterior/SLShoulderPressParGrip.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp parallel bar grips to front of shoulders on each side.
DeltoidAnterior/SLShoulderPressParGrip.execution: Press handles upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/SLShoulderPressParGrip.comments: Parallel grip can be used for variety or when flexibility does not permit standard overhand grip further back.

DeltoidAnterior/SMBehindNeckPress.name: Smith Behind Neck Press
DeltoidAnterior/SMBehindNeckPress.preparation: Sit on bench with bar positioned behind shoulders. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
DeltoidAnterior/SMBehindNeckPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower bar behind neck and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/SMBehindNeckPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/SLShoulderPress.name: Sled Shoulder Press
DeltoidAnterior/SLShoulderPress.preparation: Set and grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
DeltoidAnterior/SLShoulderPress.execution: Press handles upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/SLShoulderPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/SMShoulderPress.name: Smith Shoulder Press
DeltoidAnterior/SMShoulderPress.preparation: Sit on bench with bar positioned in front of shoulders. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
DeltoidAnterior/SMShoulderPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower bar to front of shoulders and repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/SMShoulderPress.comments: Pull head back slightly so bar does not make contact with head. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

DeltoidAnterior/STFrontRaise.name: Suspended Front Raise
DeltoidAnterior/STFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Position body and legs straight at desired angle, hanging from handles with arms straight and palms facing downward.
DeltoidAnterior/STFrontRaise.execution: Raise arms upward overhead by flexing shoulders with arms straight. Return and lower body back until arms are extended straight forward in original position. Repeat.
DeltoidAnterior/STFrontRaise.comments: At higher angles, feet can be placed flat on floor. When angled further back, only heels may contact floor with forefeet raising upward. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright. This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings.

DeltoidLateral/BBUprightRow.name: Barbell Upright Row
DeltoidLateral/BBUprightRow.preparation: Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower overhand grip.
DeltoidLateral/BBUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/BBUprightRow.comments: Bar can be recieved from barbell rack, standing behind bar mid-thigh height. See

DeltoidLateral/BBWideGripUprightRow.name: Barbell Wide Grip Upright Row
DeltoidLateral/BBWideGripUprightRow.preparation: Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
DeltoidLateral/BBWideGripUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/BBWideGripUprightRow.comments: Bar can be received from barbell rack, standing behind bar mid-thigh height. See

DeltoidLateral/CBBarUprightRow.name: Cable Bar Upright Row
DeltoidLateral/CBBarUprightRow.preparation: Grasp cable bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower overhand grip. Stand close to cable bar.
DeltoidLateral/CBBarUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.

DeltoidLateral/CBLateralRaiseClose.name: Cable Lateral Raise (pulleys close)
DeltoidLateral/CBLateralRaiseClose.preparation: Stand facing two low pulleys positioned side by side. Grasp stirrups with each hand. Stand upright with arms staight down to each side.
DeltoidLateral/CBLateralRaiseClose.execution: With elbows slightly bent, raise arms to side until elbows are shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/CBLateralRaiseClose.comments: Maintain fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by

DeltoidLateral/CBLateralRaise.name: Cable Lateral Raise
DeltoidLateral/CBLateralRaise.preparation: With low pulleys to each side, grasp left stirrup with right hand and right stirrup with left hand. Stand upright.
DeltoidLateral/CBLateralRaise.execution: With elbows slightly bent, raise arms to sides   until elbows are shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/CBLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by

DeltoidLateral/CBOneArmLateralRaise.name: Cable One Arm Lateral Raise
DeltoidLateral/CBOneArmLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp stirrup cable attachment. Stand facing with side of resting arm toward low pulley. Grasp ballet bar if available.
DeltoidLateral/CBOneArmLateralRaise.execution: With elbow slightly bent, raise arm to side away from low pulley until elbow is shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/CBOneArmLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by

DeltoidLateral/CBOneArmUprightRow.name: Cable One Arm Upright Row
DeltoidLateral/CBOneArmUprightRow.preparation: Grasp stirrup on low pulley with overhand grip. Stand with side of arm with stirup away from pulley machine, arm against front of body. Place other hand on ballet bar or side of pulley column for support.
DeltoidLateral/CBOneArmUprightRow.execution: Pull stirup to front side of shoulder with elbow leading. Allow wrist to flex as stirrup is lifted. Lower and repeat.

DeltoidLateral/CBSeatedLateralRaise.name: Cable Seated Lateral Raise
DeltoidLateral/CBSeatedLateralRaise.preparation: Sit on seat above twin cable pulleys. Grasp stirrups on each side. Sit upright with arms nearly straight down to each side.
DeltoidLateral/CBSeatedLateralRaise.execution: With elbows slightly bent, raise arms to side until elbows are shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/CBSeatedLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. At top of movement, elbows (not necessarily dumbbells) should be directly lateral to shoulders since elbows are slightly bent forward. Stirrup is raised by

DeltoidLateral/CBSeatedYRaise.name: Cable Seated Y Raise
DeltoidLateral/CBSeatedYRaise.preparation: On dual pulley seated row machine, sit slightly forward on seat or bench in order to grasp both cable attachments. Place feet on vertical platform. Position torso upright and slide hips back so knees are slightly bent.
DeltoidLateral/CBSeatedYRaise.execution: Raise arms upward and outward to sides in Y configuration while allowing elbows to partially bend. Pull back until elbows are approximately lateral to each ear. Lower stirrups forward and downward until arms are extended straight in front of body. Repeat.
DeltoidLateral/CBSeatedYRaise.comments: Keep torso upright throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by combining

DeltoidLateral/CBSeatedYRaiseRope.name: Cable Seated Y Raise (with rope attachment)
DeltoidLateral/CBSeatedYRaiseRope.preparation: Sit slightly forward on seat or bench and grasp ends of rope attachment with hand. Place feet on vertical platform. Slide hips back so knees are slightly bent.
DeltoidLateral/CBSeatedYRaiseRope.execution: With torso upright pull rope upward over head until elbows are approximately lateral to each ear. Lower stirrups forward and downward until arms are extended straight in front of body. Repeat.
DeltoidLateral/CBSeatedYRaiseRope.comments: Keep torso upright while maintaining fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by combining

DeltoidLateral/CBUprightRow.name: Cable Upright Row
DeltoidLateral/CBUprightRow.preparation: Grasp cable bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower overhand grip. Stand close to pulley.
DeltoidLateral/CBUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.

DeltoidLateral/CBUprightRowDualPulley.name: Cable Upright Row (dual pulley)
DeltoidLateral/CBUprightRowDualPulley.preparation: Stand between low dual pulleys. Grasp handles with opposite hands - right hand holds left stirrup and left hand holds right stirrup. Stand upright with arms straight and palms facing back (overhand grip), one stirrup in front of other.
DeltoidLateral/CBUprightRowDualPulley.execution: Pull handles up to front of shoulders with elbows leading and cables crossed. Allow wrists to flex as stirrups are lifted. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/CBUprightRowDualPulley.comments: To prevent cable parts from catching, stand with body turned very subtly to side of cable behind other. Positioning one cable slightly in front of other cable may result in slight asymmetrical movement. Therefore, alternate opposite arm positions every other workout or set. See

DeltoidLateral/CBUprightRowRope.name: Cable Upright Row (with rope attachment)
DeltoidLateral/CBUprightRowRope.preparation: Grasp each side of rope with overhand grip, just under rope ends. Stand close to pulley.
DeltoidLateral/CBUprightRowRope.execution: Pull rope ends to front of shoulders with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as stirrups are lifted. Lower and repeat.

DeltoidLateral/CBUprightRowStirrups.name: Cable Upright Row (stirrup attachments)
DeltoidLateral/CBUprightRowStirrups.preparation: Grasp handles of both stirrups with overhand grip. Stand close to pulley.
DeltoidLateral/CBUprightRowStirrups.comments: Pull handles to front of shoulders with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as stirrups are lifted. Lower and repeat.

DeltoidLateral/CBWideGripUprightRow.name: Cable Wide Grip Upright Row
DeltoidLateral/CBWideGripUprightRow.preparation: Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip. Stand close to pulley.
DeltoidLateral/CBWideGripUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.

DeltoidLateral/CBYRaise.name: Cable Y Raise
DeltoidLateral/CBYRaise.preparation: Stand facing between low pulleys medium width apart, grasp left stirrup with right hand and right stirrup with left hand. Step back slightly away from pulleys and stand upright with cables crossed in front of hips.
DeltoidLateral/CBYRaise.execution: With elbows slightly bent, raise arms upward and outward to sides in Y configuration until elbows are approximately lateral to each ear. Lower stirrups forward and downward in reverse pattern. Repeat.
DeltoidLateral/CBYRaise.comments: Maintain fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by combining

DeltoidLateral/DBInclineLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Incline Lateral Raise
DeltoidLateral/DBInclineLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbell in one hand. Lie on 30° to 45° incline bench with opposite side of body on incline, arm over top of bench, lower leg positioned on front side of seat, and upper leg on back side of seat. Position dumbbell inside of lower leg, just in front of upper leg.
DeltoidLateral/DBInclineLateralRaise.execution: Raise dumbbell from until upper arm is perpendicular to torso. Maintain slight fixed bend in elbow throughout exercise. Lower dumbbell to front of upper leg and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/DBInclineLateralRaise.comments: In order for lateral deltoid to be exercised, dumbbell must be raised by

DeltoidLateral/DBInclineYRaise.name: Dumbbell Incline Y Raise
DeltoidLateral/DBInclineYRaise.preparation: With dumbbells in each hand, lie prone on 45
DeltoidLateral/DBInclineYRaise.execution: Incline bench with head over top of bench and arms extended down to each side.
DeltoidLateral/DBInclineYRaise.comments: With elbows slightly bent, raise arms with dumbbells upward and outward to sides in Y configuration until elbows are approximately lateral to each ear. Lower dumbbells in reverse pattern until they are below shoulders and repeat.

DeltoidLateral/DBLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
DeltoidLateral/DBLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbells in front of thighs with elbows slightly bent. Bend over slightly with hips and knees bent slightly.
DeltoidLateral/DBLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arms to sides until slightly bent elbows are shoulder height while maintaining elbows' height above or equal to wrists. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/DBLateralRaise.comments: Keep elbows pointed high while maintaining slight bend through elbows (10° to 30° angle) throughout movement. At top of movement, elbows (not necessarily dumbbells) should be directly lateral to shoulders since elbows are slightly bent forward. Dumbbells are raised by

DeltoidLateral/DBLyingLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Lying Lateral Raise
DeltoidLateral/DBLyingLateralRaise.preparation: Lie on side with legs separated for support. Grasp dumbbell in front of thigh.
DeltoidLateral/DBLyingLateralRaise.execution: Raise dumbbell from floor until arm is vertical. Maintain fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Lower and repeat.

DeltoidLateral/DBOneArmLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell One Arm Lateral Raise
DeltoidLateral/DBOneArmLateralRaise.preparation: Position dumbbell in front of pelvis with elbow slightly bent. Grasp stationary object with other hand for support. Bend over with hips and knees bent slightly.
DeltoidLateral/DBOneArmLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arm to side until slightly bent elbow is shoulder height while maintaining elbow's height above or equal to wrist. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/DBOneArmLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. At top of movement, elbow (not necessarily dumbbell) should be directly lateral to shoulder since elbow is slightly bent forward. Dumbbell is raised by

DeltoidLateral/DBOneArmSeatedLateralRais.name: Dumbbell One Arm Seated Lateral Raise
DeltoidLateral/DBOneArmSeatedLateralRais.preparation: Sit on stool or end of bench with legs together. Position dumbbell to side with elbow slightly bent. Angle torso slightly forward and place free hand on end of thigh for support.
DeltoidLateral/DBOneArmSeatedLateralRais.execution: Raise upper arm to side until slightly bent elbow is shoulder height while maintaining elbow's height above or equal to wrist. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/DBOneArmSeatedLateralRais.comments: Maintain fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. At top of movement, elbow (not necessarily dumbbell) should be directly lateral to shoulder since elbow is slightly bent forward. Dumbbell is raised by

DeltoidLateral/DBOneArmUprightRow.name: Dumbbell One Arm Upright Row
DeltoidLateral/DBOneArmUprightRow.preparation: Grasp dumbbells with palms facing front of thighs. Position other hand for support.
DeltoidLateral/DBOneArmUprightRow.execution: Pull dumbbell to front of shoulder with elbow leading. Allow wrist to flex as dumbbell rises upward. Lower and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

DeltoidLateral/DBSeatedLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Seated Lateral Raise
