DeltoidLateral/DBSeatedLateralRaise.preparation: Sit on end of bench with dumbbell in each hand and legs together. Position dumbbells with palms facing inward and arms hanging down slightly bent.
DeltoidLateral/DBSeatedLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arms to sides until slightly bent elbows are shoulder height while maintaining elbows' height above or equal to wrists. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/DBSeatedLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. At top of movement, elbow (not necessarily dumbbell) should be directly lateral to shoulder since elbow is slightly bent forward. Dumbbell is raised by

DeltoidLateral/DBRaises.name: Dumbbell Raise
DeltoidLateral/DBRaises.preparation: Stand and grasp dumbbells with arms to side, palms facing sides of thighs.
DeltoidLateral/DBRaises.execution: Pull dumbbells up to sides of ribs with elbows out to sides. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/DBRaises.comments: When dumbbells are raised, wrist can be flexed, extended, or keep neutral.

DeltoidLateral/DBSeatedUprightRow.name: Dumbbell Seated Upright Row
DeltoidLateral/DBSeatedUprightRow.preparation: Sit on end of bench with legs far apart. Grasp dumbbell between legs with arm vertical under shoulder. Position torso slightly forward with hand on knee for support.
DeltoidLateral/DBSeatedUprightRow.execution: Pull dumbbell to front of shoulder with elbow leading out to side. Allow wrists to flex as dumbbell rises upward. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/DBSeatedUprightRow.comments: When dumbbell is raised, wrist should be in front or just below of shoulder; elbow should be to side, not too pointing forward. See

DeltoidLateral/DBUprightRow.name: Dumbbell Upright Row
DeltoidLateral/DBUprightRow.preparation: Grasp dumbbells and stand with palms facing front of thighs.
DeltoidLateral/DBUprightRow.execution: Pull dumbbells to front of shoulder with elbows leading out to sides. Allow wrists to flex as dumbbells rise upward. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/DBUprightRow.comments: When dumbbells are raised, wrists should be in front or just below of shoulders; elbows should be to sides, not pointing   forward. See

DeltoidLateral/LVBBUprightRow.name: Lever Barbell Upright Row (plate loaded)
DeltoidLateral/LVBBUprightRow.preparation: Stand behind bar mid-thigh height, facing away from from fulcrum. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back and stand upright.
DeltoidLateral/LVBBUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.

DeltoidLateral/LVExtendedArmKneelingLate.name: Lever Extended Arm Kneeling Lateral Raise
DeltoidLateral/LVExtendedArmKneelingLate.preparation: Kneel on shin pads facing machine and grasp lever handles to each side with elbows straight or slightly bent.
DeltoidLateral/LVExtendedArmKneelingLate.execution: Raise lever handles to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain elbows' height above or equal to wrists. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/LVExtendedArmKneelingLate.comments: If elbows drop much lower than wrists, front deltoids become primary mover instead of lateral deltoids.

DeltoidLateral/LVExtendedArmLateralRaise.name: Lever Extended Arm Lateral Raise
DeltoidLateral/LVExtendedArmLateralRaise.preparation: Stand facing machine and grasp lever handles to each side with elbows straight or slightly bent.
DeltoidLateral/LVExtendedArmLateralRaise.execution: Raise lever handles to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain elbows' height above or equal to wrists. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/LVExtendedArmLateralRaise.comments: If elbows drop much lower than wrists, front deltoids become primary mover instead of lateral deltoids. Torso can also lean forward slightly to keep resistance targeted to side delt.

DeltoidLateral/LVLateralRaise.name: Lever Lateral Raise
DeltoidLateral/LVLateralRaise.preparation: Sit in machine. Situate bent arms between padded lever and sides of body. Grasp handles if available.
DeltoidLateral/LVLateralRaise.execution: Raise arms to sides until upper arms are horizontal. Return and repeat.
DeltoidLateral/LVLateralRaise.comments: If necessary, lean forward slightly to keep elbows directly lateral to body. Also see

DeltoidLateral/LVLateralRaise2.name: Lever Lateral Raise
DeltoidLateral/LVLateralRaise2.preparation: Sit in machine. Situate bent arms between padded lever and sides of body. Grasp handles if available.
DeltoidLateral/LVLateralRaise2.execution: Raise arms to sides until upper arms are horizontal. Return and repeat.

DeltoidLateral/LVLateralRaiseH.name: Lever Lateral Raise (plate loaded)
DeltoidLateral/LVLateralRaiseH.preparation: Sit in machine. Situate bent arms between padded lever and sides of body.
DeltoidLateral/LVLateralRaiseH.execution: Raise arms to sides until upper arms are horizontal. Return and repeat.

DeltoidLateral/SMUprightRow.name: Smith Upright Row
DeltoidLateral/SMUprightRow.preparation: Stand behind bar mid-thigh height. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back and stand upright.
DeltoidLateral/SMUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.

DeltoidLateral/SMWideGripUprightRow.name: Smith Wide Grip Upright Row
DeltoidLateral/SMWideGripUprightRow.preparation: Stand behind bar mid-thigh height. Grasp bar with wide grip overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back and stand upright.
DeltoidLateral/SMWideGripUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.

DeltoidLateral/STYShoulderRaise.name: Suspended Y Lateral Raise
DeltoidLateral/STYShoulderRaise.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Position body and legs straight at desired angle hanging from handles with arms straight and palms angled inward.
DeltoidLateral/STYShoulderRaise.execution: Raise arms upward and outward in shape of a Y while keeping arms straight. Return and lower body back in opposite motion until arms are extended straight forward in original position. Repeat.
DeltoidLateral/STYShoulderRaise.comments: At higher angles, feet can be placed flat on floor. When angled further back, only heels may contact forefeet floor with forefeet   raising upward. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright. This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings.

DeltoidPosterior/BBLyingRearDeltRow.name: Barbell Lying Rear Delt Row
DeltoidPosterior/BBLyingRearDeltRow.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
DeltoidPosterior/BBLyingRearDeltRow.execution: Keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso, pull barbell up toward upper chest until upper arms are just beyond parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/BBLyingRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

DeltoidPosterior/BBRearDeltRaise.name: Barbell Rear Delt Raise
DeltoidPosterior/BBRearDeltRaise.preparation: Stand holding barbell behind thighs or hips with arms straight down to sides.
DeltoidPosterior/BBRearDeltRaise.execution: Pull barbell behind hips and low back up as far as possible allowing elbows to travel up behind body to each side. Flex wrists near top of movement so bar can be raised higher. Lower until arms and wrists are straight. Repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/BBRearDeltRaise.comments: Flexion of wrist can allow for slightly greater range of movement near top, but this movement optional.

DeltoidPosterior/BBRearDeltRow.name: Barbell Rear Delt Row
DeltoidPosterior/BBRearDeltRow.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight, approximately horizontal. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
DeltoidPosterior/BBRearDeltRow.execution: Keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso, pull barbell up toward upper chest until upper arms are just beyond horizontal. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/BBRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

DeltoidPosterior/BWRearDeltInvertedRow.name: Rear Delt Inverted Row
DeltoidPosterior/BWRearDeltInvertedRow.preparation: Stand facing horizontal bar positioned waist to lower chest height. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Step back until arms are straight. Walk forward under bar until arms are perpendicular to extended body. With heels on floor, position body at angle under bar with legs, hips and spine straight.
DeltoidPosterior/BWRearDeltInvertedRow.execution: Pull shoulders toward bar while keeping body straight, elbows to sides of shoulders, and upper arms perpendicular to torso, until upper arms are parallel to one another, or just beyond. Lower body while keeping elbows positioned high to sides of shoulders until arms are extended straight. Repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/BWRearDeltInvertedRow.comments: If elbows fall so upper arms no longer travel perpendicular to trunk,

DeltoidPosterior/BWRearDeltInvertedRowHi.name: Rear Delt Inverted Row (high bar)
DeltoidPosterior/BWRearDeltInvertedRowHi.preparation: Stand facing horizontal bar positioned lower to upper chest height. Step toward bar so chest makes contact. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Raise elbows up to shoulder height. Place feet forward on floor so body is reclined back with legs, hips and spine straight.
DeltoidPosterior/BWRearDeltInvertedRowHi.execution: Lower body while keeping body straight, elbows high, and upper arms perpendicular to torso, until arms are extended straight. Pull shoulders toward bar while keeping elbows up high until upper arms are parallel to one another, or just beyond. Repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/BWRearDeltInvertedRowHi.comments: If elbows fall so upper arms no longer travel perpendicular to trunk,

DeltoidPosterior/CBOneArmCrossRow.name: Cable One Arm Standing Cross Row
DeltoidPosterior/CBOneArmCrossRow.preparation: Facing shoulder height cable pulley, grasp stirrup cable attachment with one hand, palm orientated down. Step back and turn body inward about 30° to 45° to face extended arm about. Stand back just enough to allow arm to be fully extended with weight raised up slightly.
DeltoidPosterior/CBOneArmCrossRow.execution: Pull stirrup back with elbow up at shoulder height until elbow travels just behind shoulder. Keep upper arm horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arm is fully extended. Repeat.

DeltoidPosterior/BWRearDeltInvertedRowHi.name: Rear Delt Inverted Row (on hips)
DeltoidPosterior/BWRearDeltInvertedRowHi.preparation: Lay on back with belly under fixed horizontal bar. Bend knees and position feet on floor. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Turn elbows outward to sides.
DeltoidPosterior/BWRearDeltInvertedRowHi.execution: Walk forward under bar while pulling upper chest close to bar. With heels on floor, position body at angle under bar with legs, hips and spine straight. Position forearms perpendicular to body, orientated forward. Also, position upper arms perpendicular to body, orientated to each side.
DeltoidPosterior/BWRearDeltInvertedRowHi.comments: Keeping hips on floor, low back straight, and elbow pointed out to sides; pull torso up to bar. Return when upper arms are just beyond parallel to one another. Lower body downward until arms are extended straight. Return and repeat.

DeltoidPosterior/CBOneArmRearDeltRow.name: Cable One Arm Rear Delt Row
DeltoidPosterior/CBOneArmRearDeltRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench or platform in order to grasp stirrup cable attachment with one hand. Straighten torso upright and slide hips back until knees are only slightly bent. Point elbow out to side.
DeltoidPosterior/CBOneArmRearDeltRow.comments: Pull stirrup out to side, elbows up shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Allow wrist to follow elbow. Keep upper arm horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat.

DeltoidPosterior/CBOneArmRearLateralRais.name: Cable One Arm Rear Lateral Raise
DeltoidPosterior/CBOneArmRearLateralRais.preparation: Stand with side to low pulley. Grasp stirrup attachment with hand furthest from pulley. Bend knees slightly and bend over with resting arm to side of low pulley.
DeltoidPosterior/CBOneArmRearLateralRais.execution: Raise arm to side until elbow is shoulder height. Maintain upper arm perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Lower and repeat. Repeat with other arm.
DeltoidPosterior/CBOneArmRearLateralRais.comments: Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso to minimize

DeltoidPosterior/CBRearDeltPull.name: Cable One Arm Reverse Fly
DeltoidPosterior/CBRearDeltPull.preparation: Stand with side to shoulder height cable pulley. Grasp stirrup cable attachment with hand furthest from pulley. Position arm across neck with elbow bent 30° to 45° outward.
DeltoidPosterior/CBRearDeltPull.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, pull stirrup out to side, maintaining fixed elbow position throughout exercise. Return to original position and repeat. Repeat with other arm.
DeltoidPosterior/CBRearDeltPull.comments: Upper arm should travel in horizontal path at shoulder height (not downward) to minimize

DeltoidPosterior/CBRearDeltRow.name: Cable Rear Delt Row
DeltoidPosterior/CBRearDeltRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench or platform in order to grasp cable bar attachment. With elbow width overhand grip, straighten torso upright and slide hips back until knees are only   slightly bent.
DeltoidPosterior/CBRearDeltRow.execution: Pull cable attachment toward upper chest, just below neck, with elbows up out to sides until elbows travel slightly behind back. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/CBRearDeltRow.comments: Elbow width is determined when elbows are raised at height of shoulders out to sides. The relatively powerful

DeltoidPosterior/CBRearLateralRaise.name: Cable Rear Lateral Raise
DeltoidPosterior/CBRearLateralRaise.preparation: Stand with cable columns to each side. Grasp left stirrup with right hand and right stirrup with left hand. Bend knees and bend over at hips, so torso is approximately horizontal with back straight. Point elbows outward with arms slightly bent.
DeltoidPosterior/CBRearLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arms to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and slight bend in elbows as arms are raised to sides. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/CBRearLateralRaise.comments: Upper arm should travel perpendicular to torso to minimize

DeltoidPosterior/CBRearDeltRowStirrups.name: Cable Rear Delt Row (stirrups)
DeltoidPosterior/CBRearDeltRowStirrups.preparation: On dual pulley seated row machine, sit slightly forward on seat or bench in order to grasp both cable attachments. Place feet on vertical platform. Position torso upright and slide hips back until knees are only slightly bent and cable taut. Point elbows outward.
DeltoidPosterior/CBRearDeltRowStirrups.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides, keeping elbows at shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Allow wrists to follow elbows. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/CBRearDeltRowStirrups.comments: Dual pulley cables should be positioned approximately shoulder height or not much lower.   The relatively powerful

DeltoidPosterior/CBSeatedRearDeltRowStir.name: Cable Seated Rear Delt Row (stirrups)
DeltoidPosterior/CBSeatedRearDeltRowStir.preparation: Sit on seat facing twin pulley cables positioned shoulder height. Grasp stirrup cable attachment in each hand. Straighten lower back upright so arms and shoulders are positioned straight forward with cable taut. Point elbows outward.
DeltoidPosterior/CBSeatedRearDeltRowStir.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides, keeping elbows at shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Allow wrists to follow elbows. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.

DeltoidPosterior/CBSeatedRearDeltPull.name: Cable Seated Reverse Fly
DeltoidPosterior/CBSeatedRearDeltPull.preparation: Sit on seat facing twin pulley cables positioned approximately shoulder height. Grasp stirrup cable attachment in each hand. Straighten lower back upright so cable is taut. Point elbows outward with arms slightly bent.
DeltoidPosterior/CBSeatedRearDeltPull.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, pull stirrups out to sides, maintaining slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Return to original position and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/CBSeatedRearDeltPull.comments: Upper arms should travel in horizontal path at shoulder height (not downward) to minimize

DeltoidPosterior/CBSeatedRearLateralRais.name: Cable Seated Rear Lateral Raise
DeltoidPosterior/CBSeatedRearLateralRais.preparation: Sit at edge of bench with feet of floor ahead of knees. Rest torso on thighs. Reach under legs and grasp stirrup cable attachments, right hand holding left stirrup, left hand holding right stirrup.
DeltoidPosterior/CBSeatedRearLateralRais.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Lower until arms contact sides of legs. Repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/CBSeatedRearLateralRais.comments: Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso to minimize

DeltoidPosterior/CBStandingCrossRow.name: Cable Standing Cross Row
DeltoidPosterior/CBStandingCrossRow.preparation: Stand between two shoulder-high cable pulleys (adjustable cross-over machine). Grasp right stirrup with left hand and left stirrup with right hand. Step back until cables are angled back 30° to 45°. Position both elbows at height of shoulders, one over other.
DeltoidPosterior/CBStandingCrossRow.execution: Pull both cable attachments by moving elbows back to sides. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/CBStandingCrossRow.comments: becomes involved if elbows drop below shoulders.

DeltoidPosterior/CBStandingRearDeltRowRo.name: Cable Standing Rear Delt Row (with rope)
DeltoidPosterior/CBStandingRearDeltRowRo.preparation: Stand facing rope attachment on high pulley cable. Grasp each end of rope just above enlarged ends. Step back with one foot so arms and shoulders are positioned straight forward with cable taut. Point elbows outward.
DeltoidPosterior/CBStandingRearDeltRowRo.execution: Pull rope to upper chest or neck, keeping elbows at shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Keep upper arms perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended forward. Repeat.

DeltoidPosterior/CBStandingRearDeltRowSt.name: Cable Standing Rear Delt Row (stirrups)
DeltoidPosterior/CBStandingRearDeltRowSt.preparation: Stand facing twin pulley cables positioned shoulder height. Grasp stirrup cable attachment in each hand. Step back with one foot so arms and shoulders are positioned straight forward with cable taut. Point elbows outward.
DeltoidPosterior/CBStandingRearDeltRowSt.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides, keeping elbows at shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Allow wrists to follow elbows. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.

DeltoidPosterior/CBStandingReverseFly.name: Cable Reverse Fly
DeltoidPosterior/CBStandingReverseFly.preparation: Stand facing twin pulley cables positioned close together and approximately shoulder height. Grasp stirrup cable attachment in each hand. Step back away from machine so cable is taut. Stand with feet staggered. Point elbows outward with arms straight or slightly bent.
DeltoidPosterior/CBStandingReverseFly.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides, maintaining stiff elbow position throughout exercise. Return to original position and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/CBStandingReverseFly.comments: Upper arms should travel in horizontal path at shoulder height (not downward) to minimize

DeltoidPosterior/CBSupineRearLateralRais.name: Cable Supine Reverse Fly
DeltoidPosterior/CBSupineRearLateralRais.preparation: With bench between two high pulleys to each side, grasp left stirrup with right hand and right stirrup with left hand. Lie on bench with pulleys to each side of shoulders. Arms should be crossed above upper chest with elbows slightly bent.
DeltoidPosterior/CBSupineRearLateralRais.execution: Pull upper arms down to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (just slightly bent) as arms are pulled down to sides. Return arms to original position and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/CBSupineRearLateralRais.comments: Upper arm should travel perpendicular to torso to minimize

DeltoidPosterior/DBInclineRearDeltRow.name: Dumbbell Incline Rear Delt Row
DeltoidPosterior/DBInclineRearDeltRow.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp dumbbells below.
DeltoidPosterior/DBInclineRearDeltRow.execution: Keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso and dumbbells just below elbows, pull dumbbells up until elbows are just above shoulders. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/DBInclineRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

DeltoidPosterior/DBLyingRearDeltRaise.name: Dumbbell Side Lying Rear Delt Raise
DeltoidPosterior/DBLyingRearDeltRaise.preparation: Lie on side with legs separated for support. Grasp dumbbell in front of chest, palm facing down, arm extended forward with slight bend.
DeltoidPosterior/DBLyingRearDeltRaise.execution: Raise dumbbell from floor until it travels above shoulder. Return dumbbell to floor at original position. Repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/DBLyingRearDeltRaise.comments: Maintain fixed elbow position straight or slightly bent and keep upper arm perpendicular to trunk throughout exercise.

DeltoidPosterior/DBLyingRearDeltRow.name: Dumbbell Lying Rear Delt Row
DeltoidPosterior/DBLyingRearDeltRow.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp dumbbells below.
DeltoidPosterior/DBLyingRearDeltRow.execution: Keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso and dumbbells just below elbows, pull dumbbells up until elbows are just above shoulders. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/DBLyingRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

DeltoidPosterior/DBLyingRearLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Lying Rear Lateral Raise
DeltoidPosterior/DBLyingRearLateralRaise.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp dumbbells below to each side.
DeltoidPosterior/DBLyingRearLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arms to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Maintain height of elbows above wrists by raising "pinkie" side up. Lower and repeat.

DeltoidPosterior/DBOneArmRearLateralRais.name: Dumbbell Lying One Arm Rear Lateral Raise
DeltoidPosterior/DBOneArmRearLateralRais.preparation: With dumbbell in one hand, lie chest down on elevated bench. Position palm forward (thumb up) with elbow straight or slightly bent.
DeltoidPosterior/DBOneArmRearLateralRais.execution: Raise upper arm to side until elbow is shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso with elbow straight throughout exercise. Maintain palm forward position. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/DBOneArmRearLateralRais.comments: Bench should be horizontal and be high enough to prevent dumbbell from touching floor. Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso to minimize latissimus dorsi involvement. Bench should be high enough to prevent dumbbells from hitting floor and close to horizontal. Lying at 45° is not sufficient angle to target rear deltoids. This exercise AKA "prone full can" has been suggested to exercise supraspinatus muscle in rehabilitation settings (Blackburn TA, et al. 1990; Reinold MM, et al. 2007). See exercise performed on

DeltoidPosterior/DBRearDeltRow.name: Dumbbell Rear Delt Row
DeltoidPosterior/DBRearDeltRow.preparation: Kneel over side of bench with arm and leg to side. Grasp dumbbell.
DeltoidPosterior/DBRearDeltRow.execution: Pull dumbbell up out to side with upper arm perpendicular to trunk until upper arm is just beyond horizontal. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/DBRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

DeltoidPosterior/DBRearLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Rear Lateral Raise
DeltoidPosterior/DBRearLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbells to each side. Bend knees and bend over through hips with back flat, close to horizontal. Position elbows with slight bend and palms facing together.
DeltoidPosterior/DBRearLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arms to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Maintain height of elbows above wrists by raising "pinkie finger" side up. Lower and repeat.

DeltoidPosterior/DBSeatedRearLateralRais.name: Dumbbell Seated Rear Lateral Raise
DeltoidPosterior/DBSeatedRearLateralRais.preparation: Sit on edge of bench with feet placed beyond knees. Bend over and rest torso on thighs. Grasp dumbbells with each hand under legs. Position elbows with slight bend with palms facing together behind ankles (as shown) or just to sides of ankles.
DeltoidPosterior/DBSeatedRearLateralRais.execution: Raise upper arms to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Maintain elbows height above wrists by raising "pinkie finger" side up. Lower and repeat.

DeltoidPosterior/LVLyingRearLateralRaise.name: Lever Lying Rear Lateral Raise
DeltoidPosterior/LVLyingRearLateralRaise.preparation: Lie on machine with chest against padding. Position arms between padded lever arms with elbows below shoulders.
DeltoidPosterior/LVLyingRearLateralRaise.execution: Pull arms up until elbows are beyond back. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVLyingRearLateralRaise.comments: Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso. At lower portion of exercise, keep elbows pointed outward below shoulders. At upper portion of exercise, keep elbows pointed outward to sides of shoulders. Legs may be kept together, extending off end, or bent straddling bench as demonstrated.

DeltoidPosterior/LVInclineRearDeltRowPL.name: Lever Incline Rear Delt Row (plate loaded)
DeltoidPosterior/LVInclineRearDeltRowPL.preparation: Lie chest low on inclined platform and grasp forward lever handles with wide overhand grip.
DeltoidPosterior/LVInclineRearDeltRowPL.execution: Pull lever with elbows forward  out to sides until upper arms are just beyond parallel, keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVInclineRearDeltRowPL.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltFlyGriplessPe.name: Lever Seated Reverse Fly (on pec deck)
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltFlyGriplessPe.preparation: Sit on machine with chest against vertical pad. Position arms against padded lever arms at height of shoulders.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltFlyGriplessPe.execution: Pull arms back until elbows are beyond back. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltFlyGriplessPe.comments: Can be performed on certain pec deck machines as shown if their range of motion and design are adequate, although

DeltoidPosterior/LVLyingRearLateralRaise.name: Lever Lying Rear Lateral Raise (plate loaded)
DeltoidPosterior/LVLyingRearLateralRaise.preparation: Lie on machine with chest against padding. Position arms between padded lever arms with elbows below shoulders.
DeltoidPosterior/LVLyingRearLateralRaise.execution: Pull arms up until elbows are beyond back. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVLyingRearLateralRaise.comments: Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso. At lower portion of exercise, keep elbows pointed outward below shoulders. At upper portion of exercise, keep elbows pointed outward to sides of shoulders. Legs may be kept together, extending off end (as shown), or bent straddling.

DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRaise.name: Lever Rear Delt Raise (plate loaded)
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRaise.preparation: Stand between lever handles facing away from machine. Squat down and grasp lever handles to each side. Stand up with arms straight to sides.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRaise.execution: Pull lever up as far as possible allowing elbows to travel up behind body to each side. Lower until arms are straight and repeat.

DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRow.name: Lever Seated Rear Delt Row
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRow.preparation: Place seat at low position. Sit on seat with chest against pad and grasp upper handles.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRow.execution: Pull lever with elbows up out to sides until upper arms are just beyond parallel, keeping upper arm horizontal, perpendicular to torso. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRowC.name: Lever Seated Rear Delt Row (plate loaded)
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRowC.preparation: Place seat at low position. Sit on seat with chest against pad and grasp upper handles.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRowC.execution: Pull lever with elbows up out to sides until upper arms are just beyond parallel, keeping upper arm horizontal, perpendicular to torso. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRowC.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

DeltoidPosterior/LVRearLateralRaiseOnLat.name: Lever Rear Lateral Raise (on lateral raise machine)
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearLateralRaiseOnLat.preparation: Stand on platform facing lateral raise machine. Bend knees and bend over at hips with back flat close to horizontal. With elbows bent under shoulders, position back of upper arms against arm pads.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearLateralRaiseOnLat.execution: Maintaining torso position, raise upper arms to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearLateralRaiseOnLat.comments: Platform height should allow pivot point of shoulders to be aligned with lever fulcrum. Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso. At lower portion of exercise, keep elbows pointed outward below shoulders. At upper portion of exercise, keep elbows pointed outward to sides of shoulders. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See

DeltoidPosterior/LVRearLateralRaiseOnExt.name: Lever Rear Lateral Raise (on extended arm kneeling lateral raise machine)
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearLateralRaiseOnExt.preparation: Stand on platform facing lateral raise machine. Bend knees and bend over at hips with back flat close to horizontal. With arms straight or slightly bent, grasp lever handles with each hand.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearLateralRaiseOnExt.execution: Maintaining torso position, raise handles to sides until upper arm is shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearLateralRaiseOnExt.comments: Platform height should allow pivot point of shoulders to be aligned with lever fulcrum. Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso to minimize relatively powerful

DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRowHammer.name: Lever Seated Rear Delt Row (plate loaded)
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRowHammer.preparation: Place seat at low position. Sit on seat with chest against pad and grasp upper handles.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRowHammer.execution: Pull lever with elbows up out to sides until upper arms are just beyond parallel, keeping upper arm horizontal, perpendicular to torso. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearDeltRowHammer.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

DeltoidPosterior/LVRearLateralRaise.name: Lever Seated Reverse Fly (parallel grip)
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearLateralRaise.preparation: Sit on machine with chest against pad. Grasp parallel handles with thumbs up at shoulder height. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are also at height of shoulders.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearLateralRaise.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, pull handles apart and to rear until elbows are just behind back. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVRearLateralRaise.comments: Keep elbows raised at same height of shoulders to minimize

DeltoidPosterior/LVReverseFlyOverhand.name: Lever Seated Reverse Fly (overhand grip)
DeltoidPosterior/LVReverseFlyOverhand.preparation: Sit on machine with chest against pad. Grasp horizontal handles with overhand grip at shoulder height. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows are also at height of shoulders.
DeltoidPosterior/LVReverseFlyOverhand.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, pull handles apart and to rear until elbows are just behind back Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVReverseFlyOverhand.comments: Keep elbows raised at same height of shoulders to minimize

DeltoidPosterior/LVReverseFlyPronated.name: Lever Seated Reverse Fly (pronated parallel grip)
DeltoidPosterior/LVReverseFlyPronated.preparation: Sit in machine with chest against pad. Grasp parallel handles from inside with thumbs down at shoulder height.
DeltoidPosterior/LVReverseFlyPronated.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, pull handles apart and to rear until elbows are just behind back. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVReverseFlyPronated.comments: Pronated grip will internally rotate shoulders so elbows are kept at height of shoulders. Preventing elbows from dropping below shoulders will minimize

DeltoidPosterior/LVSeatedRearDeltFly.name: Lever Seated Reverse Fly (gripless)
DeltoidPosterior/LVSeatedRearDeltFly.preparation: Sit on machine with back against vertical pad and roller pads in front of body. Place feet forward on foot bars. Cross both arms in front of body situated between roller pads. Position arms one on top of another, shoulder height.
DeltoidPosterior/LVSeatedRearDeltFly.execution: Pull arms apart and back until elbows are slightly beyond back. Return to starting position and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVSeatedRearDeltFly.comments: To maintain hips and back against pad during lift, legs must push into foot bar while keeping spine ridged. If apparatus is unavailable, a similar movement can be performed on certain

DeltoidPosterior/LVSeatedRearLateralRais.name: Lever Seated Rear Lateral Raise (plate loaded)
DeltoidPosterior/LVSeatedRearLateralRais.preparation: Sit on seat with feet placed on platform ahead of knees. Rest torso on thighs. Reach under legs and grasp lever handles on each side.
DeltoidPosterior/LVSeatedRearLateralRais.execution: Pull lever handles out to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Lower and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVSeatedRearLateralRais.comments: Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso to minimize

DeltoidPosterior/LVTBarRearDeltRow.name: Lever T-Bar Rear Delt Row (plate loaded)
DeltoidPosterior/LVTBarRearDeltRow.preparation: Straddle lever bar facing handles. Bend knees slightly and bend over handles with back straight. Grasp wide grip handles with overhand grip. With arms extended, position torso just high enough to allow weight to make contact with floor.
DeltoidPosterior/LVTBarRearDeltRow.execution: With elbows out to sides, pull bar up toward upper chest until elbows are same height as shoulders or just beyond, keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/LVTBarRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

DeltoidPosterior/SMRearDeltRow.name: Smith Rear Delt Row
DeltoidPosterior/SMRearDeltRow.preparation: Stand near low smith bar. Bend knees and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with wide   overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
DeltoidPosterior/SMRearDeltRow.execution: Keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso, pull bar up toward upper chest until upper arms are just beyond parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/SMRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

ErectorSpinae/BB45BackExtension.name: Barbell 45° Back Extension (on hyperextension apparatus)
ErectorSpinae/BB45BackExtension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
ErectorSpinae/BB45BackExtension.execution: Lower body by bending waist until fully flexed. Raise, or extend waist until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BB45BackExtension.comments: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

DeltoidPosterior/STRearDeltRow.name: Suspended Rear Delt Row
DeltoidPosterior/STRearDeltRow.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles.
DeltoidPosterior/STRearDeltRow.execution: Position body and legs straight at desired angle hanging from handles with arms straight. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows are positioned directly outwards.
DeltoidPosterior/STRearDeltRow.comments: Pull body up while keeping elbows pointed directly out to each side and body and legs straight. Pull until elbows are directly lateral to each side without allowing elbows to drop. Return until arms are extended straight and shoulders are stretched forward, maintaining high elbow position. Repeat.

DeltoidPosterior/STReverseFly.name: Suspended Reverse Fly
DeltoidPosterior/STReverseFly.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Position body and legs straight at desired angle hanging from handles with arms straight. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows are positioned directly outwards with arms straight or slightly bent. Shoulder should be positioned approximately 90° relative to torso position.
DeltoidPosterior/STReverseFly.execution: Pull handles out to sides while keeping stiff elbow position and maintaining shoulder at 90° plane to torso throughout exercise. Raise up until upper arms are in-line to one another. Return to original position in same plane and repeat.
DeltoidPosterior/STReverseFly.comments: Upper arms should travel in transverse path at shoulder level without allowing elbows to drop to minimize

ErectorSpinae/BB45Hyperextension.name: Barbell 45° Hyperextension
ErectorSpinae/BB45Hyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
ErectorSpinae/BB45Hyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BB45Hyperextension.comments: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

ErectorSpinae/BBBackExtension.name: Barbell Back Extension (on hyperextension apparatus)
ErectorSpinae/BBBackExtension.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded bar. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
ErectorSpinae/BBBackExtension.execution: Lower body by bending waist until fully flexed. Raise or extend waist until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BBBackExtension.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

ErectorSpinae/BBBentKneeGoodMorning.name: Barbell Bent Knee Good-morning
ErectorSpinae/BBBentKneeGoodMorning.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
ErectorSpinae/BBBentKneeGoodMorning.execution: Bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.

ErectorSpinae/BBBlockPull.name: Barbell Block Pull
ErectorSpinae/BBBlockPull.preparation: With barbell on blocks, position feet shoulder width or slightly narrower beneath bar. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
ErectorSpinae/BBBlockPull.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BBBlockPull.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip.

ErectorSpinae/BBDeadlift.name: Barbell Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/BBDeadlift.preparation: With feet flat beneath bar, squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
ErectorSpinae/BBDeadlift.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.

ErectorSpinae/BBHyperextension.name: Barbell Hyperextension
ErectorSpinae/BBHyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
ErectorSpinae/BBHyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BBHyperextension.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

ErectorSpinae/BBDeficitDeadlift.name: Barbell Deficit Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/BBDeficitDeadlift.preparation: Stand on weight plate, bumper plate, or shallow elevated platform with loaded bar above feet. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
ErectorSpinae/BBDeficitDeadlift.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weights to floor by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BBDeficitDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip.

ErectorSpinae/BBStiffLegDeadlift.name: Barbell Stiff Leg Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/BBStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on shallow platform with feet flat beneath bar. Bend knees and bend over with lower back straight. Grasp barbell with shoulder width overhand or mixed grip, shoulder width or slightly wider. Lift weight to standing position.
ErectorSpinae/BBStiffLegDeadlift.execution: Lower bar to top of feet by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing only slightly at bottom. With knees bent, lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BBStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion. Erector Spinae is exercised isometrically if low back does articulate as with

ErectorSpinae/BBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Barbell Straight Leg Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/BBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on shallow platform with feet flat beneath bar. Bend knees and bend over with lower back straight. Grasp barbell with shoulder width overhand or mixed grip, shoulder width or slightly wider. Lift weight to standing position.
ErectorSpinae/BBStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips and waist. Lift bar by extending waist and hip until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BBStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

ErectorSpinae/BBSumoBlockPull.name: Barbell Sumo Block Pull
ErectorSpinae/BBSumoBlockPull.preparation: With barbell on blocks, position feet under bar with very wide stance. Squat down and grasp bar between legs with shoulder width mixed grip. Face forward while positioning shoulders upward with arms straight, chest high, hips low, and back straight.
ErectorSpinae/BBSumoBlockPull.execution: Pull bar up by driving feet outward while pulling chest up. Extend knees when bar passes knees. At top of lift, when torso is upright, drive shoulders back and chest up. Return weight to blocks by bending hips back and knees pointed outward, while keeping chest high and back straight. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BBSumoBlockPull.comments: Use shoulder width grip since narrower than shoulder width grip will make it more difficult to lockout at top. Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight, and knees pointed out same direction as feet. Also, keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. With wide stance, push feet out to sides and not down to prevent knees from buckling inward. Pushing knees out will allow hips to travel toward bar more quickly while improving leverage. Barbell Sumo Block Pull emphasizes mid portion of

ErectorSpinae/BBSumoDeadlift.name: Barbell Sumo Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/BBSumoDeadlift.preparation: Position feet under bar with very wide stance. Squat down and grasp bar between legs with shoulder width mixed grip. Face forward while positioning shoulders upward with arms straight, chest high, hips low, and back straight.
ErectorSpinae/BBSumoDeadlift.execution: Pull bar up by driving feet outward while pulling chest up. Extend knees when bar passes knees. At top of lift, when torso is upright, drive shoulders back and chest up. Return weight to floor by bending hips back and knees pointed outward, while keeping chest high and back straight. Repeat.

ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionArmsCros.name: 45° Hyperextension (arms crossed)
ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionArmsCros.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Cross arms across chest.
ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionArmsCros.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionArmsCros.comments: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.

ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionArmsUp.name: 45° Hyperextension (arms up)
ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionArmsUp.preparation: Place arms parallel extending upward to sides of head.
ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionArmsUp.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionArmsUp.comments: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.

ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionHips.name: 45° Hyperextension (hands behind hips)
ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionHips.preparation: Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionHips.execution: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.
ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionHips.comments: Begin with arms in low position and gradually position arms in higher position to allow lower back adequate

ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionNeck.name: 45° Hyperextension (hands behind neck)
ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionNeck.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BW45HyperextensionNeck.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad and full range of motion is permitted; abdomen should not press on side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.

ErectorSpinae/BWAlternatingBirdDog.name: Alternating Bird Dog
ErectorSpinae/BWAlternatingBirdDog.execution: Kneel on mat on all fours with legs and hands slightly apart.

ErectorSpinae/BWAlternatingBirdDogExBall.name: Alternating Bird Dog (on exercise ball)
ErectorSpinae/BWAlternatingBirdDogExBall.preparation: Lay on top of exercise ball with legs and hands slightly apart. Place chest down so torso is wrapped over ball.
ErectorSpinae/BWAlternatingBirdDogExBall.execution: Raise left arm and torso upward beside head while raising right leg up behind body. Lower arm, torso, and leg to original position and repeat. Repeat by raising and lowering right arm and left leg in same manner. Repeat by alternating between opposite sides.
ErectorSpinae/BWAlternatingBirdDogExBall.comments: Lift leg and arm deliberately with no jerking. Also see

ErectorSpinae/BWBirdDog.name: Bird Dog
ErectorSpinae/BWBirdDog.execution: Kneel on mat on all fours with legs and hands slightly apart.

ErectorSpinae/BWBirdDogExBall.name: Bird Dog (on stability ball)
ErectorSpinae/BWBirdDogExBall.preparation: Lay on top of exercise ball with legs and hands slightly apart. Place chest down so torso is wrapped over ball.
ErectorSpinae/BWBirdDogExBall.execution: Raise arm and torso upward beside head while raising leg on opposite side up out behind body. Lower arm, torso, and leg to original position and repeat. Perform movement with opposite arm and leg.
ErectorSpinae/BWBirdDogExBall.comments: Lift leg and arm deliberately with no jerking. Also see

ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionBall.name: Back Extension (on stability ball, arms down)
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionBall.preparation: Lie prone on ball with feet against base of wall. Place arms to sides or clasp hands behind hips or low back.
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionBall.execution: Raise torso off of ball by hyperextending spine. Lower torso onto ball allowing spine to flex. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionBall.comments: If no wall is available, hips can be positioned lower on ball and toes can be positioned out wide on floor for balance. Synergists only work partial range of motion through terminal extension.

ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionBallArmsCr.name: Back Extension (on stability ball, arms crossed)
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionBallArmsCr.preparation: Lie prone on ball, with front of feet apart on floor or with feet against base of wall. Cross arms, hands in front of shoulders.
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionBallArmsCr.execution: Raise torso off of ball by hyperextending spine. Lower torso onto ball allowing spine to flex. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionBallArmsCr.comments: If no wall is available, hips can be positioned lower on ball and toes can be positioned out wide on floor for balance.

ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionBallArmsUp.name: Back Extension (on stability ball, arms up)
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionBallArmsUp.preparation: Lie prone on ball with feet against base of wall. Place arms parallel out over floor beyond head.
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionBallArmsUp.execution: Raise torso off of ball and hands over head by hyperextending spine. Lower torso onto ball allowing spine to flex with arms being lowered toward floor. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionBallArmsUp.comments: If no wall is available, hips can be positioned lower on ball and toes can be positioned out wide on floor for balance. Synergists only work partial range of motion through terminal extension.

ErectorSpinae/BWHangingHyperextension.name: Hanging Hyperextension
ErectorSpinae/BWHangingHyperextension.preparation: Stand behind bar facing elevated platform positioned slightly away on other side of bar. Grasp bar with slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Walk body under bar and position back of heels on elevated platform. With legs extended forward, hang under bar with arms straight and hips bent just above floor.
ErectorSpinae/BWHangingHyperextension.execution: Raise hips up as high as possible by extending hips and spine. Lower hips to original position just above floor. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BWHangingHyperextension.comments: Platform should be high enough to allow hips to flex without buttocks contacting floor. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Adductor Magnus may only assist at initial phase hip extension depending on degree of hip flexion at bottom of movement. Also see

ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionHead.name: Hyperextension (hands on head)
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionHead.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Place hands behind neck or to sides of head.
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionHead.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionHead.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad and full range of motion is permitted; abdomen should not press on side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.

ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionHips.name: Hyperextension (hands behind hips)
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionHips.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Clasp hands behind hips or low back.
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionHips.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionHips.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad and full range of motion is permitted; abdomen should not press on side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.

ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionX.name: Hyperextension (arms crossed)
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionX.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Cross arms on chest.
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionX.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BWHyperextensionX.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad and full range of motion is permitted; abdomen should not press on side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.

ErectorSpinae/BackPlank.name: Rear Bridge
ErectorSpinae/BackPlank.preparation: Sit on mat or floor with legs bent and feet on floor or mat. Place hands back to sides on floor or mat so torso is reclined back slightly.
ErectorSpinae/BackPlank.execution: Raise hips up off floor until hips are straight. Hold position.

ErectorSpinae/CBStiffLegDeadlift.name: Cable Stiff Leg Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/CBStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
ErectorSpinae/CBStiffLegDeadlift.execution: Bow forward by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing low back at bottom. With knees slightly bent, raise torso by extending at waist, then hips, gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/CBStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Lower back may bend slightly during hip flexion phase. Erector Spinae is exercised isometrically if low back does articulate as with

ErectorSpinae/CBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Cable Straight Leg Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/CBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
ErectorSpinae/CBStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, bow forward by bending hips. Bend waist as stirrups approach lowest position. Lift dumbbells by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/CBStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

ErectorSpinae/ContraLateralSuperman.name: Contralateral Superman
ErectorSpinae/ContraLateralSuperman.preparation: Lie prone on mat with legs together and arms extended out on floor approximately parallel.
ErectorSpinae/ContraLateralSuperman.execution: Raise left arm and shoulder and right leg up off floor. Lower arm and shoulder and leg to floor. Repeat by raising and lowering right arm and shoulder and left leg. Repeat by alternating between opposite sides.
ErectorSpinae/ContraLateralSuperman.comments: Lift legs and arms deliberately with no jerking. Also see bilateral movement:

ErectorSpinae/DBOneArmStraightLegDeadlif.name: Dumbbell One Arm Straight Leg Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/DBOneArmStraightLegDeadlif.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or wide stance. Grasp dumbbell to side. Place opposite hand to side or behind low back.
ErectorSpinae/DBOneArmStraightLegDeadlif.execution: With knees straight, lower dumbbell between feet by bending hips and twisting waist, so shoulder of weighted side is turned forward. Allow hips to fall back and waist to bend as dumbbell approaches floor. Lift dumbbell upward and back to side by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulder back if rounded. Repeat. Perform exercise with opposite arm.
ErectorSpinae/DBOneArmStraightLegDeadlif.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

ErectorSpinae/DBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Dumbbell Straight Leg Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/DBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance. Grasp dumbbells to sides.
ErectorSpinae/DBStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower dumbbells to top or sides of feet by bending hips. Allow hips to fall back and bend waist as dumbbell approaches feet. Lift dumbbells by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back if rounded. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/DBStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

ErectorSpinae/LVBackExtension.name: Lever Back Extension
ErectorSpinae/LVBackExtension.preparation: Sit in machine with feet on platform, back under padded lever, and hips against back of seat.
ErectorSpinae/LVBackExtension.execution: Extend lower hips and low back until extended. Return and repeat.

ErectorSpinae/LVBackExtensionMedEx.name: Lever Back Extension
ErectorSpinae/LVBackExtensionMedEx.preparation: Sit on seat and secure seat belt. Place feet on foot platform with knees bent approximately 135°. Position leg braces securely on legs. Release lever and grasp handles to each side. Lean completely forward and position back pad against back.
ErectorSpinae/LVBackExtensionMedEx.execution: Extend spine until hyperextended. Return and repeat.
ErectorSpinae/LVBackExtensionMedEx.comments: Exercise is performed on MedEx isolated lumbar spine apparatus. See

ErectorSpinae/LVBackExtensionN.name: Lever Back Extension
ErectorSpinae/LVBackExtensionN.preparation: Sit on machine with back against padded lever. Push hips back against back of seat by pushing feet against platform. Arch back in "C" shape.
ErectorSpinae/LVBackExtensionN.execution: Extend spine until hyperextended. Return and repeat.
ErectorSpinae/LVBackExtensionN.comments: To avoid hip movement, push hips back into seat by pushing feet into platform throughout exercise. Position foot platform, so small space remains between edge of seat and back of lower thigh. Use seat belt if it becomes difficult to stabilize hips. See

ErectorSpinae/LVDeadlift.name: Lever Deadlift (plate loaded)
ErectorSpinae/LVDeadlift.preparation: Stand in between lever handles. Squat down with feet flat and grasp handles to sides.
ErectorSpinae/LVDeadlift.execution: Lift lever by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.

ErectorSpinae/LVKneelingBackExtension.name: Lever Kneeling Back Extension
ErectorSpinae/LVKneelingBackExtension.preparation: Slide back under lever pad and kneel on lower pad. Grasp handles and position feet on foot bars. Make sure knees are against knee pad and hips are against upper thigh pad.
ErectorSpinae/LVKneelingBackExtension.execution: Extend spine until hyperextended. Return and repeat.
ErectorSpinae/LVKneelingBackExtension.comments: Apparatus shown does not allow for full spinal flexion, only allowing for last half of spinal extension.

ErectorSpinae/LVPullBackExtension.name: Lever Pull Back Extension
ErectorSpinae/LVPullBackExtension.preparation: Sit on machine positioning back of hips against back pad and feet against foot bar with knees bent slightly. Push hips back against back of seat by pushing feet against foot bar. Reach forward and grasp handles with both hands.
ErectorSpinae/LVPullBackExtension.execution: Pull lever back until spine hyperextends while keeping hips pushed back against pad. Return and repeat.
ErectorSpinae/LVPullBackExtension.comments: To avoid hip movement, push hips back into seat by pushing feet into foot bar throughout exercise. Apparatus should be adjusted so knees remain slightly bent when hips are pushed back. See

ErectorSpinae/LVStiffLegDeadlift.name: Lever Stiff Leg Deadlift (plate loaded)
ErectorSpinae/LVStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
ErectorSpinae/LVStiffLegDeadlift.execution: Bow forward by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing low back at bottom. With knees slightly bent, raise torso by extending at waist, then hips, gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/LVStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Lower back may bend slightly during hip flexion phase. Erector Spinae is exercised isometrically if low back does articulate as with

ErectorSpinae/LVStraightLegDeadlift.name: Lever Straight Leg Deadlift (plate loaded)
ErectorSpinae/LVStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
ErectorSpinae/LVStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, bow forward by bending hips. Bend waist as stirrups approach lowest position. Lift lever by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/LVStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

ErectorSpinae/RearDeclinePlank.name: Decline Rear Bridge
ErectorSpinae/RearDeclinePlank.preparation: Lie supine on mat with arms to sides. Place feet flat on floor or mat with knees bent.
ErectorSpinae/RearDeclinePlank.execution: Raise hips up off floor until hips are straight. Hold position.

ErectorSpinae/RearInclinePlank.name: Incline Rear Bridge
ErectorSpinae/RearInclinePlank.preparation: Sit on mat with legs straight and placed together. Place hands back to sides on floor or mat so torso is reclined back slightly.
ErectorSpinae/RearInclinePlank.execution: Raise hips up off floor until hips are straight. Hold position.

ErectorSpinae/SMBentKneeGoodMorning.name: Smith Bent Knee Good-morning
ErectorSpinae/SMBentKneeGoodMorning.preparation: Position bar on back of shoulders. Grasp bar to sides. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
ErectorSpinae/SMBentKneeGoodMorning.execution: Bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.

ErectorSpinae/SMDeadlift.name: Smith Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/SMDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance with feet flat beneath bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider mixed grip or slightly wider. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
ErectorSpinae/SMDeadlift.execution: Squat down to lower bar by bending hips and knees. Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.
ErectorSpinae/SMDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. See

ErectorSpinae/SMStiffLegDeadlift.name: Smith Stiff Leg Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/SMStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on elevated platform with thigh against bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
ErectorSpinae/SMStiffLegDeadlift.execution: With knees slightly bent, Lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips. Keep waist straight, flexing only slightly at bottom. Lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/SMStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion. Erector Spinae is exercised

ErectorSpinae/SMStraightLegDeadlift.name: Smith Straight Leg Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/SMStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on elevated platform with thigh against bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
ErectorSpinae/SMStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips. After hips can no longer flex, bend waist as bar approaches top of feet. Lift bar by extending waist and hip until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/SMStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

ErectorSpinae/STHyperextension.name: Suspended Hyperextension
ErectorSpinae/STHyperextension.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Fold at hips onto heels, allowing rear end to fall far back with arms and shoulders stretched forward.
ErectorSpinae/STHyperextension.execution: Drive hips forward until hips are straight, while keeping arms and shoulders straight. Near top of motion, reach back with arms over head and hyperextend spine. While keeping arms over head, lower body with hips falling back down to starting position and repeat.
ErectorSpinae/STHyperextension.comments: An alternative mount involves stepping back with suspension handles in hands until arms are pulled forward about 45° (give or take) from resting position. At this point, recline body back, then fold at hips, allowing rear end to fall far back with arms and shoulders stretched forward. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright. This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings.

ErectorSpinae/STPullThrough.name: Suspended Pull Through
ErectorSpinae/STPullThrough.preparation: Sit on floor with feet under suspension trainer loops in low position. Reach and grasp bottom of loops and lay back supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles (or ankles through loops as shown). Extend legs out straight. Sit up and place hands on floor to sides at desired distance from suspension trainer. Raise hips from floor, supporting upper body with arms.
ErectorSpinae/STPullThrough.execution: Pull hips back while flexing spine in C shape. Raise hips up high by straightening spine and hips until straight.
ErectorSpinae/STPullThrough.comments: This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer. See

ErectorSpinae/SingleLegDeclineRearBridge.name: Single Leg Decline Rear Bridge
ErectorSpinae/SingleLegDeclineRearBridge.preparation: Lie supine on mat with arms to sides. Place one foot flat on floor or mat with knee bent. Keep other leg straight. Place arms out to sides of body for stability.
ErectorSpinae/SingleLegDeclineRearBridge.execution: While keeping leg straight inline with body, raise hips up off floor until hip of bent leg is straight. Hold position. Change position and repeat hold on opposite side.

ErectorSpinae/Superman.name: Superman
ErectorSpinae/Superman.preparation: Lie prone on mat with legs together and arms extended out on floor approximately parallel.
ErectorSpinae/Superman.execution: Slowly raise upper body and legs off floor. Return upper body and legs to floor and repeat.
ErectorSpinae/Superman.comments: Lift legs and upper body slowly with no jerking or fast movements. Also see

ErectorSpinae/TBDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/TBDeadlift.execution: Stand with feet shoulder width or narrower in trap bar, weight to each side. Squat down with feet flat, low back taut. Grasp handles to sides.

ErectorSpinae/TBStiffLegDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Stiff Leg Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/TBStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand on platform under loaded trap bar. Squat down and grasp handles to sides.

ErectorSpinae/TBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Straight Leg Deadlift
ErectorSpinae/TBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand on platform under loaded trap bar. Squat down and grasp handles to sides.

ErectorSpinae/Wt45BackExtension.name: Weighted 45° Back Extension (on hyperextension apparatus)
ErectorSpinae/Wt45BackExtension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
ErectorSpinae/Wt45BackExtension.execution: Lower body by bending waist until fully flexed. Raise, or extend waist until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/Wt45BackExtension.comments: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

ErectorSpinae/Wt45Hyperextension.name: Weighted 45° Hyperextension
ErectorSpinae/Wt45Hyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
ErectorSpinae/Wt45Hyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/Wt45Hyperextension.comments: If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers:

ErectorSpinae/WtBackExtension.name: Weighted Back Extension (on hyperextension apparatus)
ErectorSpinae/WtBackExtension.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
ErectorSpinae/WtBackExtension.execution: Lower body by bending waist until fully flexed. Raise, or extend waist until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/WtBackExtension.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

ErectorSpinae/WtBallHyperextension.name: Weighted Back Extension (on stability ball)
ErectorSpinae/WtBallHyperextension.preparation: Lie prone on ball. Position toes out wide on floor for balance. Hold weight under chin or behind neck.
ErectorSpinae/WtBallHyperextension.execution: Raise torso off of ball by hyperextending spine. Lower torso onto ball allowing spine to flex. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/WtBallHyperextension.comments: Movement can be made easier by using

ErectorSpinae/WtHyperextension.name: Weighted Hyperextension
ErectorSpinae/WtHyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
ErectorSpinae/WtHyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.
ErectorSpinae/WtHyperextension.comments: If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers:

Gastrocnemius/ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelf.name: Self-assisted Single Leg Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelf.preparation: Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with heels and arches extending off. Place hands on support for assistance. Lift one leg to rear by bending knee.
Gastrocnemius/ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelf.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible, assisting with upper body as little as possible. Lower heel by bending ankle until calf is stretched. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Gastrocnemius/ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelf.comments: Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch. Clip shows use of pulling assistance from high support. If support is lower, assist by

Gastrocnemius/ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelfFo.name: Self-assisted Single Leg Calf Raise (with opposite leg)
Gastrocnemius/ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelfFo.preparation: Position toes and ball of foot on calf block with heels and arches extending off. Place hand or hands on support for balance. Raise one ankle by bending knee forward, keeping forefoot on platform.
Gastrocnemius/ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelfFo.execution: Raise body upward as high as possible by extending lower ankle while straightening knee of assisting leg. Lower heel by bending ankle while bending knee of assisting leg forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg positioning.
Gastrocnemius/ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelfFo.comments: Keep knee of exercised leg straight throughout exercise. On assisting leg, keep ankle high and only assist minimal, just enough to raise body in a steady motion. See

Gastrocnemius/BBStandingCalfRaise.name: Barbell Standing Leg Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/BBStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Set barbell on power rack upper chest height with calf block under barbell. Position back of shoulders under barbell with both hands to sides. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Lean barbell against rack and raise from supports by extending knees and hips. Support barbell against verticals with both hands to sides.
Gastrocnemius/BBStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/BBStandingCalfRaise.comments: Notice barbell makes contact with only non-painted surface (plastic or metal surface). Exercise step that will not overturn can be used as calf block. Position rack just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/BWSingleLegForwardAngledCa.name: Single Leg Forward Angled Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/BWSingleLegForwardAngledCa.preparation: Stand facing mid-thigh to hip high vertical bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Step back so body is angled forward with body straight and arms extended approximately perpendicular to body. Feet should be pointed forward. Lift one leg to rear by bending knee.
Gastrocnemius/BWSingleLegForwardAngledCa.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. Allow body to travel forward and upward in same direction as body is orientated. Lower heel allowing foot to come back down flat on floor. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Gastrocnemius/BWSingleLegForwardAngledCa.comments: Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch.

Gastrocnemius/BWSingleLegCalfRaise.name: Single Leg Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/BWSingleLegCalfRaise.preparation: Position toes and balls of feet on calf block or elevation with heels and arches extending off. Place hand or hands on support for balance. Lift one leg to rear by bending knee.
Gastrocnemius/BWSingleLegCalfRaise.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. Lower heel by bending ankle until calf is stretched. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
