Gastrocnemius/BWSingleLegCalfRaise.comments: Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/BWStandingCalfRaise.name: Standing Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/BWStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Place hand on support for balance.
Gastrocnemius/BWStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/BWStandingCalfRaise.comments: Exercise step that will not overturn can be used as calf block. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/CBOneArmSingleLegCalfRaise.name: Cable One Arm Single Leg Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/CBOneArmSingleLegCalfRaise.preparation: Stand facing low pulley with platform on floor. Bend over and grasp stirrup attachment with one hand. Stand on edge of platform and grasp support bar for balance. Position toes and balls of feet on platform with arches and heels extending off. Lift one leg up off of floor.
Gastrocnemius/CBOneArmSingleLegCalfRaise.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. Lower heel by bending ankle until calf is stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/CBOneArmSingleLegCalfRaise.comments: Calf block or exercise step that will not overturn can be used as platform. Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/CBSingleLegCalfRaise.name: Cable Single Leg Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/CBSingleLegCalfRaise.preparation: Kneel before low pulley and attach cable belt or dip belt to cable. Stand on edge of platform and grasp support bar for balance. Position toes and balls of feet on platform with arches and heels extending off. Lift one leg up off of floor.
Gastrocnemius/CBSingleLegCalfRaise.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. Lower heel by bending ankle until calf is stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/CBSingleLegCalfRaise.comments: A short chain may be used to add length to cable so belt can be more easily attached to cable as long as it is short enough to allow full range of motion. Calf block or exercise step that will not overturn can be used as platform. A short chain may be used, so belt can be more easily attached to cable as long as it is short enough to allow full range of motion. Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/CBStandingCalfRaise.name: Cable Standing Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/CBStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Place cable belt or dip belt around waist. Kneel before low pulley and attach belt to cable. Stand on calf block and grasp support bar for balance. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off.
Gastrocnemius/CBStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/CBStandingCalfRaise.comments: Chain may be used to add length to cable so belt can be more easily attached to cable as long as it is short enough to allow full range of motion. Exercise step that will not overturn can be used as calf block. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch.   See

Gastrocnemius/DBSingleLegCalfRaise.name: Dumbbell Single Leg Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/DBSingleLegCalfRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbell in one hand to side. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Place hand on support for balance. Lift other leg to rear by bending knee.
Gastrocnemius/DBSingleLegCalfRaise.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. Lower heel by bending ankle until calf is stretched. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Gastrocnemius/DBSingleLegCalfRaise.comments: Exercise step that will not overturn can be used as calf block. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch. Use lighter load if you need to assist with hands used for support or

Gastrocnemius/DBStandingCalfRaise.name: Dumbbell Standing Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/DBStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbell in one hand to side. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Place hand on support for balance.
Gastrocnemius/DBStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/DBStandingCalfRaise.comments: Exercise step that will not overturn can be used as calf block. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. If holding heavy dumbbell becomes too difficult, try

Gastrocnemius/LV45CalfPress.name: Lever 45° Calf Press (plate loaded)
Gastrocnemius/LV45CalfPress.preparation: Sit on seat with back on padded support. Place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and extend hips and knees. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
Gastrocnemius/LV45CalfPress.execution: Push platform by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LV45CalfPress.comments: Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/LV45CalfRaise.name: Lever 45° Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/LV45CalfRaise.preparation: Sit on machine with low back against padding and grasp handles to sides. Position toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform or foot bar with arches and heels extending off. Straighten knees.
Gastrocnemius/LV45CalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LV45CalfRaise.comments: When finished, place feet back on platform, engage dock lever (if it automatically disengaged), and lower seat to original position. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/LV45CalfRaisePL.name: Lever 45° Calf Raise (plate loaded)
Gastrocnemius/LV45CalfRaisePL.preparation: Sit on machine with low back against padding and grasp handles to sides. Place feet high on platform and straighten knees. Position toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with arches and heels extending off.
Gastrocnemius/LV45CalfRaisePL.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LV45CalfRaisePL.comments: When finished, place feet back on platform, engage dock lever (if it automatically disengaged), and lower seat to original position. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch.   See

Gastrocnemius/LVAlternatingSeatedCalfExt.name: Lever Alternating Calf Extension
Gastrocnemius/LVAlternatingSeatedCalfExt.preparation: Sit on seat and position forefeet on pedals. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
Gastrocnemius/LVAlternatingSeatedCalfExt.execution: Push left pedal by extending ankle as far as possible while allowing right pedal to return back until calf is stretched. Reverse motion by pushing right pedal and allowing left pedal to return back. Continue to alternate motion.
Gastrocnemius/LVAlternatingSeatedCalfExt.comments: Position seat to allow full range of motion. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch.

Gastrocnemius/LVDonkeyCalfRaise.name: Lever Donkey Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/LVDonkeyCalfRaise.preparation: Position lower back and hips under padded lever. Place forearms on supports. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Straighten knees.
Gastrocnemius/LVDonkeyCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LVDonkeyCalfRaise.comments: Position lever just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/LVDonkeyCalfRaisePL.name: Lever Donkey Calf Raise (plate loaded)
Gastrocnemius/LVDonkeyCalfRaisePL.preparation: Position lower back and hips under padded lever. Place forearms on supports. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Straighten knees.
Gastrocnemius/LVDonkeyCalfRaisePL.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LVDonkeyCalfRaisePL.comments: Position lever just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/LVForwardAngledCalfRaise.name: Lever Forward Angled Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/LVForwardAngledCalfRaise.preparation: Place shoulders under padded lever. Position toes and balls of feet on top of calf block with arches and heels extending off. Grasp handles or sides of padded lever. Stand erect by extending hips and knees.
Gastrocnemius/LVForwardAngledCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LVForwardAngledCalfRaise.comments: If possible, position lever just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfExtension.name: Lever Calf Extension
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfExtension.preparation: Sit on seat and position forefeet on horizontal foot bar. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfExtension.execution: Push lever by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfExtension.comments: Position seat to allow full range of motion. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch (as shown).

Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfExtensionBi.name: Lever Calf Extension (bilateral)
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfExtensionBi.preparation: Sit on seat and position forefeet on lever platform or foot pedals. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfExtensionBi.execution: Push lever by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfExtensionBi.comments: Position seat to allow full range of motion. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch (as shown).

Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfExtensionHamme.name: Lever Calf Extension (plate loaded)
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfExtensionHamme.preparation: Sit on seat and position forefeet on lever platform. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfExtensionHamme.execution: Push lever by extending ankle as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfExtensionHamme.comments: Position seat to allow full range of motion. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Also known as Rotary Calf Extension. See

Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfPress.name: Lever Seated Calf Press
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfPress.preparation: Place seat away from platform. Sit on seat with lower back against back of seat. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfPress.execution: Push lever by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfPress.comments: Position seat back yet not so far that weight bottoms out (weight stack hits bottom) during stretch. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfPressH.name: Lever Seated Calf Press (plate loaded)
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfPressH.preparation: Place seat away from platform. Sit on seat with lower back against back of seat. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform(s) with heels and arches extending off. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfPressH.execution: Push lever platform(s) by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LVSeatedCalfPressH.comments: Position seat back yet not so far that lever bottoms out during stretch. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/LVStandingCalfRaise.name: Lever Standing Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/LVStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Place shoulders under padded lever. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Grasp handles or sides of padded lever. Stand erect by extending hips and knees.
Gastrocnemius/LVStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LVStandingCalfRaise.comments: If possible, position lever just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/LVStandingCalfRaiseBelt.name: Lever Standing Calf Raise (belt loaded)
Gastrocnemius/LVStandingCalfRaiseBelt.preparation: Place lever belt or dip belt around waist. Kneel before lever and attach belt. Stand on calf block and grasp support bar for balance. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off.
Gastrocnemius/LVStandingCalfRaiseBelt.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LVStandingCalfRaiseBelt.comments: Chain with attachment can be preattached to lever so belt can be more easily attached as long as it is short enough to allow full range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch.   See

Gastrocnemius/LVVCalfRaiseH.name: Lever Calf Raise (on v-squat machine, plate loaded)
Gastrocnemius/LVVCalfRaiseH.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet on platform shoulder width apart. Extend hips and knees. Position toes and balls of feet on nearest edge of platform with arches and heels extending off.
Gastrocnemius/LVVCalfRaiseH.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LVVCalfRaiseH.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/LVStandingCalfRaisePL.name: Lever Standing Calf Raise (plate loaded)
Gastrocnemius/LVStandingCalfRaisePL.preparation: Place shoulders under padded lever. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Grasp handles or sides of padded lever. Stand erect by extending hips and knees.
Gastrocnemius/LVStandingCalfRaisePL.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/LVStandingCalfRaisePL.comments: If available, position lever or chain just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/SBStandingCalfRaise.name: Safety Barbell Standing Leg Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/SBStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Stand facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height and calf block on floor just below. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Place hands on bar to each sides or on vertical rack bars. Position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. Dismount bar from rack by standing erect with safety bar, away yet close to rack.
Gastrocnemius/SBStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SBStandingCalfRaise.comments: Position rack just below lowest range of motion. Calf block should be positioned so safety bar is close to but does not make contact with rack. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/SL45AlternatingCalfPress.name: Sled 45° Alternating Calf Press
Gastrocnemius/SL45AlternatingCalfPress.preparation: Sit on seat with back on padded support. Grasp handles to sides. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
Gastrocnemius/SL45AlternatingCalfPress.execution: Push sled by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SL45AlternatingCalfPress.comments: Lower weight back into starting position if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Exercise can also be performed with

Gastrocnemius/SL45CalfPress.name: Sled 45° Calf Press
Gastrocnemius/SL45CalfPress.preparation: Sit on seat with back on padded support. Place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and extend hips and knees. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
Gastrocnemius/SL45CalfPress.execution: Push sled by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SL45CalfPress.comments: Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Movement can also be performed on

Gastrocnemius/SL45CalfRaise.name: Sled 45° Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/SL45CalfRaise.preparation: Sit on machine with lower back against padding and grasp handles to sides. Position toes and balls of feet on foot platform with arches and heels extending off. Straighten knees.
Gastrocnemius/SL45CalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SL45CalfRaise.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Also known as Sled Donkey Calf Raise. See

Gastrocnemius/SLForwardAngledCalfRaise.name: Sled Forward Angled Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/SLForwardAngledCalfRaise.preparation: Lie forward so chest is on pad and shoulders are under padded bars. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Grasp handles or sides of padded bars. Stand erect by extending hips and knees. Release lever if available.
Gastrocnemius/SLForwardAngledCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SLForwardAngledCalfRaise.comments: Sled can be positioned just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/SL45CalfPressPL.name: Sled 45° Calf Raise (plate loaded)
Gastrocnemius/SL45CalfPressPL.preparation: Sit on machine with lower back against padding and grasp handles to sides. Position toes and balls of feet on foot of platform with arches and heels extending off. Straighten knees.
Gastrocnemius/SL45CalfPressPL.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SL45CalfPressPL.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Also known as Sled Donkey Calf Raise. See

Gastrocnemius/SLDonkeyCalfRaise.name: Sled Donkey Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/SLDonkeyCalfRaise.preparation: Position lower back and hips under upper pad. Place forearms on supports. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Straighten knees.
Gastrocnemius/SLDonkeyCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SLDonkeyCalfRaise.comments: Position upper pad just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/SLHackCalfPress.name: Sled Hack Calf Press
Gastrocnemius/SLHackCalfPress.preparation: Lie supine on sled with shoulders against pad and place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
Gastrocnemius/SLHackCalfPress.execution: Push sled up away from platform by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SLHackCalfPress.comments: Not all Hack Squat machines have platform with opened lower end allowing for this movement, but some platforms may accommodate calf block, see

Gastrocnemius/SLLyingCalfPress.name: Sled Lying Calf Press
Gastrocnemius/SLLyingCalfPress.preparation: Position sled away from platform. Lie supine on sled with shoulders against pad and place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
Gastrocnemius/SLLyingCalfPress.execution: Push sled away from platform by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SLLyingCalfPress.comments: Position sled back yet not so far that weight bottoms out during stretch. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/SLLyingCalfPressPL.name: Sled Lying Calf Press (plate loaded)
Gastrocnemius/SLLyingCalfPressPL.preparation: Position sled away from platform. Lie supine on sled with shoulders against pad and place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
Gastrocnemius/SLLyingCalfPressPL.execution: Push sled away from platform by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SLLyingCalfPressPL.comments: If sled bottoms out on dock lever, disengage it to allow full range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/SLSeatedCalfPress.name: Sled Seated Calf Press
Gastrocnemius/SLSeatedCalfPress.preparation: Place seat away from platform. Sit on seat and place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and extend hips and knees. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
Gastrocnemius/SLSeatedCalfPress.execution: Push sled by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SLSeatedCalfPress.comments: Position seat back yet not so far that weight bottoms out during stretch. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/SLSeatedCalfPressLyingLP.name: Sled Seated Calf Press (on lying leg press)
Gastrocnemius/SLSeatedCalfPressLyingLP.preparation: Place sled away from platform. Lean firm pad upright against what would normally be shoulder pads. Sit on sled with back and hips against added pad and hands on sides of sled. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off. Extend hips and knees so legs are straight.
Gastrocnemius/SLSeatedCalfPressLyingLP.execution: Push sled by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SLSeatedCalfPressLyingLP.comments: Position sled back yet not so far that weight bottoms out during stretch. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/SLStandingCalfRaise.name: Sled Standing Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/SLStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Place shoulders under padded bars. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Grasp handles or sides of padded bars. Stand erect by extending hips and knees.
Gastrocnemius/SLStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SLStandingCalfRaise.comments: Position sled just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Also see exercise on

Gastrocnemius/SLVerticalCalfPress.name: Sled Vertical Calf Press
Gastrocnemius/SLVerticalCalfPress.preparation: Lie on back pad. Place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and extend hips and knees. Place toes and balls of feet on platform with heels and arches extending off.
Gastrocnemius/SLVerticalCalfPress.execution: Push sled by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SLVerticalCalfPress.comments: Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

Gastrocnemius/SMDonkeyCalfRaise.name: Smith Donkey Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/SMDonkeyCalfRaise.preparation: Engage both safety stops mid height so bar will be just above in lowest range of motion. Place calf block under bar. Position padded surface of tall bench or
Gastrocnemius/SMDonkeyCalfRaise.execution: in front of smith machine for arm rest. Place stiffly padded board within arms reach. Step on calf block while standing between smith bar and arm rest. Situate padded board on back of hips while bending under smith bar. Arrange smith bar above upper hips or lower waist with padded board in between. Place forearms on supports. Lift bar off of safety stops by straighten knees. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off.
Gastrocnemius/SMDonkeyCalfRaise.comments: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.

Gastrocnemius/SMStandingCalfRaise.name: Smith Standing Leg Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/SMStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Position bar on upper chest height and place calf block under bar. Position back of shoulders under bar and grasp bar to sides. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Disengage bar by rotating bar back. Stand erect by extending knees and hips.
Gastrocnemius/SMStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SMStandingCalfRaise.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Also see alternative form:

Gastrocnemius/STSingleLegForwardAngledCa.name: Suspended Single Leg Forward Angled Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/STSingleLegForwardAngledCa.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. Allow body to travel forward and upward in same direction as body is orientated. Lower heel allowing foot to come back down flat on floor. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Gastrocnemius/STSingleLegForwardAngledCa.comments: Keep knee of supporting leg straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch.

Gastrocnemius/SVSingleLeg45CalfPress.name: Sled Single Leg 45° Calf Press
Gastrocnemius/SVSingleLeg45CalfPress.preparation: Sit on seat with back on padded support. Place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and extend hips and knees. With one foot, place toes and ball of foot on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off. Position other foot on floor within machine.
Gastrocnemius/SVSingleLeg45CalfPress.execution: Push sled by extending ankle as far as possible. Return by bending ankle until calf is stretched. Repeat.
Gastrocnemius/SVSingleLeg45CalfPress.comments: Reposition stance if foot slips by first securing platform with foot of resting leg. Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knee bends slightly during stretch. Movement can also be performed on

Gastrocnemius/WTDonkeyCalfRaise.name: Weighted Donkey Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/WTDonkeyCalfRaise.preparation: Stand on edge of platform, toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Bend over and grasp knee high bar (as shown) or place forearms on thigh high surface (see
Gastrocnemius/WTDonkeyCalfRaise.execution: ). Allow training partner to mount hips or lower back from bench.
Gastrocnemius/WTDonkeyCalfRaise.comments: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.

Gastrocnemius/WTSingleLegCalfRaise.name: Weighted Single Leg Calf Raise
Gastrocnemius/WTSingleLegCalfRaise.preparation: Hang weight from dip belt around waist. Position toes and ball of foot on calf block end of platform with heel and arch extending off. Place hand or hands on support for balance. Lift other leg to rear by bending knee.
Gastrocnemius/WTSingleLegCalfRaise.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. Lower heel by bending ankle until calf is stretched. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Gastrocnemius/WTSingleLegCalfRaise.comments: Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch. Use lighter load if you need to assist with hands used for support. See

GluteusMaximus/ASSquatSelf.name: Self-assisted Squat
GluteusMaximus/ASSquatSelf.preparation: Stand in front of horizontal bar positioned at height of upper abdomen to lower chest.  Place hands on horizontal bar with arms extended forward.
GluteusMaximus/ASSquatSelf.execution: While holding onto horizontal bar, squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Stand up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return to standing position and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/ASSquatSelf.comments: Exercise can also be performed by placing hands on sturdy piece of furniture or railing. If assistance is needed, push down onto horizontal bar or furniture. Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface. Apply equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/ASSingleLegSquatSelfPole.name: Self-assisted Single Leg Reclining Squat (pole)
GluteusMaximus/ASSingleLegSquatSelfPole.preparation: Stand with feet behind vertical pole. Grasp pole with both hands, waist to hip height. Balance on one leg with opposite leg raised up off of floor to side of pole.
GluteusMaximus/ASSingleLegSquatSelfPole.execution: Squat down while keeping leg elevated off of floor. With arms slightly flexed, lean back slightly while only allowing knee to travel slightly forward. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as supporting foot. Descend to lowest position. Raise body back up to original position while keeping knee behind bar and arms slightly flexed until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/ASSingleLegSquatSelfPole.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement, yet only extend forward slightly. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

GluteusMaximus/ASSquatSelfST.name: Self-assisted Squat (on suspension trainer)
GluteusMaximus/ASSquatSelfST.preparation: Stand in front of suspension trainer handles positioned at height of upper abdomen to lower chest.  Grasp suspension trainer handles with arms extended forward.
GluteusMaximus/ASSquatSelfST.execution: While holding onto suspension trainer handles, squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Stand up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return to standing position and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/ASSquatSelfST.comments: Exercise can also be performed by placing hands on sturdy piece of furniture or

GluteusMaximus/ASStepDownSelf.name: Self-assisted Step-down
GluteusMaximus/ASStepDownSelf.preparation: Stand with one foot on bench or elevated surface. Position foot on elevated surface to side and forward of straight knee.
GluteusMaximus/ASStepDownSelf.execution: Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning foot off of bench to floor and repeat. Continue with opposite position.
GluteusMaximus/ASStepDownSelf.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Knee of exercised leg should point same direction as foot. Exercise can also be performed by placing travelling foot onto and off of bench next to foot of exercised leg (See

GluteusMaximus/AsSingleLegSquatLegSelf.name: Self-assisted Single Leg Squat (leg wrapped)
GluteusMaximus/AsSingleLegSquatLegSelf.preparation: Stand with hand on hip height elevated surface or other tall, sturdy structure for support. Stand on one leg by wrapping leg around back of supporting leg so top of lifted foot is on outside of supporting leg's ankle.
GluteusMaximus/AsSingleLegSquatLegSelf.execution: Squat down by bending knee forward and hip back behind. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Descend until thigh is just past parallel to floor. Return to standing position with minimal assistance from wrapped leg. Stand to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg are straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/AsSingleLegSquatLegSelf.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement.

GluteusMaximus/BBBlockPull.name: Barbell Block Pull
GluteusMaximus/BBBlockPull.preparation: With barbell on blocks, position feet shoulder width or slightly narrower beneath bar. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
GluteusMaximus/BBBlockPull.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBBlockPull.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip.

GluteusMaximus/BBBentKneeGoodMorning.name: Barbell Bent Knee Good-morning
GluteusMaximus/BBBentKneeGoodMorning.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
GluteusMaximus/BBBentKneeGoodMorning.execution: Keeping back straight, bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBBentKneeGoodMorning.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

GluteusMaximus/AsSingleLegSquatSelf.name: Self-assisted Single Leg Squat (bar)
GluteusMaximus/AsSingleLegSquatSelf.preparation: Stand behind horizontal bar, lower chest to waist height. Place finger tips or inside base of thumbs on bar, hold with just enough contact for balance and self-assistance. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
GluteusMaximus/AsSingleLegSquatSelf.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as supporting foot. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/AsSingleLegSquatSelf.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

GluteusMaximus/BBBoxSquat.name: Barbell Box Squat
GluteusMaximus/BBBoxSquat.preparation: From rack with barbell at upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders. Grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and back up until contact is made with box immediately behind. Stand with wide stance with feet flared out slightly.
GluteusMaximus/BBBoxSquat.execution: Sit back onto box by bending hips back while bending knees, keeping shins nearly perpendicular or knees slightly behind ankles. Lower rear end back onto box in controlled manner. Rock torso back slightly. Once torso rocks forward, immediately stand back up rapidly by driving hips upward, keeping knees above ankles and chest high until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBBoxSquat.comments: Try to keep knees from traveling forward while reaching rear end back onto squat box. Ideally, knees could be behind ankles. In this position, greater stretch reflex can be created through hips (via

GluteusMaximus/BBDeadlift.name: Barbell Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/BBDeadlift.preparation: With feet flat beneath bar squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
GluteusMaximus/BBDeadlift.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weights to floor by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip.

GluteusMaximus/BBDeficitDeadlift.name: Barbell Deficit Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/BBDeficitDeadlift.preparation: Stand on weight plate or shallow elevated platform with loaded bar above feet. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
GluteusMaximus/BBDeficitDeadlift.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weights to floor by bending hips back, while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBDeficitDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances.

GluteusMaximus/BBFrontSquat.name: Barbell Front Squat
GluteusMaximus/BBFrontSquat.preparation: From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar in front of shoulders. Cross arms and place hands on top of barbell with upper arms parallel to floor. Dismount bar from rack.
GluteusMaximus/BBFrontSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBFrontSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/BBHackSquat.name: Barbell Hack Squat
GluteusMaximus/BBHackSquat.preparation: Position barbell just behind legs. With feet flat on floor, squat down and grasp barbell from behind with overhand grip.
GluteusMaximus/BBHackSquat.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Squat down by bending knees forward while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are close to parallel to floor and bar is behind lower leg. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBHackSquat.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/BBHipThrust.name: Barbell Hip Thrust
GluteusMaximus/BBHipThrust.preparation: Sit on floor with long side of bench behind back. Roll barbell back and center over hips. Position upper back on corner of bench. Place feet on floor approximately shoulder width with knees bent. Grasp bar to each side.
GluteusMaximus/BBHipThrust.execution: Raise bar upward by extending hips until straight. Lower and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBHipThrust.comments: Use bench of lower height 16" to 18" (40 to 46 cm) allowing torso to be angled approximately 45º. Bench may need to be secured so it does not slide on floor.

GluteusMaximus/BBFullSquat.name: Barbell Full Squat
GluteusMaximus/BBFullSquat.preparation: From rack with barbell upper chest height, position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Dismount bar from rack.
GluteusMaximus/BBFullSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until knees and hips are fully bent. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBFullSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement.

GluteusMaximus/BBLateralStepUp.name: Barbell Lateral Step-up
GluteusMaximus/BBLateralStepUp.preparation: Stand between two benches, one to each side. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides.
GluteusMaximus/BBLateralStepUp.execution: Lift leg and place foot on bench to side and forward of straight knee. Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning feet to original position. Repeat with opposite leg, alternating between legs.
GluteusMaximus/BBLateralStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Stepping knee should point same direction as foot. A modest degree of

GluteusMaximus/BBLunge.name: Barbell Lunge
GluteusMaximus/BBLunge.preparation: bar from floor or dismount bar from rack. From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides.
GluteusMaximus/BBLunge.execution: Lunge forward with first leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/BBRackPull.name: Barbell Rack Pull
GluteusMaximus/BBRackPull.preparation: In power rack, with barbell on safety bar in low position, place feet shoulder width or slightly narrower beneath bar. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
GluteusMaximus/BBRackPull.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBRackPull.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip.

GluteusMaximus/BBRearLunge.name: Barbell Rear Lunge
GluteusMaximus/BBRearLunge.preparation: From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack.
GluteusMaximus/BBRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

GluteusMaximus/BBSeatedGoodMorning.name: Barbell Seated Good-morning
GluteusMaximus/BBSeatedGoodMorning.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Sit on end of bench or corner of box secured to floor. Position feet apart on floor with knees slightly bent.
GluteusMaximus/BBSeatedGoodMorning.execution: Keeping back straight, bend torso forward as low as possible by bending hips. Raise torso until torso is upright. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBSeatedGoodMorning.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

GluteusMaximus/BBSideSplitSquat.name: Barbell Side Split Squat
GluteusMaximus/BBSideSplitSquat.preparation: Place bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell on each side. Stand with feet wide apart; foot of lead leg angled out to side.
GluteusMaximus/BBSideSplitSquat.execution: Lower body toward side of angled foot by bending knee and hip of lead leg while keeping opposite leg only slightly bent. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of lead leg. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBSideSplitSquat.comments: Keep torso upright and knee of lead leg pointed same direction of foot. Flexible

GluteusMaximus/BBSideLunge.name: Barbell Side Lunge
GluteusMaximus/BBSideLunge.preparation: bar from floor or dismount bar from rack. From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides.
GluteusMaximus/BBSideLunge.execution: Lunge to one side with first leg. Land on heel, then on forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of lead leg, keeping knee pointed same direction of foot. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of lead leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/BBSideLunge.comments: Keep torso upright during lunge. Flexible

GluteusMaximus/BBSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Barbell Single Leg Split Squat
GluteusMaximus/BBSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Stand facing away from bench. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Extend leg back and place top of foot on bench.
GluteusMaximus/BBSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/BBSingleLegSquat.name: Barbell Single Leg Squat
GluteusMaximus/BBSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand with arms extended out in front holding barbell. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
GluteusMaximus/BBSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep   supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/BBSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

GluteusMaximus/BBSingleLegStiffLegDeadli.name: Barbell Single Leg Stiff-leg Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/BBSingleLegStiffLegDeadli.preparation: Hold barbell down in front, arms straight with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Stand with feet together. Lift leg slightly so foot is just off floor.
GluteusMaximus/BBSingleLegStiffLegDeadli.execution: Lower bar to floor while raising lifted leg back behind. Keep back straight and knee of supporting leg slightly bent. Keep hip and knee of lifted leg extended throughout movement. Once stretch is felt or barbell contacts floor, return to original position by raising torso while lowering lifted leg. Straighten knee of supporting leg as torso becomes upright. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBSingleLegStiffLegDeadli.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms and back straight. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Those with

GluteusMaximus/BBSplitSquat.name: Barbell Split Squat
GluteusMaximus/BBSplitSquat.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Stand with feet far apart; one foot forward and other foot behind.
GluteusMaximus/BBSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/BBSplitSquat.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement. Keep torso upright during squat;

GluteusMaximus/BBSquat.name: Barbell Squat (low bar)
GluteusMaximus/BBSquat.preparation: From rack with barbell at upper chest height, position bar low on back of shoulders. Grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and stand with wide stance.
GluteusMaximus/BBSquat.comments: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend hips and knees until legs are straight. Return and repeat.

GluteusMaximus/BBStepUp.name: Barbell Step-up
GluteusMaximus/BBStepUp.preparation: Stand facing side of bench. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides.
GluteusMaximus/BBStepUp.execution: Place foot of first leg on bench. Stand on bench by extending hip and knee of first leg and place foot of second leg on bench. Step down with second leg by flexing hip and knee of first leg. Return to original standing position by placing foot of first leg to floor. Repeat first step with opposite leg alternating first steps between legs.
GluteusMaximus/BBStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Forward knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Stepping distance from bench emphasizes Gluteus Maximus; stepping close to bench emphasizes Quadriceps.

GluteusMaximus/BBSquatChains.name: Barbell Squat (with chains)
GluteusMaximus/BBSquatChains.preparation: Stand facing barbell, racked upper chest height, with thick chains hanging to floor on each side. Position bar low on back of shoulders. Grasp barbell to sides and position elbows back. Dismount bar from rack and stand with wide stance.
GluteusMaximus/BBSquatChains.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend hips and knees until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBSquatChains.comments: Chains provide increasing resistance as barbell moves away from floor. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/BBStiffLegDeadlift.name: Barbell Stiff Leg Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/BBStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on 5" to 8" (13-20 cm) platform with feet flat beneath bar. Bend over and grasp barbell with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
GluteusMaximus/BBStiffLegDeadlift.execution: With knees bent, lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Lower bar to top of feet by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing only slightly at bottom. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift keep arms and back straight. Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion. Quadriceps can be kept bent throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/BBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.name: Barbell Straight-back Stiff-leg Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/BBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.execution: from floor with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip. Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance.
GluteusMaximus/BBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.comments: With back straight, lower bar to top of feet by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight. Place weight onto floor. With knees still bent, lift bar by straightening hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.

GluteusMaximus/BBSumoBlockPull.name: Barbell Sumo Block Pull
GluteusMaximus/BBSumoBlockPull.preparation: With barbell on blocks, position feet under bar with very wide stance. Squat down and grasp bar between legs with shoulder width mixed grip. Face forward while positioning shoulders upward with arms straight, chest high, hips low, and back straight.
GluteusMaximus/BBSumoBlockPull.execution: Pull bar up by driving feet outward while pulling chest up. Extend knees when bar passes knees. At top of lift, when torso is upright, drive shoulders back and chest up. Return weight to blocks by bending hips back and knees pointed outward, while keeping chest high and back straight. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBSumoBlockPull.comments: Use shoulder width grip, since narrower than shoulder width grip will make it more difficult to lockout at top. Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight, and knees pointed out same direction as feet. Also, keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. With wide stance, push feet out to sides and not down to prevent knees from buckling inward. Pushing knees out will allow hips to travel toward bar more quickly while improving lev   erage.

GluteusMaximus/BBSumoDeadlift.name: Barbell Sumo Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/BBSumoDeadlift.preparation: Position feet under bar with very wide stance. Squat down and grasp bar between legs with shoulder width mixed grip. Face forward while positioning shoulders upward with arms straight, chest high, hips low, and back straight.
GluteusMaximus/BBSumoDeadlift.execution: Pull bar up by driving feet outward, while pulling chest up. Extend knees when bar passes knees. At top of lift, when torso is upright, drive shoulders back and chest up. Return weight to floor by bending hips back and knees pointed outward, while keeping chest high and back straight. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBSumoDeadlift.comments: Use shoulder width grip since narrower than shoulder width grip will make it more difficult to lockout at top. Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight, and knees pointed out same direction as feet. Also, keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. With wide stance, push feet out to sides and not down to prevent knees from buckling inward. Pushing knees out will allow hips to travel toward bar more quickly while improving leverage.

GluteusMaximus/BBZercherSquat.name: Barbell Zercher Squat
GluteusMaximus/BBZercherSquat.preparation: From rack with barbell upper waist height position, forearms under bar and in front of bar with elbows shoulder width apart. Cross wrists and pull bar in, close against body. Lift barbell from rack. Step back with wide stance, feet pointing out 20-30°.
GluteusMaximus/BBZercherSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight, hands close to body, and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are near parallel. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BBZercherSquat.comments: Turning knuckles up places bar more on

GluteusMaximus/BBWalkingLunge.name: Barbell Walking Lunge
GluteusMaximus/BBWalkingLunge.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
GluteusMaximus/BBWalkingLunge.execution: Step forward with first leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Stand on forward leg with assistance of rear leg. Lunge forward with opposite leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite legs.

GluteusMaximus/BWAlternatingStepDown.name: Alternating Step-down
GluteusMaximus/BWAlternatingStepDown.preparation: Stand on bench or narrow platform, with feet side by side.
GluteusMaximus/BWAlternatingStepDown.execution: Step down with first foot to side of elevated surface onto floor. Stand back up on elevated surface by straightening upper leg and pushing body upward. Place foot to original position next to opposite foot. Step down and back up with opposite leg in same manner. Repeat by alternating between sides.
GluteusMaximus/BWAlternatingStepDown.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Stepping knee should point same direction as foot. A modest degree of

GluteusMaximus/BWHalfSquat.name: Half Squat
GluteusMaximus/BWHalfSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend to height which allows prescribed number of reps at suggested intensity, short of thighs descending just past parallel to floor. Stand up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return to standing position and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BWHalfSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface. Apply equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Arms positioned forward allow torso to be positioned more upright. See

GluteusMaximus/BWLateralStepUp.name: Lateral Step-up
GluteusMaximus/BWLateralStepUp.preparation: Stand between two benches, one to each side.
GluteusMaximus/BWLateralStepUp.execution: Lift leg and place foot on bench to side and forward of straight knee. Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning feet to original position. Repeat with opposite leg, alternating between legs.
GluteusMaximus/BWLateralStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Stepping knee should point same direction as foot. A modest degree of

GluteusMaximus/BWLunge.name: Lunge
GluteusMaximus/BWLunge.preparation: Stand with hands on hips or in front of body.
GluteusMaximus/BWLunge.execution: Lunge forward with first leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/BWLunge.comments: Weighted versions of this exercise would normally be considered auxiliary in context of other basic exercises (ie: Barbell Squat, Sled Leg Press). However, in the context of 'body weight' only program, this exercise can be considered basic.

GluteusMaximus/BWLyingHipExtension.name: Single Leg Hip Bridge
GluteusMaximus/BWLyingHipExtension.preparation: Lie on floor or mat. Place one leg straight and bend the other leg with foot flat on floor or mat. Place arms down on mat to each side of hips.
GluteusMaximus/BWLyingHipExtension.execution: Raise body by extending hip of bent leg, keeping extended leg and hip straight. Return to original position by lowering body with extended leg and hip straight. Repeat and continue with opposite sides.

GluteusMaximus/BWRearLunge.name: Rear Lunge
GluteusMaximus/BWRearLunge.preparation: Stand with hands on hips or in front of body.
GluteusMaximus/BWRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

GluteusMaximus/BWReverseHyperextension.name: Reverse Hyper-extension
GluteusMaximus/BWReverseHyperextension.preparation: Lay torso and waist on bench and grasp handles. Feet should be above floor with legs straight.
GluteusMaximus/BWReverseHyperextension.execution: Raise legs by extending hips as high as possible until legs are nearly straight. Lower legs to original position. Repeat.

GluteusMaximus/BWReverseHyperextensionBa.name: Reverse Hyper-extension (on stability ball)
GluteusMaximus/BWReverseHyperextensionBa.preparation: Lay prone with waist on stability ball. Grasp secure anchor or bar near floor. Feet should be above floor with legs straight.
GluteusMaximus/BWReverseHyperextensionBa.execution: Holding firmly on anchor, extend legs upward by lifting and straightening leg as high as possible. Lower legs to original position with thighs close to stability ball. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BWReverseHyperextensionBa.comments: Since knee is initially bent significantly, hamstrings are not significantly involved. Also see

GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegBoxSquat.name: Single Leg Box Squat (pistol)
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegBoxSquat.preparation: Stand in front of adjustable height bench or box. Extend arms out in front of body. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegBoxSquat.execution: Squat down while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Once bottocks makes contact with bench or box, raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegBoxSquat.comments: Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength. Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Weighted versions of this exercise would normally be considered auxiliary in context of other basic exercises (ie: Barbell Squat, Sled Leg Press). However, in the context of 'body weight' only program, this exercise can be considered basic. Also known as Bench Pistol Squat or Single Leg Bench Squat.

GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegHalfSquat.name: Single Leg Half Squat
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegHalfSquat.preparation: Stand with arms in front of body either extended or close to torso. Balance on one leg and bend raised leg back at knee.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegHalfSquat.execution: Squat down to challenging depth while keeping raised leg from contacting floor. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Stand back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg are straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegHalfSquat.comments: Allow torso to lean forward slightly while hips travel to back and knee travels forward. Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength.

GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegPartialBoxSqua.name: Single Leg Partial Box Squat (pistol)
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegPartialBoxSqua.preparation: Stand facing away from box, platform, or adjustable height bench positioned just behind legs. Extended arms out in front of body. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegPartialBoxSqua.execution: Squat down while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Once buttock makes contact with bench or box, raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegPartialBoxSqua.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Partial range of motion, as name implies, can be considered hips descending to height above knee. Weighted versions of this exercise would normally be considered auxiliary in context of other basic exercises (ie: Barbell Squat, Sled Leg Press). However, in the context of 'body weight' only program, this exercise can be considered basic. Also known as Pistol Box Squat (partial).

GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegRecliningSquat.name: Single Leg Reclining Squat (bar)
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegRecliningSquat.preparation: Stand behind horizontal bar, lower chest to upper waist height. Grasp bar with both hands. Place feet slightly forward and lean back with arms straight. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegRecliningSquat.execution: While reclining back, squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as suppor ting foot. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegRecliningSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Single Leg Split Squat
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Stand facing away from bench. Extend leg back and place top of foot on bench.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegSquat.name: Single Leg Squat (pistol)
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand with arms extended out in front. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep back as straight as possible and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegSquatLegBack.name: Single Leg Squat (with leg back)
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegSquatLegBack.preparation: Stand with arms extended out in front.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegSquatLegBack.execution: Balance on one leg and bend raised leg back at knee.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegSquatLegBack.comments: Squat down as far as possible while keeping raised leg from contacting floor as far down as possible. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. In lowest position, gently place elevated lower leg on floor. Raise body back up with minimal assistance from raised leg on floor. Stand to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg are straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegStiffLegDeadli.name: Single Leg Stiff-leg Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegStiffLegDeadli.preparation: Stand with feet together and hands just in front of thighs. Lift leg slightly so foot is just off floor.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegStiffLegDeadli.execution: Lower torso forward and downward while raising lifted leg back behind. Keep back straight and knee of supporting leg slightly bend. Keep hip and knee of lifted leg extended throughout movement. Once stretch is felt or hands contact floor, return to original position by raising torso while lowering lifted leg. Straighten knee of supporting leg as torso becomes upright. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BWSingleLegStiffLegDeadli.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms and back straight. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Those with

GluteusMaximus/BWSplitSquat.name: Split Squat
GluteusMaximus/BWSplitSquat.preparation: Stand with hands on hips. Position feet far apart; one foot forward and other foot behind.
GluteusMaximus/BWSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/BWSplitSquat.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

GluteusMaximus/BWSquat.name: Squat
GluteusMaximus/BWSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Squat up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/BWSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Arms positioned forward allows torso to be positioned more upright. See

GluteusMaximus/BWStepDown.name: Step-down
GluteusMaximus/BWStepDown.preparation: Stand with one foot on bench or elevated surface. Position foot on elevated surface to side, forward of straight knee.
GluteusMaximus/BWStepDown.execution: Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning foot off of bench to floor and repeat. Continue with opposite position.
GluteusMaximus/BWStepDown.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Knee of exercised leg should point same direction as foot. See

GluteusMaximus/BWStepUp.name: Step-up
GluteusMaximus/BWStepUp.preparation: Stand facing side of bench, step or platform.
GluteusMaximus/BWStepUp.execution: Place foot of first leg on bench. Stand on bench by extending hip and knee of first leg and place foot of second leg on bench. Step down with second leg by flexing hip and knee of first leg. Return to original standing position by placing foot of first leg to floor. Repeat first step with opposite leg, alternating first steps between legs.
GluteusMaximus/BWStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Lead knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Stepping distance from bench emphasizes Gluteus Maximus; stepping close to bench emphasizes Quadriceps.

GluteusMaximus/CBBentOverHipExtension.name: Cable Bent-over Hip Extension
GluteusMaximus/CBBentOverHipExtension.preparation: Attach ankle cuff to low pulley. With cuff on one ankle, grasp ballet bar with both hands and step far back with other foot. Arms remain extended to support body leaning forward. Leg with ankle cuff attached in slightly bent with foot off floor.
GluteusMaximus/CBBentOverHipExtension.execution: Pull cable attachment back by extending hip. Return leg to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/CBBentOverHipExtension.comments: Spinal stabilization through the sagittal plane is not significant as it is in

GluteusMaximus/CBGluteKickback.name: Cable Glute Kickback
GluteusMaximus/CBGluteKickback.preparation: Attach ankle cuff to low pulley. With cuff on one ankle, grasp ballet bar with both hands and step far back with other foot. Arms remain extended to support body leaning forward. Leg with ankle cuff attached is flexed at hip and knee.
GluteusMaximus/CBGluteKickback.execution: Pull cable attachment back by extending hip and knee. Return leg to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/CBGluteKickback.comments: Spinal stabilization through the sagittal plane is not significant as it is in

GluteusMaximus/CBBarSquat.name: Cable Bar Squat
GluteusMaximus/CBBarSquat.preparation: Adjust cable pulleys to medium low positions. Kneel under attached cable bar while supporting it with both hands. Position body in lower squat position with cable bar on top of shoulders, both feet flat on floor with mid feet in line with both pulleys, knees positioned same direction as feet, back straight and angled forward, and hands grasping bar to each side.
GluteusMaximus/CBBarSquat.execution: Stand up by extending hips and knees until legs are straight. Squat back down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend slightly forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/CBBarSquat.comments: Position height of cable bar so moving weight plates make contact with unused weight stack at bottom of squat when hips are slightly lower or same height as knees. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/CBLunge.name: Cable Split Squat (belt)
GluteusMaximus/CBLunge.preparation: Facing low pulley, kneel to attach cable belt or dip belt around waist. Place hand(s) on ballet bar or machine (not on guide rod!) for balance. Stand away from pulley with one leg forward and opposite leg to rear.
GluteusMaximus/CBLunge.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original straddle position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with legs in opposite position.
GluteusMaximus/CBLunge.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

GluteusMaximus/CBLungeOneArm.name: Cable One Arm Split Squat
GluteusMaximus/CBLungeOneArm.preparation: Face low pulley and grasp stirrup attachment with one hand. Stand away from pulley with one leg forward and opposite leg to rear. Place other hand on hip or on support to side.
GluteusMaximus/CBLungeOneArm.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original straddle position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with legs in opposite position.
GluteusMaximus/CBLungeOneArm.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

GluteusMaximus/CBLungeTwoArm.name: Cable Split Squat
GluteusMaximus/CBLungeTwoArm.preparation: Stand between two very low cable pulleys. Grasp stirrup attachments with each hand. Place one leg far forward and opposite leg far back to rear.
GluteusMaximus/CBLungeTwoArm.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original straddle position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with legs in opposite position.
GluteusMaximus/CBLungeTwoArm.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

GluteusMaximus/CBRearLunge.name: Cable Rear Lunge
GluteusMaximus/CBRearLunge.preparation: Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
