GluteusMaximus/CBRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

GluteusMaximus/CBRearStepdownLunge.name: Cable Rear Step-down Lunge
GluteusMaximus/CBRearStepdownLunge.preparation: Stand on upper platform with stirrups grasped to sides.
GluteusMaximus/CBRearStepdownLunge.execution: Extend one leg back on forefoot. Lower body on other leg by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with lower platform. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat by alternating rear lunge with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/CBSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Cable Single Leg Split Squat
GluteusMaximus/CBSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Facing away from bench, stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides. Extend leg back and place top of foot on bench.
GluteusMaximus/CBSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/CBSingleLegSplitSquatOneA.name: Cable One Arm Single Leg Split Squat
GluteusMaximus/CBSingleLegSplitSquatOneA.preparation: Stand between bench and low pulley cable. Grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Facing low pulley, extend leg back and place top of foot or forefoot on bench. Place other hand on hip or support to side.
GluteusMaximus/CBSingleLegSplitSquatOneA.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/CBSquat.name: Cable Squat
GluteusMaximus/CBSquat.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or slightly wider on platform between very low and close pulley cables. Squat down with knees slightly beyond foot and shoulder above feet. Grasp stirrups to each side with arms straight.
GluteusMaximus/CBSquat.execution: Keeping chest high and back straight, raise stirrups by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Squat down until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/CBSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, arms straight to sides, and feet flat on platform; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/CBSquatBelt.name: Cable Belt Squat
GluteusMaximus/CBSquatBelt.preparation: Place pin on lightest weight. Place belt around waist. Pull cable from pulley and attach to front of belt. Step onto platform and grasp pole. Squat or sit on platform and select desired weight. Stand with feet shoulder width or wider to each side of cable. Place both hands on pole at waist height.
GluteusMaximus/CBSquatBelt.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Squat up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/CBSquatBelt.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. When finished, squat or sit and place pin into lightest weight setting. Step off of platform and unclip cable from belt. Also known as

GluteusMaximus/CBStandingHipExtension.name: Cable Standing Hip Extension
GluteusMaximus/CBStandingHipExtension.preparation: Attach ankle cuff to low pulley. With cuff on one ankle, grasp ballet bar with both hands and step back with other foot. Elbows remain straight. Attached leg is straight and foot is slightly off floor.
GluteusMaximus/CBStandingHipExtension.execution: Pull cable attachment back by extending hip. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/CBStepUp.name: Cable Step-up
GluteusMaximus/CBStepUp.preparation: Stand behind elevated platform and low and close pulley cables to sides. Grasp stirrups at each side of platform. Stand upright with arms straight down at sides.
GluteusMaximus/CBStepUp.execution: Place foot of first leg on elevated platform. Stand on elevated platform by extending hip and knee of first leg and place foot of second leg on bench. Step down with second leg by flexing hip and knee of first leg. Return to original standing position by placing foot of first leg to lower position. Repeat first step with opposite leg alternating first steps between legs.
GluteusMaximus/CBStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Forward knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Stepping distance from bench emphasizes Gluteus Maximus; stepping close to bench emphasizes Quadriceps.

GluteusMaximus/CBStiffLegDeadlift.name: Cable Stiff Leg Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/CBStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand on elevated platform between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
GluteusMaximus/CBStiffLegDeadlift.execution: Bow forward by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing low back at bottom. With knees slightly bent, raise torso by extending at waist, then hips, gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/CBStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Lower back may bend slightly during hip flexion phase. Target muscle is exercised isometrically if lower back does not bend. Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

GluteusMaximus/CBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.name: Cable Straight-back Stiff-leg Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/CBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
GluteusMaximus/CBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.execution: With back straight, bow forward by bending hips and bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso by extending hips while gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/CBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Do not stand behind pulleys. Throughout lift, keep arms and back straight. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings. When finished with set, dismount by lowering weight with knees bent and low back straight. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Those with

GluteusMaximus/DBFrontSquat.name: Dumbbell Front Squat
GluteusMaximus/DBFrontSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides. Clean dumbbells up to shoulders so side of each dumbbell rests on top of each shoulder. Balance dumbbells on shoulder by holding on to dumbbells with elbows flaring outward. Position feet shoulder width or slightly narrower apart.
GluteusMaximus/DBFrontSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/DBFrontSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/DBLateralStepUp.name: Dumbbell Lateral Step-up
GluteusMaximus/DBLateralStepUp.preparation: Stand between two benches, one to each side. Hold dumbbells in each hand down to sides
GluteusMaximus/DBLateralStepUp.execution: Lift leg and place foot on bench to side and forward of straight knee. Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning feet to original position. Repeat with opposite leg alternating between legs.
GluteusMaximus/DBLateralStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Stepping knee should point same direction as foot. A modest degree of

GluteusMaximus/DBLunge.name: Dumbbell Lunge
GluteusMaximus/DBLunge.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
GluteusMaximus/DBLunge.execution: Lunge forward with first leg. Land on heel then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/DBRearLunge.name: Dumbbell Rear Lunge
GluteusMaximus/DBRearLunge.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
GluteusMaximus/DBRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

GluteusMaximus/DBSideLunge.name: Dumbbell Alternating Side Lunge
GluteusMaximus/DBSideLunge.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
GluteusMaximus/DBSideLunge.execution: Lunge to one side with first leg. Position closest dumbbell behind thigh and opposite dumbbell to front. Land on heel then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of lead leg, keeping knee pointed same direction of foot. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of lead leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/DBSideLunge.comments: Keep torso upright during lunge. Flexible

GluteusMaximus/DBSideLunge2.name: Dumbbell Side Lunge
GluteusMaximus/DBSideLunge2.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
GluteusMaximus/DBSideLunge2.execution: Lunge to one side with first leg. Position closest dumbbell behind thigh and opposite dumbbell to front. Land on heel then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of lead leg, keeping knee pointed same direction of foot. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of lead leg. Repeat by

GluteusMaximus/DBSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Dumbbell Single Leg Split Squat
GluteusMaximus/DBSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides facing away from bench. Extend leg back and place top of foot on bench.
GluteusMaximus/DBSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/DBSingleLegSquat.name: Dumbbell Single Leg Squat
GluteusMaximus/DBSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
GluteusMaximus/DBSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep   supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/DBSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

GluteusMaximus/DBSingleLegStiffLegDeadli.name: Dumbell Single Leg Stiff-leg Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/DBSingleLegStiffLegDeadli.preparation: Hold dumbbell in each hand. Position dumbbells down in front of upper thighs with arms straight. Stand with feet together. Lift leg slightly so foot is just off floor.
GluteusMaximus/DBSingleLegStiffLegDeadli.execution: Lower dumbells to floor while raising lifted leg back behind. Keep back straight and knee of supporting leg slightly bend. Keep hip and knee of lifted leg extended throughout movement. Once stretch is felt or dumbells contacts floor, return to original position by raising torso while lowering lifted leg. Straighten knee of supporting leg as torso becomes upright. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/DBSingleLegStiffLegDeadli.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms and back straight. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Those with

GluteusMaximus/DBSplitSquat.name: Dumbbell Split Squat
GluteusMaximus/DBSplitSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides. Stand with feet far apart; one foot forward and other foot behind.
GluteusMaximus/DBSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/DBSplitSquat.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

GluteusMaximus/DBSquat.name: Dumbbell Squat
GluteusMaximus/DBSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
GluteusMaximus/DBSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/DBSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/DBStepDown.name: Dumbbell Step Down
GluteusMaximus/DBStepDown.preparation: Hold dumbbells in each hand down to sides and stand with one foot on bench. Position foot on bench to side, forward of straight knee.
GluteusMaximus/DBStepDown.execution: Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning foot off of bench to floor and repeat. Continue with opposite position.
GluteusMaximus/DBStepDown.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Knee of exercised leg should point same direction as foot. Exercise can also be performed by placing traveling foot onto and off of bench next to foot of exercised leg. See

GluteusMaximus/DBStepUp.name: Dumbbell Step-up
GluteusMaximus/DBStepUp.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides facing side of bench.
GluteusMaximus/DBStepUp.execution: Place foot of first leg on bench. Stand on bench by extending hip and knee of first leg and place foot of second leg on bench. Step down with second leg by flexing hip and knee of first leg. Return to original standing position by placing foot of first leg to floor. Repeat first step with opposite leg, alternating first steps between legs.
GluteusMaximus/DBStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Forward knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Stepping distance from bench emphasizes Gluteus Maximus; stepping close to bench emphasizes Quadriceps.

GluteusMaximus/DBWalkingLunge.name: Dumbbell Walking Lunge
GluteusMaximus/DBWalkingLunge.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
GluteusMaximus/DBWalkingLunge.execution: Step forward with first leg. Land on heel then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Stand on forward leg with assistance of rear leg. Lunge forward with opposite leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite legs.

GluteusMaximus/LV45LegPress.name: Lever 45° Leg Press (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LV45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet slightly high on platform. Extend hips and knees. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/LV45LegPress.execution: Flex hips and knees to lower lever until hips are completely flexed. Push platform by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LV45LegPress.comments: Adjust safety brace and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps. Also see

GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingLegPress.name: Lever Alternating Seated Leg Press (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingLegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet on slightly high on platform. Grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingLegPress.execution: Push one platform away by extending knee and hip. Return to original position. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue by alternating between sides.
GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingLegPress.comments: Adjust seat and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. This exercise may be performed by alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion.

GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingKneelingHipE.name: Lever Alternating Kneeling Hip Extension
GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingKneelingHipE.preparation: Kneel on lowest (shin) pad with roller pad behind lower thighs. Position midsection on middle pad. Place forearms on padded arm rest and grip handles.
GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingKneelingHipE.execution: Keeping one leg on shin pad, extending hip of other leg and push roller pad back. Raise roller pad up until hip is completely extended. Return leg to original position. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue alternating between each side.
GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingKneelingHipE.comments: Exercise can be performed with one leg, then other leg. See

GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingLyingHipExte.name: Lever Alternating Lying Hip Extension
GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingLyingHipExte.execution: Lie on bench with knees legs over pads. Align hip joints with lever fulcrum. Strap hips down with belt. Extend both hips with feet toward floor.

GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingLyingLegPres.name: Lever Alternating Lying Leg Press
GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingLyingLegPres.preparation: Lie on machine with shoulder under pads. Place feet slightly high on individual lever platforms. Grasp handles to sides. Push both lever platforms away by extending knees and hips so knees are straight.
GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingLyingLegPres.execution: Lower one lever platform toward body by bending knee and hip until weight taps or nearly taps unused portion of weight stack. Push lever platform away by extending knee and hip. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue by alternating between sides.
GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingLyingLegPres.comments: Adjust bench to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. This exercise may be performed by alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion.

GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingSingleLegSpl.name: Lever Alternating Single Leg Split V-Squat
GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingSingleLegSpl.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet slightly forward on platform. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until hip or knee is short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard). Raise lever by extending knees and hips.
GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingSingleLegSpl.execution: Transfer right foot back to inside of rear vertical platform. Lower lever by flexing hips and knees until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Raise lever by extending knees and hips until knee is straight. Return right foot to original position by other foot. Repeat with opposite leg movement and continue alternating between sides.
GluteusMaximus/LVAlternatingSingleLegSpl.comments: When finished, keep both feet forward and descend lever downward. Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and legs are straight. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Push with both heel and forefoot. Do not allow forward heel to raise off of platform.

GluteusMaximus/LVBBRearLunge.name: Lever Barbell Rear Lunge (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVBBRearLunge.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet under bar or slightly forward. Straighten legs so weight is lifted. Disengage bar by rotating bar back. Place feet slightly forward.
GluteusMaximus/LVBBRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

GluteusMaximus/LVBBSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Lever Barbell Single Leg Split Squat (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVBBSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Place bench behind smith bar. With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place foot slightly forward under bar. Extend other leg back and place top of foot on bench. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
GluteusMaximus/LVBBSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/LVBBSplitSquat.name: Lever Barbell Split Squat (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVBBSplitSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place one foot forward and forefoot of other leg further back. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
GluteusMaximus/LVBBSplitSquat.execution: Lower body on other leg by flexing knees and hips of of both legs until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original straddled position by extending hips and knees of both legs. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/LVBBSquat.name: Lever Barbell Squat (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVBBSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet slightly forward. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
GluteusMaximus/LVBBSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVBBSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/LVBentOverHipExtension.name: Lever Bent-over Hip Extension
GluteusMaximus/LVBentOverHipExtension.preparation: Step up onto platform. Position belly on wide pad, forearms on padded arm rest, and grip handles. Position bottom of foot on foot lever with lower leg under pad.
GluteusMaximus/LVBentOverHipExtension.execution: Push foot lever back by extending hip. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Reposition and continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/LVBentOverHipExtension.comments: Stabilizers may not be significantly activated if hips are securely supported by apparatus. Despite apparatus' similarity to rear kick exercise, it is actually hip extension exercise due to the isolated hip movement which is apparent with lack of knee articulation.

GluteusMaximus/LVBentOverRearKick.name: Lever Bent-over Glute Kickback
GluteusMaximus/LVBentOverRearKick.preparation: Lean over padded surface and grasp handles. Bend knee and position foot against lever platform or pedal.
GluteusMaximus/LVBentOverRearKick.execution: Push platform or pedal back by extending leg. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/LVBentOverRearKickPL.name: Lever Bent-over Glute Kickback (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVBentOverRearKickPL.preparation: Lean over wide padded area, place forearms on padded arm rest, and grip handles. Bend knee and position foot against lever platform.
GluteusMaximus/LVBentOverRearKickPL.execution: Push platform back by extending leg back. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/LVBentOverRearKickPL.comments: Stabilizers may not be significantly activated if hips are securely supported by apparatus.

GluteusMaximus/LVDeadlift.name: Lever Deadlift (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles to sides. Squat down with feet flat and grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/LVDeadlift.execution: Lift lever by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weight by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Exercise can also be performed

GluteusMaximus/LVFrontSquatPL.name: Lever Front Squat
GluteusMaximus/LVFrontSquatPL.preparation: Step onto platform facing padded levers. Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width apart on platform. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Release support lever if it does not disengage by itself.
GluteusMaximus/LVFrontSquatPL.execution: Lower lever by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Lift lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVFrontSquatPL.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Model shown uses foot pedal near base of platform to reengage support lever. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on platform; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/LVHackPress.name: Lever Hack Press (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVHackPress.preparation: Sit on seat with back of hips against back pad. Place feet on platform shoulder width or slightly wider. Extend hips and knees. Disengage dock lever if it does not automatically disengage.
GluteusMaximus/LVHackPress.execution: Lower seat by flex hips and knees until either is near complete flexion. Raise seat by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVHackPress.comments: When finished, engage dock lever, and lower seat to starting position. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps. Also see

GluteusMaximus/LVFullSquatPL.name: Lever Full Squat (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVFullSquatPL.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width apart slightly in front of shoulders. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Release support lever.
GluteusMaximus/LVFullSquatPL.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until knees and hips are fully bent. Lift lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVFullSquatPL.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/LVHackSquat.name: Lever Hack Squat (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVHackSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pad and back on back pad. Place feet slightly high on platform. Extend hips and knees and release dock lever if available.
GluteusMaximus/LVHackSquat.execution: Lower lever by bending hips and knees, until knees are just short of complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVHackSquat.comments: If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform. Push with both heel and forefoot. If available, re-engage dock lever in extended position before dismounting. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps. Also see similar exercise

GluteusMaximus/LVHipThrust.name: Lever Hip Thrust (on lying leg curl machine)
GluteusMaximus/LVHipThrust.preparation: Sit on floor facing padded roller with back against edge of thigh pad. Position back of shoulders on thigh pad and hips under padded roller. Place feet on floor or slightly elevated platform approximately shoulder width with knees bent. Place hands on roller pad or postion bend arms above chest.
GluteusMaximus/LVHipThrust.execution: Raise padded roller upward by extending hips until straight. Lower and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVHipThrust.comments: To increase range of motion, feet can be placed on slightly elevated surface such as aerobic step or Bosa® balance trainer.

GluteusMaximus/LVHipThrustPL.name: Lever Hip Thrust
GluteusMaximus/LVHipThrustPL.preparation: Lie on apperatuse with knees bent and feet on foot platform shoulder width or slightly narrower apart. Position hips just below padded bar or adjustable belt. Lock padded bar or tighten adjustable belt snuggly above hips.
GluteusMaximus/LVHipThrustPL.execution: Raise weight upward by extending hips until straight. Lower and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVHipThrustPL.comments: Use resistance which allows full hip extension.

GluteusMaximus/LVKneelingHipExtensionRol.name: Lever Kneeling Hip Extension
GluteusMaximus/LVKneelingHipExtensionRol.preparation: Kneel on lowest (shin) pad with roller pad behind lower thighs. Position midsection on middle pad. Place forearms on padded arm rest and grip handles.
GluteusMaximus/LVKneelingHipExtensionRol.execution: Keeping one leg on shin pad, extend hip of other leg and push roller pad back. Raise roller pad up until hip is completely extended. Return leg to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/LVKneelingHipExtension.name: Lever Kneeling Glute Kickback
GluteusMaximus/LVKneelingHipExtension.preparation: Kneel on machine by placing one knee on lower pad. Rest torso on middle pad, place forearms on padded arm rest, and grip handles. Position other foot of other leg up to lever platform.
GluteusMaximus/LVKneelingHipExtension.execution: Push platform back by extending leg back. Return leg to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/LVLyingHipExtension.name: Lever Lying Hip Extension
GluteusMaximus/LVLyingHipExtension.preparation: With leg lever positioned in the lower position, lie supine on machine with legs over padded bar. Align hip joints with lever fulcrum. Strap hips down with belt if available. Release leg lever and adjust until leg lever is in upper position. Grasp handles to sides of head.
GluteusMaximus/LVLyingHipExtension.execution: Push padded leg bar down until hips are extended. Return and repeat.

GluteusMaximus/LVLyingHipExtensionH.name: Lever Lying Hip Extension (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVLyingHipExtensionH.preparation: Lie on bench with knees legs over pads. Align hip joints with lever fulcrum. Strap hips down with belt. Grasp handles at each side.
GluteusMaximus/LVLyingHipExtensionH.execution: Extend hips and knees until legs are straight. Return to original position by flexing hips and knees. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVLyingHipExtensionH.comments: Erector Spinae could be exercised dynamically as a synergist, particularly if

GluteusMaximus/LVLyingLegPress.name: Lever Lying Leg Press (custom - plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie supine on padded platform. Place hands on bars above head or to sides. Place feet flat on lever platform with hips and knees bent.
GluteusMaximus/LVLyingLegPress.execution: Push lever platform by extending hips and knees until knees are straight. Lower lever platform by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVLyingLegPress.comments: Adjust machine to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps. Unique apparatus is designed and built by

GluteusMaximus/LVLyingLegPressH.name: Lever Lying Leg Press (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVLyingLegPressH.preparation: Climb up steps to top of machine. Lie supine on horizontal padded platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet equally spaced and slightly high on platform. Grip handles above shoulder pads.
GluteusMaximus/LVLyingLegPressH.execution: Push lever platform away by extending hips and knees until knees are straight. Return lever platform by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion or until hips are completely flexed. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVLyingLegPressH.comments: Adjust shoulder pads to allow full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Push with both heel and forefoot and do not allow heels to raise off of platform. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

GluteusMaximus/LVPowerRunnerPL.name: Lever Power Runner (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVPowerRunnerPL.preparation: Place forefeet into pedals. Squat down and position shoulders forward in padded yoke. Grasp handles to sides. Push one pedal back by extending knee and hip so one leg is straight while the other remains forward.
GluteusMaximus/LVPowerRunnerPL.execution: Push forward pedal back by extending leg while allowing other pedal to come forward by bending opposite leg. Continue pedalling by alternating between sides.
GluteusMaximus/LVPowerRunnerPL.comments: Adjust yoke position to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Also see

GluteusMaximus/LVRearLunge.name: Lever Rear Lunge (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVRearLunge.preparation: Stand between lever handles to sides. Squat down with feet flat on floor and grasp lower handles to sides. Lift lever by extending hips and knees to full extension. Position both feet slightly forward.
GluteusMaximus/LVRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg   until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

GluteusMaximus/LVReverseHyperextension.name: Lever Reverse Hyper-extension (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVReverseHyperextension.preparation: Place one leg in strap so it is positioned above ankle. Step up onto step built on side of apparatus with other foot. Lay torso and waist on bench and grasp handles. Place stepping foot inside of strap, just in front of leg already in strap. Position legs side by side. Feet should be above floor with legs hanging straight down.
GluteusMaximus/LVReverseHyperextension.execution: Raise lever by extending hips as high as possible with legs nearly straight. Lower legs to original position. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVReverseHyperextension.comments: Taller individuals may be able to place both legs into strap and position torso on bench without using steps. Some individuals may be able to articulate both through the hips and through the lower back (i.e. lumbar spine), in which case, Erector Spinae also becomes synergist. Movement can be performed

GluteusMaximus/LVSeatedLegPress.name: Lever Seated Leg Press
GluteusMaximus/LVSeatedLegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet slightly high on platform. Grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/LVSeatedLegPress.execution: Extend knees and hips until knees are fully extended. Return until hips are completely flexed. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVSeatedLegPress.comments: Adjust seat and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

GluteusMaximus/LVSeatedLegPressH.name: Lever Seated Leg Press (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVSeatedLegPressH.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet slightly high on platform. Grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/LVSeatedLegPressH.execution: Push platform(s) away by extending knees and hips until knees are fully extended. Return until hips are completely flexed. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVSeatedLegPressH.comments: Adjust seat and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLeg45LegPress.name: Lever Single Leg 45° Leg Press
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLeg45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place one foot mid height to high up on platform. Place outside of resting foot on lower surface with knee positioned out for greater clearance. Push platform up by extending hip and knee. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLeg45LegPress.execution: Lower platform by bending leg until knee is just short of complete flexion. Return by extending knee and hip. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLeg45LegPress.comments: Lower platform enough to achieve full range of motion without forcing pelvis to bend at waist. On exercised leg, keep pointed same direction as foot . Also, do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. For alternative view, see

GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegLegPress.name: Lever Single Leg Seated Leg Press
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegLegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place one foot slightly high on platform and other foot on floor below platform.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegLegPress.execution: Push platform away by extending hip and knee. Return by bending leg until knee or hip is just short of complete flexion. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegLegPress.comments: Adjust back support back to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing pelvis to bend at waist. Keep knee pointed same direction as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegLyingLegPress.name: Lever Single Leg Lying Leg Press (custom - plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie supine on padded platform. Place hands on bars above head or to sides. Place one foot on platform and other foot on floor below platform.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegLyingLegPress.execution: Push platform away by extending hip and knee. Return by bending leg until knee or hip is just short of complete flexion. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegLyingLegPress.comments: Adjust machine to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing pelvis to bend at waist. Keep knee pointed same direction as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Unique apparatus is designed and built by

GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegPressH.name: Lever Single Leg Seated Leg Press (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegPressH.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place one foot slightly high on platform and other foot near floor below platform or off to side.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegPressH.comments: Push platform away by extending hip and knee. Return by bending leg until knee or hip is just short of complete flexion. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Lever Single Leg Split Squat (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Stand between lever handles to sides. Extend leg back and place top of foot on cross bar. Squat down and grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: With chest high, lift lever by extending hips and knees to full extension. Return until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegSplitVSquat.name: Lever Single Leg Split V-Squat
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegSplitVSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place one foot forward on platform. Place other foot against rear vertical platform. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until hip or knee is short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard).
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegSplitVSquat.execution: Raise lever by extending knees and hips. Lower lever by flexing hips and knees until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg positions.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegSplitVSquat.comments: Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and legs are straight. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow  forward heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegSquat.name: Lever Single Leg Squat (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand between handles facing away from fulcrum. Grasp both handles to sides and stand upright. Cross lower leg above knee of supporting leg.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegSquat.execution: Bend knee forward slightly while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back straight and knee pointed same direction of foot. Squat down as low as possible. Extend knee and hip until leg is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegSquat.comments: Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegStandingLegPre.name: Lever Standing Glute Kickback
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegStandingLegPre.preparation: Step on left platform with left foot. Grasp handle bars to each side. Place right foot on highest lever platform.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegStandingLegPre.execution: Push platform down by extending leg until straight. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg positions.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegStandingLegPre.comments: With greater resistances, more effort is required to pull on handle bars to keep body from rising upward.

GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegVSquat.name: Lever Split V-Squat
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegVSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet on platform, shoulder or hip width apart, slightly forward. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until knees or hips are just short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard). Raise sled by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Place one leg back behind platform with toes pointed downward over floor.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegVSquat.execution: Squat down with knee pointed same direction as foot. Allow leg to bend behind with forefoot on floor. Descend until forward hip is near complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knee and hip until leg is straight. Repeat. Continue with other leg.
GluteusMaximus/LVSingleLegVSquat.comments: Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and leg is straight. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knee pointed same directions as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly forward on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly back on platform emphasize Quadriceps. See manufacturer's suggested foot placement for

GluteusMaximus/LVSlidingSplitSquatPL.name: Lever Sliding Split Squat (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVSlidingSplitSquatPL.preparation: Stand with one foot on stationary platform under foot pad and other foot back on sliding platform. Squat down and grasp handles to sides. Stand upright with arms straight to sides.
GluteusMaximus/LVSlidingSplitSquatPL.execution: Lower lever downward by sliding platform back and squatting down on forward leg. Keep chest high as hips descend to knee height. Lift sliding forward and extending hips and knee to full extension. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/LVSplitSquat.name: Lever Split Squat (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVSplitSquat.preparation: Stand between lever handles to sides. Place forefoot of one foot on floor to rear and other foot slightly forward. Squat down and grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/LVSplitSquat.execution: With chest high, lift lever by extending hips and knees to full extension. Return until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/LVSquat.name: Lever Squat
GluteusMaximus/LVSquat.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width apart slightly in front of shoulders.
GluteusMaximus/LVSquat.execution: Raise lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVSquat.comments: Lever height should be adjusted to accommodate full range, allowing hips to descend same height or slightly lower than knees. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/LVSquatPL.name: Lever Squat (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVSquatPL.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width apart slightly in front of shoulders. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Release support lever.
GluteusMaximus/LVSquatPL.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend by bending knees and hip until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Lift lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVSquatPL.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/LVSquatPL3.name: Lever Squat (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVSquatPL3.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width or marginally wider apart, slightly in front of shoulders. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Release support lever.
GluteusMaximus/LVSquatPL3.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend by bending knees and hip until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Lift lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVSquatPL3.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/LVStandingHipExtension.name: Lever Standing Hip Extension
GluteusMaximus/LVStandingHipExtension.preparation: Stand on platform facing to one side and grasp bar for support. Place leg nearest machine on padded roller while standing on other leg.
GluteusMaximus/LVStandingHipExtension.execution: Lower lever by extending hip. Return until knee is higher than hip. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/LVStandingHipExtensionTec.name: Lever Standing Hip Extension (with abdominal pad)
GluteusMaximus/LVStandingHipExtensionTec.preparation: Stand on platform so front of hips are against edge of abdominal pad. Position flexed leg over padded roller while standing on other leg. Grasp handles with both hands.
GluteusMaximus/LVStandingHipExtensionTec.execution: Extend lever back by extending hip and straightening leg. Return by flexing hip and knee. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/LVStandingHipExtensionTec.comments: Shorter individuals should stand on higher platform and may be bent over more. Stabilizers may not be significantly activated if hips are securely supported by apparatus.

GluteusMaximus/LVStiffLegDeadlift.name: Lever Stiff Leg Deadlift (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
GluteusMaximus/LVStiffLegDeadlift.execution: Bow forward by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing low back at bottom. With knees slightly bent, raise torso by extending at waist, then hips, gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Lower back may bend slightly during hip flexion phase. Target muscle is exercised isometrically if lower back does not bend. Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

GluteusMaximus/LVStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.name: Lever Straight-back Stiff-leg Deadlift (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
GluteusMaximus/LVStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.execution: With back straight, bow forward by bending hips and bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso by extending hips while gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Do not stand behind handles. Throughout lift, keep arms and back straight. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings. When finished with set, dismount by lowering weight with knees bent and low back straight. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Those with

GluteusMaximus/LVVSquat.name: Lever V-Squat
GluteusMaximus/LVVSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet on platform, shoulder or hip width apart. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until knees or hips are just short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard).
GluteusMaximus/LVVSquat.execution: Raise lever by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Squat down with knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until knees or hips are near complete flexion. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVVSquat.comments: Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and legs are straight. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly forward on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly back on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

GluteusMaximus/LVVSquatH.name: Lever V-Squat (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/LVVSquatH.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet on platform, shoulder or hip width apart. Extend hips and knees and release lever if available.
GluteusMaximus/LVVSquatH.execution: Bend knees forward slightly while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until hips are just short of complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/LVVSquatH.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform. Push with both heel and forefoot. Also see

GluteusMaximus/LungeAndRearLunge.name: Barbell Alternating Lunge & Rear Lunge
GluteusMaximus/LungeAndRearLunge.preparation: Stand facing rack with barbell at upper chest height and short platform behind. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and step back. Stand with feet slightly narrower than shoulder width apart.
GluteusMaximus/LungeAndRearLunge.execution: Lunge forward with right leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of right front leg until knee of rear left leg is almost in contact with floor. Forcibly extending hip and knee of forward right leg to return to original standing position.
GluteusMaximus/LungeAndRearLunge.comments: Step back with right leg while bending supporting left leg. Plant right forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting left leg until knee of rear right leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of supporting left leg and return rear right leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

GluteusMaximus/LungeRearLunge.name: Barbell Alternating Lunge To Rear Lunge
GluteusMaximus/LungeRearLunge.preparation: Stand facing rack with barbell at upper chest height and short platform behind. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and step back. Stand with feet slightly narrower than shoulder width apart.
GluteusMaximus/LungeRearLunge.execution: Lunge forward with right leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of right front leg until knee of rear left leg is almost in contact with floor. Forcibly extending hip and knee of forward right leg to return to upright position. Instead of returning right foot to side of left foot, instead continue to step back with right leg while bending supporting left leg. Plant right forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting left leg until knee of rear right leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to standing position by extending hip and knee of supporting left leg and return rear right leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

GluteusMaximus/SBSquat.name: Safety Barbell Squat
GluteusMaximus/SBSquat.preparation: Standing facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height. Position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. Hands can be placed on ends of yoke (as shown) or on safety bar out to sides. Dismount bar from rack and step back.
GluteusMaximus/SBSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend slightly forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Stand by extending hips and knees until legs are straight. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SBSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Exercise can also be performed

GluteusMaximus/SBSquatHandles.name: Safety Barbell Squat (long handles)
GluteusMaximus/SBSquatHandles.preparation: Standing facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height. Position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. Grasp ends of handles. Dismount bar from rack and step back.
GluteusMaximus/SBSquatHandles.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend slightly forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Stand with or without assistance of arms, extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SBSquatHandles.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Exercise can also be performed

GluteusMaximus/SBSquatSelfSpot.name: Safety Barbell Squat (self-spotting)
GluteusMaximus/SBSquatSelfSpot.execution: Stand facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height. Place hands vertical rack supports. Position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. Dismount bar from rack and step back so body is upright at arms length from supports.

GluteusMaximus/SL45LegPress.name: Sled 45° Leg Press
GluteusMaximus/SL45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet slightly high on platform. Extend hips and knees. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/SL45LegPress.execution: Lower sled by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion or until hips are completely flexed. Return by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SL45LegPress.comments: Adjust safety brace and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. A wide stance may allow for deeper range of motion as shown. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps. See exercise performed on

GluteusMaximus/SLAlternating45LegPress.name: Sled Alternating 45° Leg Press
GluteusMaximus/SLAlternating45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet slightly high on individual platforms. Grasp handles to sides. Push both platforms away by extending knees and hips so knees are straight. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/SLAlternating45LegPress.execution: Lower one platform toward body by bending knee and hip until knees are just short of complete flexion or until hips are completely flexed. Push platform away by extending knee and hip. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue by alternating between sides.
GluteusMaximus/SLAlternating45LegPress.comments: Adjust safety brace and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Wide stance may allow for deeper range of motion. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps. See exercise performed

GluteusMaximus/SLHackPress.name: Sled Hack Press
GluteusMaximus/SLHackPress.preparation: Sit on sled with back of hips against back pad. Place feet on platform shoulder width or slightly wider. Extend hips and knees. Release dock lever(s).
GluteusMaximus/SLHackPress.execution: Lower sled by flexing hips and knees until either is near complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SLHackPress.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

GluteusMaximus/SLHackSquat.name: Sled Hack Squat
GluteusMaximus/SLHackSquat.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet high up on platform. Extend hips and knees. Release dock levers.
GluteusMaximus/SLHackSquat.execution: Lower sled by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed. Raise sled by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SLHackSquat.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

GluteusMaximus/SLKneelingHipExtension.name: Sled Kneeling Glute Kickback
GluteusMaximus/SLKneelingHipExtension.preparation: Kneel on machine by placing knees on lower pad and feet against bars to rear, if available. Place forearms on padded armrest, and grip handles. Position one foot up so middle of sole is positioned under foot bar.
GluteusMaximus/SLKneelingHipExtension.execution: Push foot bar up by extending leg   back as far as possible. Return leg to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/SLLyingLegPress.name: Sled Lying Leg Press
GluteusMaximus/SLLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet slightly high on platform.
GluteusMaximus/SLLyingLegPress.execution: Extend hips and knees. Return until hips are completely flexed. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SLLyingLegPress.comments: Adjust machine to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

GluteusMaximus/SLLyingLegPressPL.name: Sled Lying Leg Press (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/SLLyingLegPressPL.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet slightly high on platform. Extend hips and knees. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/SLLyingLegPressPL.execution: Bring sled toward platform by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion or until hips are completely flexed. Return by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SLLyingLegPressPL.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Allow for full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

GluteusMaximus/SLSeatedLegPress.name: Sled Seated Leg Press
GluteusMaximus/SLSeatedLegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet slightly high on platform. Grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/SLSeatedLegPress.execution: Extend knees and hips until knees are fully extended. Return until hips are completely flexed. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SLSeatedLegPress.comments: Adjust seat and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

GluteusMaximus/SLRearLunge.name: Sled Rear Lunge
GluteusMaximus/SLRearLunge.preparation: Position shoulders under padded bars handles. Place feet under bar or just slightly forward. Straighten legs so weight is lifted. Disengage dock lever(s) if available. Place feet slightly forward.
GluteusMaximus/SLRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs, alternating between sides.
GluteusMaximus/SLRearLunge.comments: If available, re-engage dock lever(s) in extended position before dismounting. Keep torso upright during lunge;

GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLeg45LegPress.name: Sled Single Leg 45° Leg Press
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLeg45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place one foot high up on platform and other foot on floor below platform. Extend hip and knee. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLeg45LegPress.execution: Lower sled by bending leg until knee is just short of complete flexion. Return by extending knee and hip. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLeg45LegPress.comments: Adjust safety brace and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing pelvis to bend at waist. Keep knee pointed same direction as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegHackSquat.name: Sled Single Leg Hack Squat
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegHackSquat.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet high up on platform. Extend hips and knees. Cross lower leg above knee of supporting leg. Release dock lever(s).
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegHackSquat.execution: Lower sled by flexing hips and knee of supporting leg until knees are just short of complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knee and hips. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegHackSquat.comments: If available, re-engage dock lever(s) in extended position before dismounting. Adjust machine to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing pelvis to rise at waist. Keep knee pointed same direction as feet. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegLyingLegPress.name: Sled Single Leg Lying Leg Press
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place foot slightly high on platform. Position other leg with lower leg parallel to platform.
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegLyingLegPress.execution: Push platform by extending knee and hip until knee is straight. Return by bending hip and knee of supporting leg until knee is just short of complete flexion or until hip is completely flexed. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegLyingLegPress.comments: Allow for full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knee pointed same directions as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing foot slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing foot slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegLyingLegPressP.name: Sled Single Leg Lying Leg Press (plate loaded)
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegLyingLegPressP.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet slightly high on platform. Prop one leg up, on support if available. Extend hip and knee of leg positioned on platform. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides if available.
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegLyingLegPressP.execution: Bring sled toward platform by flexing hip and knee of supporting leg until knee is just short of complete flexion or until hip is completely flexed. Return by extending knee and hip. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegLyingLegPressP.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Allow for full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knee pointed same directions as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing foot slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing foot slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegVerticalLegPre.name: Sled Single Leg Vertical Leg Press
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegVerticalLegPre.preparation: Lie on declined back pad with hips under weighted sled. Place both feet on platform. Raise weight by extending hips and knees. Place foot down off of foot platform. Release dock levers and grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegVerticalLegPre.execution: Lower sled by flexing leg until knees are just short of complete flexion or just before hips raise up from pad. Push weight up by extending knee and hip. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/SLSingleLegVerticalLegPre.comments: Re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting.

GluteusMaximus/SLStandingHipExtension.name: Sled Standing Glute Kickback
GluteusMaximus/SLStandingHipExtension.preparation: Straddle sled and place foot on pedal. Place chest on pad and grasp handles.
GluteusMaximus/SLStandingHipExtension.execution: Push platform back by extending leg   back until straight. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/SLSquat.name: Sled Squat
GluteusMaximus/SLSquat.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded bars. Lean back against back pad if available. Place feet shoulder width apart, slightly in front of shoulders.
GluteusMaximus/SLSquat.execution: If hand or lever lock is available, disengage weight, squat to lowest position and re-engage lock. Lift sled by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Lower sled by bending knees forward slightly while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SLSquat.comments: On apparatuses with hand or lever lock, return sled to very bottom, disengage weight, return sled to mid-upper position, and re-engage weight before stepping out. Some Sled Squat apparatuses have back pads like the one shown, whereas,

GluteusMaximus/SLVerticalLegPress.name: Sled Vertical Leg Press
GluteusMaximus/SLVerticalLegPress.preparation: Lie on declined back pad with hips under weighted sled. Place feet on platform. Raise weight by extending hips and knees. Release dock levers and grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/SLVerticalLegPress.execution: Lower sled by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion or just before hips raise up from pad. Return by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SLVerticalLegPress.comments: is required for fuller range of motion through knee. Lower weight just short of hips, leaving back support. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot, or center of feet if platform is shorter than length of feet.

GluteusMaximus/SMBentKneeGoodMorning.name: Smith Bent Knee Good-morning
GluteusMaximus/SMBentKneeGoodMorning.preparation: Position bar on back of shoulders. Disengage bar by rotating bar back. Grasp bar to sides.
GluteusMaximus/SMBentKneeGoodMorning.execution: Bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SMBentKneeGoodMorning.comments: Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

GluteusMaximus/SMFrontSquat.name: Smith Front Squat
GluteusMaximus/SMFrontSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, grasp bar with overhand shoulder width grip. Position bar on front of shoulders with elbows forward and wrists hyperextended. Place feet slightly forward. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
GluteusMaximus/SMFrontSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward   , keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SMFrontSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefeet and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Also see

GluteusMaximus/SMDeadlift.name: Smith Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/SMDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance with feet flat beneath bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider mixed grip or slightly wider. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
GluteusMaximus/SMDeadlift.execution: Return weight toward floor by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SMDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. See

GluteusMaximus/SMHackSquat.name: Smith Hack Squat
GluteusMaximus/SMHackSquat.preparation: Stand with back of thighs or gluteus against bar. Grasp bar from behind with overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
GluteusMaximus/SMHackSquat.execution: Squat down by bending knees forward while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are too close to parallel to floor and bar is behind lower leg. Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SMHackSquat.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/SMRearLunge.name: Smith Rear Lunge
GluteusMaximus/SMRearLunge.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet under bar or slightly forward. Straighten legs so weight is lifted. Disengage bar by rotating bar back. Place feet slightly forward.
GluteusMaximus/SMRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs, alternating between sides.

GluteusMaximus/SMSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Smith Single Leg Split Squat
GluteusMaximus/SMSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Place bench behind smith bar. With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place foot slightly forward under bar. Extend other leg back and place top of foot on bench. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
GluteusMaximus/SMSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/SMSingleLegSquat.name: Smith Single Leg Squat
GluteusMaximus/SMSingleLegSquat.execution: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet slightly forward and cross lower leg above knee of supporting leg. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
GluteusMaximus/SMSingleLegSquat.comments: Bend knee slightly forward while allowing hips to bend, keeping back straight and knee pointed same direction of foot. Descend until thigh of supporting leg is just past parallel to floor. Extend knee and hip until leg is straight. Return and repeat.

GluteusMaximus/SMSplitSquat.name: Smith Split Squat
GluteusMaximus/SMSplitSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place one foot forward and forefoot of other leg further back. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
