GluteusMaximus/SMSplitSquat.execution: Lower body on other leg by flexing knees and hips of both legs until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original straddled position by extending hips and knees of both legs. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/SMSquat.name: Smith Squat
GluteusMaximus/SMSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet slightly forward. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
GluteusMaximus/SMSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SMSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/SMStiffLegDeadlift.name: Smith Stiff Leg Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/SMStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on elevated platform with thigh against bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
GluteusMaximus/SMStiffLegDeadlift.execution: With knees slightly bent, lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips. Keep waist straight, flexing only slightly at bottom. Lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SMStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion. Target muscle is exercised isometrically if lower back does not bend. Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

GluteusMaximus/SMStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.name: Smith Straight-back Stiff-leg Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/SMStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance with thigh against bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
GluteusMaximus/SMStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.execution: With knees bent, lower bar toward top feet by bending hips and keeping waist straight. Lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SMStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms and back straight. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on

GluteusMaximus/SMWideSquat.name: Smith Wide Squat
GluteusMaximus/SMWideSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet wide, pointing outward 45° to 30°. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
GluteusMaximus/SMWideSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/SMWideSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/STHipBridge.name: Suspended Hip Bridge
GluteusMaximus/STHipBridge.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Grasp bottom of loops, then lay supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles. Lie down supine on mat so knees and hips are bent with suspension straps hanging vertical. Place arms off to sides.
GluteusMaximus/STHipBridge.execution: Raise hips up by extending hips until fully extended. Lower hips until hips and back make contact with mat. Repeat.

GluteusMaximus/STSingleLegSplitSquatSelf.name: Suspended Single Leg Split Squat (self-assisted)
GluteusMaximus/STSingleLegSplitSquatSelf.preparation: Grasp one or both suspension trainer handle(s) in lower position hanging. Stand facing   nearby fixed support and hold with one hand for balance. With other hand, secure foot in loop(s) from behind while balancing on one leg. With both hands, hold lightly on fixed support for balance and minimal assistance if needed.
GluteusMaximus/STSingleLegSplitSquatSelf.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of supporting leg. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/STSingleLegSquat.name: Suspended Single Leg Squat
GluteusMaximus/STSingleLegSquat.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Position body and legs straight at desired angle hanging from handles with arms straight. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
GluteusMaximus/STSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back, up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/STSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Dismounting can be achieved by placing elevated leg down and walking backward until body is upright. This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings. Also known as Suspended Pistol Squat.

GluteusMaximus/STSquat.name: Suspended Reclining Squat
GluteusMaximus/STSquat.preparation: Stand in front of suspension trainer handles positioned at height of upper abdomen to lower chest. Grasp suspension trainer handles and step back with arms extended forward until suspension straps are taut. While leaning back, step forward with both feet. Recline back with feet apart with arms and body straight.
GluteusMaximus/STSquat.execution: While reclined back and holding onto suspension trainer handles, squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward while keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are perpendicular to body's angle of movement. Stand up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return to reclined standing position with body straight. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/STSquat.comments: Apply equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/STSplitSquat.name: Suspended Single Leg Split Squat
GluteusMaximus/STSplitSquat.preparation: Grasp one or both suspension trainer handle(s) in lower position. Step and face away from suspension trainers. Balance on one leg while raising foot from behind and slipping single foot in loop(s). Release handle with hand and position leg back so it is supported behind body by suspension trainer. Place hands on hips and maintain balance throughout exercise.
GluteusMaximus/STSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

GluteusMaximus/TBDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/TBDeadlift.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or narrower in trap bar, weight to each side. Squat down with feet flat and grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/TBDeadlift.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weight to floor by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/TBDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/TBSquat.name: Trap Bar Squat
GluteusMaximus/TBSquat.preparation: Stand on platform under loaded trap bar. Squat down until thighs are just past parallel to floor with knees pointed same direction as feet and feet flat on platform. Grasp handles to sides. Posture chest up with back arched tightly.
GluteusMaximus/TBSquat.execution: Lift weight upward by extending knees and hips until straight. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weight to floor by bending hips back, while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.
GluteusMaximus/TBSquat.comments: An inverted squared open-ended trap bar is used in this demonstration. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/TBStiffLegDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Stiff Leg Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/TBStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand on platform under loaded trap bar. Squat down and grasp handles to sides.

GluteusMaximus/TBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Straight-back Stiff-leg Deadlift
GluteusMaximus/TBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or narrower in trap bar, weight to each side. Squat down with feet flat and grasp handles to sides.
GluteusMaximus/TBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.comments: With back straight, lower bar toward floor by bending at hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight. Place weight onto floor. With knees still bent, lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.

GluteusMaximus/WTFrontSquat.name: Weighted Front Squat
GluteusMaximus/WTFrontSquat.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or slightly narrower apart. Holding weight plate upper chest height with both hands.
GluteusMaximus/WTFrontSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/WTFrontSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

GluteusMaximus/WtReverseHyperextension.name: Weighted Reverse Hyper-extension
GluteusMaximus/WtReverseHyperextension.preparation: Place sandbag or medicine ball between ankles. Lay torso and waist on bench and grasp handles. Feet should be above floor with legs straight.
GluteusMaximus/WtReverseHyperextension.execution: Raise weight by extending hips as high as possible until legs are nearly straight. Lower legs to original position. Repeat.

GluteusMaximus/WtSingleLegSquat.name: Weighted Single Leg Squat
GluteusMaximus/WtSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand with arms extended out in front, holding medicine ball or weight plate. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
GluteusMaximus/WtSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
GluteusMaximus/WtSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

GluteusMaximus/WtSquat.name: Weighted Belt Squat
GluteusMaximus/WtSquat.preparation: Place weight on dip belt around waist. Step up onto boxes or benches spaced apart; foot on each bench. Arms can be extended forward throughout exercise.
GluteusMaximus/WtSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Squat up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
GluteusMaximus/WtSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Hamstrings/ASHamstringRaiseSelf.name: Self-assisted Inverse Leg Curl
Hamstrings/ASHamstringRaiseSelf.preparation: Place elevated platform in front of glute-hamstring apparatus. Adjust padded supports and kneel upright in apparatus. Position knees against large roller pad or near-upper side of padded hump (depending on model), ankles between padded supports, and feet on platform.
Hamstrings/ASHamstringRaiseSelf.execution: Lower body with hips straight by slowly straightening knees. Position hands forward, ready to push body weight back up off of surface. Control descent only with hamstrings as low as possible before catching body by quickly placing hands on elevated platform and rapidly pushing off against platform, just enough to assist hamstrings in raising body upward. Return to upright kneeling position and repeat.
Hamstrings/ASHamstringRaiseSelf.comments: This movement is also known as Self-assisted Hamstring Raise. To keep exercise challenging, push off only hard enough to minimally assist raising of body with hamstrings only.

Hamstrings/ASHamstringRaiseSelfFloor.name: Self-assisted Inverse Leg Curl (on floor)
Hamstrings/ASHamstringRaiseSelfFloor.preparation: Kneel on floor. Position ankles under fixed bar or pad and knees on thick dense pad. Kneel upright with hips straight. Extend arms out to sides with elbow pointing back and slightly bent. Position hands slightly forward with palms facing forward or slightly toward floor.
Hamstrings/ASHamstringRaiseSelfFloor.execution: Lower body with hips straight by slowly straightening knees. Control descent only with hamstrings as low as possible. Only when body begins to fall, touch down with tensed finger tips out to each side. Once fingers make contact with floor, control remaining descent with assistance of arms. Allowing chest to come very close to floor, rapidly push off against floor, again just enough to assist hamstrings in raising body upward. Return to upright kneeling position and repeat.
Hamstrings/ASHamstringRaiseSelfFloor.comments: This movement is also known as Self-assisted Hamstring Raise on Floor. Bar or pad height should be only just high enough to position ankles underneath, allowing room for vertical orientation of feet with toes on floor.

ErectorSpinae/BBRackPull.name: Barbell Rack Pull
ErectorSpinae/BBRackPull.preparation: In power rack, with barbell on safety bar in low position, place feet shoulder width or slightly narrower beneath bar. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
ErectorSpinae/BBRackPull.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.
ErectorSpinae/BBRackPull.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip. Barbell Rack Pull emphasizes mid portion of

Hamstrings/ASInverseLegCurlBands.name: Band-assisted Inverse Leg Curl
Hamstrings/ASInverseLegCurlBands.preparation: Place resistance band around each shoulder with other end anchored to bar just behind head or shoulders. Position arms behind hips or crossed on chest.
Hamstrings/ASInverseLegCurlBands.execution: This is an advanced exercise performed on Glute Ham Raise Apparatus. This movement is also known as Band-assisted Hamstring Raise.

Hamstrings/BB45HipExtension.name: Barbell 45° Back Raise (on hyperextension apparatus)
Hamstrings/BB45HipExtension.preparation: Position thighs prone on upper padding of 45-degree hyper-extension apparatus. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
Hamstrings/BB45HipExtension.execution: Lower body by bending hips until fully flexed. Raise or extend hips until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BB45HipExtension.comments: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered.

Hamstrings/BB45Hyperextension.name: Barbell 45° Hyperextension
Hamstrings/BB45Hyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
Hamstrings/BB45Hyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hip and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until fully flexed. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BB45Hyperextension.comments: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered.

Hamstrings/BBGluteHamRaise.name: Barbell Glute-Ham Raise
Hamstrings/BBGluteHamRaise.preparation: Place ankles between ankle roller pads with feet on vertical platform and position knees on pad with lower thighs against large padded hump. If barbell can safely be placed on horizontal handles, grasp barbell in upright position and place behind shoulders. If barbell is placed on floor, lower torso by extending knees and flexing hips, then position barbell on back of shoulders. Grasp bar to sides.
Hamstrings/BBGluteHamRaise.execution: From lower position, raise torso by extending hips until fully extended. Continue to raise body by flexing knees until body is upright. Lower body by straightening knees until body is horizontal. Continue to lower torso by bending hips until body is upside down. Repeat.

Hamstrings/BBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Barbell Straight Leg Deadlift
Hamstrings/BBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on shallow platform with feet flat beneath bar. Bend knees and bend over with lower back straight. Grasp barbell with shoulder width overhand or mixed grip, shoulder width or slightly wider. Lift weight to standing position.
Hamstrings/BBStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips. After hips can no longer flex, bend waist as bar approaches top of feet. Lift bar by extending waist and hip until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BBStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

Hamstrings/BBGoodMorning.name: Barbell Good-morning
Hamstrings/BBGoodMorning.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
Hamstrings/BBGoodMorning.execution: Keeping back straight, bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BBGoodMorning.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

Hamstrings/BBHamstringRaise.name: Barbell Inverse Leg Curl
Hamstrings/BBHamstringRaise.preparation: Adjust padded supports and kneel upright in apparatus. Position knees against large roller pad or near-upper side of padded hump, ankles between padded supports, and feet on platform. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
Hamstrings/BBHamstringRaise.execution: Lower body until horizontal by straightening knees. Raise body by flexing knees only allowing hips to bend slightly. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BBHamstringRaise.comments: This is an advanced exercise performed on Glute Ham Raise Apparatus. This movement is also known as Barbell Hamstring Raise. Exercise can be performed

Hamstrings/BBHipExtension.name: Barbell Back Raise (on hyperextension apparatus)
Hamstrings/BBHipExtension.preparation: Stand in hyper-extension apparatus. Position thighs prone on large pad and lower leg under padded bar. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
Hamstrings/BBHipExtension.execution: Lower body by bending hips until fully flexed. Raise, or extend hips until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BBHipExtension.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad.

Hamstrings/BWBallLegCurl.name: Straight Hip Leg Curl (on stability ball)
Hamstrings/BWBallLegCurl.preparation: Lie supine on floor with lower legs on exercise ball. Extended arms out to sides. Straighten low back, knees, and hips, raising back and hips off of floor.
Hamstrings/BWBallLegCurl.execution: Keeping hips and low back straight, bend knees, pulling heels toward rear end. Allow feet to rollup on to ball. Lower to original position by straightening knees. Repeat.

Hamstrings/BBHyperextension.name: Barbell Hyperextension
Hamstrings/BBHyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower leg under padded brace. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
Hamstrings/BBHyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hip and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until fully flexed. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BBHyperextension.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

Hamstrings/BBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.name: Barbell Straight-back Straight-leg Deadlift
Hamstrings/BBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.execution: from floor with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip. Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance.
Hamstrings/BBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.comments: With knees and back straight, lower bar by bending hips until hamstrings are tight, or just before lower back bends. Lift bar by extending hips until upright. Pull shoulders slightly back at top of lift if rounded. Repeat.

Hamstrings/BWBallSingleLegStraightHipLeg.name: Single Leg Straight Hip Leg Curl (on stability ball)
Hamstrings/BWBallSingleLegStraightHipLeg.preparation: Lie supine on floor with lower legs on exercise ball. Extended arms out to sides. Straighten low back, knees, and hips, raising back and hips off of floor.
Hamstrings/BWBallSingleLegStraightHipLeg.execution: Keeping hips and low back straight, bend knee, pulling heel toward rear end while keeping other leg extended straight so it raises upward. Allow foot to rollup on to ball. Lower to original position by straightening knee until other leg makes contact with ball. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BWBallSingleLegStraightHipLeg.comments: Keep hips straight throughout movement. Knee of rising straight leg will be kept close to knee of bending leg.

Hamstrings/BWGluteHamRaiseHead.name: Glute-Ham Raise (hands behind neck)
Hamstrings/BWGluteHamRaiseHead.preparation: Place ankles between ankle roller pads with feet on vertical platform and position knees on pad with lower thighs against large padded hump. Position behind neck.
Hamstrings/BWGluteHamRaiseHead.execution: From upright position, lower body by straightening knees until body is horizontal. Continue to lower torso by bending hips until body is upside down. Raise torso by extending hips until fully extended. Continue to raise body by flexing knees until body is upright. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BWGluteHamRaiseHead.comments: Movement can be made easier by placing arms further down away from head.

Hamstrings/BWGluteHamRaiseHips.name: Glute-Ham Raise (hands behind hips)
Hamstrings/BWGluteHamRaiseHips.preparation: Place ankles between ankle roller pads with feet on vertical platform and position knees on pad with lower thighs against large padded hump. Position hands behind hips.
Hamstrings/BWGluteHamRaiseHips.execution: From upright position, lower body by straightening knees until body is horizontal. Continue to lower torso by bending hips until body is upside down. Raise torso by extending hips until fully extended. Continue to raise body by flexing knees until body is upright. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BWGluteHamRaiseHips.comments: Movement can be made easier by having partner assist in raise by pulling up on shoulders (from front) or chest (from side).

Hamstrings/BWHamstringRaise.name: Inverse Leg Curl
Hamstrings/BWHamstringRaise.preparation: Adjust padded supports and kneel upright in apparatus. Position knees on near-upper side of padded hump, ankles between padded supports, and feet on platform. Place arms behind back, across chest, or bent beside head depending on desired intensity.
Hamstrings/BWHamstringRaise.execution: Lower body until horizontal by straightening knees. Raise body by flexing knees only allowing hips to bend slightly. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BWHamstringRaise.comments: This is an advanced exercise performed on Glute Ham Raise Apparatus. This movement is also known as Hamstring Raise.

Hamstrings/BWHangingHamstringBridgeCurl.name: Hanging Hamstring Bridge Curl
Hamstrings/BWHangingHamstringBridgeCurl.preparation: Stand behind bar facing elevated platform positioned slightly away on other side of bar. Grasp bar with slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Walk body under bar and position back of heels on elevated platform. With legs extended forward, hang under bar with arms straight and hips bent just above floor.
Hamstrings/BWHangingHamstringBridgeCurl.execution: Raise hips by extending hips. Before full hip extension, pull body toward feet by bending knees and hips. Roll onto feet until knees are fully flexed. Return body to original position by extending knees, then lowering hips to original position just above floor. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BWHangingHamstringBridgeCurl.comments: Platform should be high enough to allow hips to flex without buttocks contacting floor. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.

Hamstrings/BWHangingHamstringBridge.name: Hanging Hamstring Bridge
Hamstrings/BWHangingHamstringBridge.preparation: Stand behind bar facing elevated platform positioned slightly away on other side of bar. Grasp bar with slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Walk body under bar and position back of heels on elevated platform. With legs extended forward, hang under bar with arms straight and hips bent just above floor.
Hamstrings/BWHangingHamstringBridge.execution: Raise hips up as high as possible by extending hips. Lower hips to original position just above floor. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BWHangingHamstringBridge.comments: Platform should be high enough to allow hips to flex without buttocks contacting floor. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Adductor Magnus may only assist at initial phase hip extension depending on degree of hip flexion at bottom of movement. Also see

Hamstrings/BWHangingLegCurl.name: Hanging Leg Curl
Hamstrings/BWHangingLegCurl.execution: Straighten and raise body off of floor keeping heels on floor.
Hamstrings/BWHangingLegCurl.comments: Pull body toward feet by bending knees and hips. Roll onto feet until knees are fully flexed. Return body to original position by extending knees and hips. Repeat.

Hamstrings/BWHangingStraightHipLegCurl.name: Hanging Straight Hip Leg Curl
Hamstrings/BWHangingStraightHipLegCurl.preparation: Lay supine under fixed horizontal bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Straighten and raise body off of floor keeping heels on floor.
Hamstrings/BWHangingStraightHipLegCurl.execution: Pull body toward feet by bending knees while keeping hips straight. Roll onto feet until knees are fully flexed. Return body to original position by extending knees. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BWHangingStraightHipLegCurl.comments: Positioned bar so back is slightly above floor once grip is established. Keep low back and hips straight throughout movement. With hips fully extended, Hamstrings enter

Hamstrings/BWSingleLeg45Hyperextension.name: Single Leg 45° Hyperextension
Hamstrings/BWSingleLeg45Hyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook one heel under platform lip or padded brace. Position other leg just above. Place arms to side, crossed on chest, or behind neck
Hamstrings/BWSingleLeg45Hyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until fully flexed. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BWSingleLeg45Hyperextension.comments: Movement can be made easier by placing arms further down to sides, away from head or performing exercise with both legs.

Hamstrings/BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBr.name: Single Leg Hanging Hamstring Bridge
Hamstrings/BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBr.preparation: Stand behind bar facing elevated platform positioned slightly away on other side of bar. Grasp bar with slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Walk body under bar. Position back of heel on elevated platform. Place other foot on or just over floor so leg is bent. Hang under bar with arms straight and hips bent just above floor.
Hamstrings/BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBr.execution: Raise hips up as high as possible by extending hip and spine. Maintain bent position of lower leg allowing it to rise with hips. Lower hips along with bent lower leg to original position and repeat. Continue with legs in opposite position.
Hamstrings/BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBr.comments: Platform should be high enough to allow hip to flex without buttocks contacting floor. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Adductor Magnus may only assist at initial phase hip extension depending on degree of hip flexion at bottom of movement.

Hamstrings/BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBr.name: Single Leg Hanging Hamstring Bridge Curl
Hamstrings/BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBr.preparation: Raise hip and bent lower leg up by extending hip of elevated leg. Maintain bent position of lower leg allowing it to rise with hips. Before full hip extension, pull body toward foot by bending knee and hip of elevated leg. Roll onto foot until knee is fully flexed. Return body to original position by extending knee, then lowering hips and bent lower leg to original position just above floor. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg position.
Hamstrings/BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBr.execution: Platform should be high enough to allow hip to flex without buttocks contacting floor. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.
Hamstrings/BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBr.comments: Adductor Magnus may only assist at initial phase hip extension depending on degree of hip flexion at bottom of movement. Preventing full extension of hip allows hamstrings to remain in a mechanically strong position as it approaches full flexion by reducing

Hamstrings/BWWheelLegCurl.name: Leg Curl (on power wheel)
Hamstrings/BWWheelLegCurl.preparation: Lie supine on floor with feet strapped onto power wheel. Extended arms out to sides. Straighten knees and hips.
Hamstrings/BWWheelLegCurl.execution: Keeping hips and low back straight, bend knees, pulling heels toward rear end. Raise up until lower legs are vertical. Lower to original position by straightening knees. Repeat.
Hamstrings/BWWheelLegCurl.comments: Keep hips straight throughout movement. With hips fully extended, Hamstrings enter

Hamstrings/CBLyingLegCurl.name: Cable Lying Leg Curl
Hamstrings/CBLyingLegCurl.preparation: Attach two ankle cuffs to low pulley attachment. With cuffs on both ankles lie prone on flat bench with knees just beyond edge of bench. Grip under side or base of bench for support.
Hamstrings/CBLyingLegCurl.execution: Raise ankles to glutes by flexing knees. Lower ankles until knees are straight. Repeat.
Hamstrings/CBLyingLegCurl.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of lower back.

Hamstrings/CBBentOverLegCurl.name: Cable Bent-over Leg Curl
Hamstrings/CBBentOverLegCurl.preparation: Attach ankle cuff to low pulley. With cuff on one ankle, grasp ballet bar with both hands and step far back with other foot. Elbows remain straight to support body leaning forward. Attached foot is stretched off floor.
Hamstrings/CBBentOverLegCurl.execution: Pull cable attachment back and up slightly by flexing knee. Raise knee slightly by flexing hip until knee is fully flexed. Return by straightening knee and lowering knee slightly to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Hamstrings/CBBentOverLegCurl.comments: Raise knee very slightly as knee is flexing and return as weight is lowered. Keep hip from sagging or from being pulled forward. Heavier resistances can tear apart standard leather ankle cuffs.

Hamstrings/CBStandingLegCurl.name: Cable Standing Leg Curl
Hamstrings/CBStandingLegCurl.execution: to low pulley. With foot harness on one ankle, grasp support bar with both hands and step back with other foot. Elbows remain straight to support body. Attached foot is slightly off floor.
Hamstrings/CBStandingLegCurl.comments: Pull cable attachment back by flexing knee until knee is fully flexed. Return by straightening knee to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Hamstrings/CBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.name: Cable Straight-back Straight-leg Deadlift
Hamstrings/CBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
Hamstrings/CBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.execution: With knees and back straight, bow forward by bending hips until hamstrings are tight, or just before lower back bends. Raise body upright by extending hips until standing. Pull shoulders back slightly at top of lift if rounded. Repeat.
Hamstrings/CBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms, knees, and back straight. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on

Hamstrings/CBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Cable Straight Leg Deadlift
Hamstrings/CBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
Hamstrings/CBStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, bow forward by bending hips. Bend waist as stirrups approach lowest position. Lift stirrups by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
Hamstrings/CBStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

Hamstrings/DBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Dumbbell Straight Leg Deadlift
Hamstrings/DBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance. Grasp dumbbells to sides.
Hamstrings/DBStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower dumbbells to top or sides of feet by bending hips. Bend waist as bar approaches feet. Lift dumbbells by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
Hamstrings/DBStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

Hamstrings/DBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.name: Dumbbell Straight-back Straight-leg Deadlift
Hamstrings/DBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance. Grasp dumbbells to each side.
Hamstrings/DBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower dumbbells by bending hips until hamstrings are tight, or just before lower back bends. Lift dumbbells by extending hips until straight. Pull shoulders back slightly at top of lift if rounded. Repeat.
Hamstrings/DBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms, knees, and back straight. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on

Hamstrings/LVAlternatingLyingLegCurl.name: Lever Alternating Lying Leg Curl
Hamstrings/LVAlternatingLyingLegCurl.preparation: Facing bench, stand between bench and lever pads. Lie prone on bench with knees just beyond edge of bench and lower legs under lever pads. Grasp handles.
Hamstrings/LVAlternatingLyingLegCurl.execution: Raise lever pad to back of thighs by flexing one knee. Lower lever pads until knee is straight and repeat with opposite leg. Continue to alternate between sides.
Hamstrings/LVAlternatingLyingLegCurl.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of lower back. Most machines are angled at user's hip to position hamstring in more favorable mechanical position. If angle is at much greater angle than one illustrated, Rectus Femoris will less likely be involved as Antagonist Stabilizer.

Hamstrings/LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlH.name: Lever Alternating Lying Leg Curl (plate loaded)
Hamstrings/LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlH.preparation: Facing bench, stand between bench and lever pads. Lie prone on bench with knees just beyond edge of bench and lower legs under lever pads. Grasp handles.
Hamstrings/LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlH.execution: Raise one lever pad to back of thigh by flexing knee. Lower lever pad until knee is straight. Raise and lower other leg pad. Continue by alternating legs.
Hamstrings/LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlH.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of lower back. Most machines are angled at user's hip to position hamstring in more favorable mechanical position. If angle at hip is significantly bent, Rectus Femoris will less likely be involved as Antagonist Stabilizer.

Hamstrings/LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlPL.name: Lever Alternating Lying Leg Curl (plate loaded)
Hamstrings/LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlPL.preparation: Lie prone on bench with knees just beyond edge of bench and lower legs under lever pads. Grasp handles.
Hamstrings/LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlPL.execution: Raise lever pad to back of thigh by flexing knee. Lower lever pad until knee is straight. Raise and lower lever pad with opposite leg. Continue by alternating legs.
Hamstrings/LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlPL.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of low back. As one leg raises lever, other knee may need to be bent slightly to avoid contact with lower leg extension pad, as demonstrated. Some plate loaded non-commercial machines may be angled at user's hip to position hamstring in more favorable mechanical position. See

Hamstrings/LVAlternatingStandingLegCurl.name: Lever Alternating Standing Leg Curl
Hamstrings/LVAlternatingStandingLegCurl.preparation: Stand in machine with lower pads behind lower legs, upper pads in front of thighs, and lever fulcrum between knees. Bend over and grasp handles for support if available.
Hamstrings/LVAlternatingStandingLegCurl.execution: Raise left foot slightly off of floor or platform. Raise lever up with left leg, bending knee as high as possible. Return lever until knee is straight. Shift body weight to left foot and raise right foot slightly off of floor or platform. Raise lever up with right leg, bending knee as high as possible. Continue alternating movement between legs.

Hamstrings/LVAlternationgBentOverLegCurl.name: Lever Alternating Bent-over Leg Curl
Hamstrings/LVAlternationgBentOverLegCurl.preparation: Stand in machine with lower pads behind lower legs, upper pads in front of thighs, and lever fulcrum between knees. Bend over, placing forearms on pads, and grasp handles.
Hamstrings/LVAlternationgBentOverLegCurl.execution: Raise left foot slightly off of floor or platform. Raise lever up with left leg, bending knee as high as possible. Return lever until knee is straight. Shift body weight to left foot and raise right foot slightly off of floor or platform. Raise lever up with right leg, bending knee as high as possible. Continue alternating movement between legs.

Hamstrings/LVBentOverLegCurl.name: Lever Bent-over Leg Curl
Hamstrings/LVBentOverLegCurl.preparation: Stand in machine with lower pads behind lower legs, upper pads in front of thighs, and lever fulcrum between knees. Bend over, placing forearms on pads, and grasp handles. Stand with body weight shifted on foot of resting leg and raise foot of exercising leg slightly off of floor or platform.
Hamstrings/LVBentOverLegCurl.execution: Raise lever up by bending knee as high as possible. Return lever until knee is straight. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Hamstrings/LVKneelingLegCurl.name: Lever Kneeling Leg Curl
Hamstrings/LVKneelingLegCurl.preparation: Mount machine by placing supporting knee on horizontal pad and other leg under roller pad with knee against vertical pad. Grip handles and place forearm on padded arm rest.
Hamstrings/LVKneelingLegCurl.execution: Raise ankle to back of thigh by flexing knee. Lower ankle until knee is straight. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurl.name: Lever Lying Leg Curl
Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurl.preparation: Facing bench, stand between bench and lever pads. Lie prone on bench with knees just beyond edge of bench and lower legs under lever pads. Grasp handles.
Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurl.execution: Raise lever pad to back of thighs by flexing knees. Lower lever pads until knees are straight. Repeat.
Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurl.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of lower back. Most machines are angled at user's hip to position hamstring in more favorable mechanical position. If this angle is sharp (as shown), Rectus Femoris is less likely involved as Antagonist Stabilizer.

Hamstrings/LVKneelingLegCurlH.name: Lever Kneeling Leg Curl (plate loaded)
Hamstrings/LVKneelingLegCurlH.preparation: Mount machine by placing supporting knee on horizontal pad and other leg under roller pad with knee against vertical pad. Grip handles and place forearm on padded arm rest.
Hamstrings/LVKneelingLegCurlH.execution: Raise ankle to back of thigh by flexing knee. Lower ankle until knee is straight. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurlPL.name: Lever Lying Leg Curl (plate loaded)
Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurlPL.preparation: Facing bench, stand between bench and lever pads. Lie prone on bench with knees just beyond edge of bench and lower legs under lever pads. Grasp handles.
Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurlPL.execution: Raise lever pad to back of thighs by flexing knees. Lower lever pads until knees are straight. Repeat.
Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurlPL.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of low back. Some plate loaded non-commercial machines may be angled at user's hip to position hamstring in more favorable mechanical position. See

Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurlRevHyperMachPL.name: Lever Lying Leg Curl (on reverse hyper-extension machine, plate loaded)
Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurlRevHyperMachPL.preparation: Place lower legs between pads with feet on bar. Lay torso and waist on bench and grasp handles.
Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurlRevHyperMachPL.execution: Raise lever back and up by flexing knees. Lower lever until knees are straight. Repeat.

Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurlH.name: Lever Lying Leg Curl (plate loaded)
Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurlH.preparation: Facing bench, stand between bench and lever pads. Lie prone on bench with knees just beyond edge of bench and lower legs under lever pads. Grasp handles.
Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurlH.execution: Raise lever pad to back of thighs by flexing knees. Lower lever pads until knees are straight. Repeat.
Hamstrings/LVLyingLegCurlH.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of lower back. Most machines are angled at user's hip to position hamstring in more favorable mechanical position. If angle is at much greater angle than one illustrated, Rectus Femoris will less likely be involved as Antagonist Stabilizer.

Hamstrings/LVSeatedLegCurl.name: Lever Seated Leg Curl
Hamstrings/LVSeatedLegCurl.preparation: Sit on apparatus with back against padded back support. Place back of lower legs on top of far padded lever. Secure lap pad on thighs just above knees. Grasp handles on lap support.
Hamstrings/LVSeatedLegCurl.execution: Pull far padded lever toward back of thighs by flexing knees. Return lever until knees are straight. Repeat.
Hamstrings/LVSeatedLegCurl.comments: Position back of seat so knees are aligned with fulcrum of lever. Position lever pad so it makes contact with lowers leg just above ankles. Place leg closest to lever in machine first, followed by further leg.

Hamstrings/LVSeatedLegCurlH.name: Lever Seated Leg Curl (plate loaded)
Hamstrings/LVSeatedLegCurlH.preparation: Sit on apparatus with back against padded back support. Push hand lever to lower leg pads. Place legs in between pads. Release hand lever gradually. Grasp handles to sides with each hand.
Hamstrings/LVSeatedLegCurlH.execution: Pull lever to back of thighs by flexing knees. Return lever until knees are straight. Repeat.
Hamstrings/LVSeatedLegCurlH.comments: Position back of seat so knees are aligned with fulcrum of lever.

Hamstrings/LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurl.name: Lever Single Leg Seated Leg Curl
Hamstrings/LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurl.preparation: Sit on seat with back against padded back support. Position back of lower leg on top of far padded lever and other leg bent over lap pad. Secure lap pad against thigh just above knee. Grasp handles on lap support.
Hamstrings/LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurl.execution: Pull far padded lever toward back of thighs as far as possible by flexing knee. Return padded lever until knee is straight. Change legs and repeat for opposite leg.
Hamstrings/LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurl.comments: Position back of seat so knee is aligned with fulcrum of lever. Position lever pad so it makes contact with lower leg just above ankle. Place leg closest to lever in/on machine first, followed by further leg. Keep resting leg down throughout exercise as not to interfere with movement of lever.

Hamstrings/LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurlHamme.name: Lever Single Leg Seated Leg Curl (plate loaded)
Hamstrings/LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurlHamme.preparation: Sit on seat with back against padded back support. Push hand lever to lower leg pads. Place one leg in between pads. Place other leg on top of upper most pad bar. Release hand lever gradually. Grasp handles to sides with each hand.
Hamstrings/LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurlHamme.execution: Pull padded lever to back of thighs as far as possible by flexing knee. Return padded lever until knee is straight. Change legs and repeat for opposite leg.
Hamstrings/LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurlHamme.comments: Allow resting leg on top to ride bar down and up throughout exercise.

Hamstrings/LVStandingLegCurl.name: Lever Standing Leg Curl
Hamstrings/LVStandingLegCurl.preparation: Stand in machine with one or both legs between pads depending upon machine's design. Position exercising leg with lever pad behind lower leg and upper pad in front of lower thigh. Bend over and grasp handles for support if available. Stand with body weight shifted on foot of resting leg and raise foot of exercising leg slightly off of floor or platform.
Hamstrings/LVStandingLegCurl.execution: Pull lever up to back of thigh by flexing knee. Return lever until knee is straight. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Hamstrings/LVStandingLegCurlMultiHip.name: Lever Standing Leg Curl (on multi-hip machine)
Hamstrings/LVStandingLegCurlMultiHip.preparation: Adjust platform to highest position or lever fulcrum to lowest position so fulcrum is at height of knee. If necessary, place extra elevation near end of platform to stand on, so knee is aligned with fulcrum. Adjust padded roller approximately 45° downward. Step on extra elevation facing padded roller. Place leg closest to lever over roller. Bend over at hips and grasp bar. Slightly extend hip to lower roller so knee maintains alignment with fulcrum.
Hamstrings/LVStandingLegCurlMultiHip.execution: Pull padded roller to glutes by flexing knee. Lower padded roller until knee is straight. Repeat. Reposition roller pad lever and continue with opposite leg.
Hamstrings/LVStandingLegCurlMultiHip.comments: Taller individuals may only be able to perform this exercise on standard multi-hip machine if adjustments are not sufficient to position knee at same height of fulcrum. If needed, raise body slightly by raising heel for proper knee alignment. Disregard calf as stabilizer if this is not necessary. Maintain knee position to lever throughout exercise. Shorter individuals may find it difficult to position body high enough even with elevation.

Hamstrings/LVStrBackStrLegDeadlift.name: Lever Straight-back Straight-leg Deadlift (plate loaded)
Hamstrings/LVStrBackStrLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
Hamstrings/LVStrBackStrLegDeadlift.execution: With knees and back straight, bow forward by bending hips until hamstrings are tight, or just before lower back bends. Raise body upright by extending hips until standing. Pull shoulders back slightly at top of lift if rounded. Repeat.
Hamstrings/LVStrBackStrLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms, knees, and back straight. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on

Hamstrings/LVStandingLegCurlLegExt.name: Lever Standing Leg Curl (on leg extension)
Hamstrings/LVStandingLegCurlLegExt.preparation: Place platform to one side of padded lever. Have additional padded board in hand. Facing machine, stand to one side of padded roller. Place far leg on elevated platform. Position closest leg into apparatus by placing back of lower leg against lever roller. Place extra padded board between knee and edge of seat. Position knee forward securely against padded board and edge of seat. Bend over seat by bending hips and support torso with arms.
Hamstrings/LVStandingLegCurlLegExt.execution: Pull lever to back of thigh by flexing knee. Return lever until knee is straight. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Hamstrings/LVStandingLegCurlLegExt.comments: A leg extension with padded rollers with access to both sides is required. If needed, raise body slightly by raising heel so lever fulcrum closer to knee articulation. Disregard calf as stabilizer if this is not necessary.

Hamstrings/LVStraightLegDeadlift.name: Lever Straight Leg Deadlift (plate loaded)
Hamstrings/LVStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
Hamstrings/LVStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, bow forward by bending hips. Bend waist as stirrups approach lowest position. Lift lever by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
Hamstrings/LVStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

Hamstrings/LVStraightLegLyingHipExtensio.name: Lever Straight-leg Lying Hip Extension
Hamstrings/LVStraightLegLyingHipExtensio.preparation: Lie on bench and place back of lower legs against leg pad. Position hips in line with fulcrum. Grasp bottom sides of bench to keep body from moving under resistance.
Hamstrings/LVStraightLegLyingHipExtensio.execution: With knees straight, extend lever downward until hips are extended. Return lever to upright position without allowing back of hips to raise up off of bench. Repeat.
Hamstrings/LVStraightLegLyingHipExtensio.comments: Throughout lift, knees straight and back of hips on bench. Hip may tend to raise up when legs are pulled up. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on

Hamstrings/SMGoodMorning.name: Smith Good-morning
Hamstrings/SMGoodMorning.preparation: Position bar on back of shoulders. Grasp bar to sides. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Hamstrings/SMGoodMorning.execution: Bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.
Hamstrings/SMGoodMorning.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

Hamstrings/SMStrBackStrLegDeadlift.name: Smith Straight-back Straight-leg Deadlift
Hamstrings/SMStrBackStrLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance with thigh against bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Hamstrings/SMStrBackStrLegDeadlift.execution: With knees and back straight, lower bar by bending hips until hamstrings are tight, or just before lower back bends. Lift bar by extending hips until straight. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
Hamstrings/SMStrBackStrLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms, knees, and back straight. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on

Hamstrings/SMStraightLegDeadlift.name: Smith Straight Leg Deadlift
Hamstrings/SMStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on elevated platform with thigh against bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Hamstrings/SMStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips. After hips can no longer flex, bend waist as bar approaches top of feet. Lift bar by extending waist and hip until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
Hamstrings/SMStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

Hamstrings/STHamstringRunner.name: Suspended Hamstring Runner
Hamstrings/STHamstringRunner.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Grasp bottom of loops, then lay supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles. Extend one leg out straight, keep other leg bent so knee is pointing up. Place arms on floor off to sides. Lift low back and hips off of floor so one leg is straight with back and other leg bent, so foot of bent leg is close to knee of straight leg.
Hamstrings/STHamstringRunner.execution: Simultaneously alternate leg positions by straightening bent leg while bending straight knee. Repeat.
Hamstrings/STHamstringRunner.comments: This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer. See

Hamstrings/STHangingLegCurl.name: Suspended Hanging Leg Curl
Hamstrings/STHangingLegCurl.preparation: Lay supine under suspension trainer and grasp handles. Straighten and raise body off of floor keeping heels on floor.
Hamstrings/STHangingLegCurl.execution: Pull body toward feet by bending knees and hips. Roll onto feet until knees are fully flexed. Return body to original position by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
Hamstrings/STHangingLegCurl.comments: This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings. Positioned handles so back is slightly above floor once grip is established. Keep low back straight, maintaining approximate height from floor throughout movement. Hamstrings seemingly acts as a dynamic stabilizer, since it shortens through knee, while it lengthens through hip. However, net contraction actually appears to occur, since hip flexes only about 50%, while knee flexes nearly 100%, allowing hamstrings to remain in a mechanically strong position throughout movement.

Hamstrings/STHangingStraightHipLegCurl.name: Suspended Hanging Straight Hip Leg Curl
Hamstrings/STHangingStraightHipLegCurl.preparation: Lay supine under suspension trainer and grasp handles. Straighten and raise body off of floor keeping heels on floor.
Hamstrings/STHangingStraightHipLegCurl.execution: Pull body toward feet by bending knees while keeping hips and back straight. Roll onto feet until knees are fully flexed. Return body to original position by extending knees maintaining straight hip position. Repeat.
Hamstrings/STHangingStraightHipLegCurl.comments: This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings. Positioned handles so back is slightly above floor once grip is established. Keep low back and hips straight throughout movement. With hips fully extended, Hamstrings enter

Hamstrings/STHyperextension.name: Suspended Hyperextension
Hamstrings/STHyperextension.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Fold at hips onto heels, allowing rear end to fall far back with arms and shoulders stretched forward.
Hamstrings/STHyperextension.execution: Drive hips forward until hips are straight, while keeping arms and shoulders straight. Near top of motion, reach back with arms over head and hyperextend spine. While keeping arms over head, lower body with hips falling back down to starting position and repeat.
Hamstrings/STHyperextension.comments: An alternative mount involves stepping back with suspension handles in hands until arms are pulled forward about 45° (give or take) from resting position. At this point, recline body back, then fold at hips, allowing rear end to fall far back with arms and shoulders stretched forward.

Hamstrings/STLegCurl.name: Suspended Leg Curl
Hamstrings/STLegCurl.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Grasp bottom of loops, then lay supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles. Extend legs out and place arms on floor off to sides. Straighten low back, knees, and hips, raising back and hips off of floor.
Hamstrings/STLegCurl.execution: Pull heels toward rear end by bending knees and hips simultaneously. Lower body to original position by straightening knees and hips. Repeat.
Hamstrings/STLegCurl.comments: Keep low back straight, maintaining approximate height from floor throughout movement. Hamstrings seemingly acts as a dynamic stabilizer, since it shortens through knee, while it lengthens through hip. However, net contraction actually appears to occur, since hip flexes only about 50%, while knee flexes nearly 100%, allowing hamstrings to remain in a mechanically strong position throughout movement.

Hamstrings/STSingleLegStraightHipLegCurl.name: Suspended Single Leg Straight Hip Leg Curl (on bench)
Hamstrings/STSingleLegStraightHipLegCurl.preparation: Sit on floor or bench facing suspension trainer loop in low position. Place heel in loop with sole contacting handle. Lie down and extend both legs out straight. If lying on floor, place arms on floor off to sides. If lying on bench, grasp end or sides of bench with each hand. Straighten low back, knees, and hips, raising back and hips off of floor or bench with both legs together.
Hamstrings/STSingleLegStraightHipLegCurl.execution: Bend knee of leg in suspension trainer while keeping other leg extended. Continue pulling heel toward rear end while keeping hips and low back straight. Raise up until lower leg is vertical or fully flexed. Lower body to original position by straightening knee until leg is straight and next to extended leg, maintaining straight hip position throughout movement. Repeat.
Hamstrings/STSingleLegStraightHipLegCurl.comments: Keep hips straight throughout movement. With hip fully extended, Hamstrings enter

Hamstrings/STStraightHipLegCurl.name: Suspended Straight Hip Leg Curl
Hamstrings/STStraightHipLegCurl.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Grasp bottom of loops, then lay supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles. Extend legs out and place arms on floor off to sides. Straighten low back, knees, and hips, raising back and hips off of floor.
Hamstrings/STStraightHipLegCurl.execution: Bend knees, pulling heels toward rear end while keeping hips and low back straight. Raise up until lower legs are vertical or fully flexed. Lower body to original position by straightening knees, maintaining straight hip position. Repeat.
Hamstrings/STStraightHipLegCurl.comments: Keep hips straight throughout movement. With hips fully extended, Hamstrings enter

Hamstrings/TBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Straight Leg Deadlift
Hamstrings/TBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand on platform under loaded trap bar. Squat down and grasp handles to sides.

Hamstrings/TBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Straight-back Straight-leg Deadlift
Hamstrings/TBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or narrower in trap bar, weight to each side. Squat down with feet flat and grasp handles to sides.
Hamstrings/TBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.comments: With knees and back straight, lower bar by bending hips until hamstrings are tight, or just before lower back bends. Lift bar by extending hips until upright. Pull shoulders slightly back at top of lift if rounded. Repeat.

Hamstrings/WT45HipExtension.name: Weighted 45° Back Raise (on hyperextension apparatus)
Hamstrings/WT45HipExtension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding of 45-degree hyper-extension apparatus. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
Hamstrings/WT45HipExtension.execution: Lower body by bending hips until fully flexed. Raise or extend hips until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
Hamstrings/WT45HipExtension.comments: Exercise can be performed without added weight until more resistance is needed. If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers.

Hamstrings/WTGluteHamRaise.name: Weighted Glute-Ham Raise
Hamstrings/WTGluteHamRaise.preparation: Place ankles between ankle roller pads with feet on vertical platform and position knees on pad with lower thighs against large padded hump. Position weight plate against upper chest or behind neck.
Hamstrings/WTGluteHamRaise.execution: From upright position, lower body by straightening knees until body is horizontal. Continue to lower torso by bending hips until body is upside down. Raise torso by extending hips until fully extended. Continue to raise body by flexing knees until body is upright. Repeat.
Hamstrings/WTGluteHamRaise.comments: Weight can be positioned closer (easier) or further away (harder) from hips to adjust intensity; see

Hamstrings/WTHamstringRaise.name: Weighted Inverse Leg Curl
Hamstrings/WTHamstringRaise.preparation: Adjust padded supports and kneel upright in apparatus. Position knees against large roller pad or near-upper side of padded hump, ankles between padded supports, and feet on platform. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
Hamstrings/WTHamstringRaise.execution: Lower body until horizontal by straightening knees. Raise body by flexing knees, only allowing hips to bend slightly. Repeat.
Hamstrings/WTHamstringRaise.comments: This is an advanced exercise performed on Glute Ham Raise Apparatus. This movement is also known as Weighted Hamstring Raise. Exercise can be performed

Hamstrings/WTHipExtension.name: Weighted Back Raise (on hyperextension apparatus)
Hamstrings/WTHipExtension.preparation: Stand in hyper-extension apparatus. Position thighs prone on large pad and lower leg under padded bar. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
Hamstrings/WTHipExtension.execution: Lower body by bending hips until fully flexed. Raise or extend hips until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
Hamstrings/WTHipExtension.comments: Exercise can be performed without added weight until more resistance is needed. If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers

Hamstrings/Wt45Hyperextension.name: Weighted 45° Hyperextension
Hamstrings/Wt45Hyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels under platform lip or padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
Hamstrings/Wt45Hyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until fully flexed. Repeat.
Hamstrings/Wt45Hyperextension.comments: If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers

Hamstrings/WtHyperextension.name: Weighted Hyperextension
Hamstrings/WtHyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower leg under padded bar. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
Hamstrings/WtHyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until fully flexed. Repeat.
Hamstrings/WtHyperextension.comments: If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers.

HipAbductor/CBHipAbduction.name: Cable Hip Abduction
HipAbductor/CBHipAbduction.preparation: Stand in front of low pulley facing to one side. Attach cable cuff to far ankle. Step out away from stack and grasp ballet bar. Stand on near foot and allow far leg to cross in front.
HipAbductor/CBHipAbduction.execution: Move leg to opposite side of low pulley by abduction hip. Return and repeat. Turn around and continue with opposite leg.

HipAbductor/BWSideBridgeHipAbduction.name: Side Bridge Hip Abduction
HipAbductor/BWSideBridgeHipAbduction.preparation: Lie on side with legs straight, one leg on top of the other. Place forearm under shoulder perpendicular to body.
HipAbductor/BWSideBridgeHipAbduction.execution: Keeping side of bottom foot on ground, raise hips up off ground while raising upper leg upward away from lower leg. Return to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
HipAbductor/BWSideBridgeHipAbduction.comments: Keep feet pointed forward. Exercise can be performed on mat or towel or cushioning can be placed under forearm. See

HipAbductor/BWBentKneeSideBridgeHipAbduc.name: Bent Knee Side Bridge Hip Abduction
HipAbductor/BWBentKneeSideBridgeHipAbduc.preparation: Lie on side with legs bent back 90 degrees, one leg on top of the other. Place forearm under shoulder perpendicular to body.
HipAbductor/BWBentKneeSideBridgeHipAbduc.execution: Keeping shank of lower leg on mat or floor, raise hips up off ground while raising upper leg upward away from lower leg. Return to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
HipAbductor/BWBentKneeSideBridgeHipAbduc.comments: Keep knees bent throughout exercise. Exercise can be performed on mat or towel or cushioning can be placed under forearm. See

HipAbductor/BWAngledSideBridgeHipAbducti.name: Angled Side Bridge Hip Abduction
HipAbductor/BWAngledSideBridgeHipAbducti.preparation: Grasp vertical bar with one hand and turn to side. Position feet out away from vertical bar with arm supporting body extended out to side. Legs should be straight and positioned side by side. Supporting arm should be approximately vertical to body and other arm can be placed on hips. Lower hips downward to floor until slight stretch is felt.
HipAbductor/BWAngledSideBridgeHipAbducti.execution: Keeping foot closest to bar on ground, raise hips upward and away from bar while raising leg furthest from bar upward away from lower leg. Return to original position with hips sagging downward and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

HipAbductor/CBLyingHipInternalRotation.name: Cable Lying Hip Internal Rotation
HipAbductor/CBLyingHipInternalRotation.preparation: Attach cable ankle cuff to ankle, furthest low pulley. Step near foot over cable and lie prone perpendicular to cable. Bend knee 90° so attached ankle crosses over resting straight leg nearest pulley. Adjust positioning of legs slightly away from cable pulley so slight stretch is felt in hip.
HipAbductor/CBLyingHipInternalRotation.execution: Keeping knee of attached leg bent approximately 90°, pull cable attachment away from pulley by rotating hip as far as possible. Return leg to original position toward pulley and repeat. Place ankle cuff on opposite leg and continue lying opposite direction.
HipAbductor/CBLyingHipInternalRotation.comments: Exercise name is somewhat counter-intuitive since direction of rotation is relative to movement of hip, or thigh, not bent leg. For example, in this exercises,

HipAbductor/DBLyingHipAbduction.name: Dumbbell Lying Hip Abduction
HipAbductor/DBLyingHipAbduction.preparation: Lie on side on floor or mat. Extend top leg down straight and position lower leg back underneath. Grasping dumbbell with hand of arm furthest from floor, position dumbbell as low as possible on top side of thigh.
HipAbductor/DBLyingHipAbduction.execution: Raise weighted leg up off ground as high as possible, keeping dumbbell positioned on side of upper thigh. Return to leg to floor and repeat. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
HipAbductor/DBLyingHipAbduction.comments: Do not allow upper hip to fall behind upper hip throughout movement. See

HipAbductor/LVKneelingHipInternalRotatio.name: Lever Kneeling Hip Internal Rotation (on hip abduction machine)
HipAbductor/LVKneelingHipInternalRotatio.preparation: Kneel backwards on seated abduction machine with outsides of ankles positioned on inside of each leg pad. Reach down to disengage and pull lever brace to position feet together as close as possible. Engage lever into locked position. Place hands on back pad.
HipAbductor/LVKneelingHipInternalRotatio.execution: Pull levers apart as far as possible with legs by externally rotating hips. Return until feet make contact, then repeat.
HipAbductor/LVKneelingHipInternalRotatio.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as levers are pulled apart, a criteria for lever angle or weight stack height can be used to ensure full range of motion is achieved each repetition. See

HipAbductor/CBSeatedHipInternalRotation.name: Cable Seated Hip Internal Rotation
HipAbductor/CBSeatedHipInternalRotation.preparation: Sit on bench or chair with low pulley to side. Attach cable ankle cuff to ankle furthest pulley. Place foot of stationary leg just forward of foot attached to cable. Grasp bench and handle bar on cable column if available. Position thighs of both legs side by side, perpendicular to cable. Raise foot attached to cable slightly off of floor.
HipAbductor/CBSeatedHipInternalRotation.execution: Keeping knee of attached leg bent approximately 90°, pull cable attachment away from pulley by rotating hip as far as possible. Return foot behind stationary foot and toward pulley. Repeat. Place ankle cuff on opposite leg and continue facing opposite direction.
HipAbductor/CBSeatedHipInternalRotation.comments: Height of knee on exercising leg may require subtle adjustment during movement to permit clearance of traveling foot above floor. Gluteus Maximus will be activated as stabilizer on heavier loads when participant pushes stationary foot onto floor, thereby anchoring lower body as hip abductors keep thighs in place.

HipAbductor/LVSeatedHipAbductionH.name: Lever Seated Hip Abduction (plate loaded)
HipAbductor/LVSeatedHipAbductionH.preparation: Stand near side of apparatus. Place one leg onto far padded lever and sit on seat. Lift other leg onto other padded lever. Lean back onto back pad. Grasp handles to sides.
HipAbductor/LVSeatedHipAbductionH.execution: Move legs away from one another as far as possible. Return and repeat.

HipAbductor/LVStandHipAbduction.name: Lever Standing Hip Abduction
HipAbductor/LVStandHipAbduction.preparation: Adjust platform so lever fulcrum is same height as hip articulation. Adjust roller in low position. Face machine and grasp bars to sides. Place outside of thigh against roller pad and shift body weight to opposite leg.
HipAbductor/LVStandHipAbduction.execution: Raise leg against roller pad to side by abduction hip. Return and repeat. Reposition roller pad lever and continue with opposite leg.

HipAbductor/LVSeatedHipAbduction.name: Lever Seated Hip Abduction
HipAbductor/LVSeatedHipAbduction.preparation: Sit on machine with legs inside of side pads. If available, place heels on foot bars. Release and pull lever brace to position legs together. Engage lever into locked position. Lie back and grasp bars to sides.
HipAbductor/LVSeatedHipAbduction.execution: Move legs apart as far as possible. Return and repeat.
HipAbductor/LVSeatedHipAbduction.comments: Mount machine with leg levers apart. Use lever to position legs together. See

HipAbductor/LVLyingHipAbduction.name: Lever Lying Hip Abduction
HipAbductor/LVLyingHipAbduction.preparation: Sit in machine with heels on bars or legs inside of side pads. Lie back on back pad. Pull in on lever to position legs together. Release lever into position and grasp bars to sides.
HipAbductor/LVLyingHipAbduction.execution: Move legs away from one another by abduction hip. Return and repeat.

HipAbductor/STHipAbduction.name: Suspended Hip Abduction
HipAbductor/STHipAbduction.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Grasp bottom of loops, then lay supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles. Extend legs out and place arms on floor off to sides. Straighten low back, knees, and hips, raising back and hips off of floor.
HipAbductor/STHipAbduction.execution: Pull legs apart as far as possible. Return by placing legs together and repeat.

HipAbductor/WtLyingHipAbduction.name: Weighted Lying Hip Abduction
HipAbductor/WtLyingHipAbduction.preparation: Sit on floor or mat with bar, plates loaded on one side. Sit on hip with knees bent and place bar on outside of shoe with weight plate(s) positioned beyond foot. Holding on to opposite end of bar, lie on side with weighted leg extended out straight and lower leg bent underneath.
HipAbductor/WtLyingHipAbduction.execution: Raise weighted leg up off ground as high as possible. Balance bar on side of foot while holding onto closest side of bar. Return to floor and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
HipAbductor/WtLyingHipAbduction.comments: Do not allow upper hip to fall behind upper hip throughout movement. See

HipAdductors/LVLyingHipAdduction.name: Lever Lying Hip Adduction
HipAdductors/LVLyingHipAdduction.preparation: Sit in machine with legs outside of vertical center pads. If available, place heels on foot bars. Lie back on back pad. Disengage and pull lever brace to position legs apart until slight stretch is felt. Engage lever into locked position. Lie back and grasp bars to sides.
HipAdductors/LVLyingHipAdduction.execution: Move legs together. Return and repeat.
HipAdductors/LVLyingHipAdduction.comments: Mount machine with leg levers together. Use lever to extend legs apart. See

HipAdductors/CBLyingHipAdduction.name: Cable Lying Hip Adduction
HipAdductors/CBLyingHipAdduction.preparation: Stand or sit in front of low pulley and attach cable cuff to ankle. Step away from pulley toward opposite pull, pulling weight plates up just far enough get next to opposite cable pulley. Attach other cable cuff to opposite ankle. Sit so hips are between both low pulley cables to each side. Lie down on back and lift legs up vertically.
HipAdductors/CBLyingHipAdduction.execution: Lower legs apart out to each side until stretch is felt in inner thigh. Raise legs together. Return and repeat.

HipAdductors/CBHipAdduction.name: Cable Hip Adduction
HipAdductors/CBHipAdduction.preparation: Stand in front of low pulley facing to one side. Attach cable cuff to near ankle. Step out away from stack with wide stance and grasp ballet bar. Stand on far foot and allow near leg to be Pulled toward low pulley.
HipAdductors/CBHipAdduction.execution: Move near leg just in front of far leg by abduction hip. Return and repeat. Turn around and continue with opposite leg.
HipAdductors/CBHipAdduction.comments: Notice cable pulley in use is out of view to left. Exerciser is holding on to ballet bar above opposite cable pulley, not in use. See

HipAdductors/LVSeatedHipAdduction.name: Lever Seated Hip Adduction
HipAdductors/LVSeatedHipAdduction.preparation: Sit in machine with legs outside of vertical center pads. If available, place heels on foot bars. Disengage and pull lever brace to position legs apart until slight stretch is felt. Engage lever into locked position. Lie back and grasp bars to sides.
HipAdductors/LVSeatedHipAdduction.execution: Move legs together. Return and repeat.
HipAdductors/LVSeatedHipAdduction.comments: Mount machine with leg levers together. Use lever to extend legs apart. See

HipAdductors/LVSeatedHipAdductionH.name: Lever Seated Hip Adduction (plate loaded)
HipAdductors/LVSeatedHipAdductionH.preparation: Sit on seat and lift one leg onto padded lever. Lean back onto back pad. Grasp handles attatched to leg levers. Push handles together and raise other leg onto other padded lever. Release leg lever handles and grasp other handles to each side.
HipAdductors/LVSeatedHipAdductionH.execution: Move legs together until leg levers make contact. Allow legs to seperate far apart until slight stretch and repeat.

HipAdductors/LVStandHipAdduction.name: Lever Standing Hip Adduction
HipAdductors/LVStandHipAdduction.preparation: Adjust platform so lever fulcrum is same height as hip articulation. Adjust roller pad to side position. Face machine and grasp bars to sides. Place inside of thigh on roller pad and remain standing on supporting leg.
HipAdductors/LVStandHipAdduction.execution: Move leg toward and across supporting leg Return and repeat. Reposition roller pad lever and continue with opposite leg.

HipAdductors/WTLyingHipAdduction.name: Weighted Lying Hip Adduction
HipAdductors/WTLyingHipAdduction.preparation: Sit on floor or mat with bar, weight plates loaded on one side. Sit on hip with knees bent and place bar on inside of shoe with weight plate beyond foot. Holding on to opposite end of bar, lie on side with weighted leg extended out straight and upper leg extended behind.
HipAdductors/WTLyingHipAdduction.execution: Raise weighted leg up off floor as high as possible while balanciong bar inside of foot and holding onto nearest side of bar. Return to floor and repeat. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.

HipExternalRotator/CBLyingHipExternalRot.name: Cable Lying Hip External Rotation
HipExternalRotator/CBLyingHipExternalRot.preparation: Attach cable ankle cuff to ankle, nearest low pulley. Lie prone with legs slightly apart and knee of attached leg bent 90°. Adjust position of legs slightly away from cable pulley so slight stretch is felt in hip.
HipExternalRotator/CBLyingHipExternalRot.execution: Keeping knee of attached leg bent approximately 90°, pull cable attachment toward opposite knee by rotating hip. Return until slight stretch is felt in hip, then repeat. Place ankle cuff on opposite leg and continue lying opposite direction.
HipExternalRotator/CBLyingHipExternalRot.comments: Exercise name is somewhat counter-intuitive since direction of rotation is relative to movement of hip, or thigh, not bent leg. For example, in this exercises,

HipExternalRotator/CBSeatedHipExternalRo.name: Cable Seated Hip External Rotation
HipExternalRotator/CBSeatedHipExternalRo.preparation: Sit on bench or chair with low pulley to side. Attach cable ankle cuff to ankle, nearest pulley. Place far stationary foot slightly forward. Grasp lower thigh of leg with attached cuff, position it along side thigh of stationary leg while keeping foot slightly above floor.
