HipExternalRotator/CBSeatedHipExternalRo.execution: Keeping knee of attached leg bent approximately 90°, pull cable attachment under thigh of stationary leg by rotating hip. Return until slight stretch is felt in hip, then repeat. Place ankle cuff on opposite leg and continue facing opposite direction.
HipExternalRotator/CBSeatedHipExternalRo.comments: Height of knee on exercising leg may require subtle adjustment during movement to permit clearance of traveling foot above floor. Gluteus Maximus will be activated as stabilizer on heavier loads when participant pushes stationary foot onto floor thereby anchoring lower body as hip adductors keep thighs together. Upper body muscles can also assist in keeping thigh of exercising leg along side stationary leg. Exercise name is somewhat counter-intuitive since direction of rotation is relative to movement of hip, or thigh, not bent leg. For example, in this exercises,

HipExternalRotator/LVKneelingHipExternal.name: Lever Kneeling Hip External Rotation (on hip adduction machine)
HipExternalRotator/LVKneelingHipExternal.preparation: Kneel backwards on seated adduction machine with insides of ankles positioned on outside of each leg pad. Reach down to disengage and pull lever brace to position feet apart until slight stretch is felt. Engage lever into locked position. Place hands on back pad.
HipExternalRotator/LVKneelingHipExternal.execution: Push levers together with legs by externally rotating hips. Return until slight stretch is felt in hip, then repeat.
HipExternalRotator/LVKneelingHipExternal.comments: Exercise name is somewhat counter-intuitive since direction of rotation is relative to movement of hips, or thighs, not bent legs. For example, in this exercises,

HipFlexors/BWHangingLegRaiseAbStrap.name: Hanging Leg Raise (with ab straps)
HipFlexors/BWHangingLegRaiseAbStrap.preparation: Stand below ab straps hanging from high bar. Place upper arms in straps and grasp straps above.
HipFlexors/BWHangingLegRaiseAbStrap.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed or knees are well above hips. Return until hips and knees are extended downward. Repeat.
HipFlexors/BWHangingLegRaiseAbStrap.comments: Exercise can be performed without ab straps, by

HipFlexors/BWHangingLegRaise.name: Hanging Leg Raise
HipFlexors/BWHangingLegRaise.preparation: Grasp and hang from high bar with slightly wider than shoulder width overhand grip.
HipFlexors/BWHangingLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed or knees are well above hips. Return until hips and knees are extended downward. Repeat.

HipFlexors/BWHangingStraightLegRaise.name: Hanging Straight Leg Raise
HipFlexors/BWHangingStraightLegRaise.preparation: Grasp and hang from high bar with slightly wider than shoulder width overhand grip.
HipFlexors/BWHangingStraightLegRaise.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until hips are completely flexed or knees are well above hips. Return until hips are extended downward. Repeat.

HipFlexors/BWInclineLegRaise.name: Incline Leg Raise
HipFlexors/BWInclineLegRaise.preparation: Lie supine on incline board with torso elevated. Grasp feet hooks or sides of board for support.
HipFlexors/BWInclineLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/BWInclineLegRaiseArmPads.name: Incline Leg Raise (arms on pads)
HipFlexors/BWInclineLegRaiseArmPads.preparation: Lie back on incline board. Grasp handles and place forearms on arm pads to each side.
HipFlexors/BWInclineLegRaiseArmPads.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/BWInclineStraightLegRaise.name: Incline Straight Leg Raise
HipFlexors/BWInclineStraightLegRaise.preparation: Sit on incline board. Lie supine on incline board with torso elevated. Grasp feet rollers or sides of board for support.
HipFlexors/BWInclineStraightLegRaise.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until hips are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/BWInclineStraightLegRaiseArmP.name: Incline Straight Leg Raise (arms on pads)
HipFlexors/BWInclineStraightLegRaiseArmP.preparation: Lie back on incline board. Grasp handles and place forearms on arm pads to each side.
HipFlexors/BWInclineStraightLegRaiseArmP.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until hips are flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/BWJackKnifeBall.name: Jack-knife on Ball
HipFlexors/BWJackKnifeBall.preparation: Kneel with chest or waist on exercise ball. Dive over top and place hands on floor with arms extended down supporting upper body. While keeping body horizontal, walk hands further away from ball until shins are positioned on top of ball. With arms vertical and straight, support body off of floor with body straight. See suggested
HipFlexors/BWJackKnifeBall.comments: Bend hips and knees, allowing shins to roll over top of ball. Pull knees toward chest until heels are under or near glutes. Return by extending hips and knees to original position. Repeat.

HipFlexors/BWJackKnifeWheel.name: Jack-knife on Power Wheel
HipFlexors/BWJackKnifeWheel.execution: kneel on floor. Place hands shoulder width apart on floor. With arms vertical and straight, support body off of floor while rolling

HipFlexors/BWKneelingWheelRollout.name: Wheel Rollout
HipFlexors/BWKneelingWheelRollout.preparation: Kneel on floor or mat. Grasp handles on wheel to each side with overhand grip. Position wheel near front of knees and lean over wheel with arms extended downward, supporting upper body.
HipFlexors/BWKneelingWheelRollout.execution: With arms straight, roll wheel out as far as possible. Lower body gently to floor extending arms forward. Raise body back up by flexing hips and pulling arms back to original position. Return until hips are extended. Repeat.
HipFlexors/BWKneelingWheelRollout.comments: Keep elbows straight or nearly straight throughout exercise. Also known as Wheel Kneeling Rollout. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques practically contract

HipFlexors/BWLyingLegRaise.name: Lying Leg Raise (on bench)
HipFlexors/BWLyingLegRaise.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Place hands under lower buttock on each side to support pelvis.
HipFlexors/BWLyingLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until thighs are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/BWLyingLegRaiseFloor.name: Lying Leg Raise (on floor)
HipFlexors/BWLyingLegRaiseFloor.preparation: Lie supine on mat or floor. Place hands under lower buttock on each side to support pelvis.
HipFlexors/BWLyingLegRaiseFloor.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until thighs are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/BWPikeDiscs.name: Pike on Discs
HipFlexors/BWPikeDiscs.preparation: Kneel on floor with forefeet on
HipFlexors/BWPikeDiscs.execution: . Place hands shoulder width apart on floor. With arms vertical and straight, support body off of floor while sliding

HipFlexors/BWPikeWheel.name: Pike on Power Wheel
HipFlexors/BWPikeWheel.execution: kneel on floor. Place hands shoulder width apart on floor. With arms vertical and straight, support body off of floor while rolling

HipFlexors/BWRomanChairSitup.name: Roman Chair Sit-up
HipFlexors/BWRomanChairSitup.preparation: Sit on chair or bench with lower leg secured under low over hang or heavy bar. Place hands on waist, chest, neck, or head depending upon desired difficulty.
HipFlexors/BWRomanChairSitup.execution: Lower body back until hips are almost extended. Raise body by flexing hips until torso is upright. Repeat.
HipFlexors/BWRomanChairSitup.comments: Feet must be propped securely to prevent injury. Exercise can also be performed on

HipFlexors/BWScissorKick.name: Lying Scissor Kick
HipFlexors/BWScissorKick.preparation: Lie supine on bench or mat. Place hands under lower buttock on each side to support pelvis. Raise one leg up vertical with knee nearly straight. If lying on floor, raise other leg slightly off of floor.
HipFlexors/BWScissorKick.execution: Keeping knees nearly straight, simultaneously change positions of legs so vertical leg is lowered while lower leg is raised vertically. Continue alternating leg positions.

HipFlexors/BWSeatedLegRaise.name: Seated Leg Raise
HipFlexors/BWSeatedLegRaise.preparation: Sit on edge of bench with legs extended to floor. Place weight between ankles or use no weight. Grasp edge of bench. Lean torso back and balance body weight on edge of bench.
HipFlexors/BWSeatedLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees while pulling torso slightly forward to maintain balance. Return by extending hips and knees and lean torso back to counter balance. Repeat.
HipFlexors/BWSeatedLegRaise.comments: Heels may make contact with floor to maintain balance at bottom of movement. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques only

HipFlexors/BWSimAltLyingLegRaise.name: Lying Simultaneous Alternating Leg Raise
HipFlexors/BWSimAltLyingLegRaise.preparation: Lie supine on bench or mat. Place hands under lower buttock on each side to support pelvis. Raise bent leg up so lower leg is approximately horizonal above hip. If lying on floor, raise other leg slightly off of floor.
HipFlexors/BWSimAltLyingLegRaise.execution: Simultaneously change positions of legs, lowering and straightening raised leg down just above floor while raising and bending lower leg to opposite position. Continue alternating leg positions.

HipFlexors/BWStraightLegRaise.name: Lying Straight Leg Raise
HipFlexors/BWStraightLegRaise.preparation: Lie supine on bench or mat. Place hands under lower buttock on each side to support pelvis.
HipFlexors/BWStraightLegRaise.execution: Keeping knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until hips are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/BWSimAltStraightLegRaise.name: Lying Simultaneous Alternating Straight Leg Raise
HipFlexors/BWSimAltStraightLegRaise.preparation: Lie supine on bench or mat. Place hands under lower buttock on each side to support pelvis. Raise one leg up vertically with knee nearly straight. If lying on floor, raise other leg slightly off of floor.
HipFlexors/BWSimAltStraightLegRaise.execution: Keeping knees nearly straight, simultaneously change positions of legs so vertical leg is lowered while lower leg is raised vertically. Continue alternating leg positions.

HipFlexors/BWVerticalLegRaise.name: Vertical Leg Raise
HipFlexors/BWVerticalLegRaise.preparation: Position forearms on padded parallel bars with hands on handles, and back on vertical pad.
HipFlexors/BWVerticalLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed or knees are well above hips. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/BWVerticalLegRaisePB.name: Vertical Leg Raise (on parallel bars)
HipFlexors/BWVerticalLegRaisePB.preparation: Stand between parallel bars and grip bar on each side with overhand grip. Lift body off floor and balance body upright with arms straight.
HipFlexors/BWVerticalLegRaisePB.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/BWVerticalStraightLegRaise.name: Vertical Straight Leg Raise
HipFlexors/BWVerticalStraightLegRaise.preparation: Position forearms on padded parallel bars with hands on handles, and back on vertical pad.
HipFlexors/BWVerticalStraightLegRaise.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until thighs are just pass parallel to floor. Return until hips are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/CBAssistedKneelingWheelRollou.name: Cable Assisted Wheel Rollout
HipFlexors/CBAssistedKneelingWheelRollou.preparation: With ab wheel attached to cable via double looped strap attachment, straddle cable facing away from low pulley. Kneel with both knees on mat. Grasp handles on wheel to each side with overhand grip. Position wheel near front of knees and lean over wheel with arms extended downward, supporting upper body.
HipFlexors/CBAssistedKneelingWheelRollou.execution: With arms straight, roll wheel out as far as possible. Lower body gently to floor extending arms forward. Raise body back up by flexing hips and pulling arms back to original position. Return until hips are extended. Repeat.
HipFlexors/CBAssistedKneelingWheelRollou.comments: Keep elbows straight or nearly straight throughout exercise. Exercise can be performed

HipFlexors/CBLyingLegRaise.name: Cable Lying Leg Raise
HipFlexors/CBLyingLegRaise.preparation: Attach cable ankle straps to both ankles, then attach ankle straps to cable. Lie supine on floor or mat, back far enough so cable is taut. Grasp support behind head.
HipFlexors/CBLyingLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until thighs are just past perpendicular to torso or before hips raise off of bench. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/CBLyingLegRaiseBench.name: Cable Lying Leg Raise (on bench)
HipFlexors/CBLyingLegRaiseBench.preparation: Attach cable ankle straps to both ankles. Sit on end of bench facing pulley at bench height. Attach cable to both ankle straps. Lie supine on bench until cable is taut. Grasp sides of bench behind head.
HipFlexors/CBLyingLegRaiseBench.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until thighs are past perpendicular to torso or before hips raise off of bench. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.
HipFlexors/CBLyingLegRaiseBench.comments: Training partner or trainer may need to assist attaching ankle cuffs to cable. Ankle cuffs may also be attached to cable pulley in lowest position when feet are on floor, but assistance may be needed to raise pulley to bench height.

HipFlexors/CBLyingStraightLegRaise.name: Cable Lying Straight Leg Raise
HipFlexors/CBLyingStraightLegRaise.preparation: Attach cable ankle straps to both ankles, then attach ankle straps to cable. Lie supine on floor, mat, or bench back far enough so cable is taut. Grasp support behind head.
HipFlexors/CBLyingStraightLegRaise.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until thighs are just past perpendicular to torso or before hips raise off of mat. Return until hips are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/CBStandingLegRaise.name: Cable Standing Leg Raise
HipFlexors/CBStandingLegRaise.preparation: Attach cable ankle cuff to one ankle. Stand facing away from low pulley. Step  forward  with opposite leg so leg with cuff is pulled back. Grasp lateral bars or other prop for support.
HipFlexors/CBStandingLegRaise.execution: Raise knee by flexing hip while allowing lower leg to bend back under resistance. When thigh is just beyond horizontal, lower leg until hip and knee is extended. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
HipFlexors/CBStandingLegRaise.comments: Also known as Cable Standing Knee Raise. See

HipFlexors/CBStandingStraightLegRaise.name: Cable Standing Straight Leg Raise
HipFlexors/CBStandingStraightLegRaise.preparation: Stand facing away from low pulley. Place foot in cable boot or foot harness. Grasp lateral bars or other prop for support. Stand forward on free leg, allowing leg attached to cable to be pulled back.
HipFlexors/CBStandingStraightLegRaise.execution: Raise leg upward by flexing hip while keeping knee straight. Raise leg as high as possible. Lower leg to original starting position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
HipFlexors/CBStandingStraightLegRaise.comments: Since knee of moving leg is straight and waist flexion is impeded by standing leg, range of motion will be limit to

HipFlexors/LVHipFlexion.name: Lever Hip Flexion
HipFlexors/LVHipFlexion.preparation: Stand on platform facing to one side and grasp bar for support. Position front of leg nearest to machine against padded roller while standing on other leg.
HipFlexors/LVHipFlexion.execution: Raise lever by flexing hip until knee is higher than hip. Return until hip is extended. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
HipFlexors/LVHipFlexion.comments: Machine must be adjusted to align hip with lever fulcrum. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques only

HipFlexors/LVLyingLegRaiseN.name: Lever Lying Leg Raise
HipFlexors/LVLyingLegRaiseN.preparation: Sit on end of bench with both legs over padded lever and hips aligned with fulcrum. Strap legs onto padded lever. Lie supine on bench. Grasp handles near head.
HipFlexors/LVLyingLegRaiseN.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips until they are completely flexed. Lower legs until hips are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/LVVerticalLegRaise.name: Lever Vertical Leg Raise
HipFlexors/LVVerticalLegRaise.preparation: Grasp handles slightly to front and stand on foot bar with knees slightly bent and hips against pad.
HipFlexors/LVVerticalLegRaise.execution: With back straight, raise legs as high as possible by flexing hips. Return and repeat.
HipFlexors/LVVerticalLegRaise.comments: Exercise is typically performed without added resistance. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques only

HipFlexors/STMountainClimber.name: Suspended Mountain Climber
HipFlexors/STMountainClimber.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Place right foot in left lower loop. Cross left leg over right leg placed in right lower loop. Turn body to right and place hands on floor, shoulder width apart. Turn body to kneel on hands and knees. Reposition hands (shoulder width or slightly wider) at desired distance from suspension trainer so that body is square with suspension trainer straps. With arms straight, raise knees from ground so body is supported by arms and suspension trainer. Bend one leg so knee is pointing down while keeping other leg extended out straight.
HipFlexors/STMountainClimber.execution: Simultaneously alternate leg positions by straightening bent leg behind, while bending straight leg forward. Repeat.
HipFlexors/STMountainClimber.comments: Attempt to straighten hip each stroke, while maintaining approximate height of hips from floor throughout movement. Dismount by removing straps, while kneeling or after sitting on one side of hip before rotating body to seated position. See

HipFlexors/STPike.name: Suspended Pike
HipFlexors/STPike.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Place right foot in left lower loop. Cross left leg over right leg placed in right lower loop. Turn body to right and place hands on floor shoulder width apart. Turn body to kneel on hands and knees. Reposition hands (shoulder width or slightly wider) at desired distance from suspension trainer so that body is square with suspension trainer straps. With arms straight, raise knees from ground, so body is supported by arms and suspension trainer.
HipFlexors/STPike.execution: Raise rear end up as high as possible by bending hips. Pull feet toward hands, while keeping knees straight. Return by extending hips to original straight body position. Repeat.
HipFlexors/STPike.comments: Keep arms straight with shoulders positioned above hands. Dismount by removing straps while kneeling or after sitting on one side of hip before rotating body to seated position. See

HipFlexors/WtHangLegRaise.name: Weighted Hanging Leg Raise
HipFlexors/WtHangLegRaise.preparation: Place weight between ankles or use no weight. Grasp and hang from high bar.
HipFlexors/WtHangLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed or knees are well above hips. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/WtDeclineSitup.name: Weighted Decline Sit-up
HipFlexors/WtDeclineSitup.preparation: Sit on apparatus with lower leg secured under padded bar. Hold weight in front of chest (as shown) or
HipFlexors/WtDeclineSitup.comments: Lower body back until hips are almost extended. Raise body by flexing hips until torso is upright. Repeat.

HipFlexors/WtHangingStraightLegRaise.name: Weighted Hanging Straight Leg Raise
HipFlexors/WtHangingStraightLegRaise.preparation: Place weight between ankles or use no weight. Grasp and hang from high bar.
HipFlexors/WtHangingStraightLegRaise.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return until hips are extended downward. Repeat.

HipFlexors/WtInclineLegRaise.name: Weighted Incline Leg Raise
HipFlexors/WtInclineLegRaise.preparation: Sit on incline board. Place weight between feet or use no weight. Lie supine on incline board with torso elevated. Grasp feet hooks or sides of board for support.
HipFlexors/WtInclineLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/WtInclineLegRaiseArmPads.name: Weighted Incline Leg Raise (arms on pads)
HipFlexors/WtInclineLegRaiseArmPads.preparation: Sit on bottom edge of incline board and place weight between feet. Lie back on incline board. Grasp handles and place forearms on arm pads to each side.
HipFlexors/WtInclineLegRaiseArmPads.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/WtInclineStraightLegRaise.name: Weighted Incline Straight Leg Raise
HipFlexors/WtInclineStraightLegRaise.preparation: Sit on incline board. Place weight between ankles. Lie supine on incline board with torso elevated. Grasp feet hooks or sides of board for support.
HipFlexors/WtInclineStraightLegRaise.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until thighs are just past perpendicular to torso. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/WtInclineStraightLegRaiseArmP.name: Weighted Incline Straight Leg Raise (arms on pads)
HipFlexors/WtInclineStraightLegRaiseArmP.preparation: Sit on bottom edge of incline board and place weight between feet. Lie back on incline board. Grasp handles and place forearms on arm pads to each side.
HipFlexors/WtInclineStraightLegRaiseArmP.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until hips are flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/WtLyingLegRaise.name: Weighted Lying Leg Raise
HipFlexors/WtLyingLegRaise.preparation: Sit on end of bench. Place weight between feet. Lie supine on bench. Grasp bench on each side behind head for support.
HipFlexors/WtLyingLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.
HipFlexors/WtLyingLegRaise.comments: Exercise can be performed without added weight until more resistance is needed (see

HipFlexors/WtRomanChairSitup.name: Weighted Roman Chair Sit-up
HipFlexors/WtRomanChairSitup.preparation: Sit on apparatus with lower leg secured under padded bar. Hold weight to front of chest or behind neck or use no weight.
HipFlexors/WtRomanChairSitup.execution: Lower body back until hips are almost extended. Raise body by flexing hips until torso is upright. Repeat.

HipFlexors/WtSeatedLegRaise.name: Weighted Seated Leg Raise
HipFlexors/WtSeatedLegRaise.preparation: Sit on edge of bench with legs extended to floor. Place weight between ankles. Grasp edge of bench. Lean torso back and balance bodyweight on edge of bench.
HipFlexors/WtSeatedLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees while pulling torso slightly forward to maintain balance. Return by extending hips and knees and lean torso back to counter balance. Repeat.
HipFlexors/WtSeatedLegRaise.comments: Heels may make contact with floor to maintain balance at bottom of movement. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques only

HipFlexors/WtVerticalLegRaise.name: Weighted Vertical Leg Raise
HipFlexors/WtVerticalLegRaise.preparation: Place weight between ankles or use no weight. Position forearms on padded parallel bars with hands on handles, and back on vertical pad.
HipFlexors/WtVerticalLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed or knees are well above hips. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/WtVerticalLegRaisePB.name: Weighted Vertical Leg Raise (on parallel bars)
HipFlexors/WtVerticalLegRaisePB.preparation: Place weight between ankles. Stand between parallel bars and grip bar on each side with overhand grip. Lift body off floor and balance body upright with arms straight.
HipFlexors/WtVerticalLegRaisePB.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

HipFlexors/WtVerticalStraightLegRaise.name: Weighted Vertical Straight Leg Raise
HipFlexors/WtVerticalStraightLegRaise.preparation: Place weight between ankles or use no weight. Position forearms on padded parallel bars with hands on handles, and back on vertical pad.
HipFlexors/WtVerticalStraightLegRaise.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return until hips are extended. Repeat.

Infraspinatus/CBSeatedExternalRotation.name: Cable Seated Shoulder External Rotation
Infraspinatus/CBSeatedExternalRotation.preparation: Sit with side to low pulley. Grasp dumbbell cable attachment with far arm. Position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
Infraspinatus/CBSeatedExternalRotation.execution: Pull cable attachment away from body by externally rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Turn around and continue with opposite arm.
Infraspinatus/CBSeatedExternalRotation.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Exercise may be performed

Infraspinatus/CBStandingExternalRotation.name: Cable Standing Shoulder External Rotation
Infraspinatus/CBStandingExternalRotation.preparation: Stand with side to elbow height cable pulley. Grasp stirrup attachment with far arm. Position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
Infraspinatus/CBStandingExternalRotation.execution: Pull cable attachment away from body as far as possible by externally rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Turn around and continue with opposite arm.
Infraspinatus/CBStandingExternalRotation.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Exercise may be performed seated on chair with pulley lowered to elbow height or

Infraspinatus/DBInclineExternalRotation.name: Dumbbell Incline Shoulder External Rotation
Infraspinatus/DBInclineExternalRotation.preparation: Lie high up on low incline bench or reverse on decline bench on side with arm pit over leg pad (as demonstrated). Position legs lower on bench for support. Grasp dumbbell and position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
Infraspinatus/DBInclineExternalRotation.execution: Lift dumbbell upright above elbow by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Flip body over and continue with opposite arm.
Infraspinatus/DBInclineExternalRotation.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Position incline as low as possible so dumbbell can still be aligned against gravity.

Infraspinatus/CBUprightExternalRotation.name: Cable Upright Shoulder External Rotation
Infraspinatus/CBUprightExternalRotation.preparation: Stand facing low to medium height cable pulley. Grasp stirrup attachment and position bent elbow shoulder height out to side with forearm in line with cable.
Infraspinatus/CBUprightExternalRotation.execution: Pull stirrup up and back as far as possible. Return by lowering stirrup to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Infraspinatus/CBUprightExternalRotation.comments: Wrist may be kept straighter throughout movement than what is shown. Also, keep elbow at shoulder height and bent at right angle. Height of cable pulley is dependent upon:

Infraspinatus/DBLyingExternalRotation.name: Dumbbell Lying Shoulder External Rotation
Infraspinatus/DBLyingExternalRotation.preparation: Lie on side with legs separated for support. Grasp dumbbell and position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
Infraspinatus/DBLyingExternalRotation.execution: Lift dumbbell by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Flip over and continue with opposite arm.
Infraspinatus/DBLyingExternalRotation.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Placing towel roll under arm increase infraspinatus and teres minor EMG signal activity compared to no towel roll (Wilk KE 2002), although subsequent study found no significant difference (Reinold MM 2004). Also see

Infraspinatus/DBProneExternalRotation.name: Dumbbell Prone External Rotation
Infraspinatus/DBProneExternalRotation.preparation: Lie supine on bench with legs either on bench or down to each side. Grasp dumbbell with one hand and position forearm vertically with upper arm perpendicular to body.
Infraspinatus/DBProneExternalRotation.execution: Lift dumbbell forward and upward by externally rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Grasp with opposite hand, position bent arm out to side of body, and perform with other arm.
Infraspinatus/DBProneExternalRotation.comments: Maintain fixed 90° angle elbow position directly lateral to shoulder throughout exercise. Also see

Infraspinatus/DBSeatedExternalRotation.name: Dumbbell Seated Shoulder External Rotation
Infraspinatus/DBSeatedExternalRotation.preparation: Sit on bench. Place foot on other side of bench and other foot on floor with knees bent. Place upper elbow on knee with dumbbell positioned above knee.
Infraspinatus/DBSeatedExternalRotation.execution: Lower dumbbell downward toward lower leg by rotating shoulder until slight stretch is felt. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Infraspinatus/DBSeatedExternalRotation.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) in front of body, chest or shoulder height.

Infraspinatus/DBProneInclineExternalRota.name: Dumbbell Prone Incline External Rotation
Infraspinatus/DBProneInclineExternalRota.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench with legs extended down to each side. Grasp dumbbell with one hand and position forearm vertically with upper arm perpendicular to body.
Infraspinatus/DBProneInclineExternalRota.execution: Lift dumbbell forward and upward by externally rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Grasp with opposite hand, position bent arm out to side of body, and perform with other arm.
Infraspinatus/DBProneInclineExternalRota.comments: Maintain fixed 90° angle elbow position directly lateral to shoulder throughout exercise. Lower Trapezius acts as stabilizer at lower bench angles whereas Upper Trapezius may act as stabilizer and higher bench angles. Also see

Infraspinatus/DBUprightExternalRotation.name: Dumbbell Upright Shoulder External Rotation
Infraspinatus/DBUprightExternalRotation.preparation: Stand or sit with dumbbell positioned out to side of head; bend elbow, shoulder height with dumbbell above elbow.
Infraspinatus/DBUprightExternalRotation.execution: Lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Infraspinatus/DBUprightExternalRotation.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) out to side, shoulder height.

Infraspinatus/DBUprightExternalRotationS.name: Dumbbell Upright Shoulder External Rotation (with support)
Infraspinatus/DBUprightExternalRotationS.preparation: Stand or sit with side against chest height platform. With dumbbell in hand, position upper arm horizontally on platform, elbow bent so forearm is upright.
Infraspinatus/DBUprightExternalRotationS.execution: Lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Infraspinatus/DBUprightExternalRotationS.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) out to side, shoulder height.

Infraspinatus/LVExternalRotation.name: Lever Shoulder External Rotation
Infraspinatus/LVExternalRotation.preparation: Place elbow on forearm pad and grasp handle with upper arm to side of body and forearm against body.
Infraspinatus/LVExternalRotation.execution: Pull lever away from body. Return and repeat. Adjust lever to opposite side and repeat with other arm.
Infraspinatus/LVExternalRotation.comments: Adjust lever and body orientation to achieve full range of motion.

Infraspinatus/LVShoulderExternalRotation.name: Lever Shoulder External Rotation (plate loaded)
Infraspinatus/LVShoulderExternalRotation.preparation: Lie supine on section of bench nearest pads to each side. Position body so shoulders and elbows are aligned to fulcrum on each side. Place wrists or back of hands on under upper set of pads to each side.
Infraspinatus/LVShoulderExternalRotation.execution: Pull both lever arms back and down as far as possible to each side of head by simultaneously rotating upper arms. Lower lever arms to original position and repeat.
Infraspinatus/LVShoulderExternalRotation.comments: Those with shorter forearms whose wrists do not make contact with pad would utilize

Infraspinatus/LVUprightExternalRotation.name: Lever Upright Shoulder External Rotation
Infraspinatus/LVUprightExternalRotation.preparation: Lever should be forward with lever handle down. Push elbow pad forward with forearm, grasp handle with overhand grip. Sit on seat with arm pads and lever to side and position in elbow pad at shoulder height. With opposite hand, grasp seat handle if available, for added stability.
Infraspinatus/LVUprightExternalRotation.execution: Pull lever handle upward and back as far as possible by rotating upper arm. Lower lever to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Infraspinatus/LVUprightExternalRotation.comments: Exercise can also be performed with

Infraspinatus/STShoulderExternalRotation.name: Suspended Shoulder External Rotation
Infraspinatus/STShoulderExternalRotation.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and position bent elbows to each sides of waist.
Infraspinatus/STShoulderExternalRotation.execution: Step back until suspension straps are taut. While keeping bent elbows to side, step forward slightly so body reclines back behind suspension handles.
Infraspinatus/STShoulderExternalRotation.comments: Pull handles apart from each side, while keeping fixed elbow position and body and legs straight throughout movement. Raise forward so handles are to each side of body. Return back until handles come back together in front of body. Repeat.

Kettlebell/KBAlternatingSwingFlipCatch.name: Kettlebell Alternating Swing Flip Catch
Kettlebell/KBAlternatingSwingFlipCatch.comments: As kettlebell approaches shoulder height decelerate handle so kettlebell begins to tilt back. Release kettlebell allowing it to gain height and flip end over end. As soon as kettlebell handle rotates back to top, grasp kettlebell handle with opposite hand. Return kettlebell between legs. Fold at hips while bending knees so forearm makes contact with inner thigh. Allow kettlebell to swing back under hips.

Kettlebell/KBBentKneeWindmill.name: Kettlebell Bent-knee Windmill
Kettlebell/KBBentKneeWindmill.preparation: Raise kettlebell overhead. Stand with left arm fully extended upward, supporting kettlebell and right arm down to side. Stand with legs far apart with feet angled slightly out to the sides.
Kettlebell/KBBentKneeWindmill.execution: Bend over to right side and bend right knee. Reach toward arch of right foot with right hand. Keep left knee straight and kettlebell balanced over left shoulder with both arms extended. Slide right forearm along inner side of right lower leg until finger tips contact floor along side arch of foot. Raise back up to original position, maintaining balance of kettlebell overhead above left shoulder. Repeat. Continue movement on opposite side.
Kettlebell/KBBentKneeWindmill.comments: Exercise emphasizes load balance and shoulder mobility. Since weight is shifted more to bent leg, those hip articulations are emphasized over the straight leg. Also see slightly more challenging

Kettlebell/KBClean.name: Kettlebell Clean
Kettlebell/KBClean.preparation: Straddle kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Squat down with arm extended downward between legs and grasp kettlebell handle with overhand grip. Position shoulder over kettlebell with taut low back and trunk close to vertical.
Kettlebell/KBClean.execution: Pull kettlebell up off floor by extending hips and knees. Once kettlebell is off of ground, vigorously raise shoulder above kettlebell while keeping it close to body. Jump upward extending body. Raise shoulder and pull kettlebell upward with arm allowing elbow to bend out to side, keeping kettlebell close to body. Drop under kettlebell, rotating arm under kettlebell. Catch kettlebell on outside of arm with wrist straight while moving into partial squat position. Extend both legs.
Kettlebell/KBClean.comments: Drop kettlebell by pulling elbow back. Immediately hop upward with elbow pointed outward continuing to hold on to kettlebell handle as it falls. Decelerate decent of kettlebell as heels make contact with ground and arm straightens. Lower kettlebell to ground between legs while squatting down with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical.

Kettlebell/KBDeadlift.name: Kettlebell Deadlift
Kettlebell/KBDeadlift.preparation: Stand between two kettlebells. Squat down with feet flat and grasp handles to sides. Position shoulders over kettlebells with taut low back.
Kettlebell/KBDeadlift.execution: Pull kettlebells up off floor by extending hips and knees. Stand upright with chest high. Lower kettlebells to original position while squatting down with taut lower back.
Kettlebell/KBDeadlift.comments: Keep feet flat on floor, hips low, and back taut throughout lift. Knees should point sam   e direction as feet throughout movement. Do not jerk weight from floor. See

Kettlebell/KBCleanAndJerk.name: Kettlebell Clean and Press
Kettlebell/KBCleanAndJerk.execution: Straddle kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Squat down with arm extended downward between legs and grasp kettlebell handle with overhand grip. Position shoulder over kettlebell with taut low back and trunk close to vertical.

Kettlebell/KBFarmersWalk.name: Kettlebell Farmer's Walk
Kettlebell/KBFarmersWalk.preparation: Squat down between two heavy kettlebells and grasp one in each hand. Deadlift kettlebells from floor using legs. Stand holding kettlebells with arms straight down to sides.
Kettlebell/KBFarmersWalk.execution: Walk for distance while counting laps.
Kettlebell/KBFarmersWalk.comments: Suggested lifting and lower technique from floor will be similar to

Kettlebell/KBGobletSquat.name: Kettlebell Goblet Squat
Kettlebell/KBGobletSquat.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or wider stance. Hold kettleball by horns over chest with both hands.
Kettlebell/KBGobletSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Kettlebell/KBGobletSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Kettlebell/KBFrontSquat.name: Kettlebell Front Squat
Kettlebell/KBFrontSquat.preparation: Hold two kettlebells in front of shoulders, one with each arm positioned close to body. Stand with feet shoulder width or slightly wider.
Kettlebell/KBFrontSquat.execution: Bend knees slightly forward while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back taut and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Kettlebell/KBFrontSquat.comments: Wrist supporting kettlebell should be held straight. Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, arms straight to sides, and feet fl   at on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Kettlebell/KBOverheadRearLunge.name: Kettlebell Overhead Rear Lunge
Kettlebell/KBOverheadRearLunge.preparation: kettlebell over head. Stand with arm fully extended upward supporting kettlebell.
Kettlebell/KBOverheadRearLunge.execution: Step back with leg on opposite side of kettlebell while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat. Clean and Jerk weight with opposite arm and lunge on other leg.

Kettlebell/KBOverheadSplitSquat.name: Kettlebell Overhead Split Squat
Kettlebell/KBOverheadSplitSquat.preparation: kettlebell over head. Stand with feet far apart; leg on side of kettlebell should be placed behind and opposite foot should be positioned forward. Arm should be fully extended upward supporting kettlebell.
Kettlebell/KBOverheadSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly, until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Clean and Jerk weight with opposite arm and squat with other leg forward.
Kettlebell/KBOverheadSplitSquat.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

Kettlebell/KBPress.name: Kettlebell Press
Kettlebell/KBPress.execution: from floor and position in front of chest with kettlebell against outside of arm. Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder's width apart.
Kettlebell/KBPress.comments: Press kettlebell upward until arm is extended overhead. Lower to front of chest and repeat. Reposition kettlebell to opposite arm and continue.

Kettlebell/KBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Kettlebell Straight-leg Deadlift
Kettlebell/KBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand straddling kettlebell. With knees straight, bend over and grasp kettlebell handle.
Kettlebell/KBStraightLegDeadlift.execution: Lift kettlebell upward and back to side by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulder back if rounded. With knees straight, lower kettlebell between feet by bending hips and twisting waist so shoulder of weighted side is turned forward. Allow hips to fall back and waist to bend as kettlebell approaches floor. Repeat. Perform exercise with opposite arm.
Kettlebell/KBStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

Kettlebell/KBSnatch.name: Kettlebell Snatch
Kettlebell/KBSnatch.preparation: Stand behind kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Bend over at hip with knees bent and back straight. Extend arm downward and grasp kettlebell handle with overhand grip. Lift kettlebell off of floor and pull forearm against inner thighs while keeping hips and knees bent with low back taut.
Kettlebell/KBSnatch.execution: Drive hips forward, torso upright, and knees straight so kettlebell is pushed forward and upward. As kettlebell begins to swing forward vigorously raise shoulder above kettlebell. As kettlebell begins to swing up past the hips, pull kettlebell toward body slightly with elbow pointing outward. As the kettlebell continues to rise slightly, decelerate rise of handle allowing kettlebell to rotate in hand into inverted position. Punch kettlebell upward in an overhead straight arm position with kettlebell positioned behind forearm.
Kettlebell/KBSnatch.comments: Swing kettlebell forward and downward. As kettlebell is swung to lower position, fold at hips while bending knees. Allow forearm to make contact with inner thigh, swing kettlebell back under hips, and repeat movement. To stop exercise, place kettlebell on floor. Continue with opposite arm.

Kettlebell/KBSplitSnatch.name: Kettlebell Split Snatch
Kettlebell/KBSplitSnatch.preparation: Stand behind kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Bend over at hip with knees bent and back straight. Extend arm downward and grasp kettlebell handle with overhand grip. Lift kettlebell off of floor and pull forearm against inner thighs while keeping hips and knees bent with low back taut.
Kettlebell/KBSplitSnatch.execution: Drive hips forward, torso upright, and knees straight so kettlebell is pushed forward and upward. As kettlebell begins to swing forward vigorously raise shoulder above kettlebell. As kettlebell begins to swing up past the hips, pull kettlebell toward body with elbow pointing outward and initiate jump into split position. As kettlebell continues to rise, decelerate rise of handle allowing kettlebell to rotate in hand into inverted position. Land on feet in lunge position. Punch kettlebell upward in overhead straight arm position with kettlebell positioned behind forearm.
Kettlebell/KBSplitSnatch.comments: Stand up and begin positioning feet together while swinging kettlebell downward from overhead.

Kettlebell/KBSumoDeadlift.name: Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift
Kettlebell/KBSumoDeadlift.preparation: Straddle kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Squat down with arms extended downward between legs and grasp kettlebell handle with overhand grip with both hands. Position shoulders over kettlebell with taut low back and trunk close to vertical.
Kettlebell/KBSumoDeadlift.execution: Pull kettlebell up off floor by extending hips and knees. Stand upright with chest high. Lower kettlebell to ground between legs while squatting down with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical.
Kettlebell/KBSumoDeadlift.comments: Keep feet flat on floor, hips low, and back taut thoughout lift. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Do not jerk weight from floor. Also see

Kettlebell/KBSwing.name: Kettlebell Swing
Kettlebell/KBSwing.preparation: Stand behind kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Bend over at hip with knees bent and back straight. Extend arm downward and grasp kettlebell handle with overhand grip. Lift kettlebell off of floor and pull forearm against inner thighs while keeping hips and knees bent with low back taut.
Kettlebell/KBSwing.execution: Drive hips forward, torso upright, and knees straight so kettlebell is pushed forward and upward. Allow kettlebell to swing back down. As kettlebell approaches lower position, fold at hips while bending knees. Forearm makes contact with inner thigh permitting kettlebell to   swing back under hips. Immediately repeat movement and continue to swing kettlebell. Maintain shoulder to eye level height swings.
Kettlebell/KBSwing.comments: Swing kettlebell back down between legs. Allow kettlebell to swing forward, but do not extend hips and knees (as would be required to continue the swing). Slow kettlebell's swing and place on floor in original deadlift posture.

Kettlebell/KBTurkishGetup.name: Kettlebell Turkish Get-up
Kettlebell/KBTurkishGetup.preparation: Lie supine on floor with kettlebell positioned next to right upper arm. Grasp handle with bent right arm.
Kettlebell/KBTurkishGetup.comments: Keep arm supporting kettlebell fully extended over shoulder throughout movement except when lifting and lowering it from floor in lying position. In seated position, keep chest high with spine extended.

Kettlebell/KBTwoArmOverheadSwing.name: Kettlebell Two Arm Overhead Swing
Kettlebell/KBTwoArmOverheadSwing.preparation: Stand behind kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Bend over at hip with knees bent and back straight. Extend arms downward and grasp kettlebell handle with both hands using overhand grip. Lift kettlebell off of floor and pull forearms against inner thighs while keeping hips and knees bent with low back taut.
Kettlebell/KBTwoArmOverheadSwing.execution: Drive hips forward, torso upright, and knees straight so kettlebell is pushed forward and upward overhead. Allow kettlebell to swing back down. As kettlebell approaches lower position, fold at hips while bending knees. Forearms make contact with inner thighs permitting kettlebell to swing back under hips. Immediately repeat movement and continue to swing kettlebell.
Kettlebell/KBTwoArmOverheadSwing.comments: Swing kettlebell back down between legs. Allow kettlebell to swing forward but do not extend hips and knees (as would be required to continue the swing). Slow kettlebell's swing and place on floor in original deadlift posture.

Kettlebell/KBTwoArmSwing.name: Kettlebell Two Arm Swing
Kettlebell/KBTwoArmSwing.preparation: Stand behind kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Bend over at hip with knees bent and back straight. Extend arms downward and grasp kettlebell handle with both hands using overhand grip. Lift kettlebell off of floor and pull forearms against inner thighs while keeping hips and knees bent with low back taut.
Kettlebell/KBTwoArmSwing.execution: Drive hips forward, torso upright, and knees straight so kettlebell is pushed forward and upward. Allow kettlebell to swing back down. As kettlebell approaches lower position, fold at hips while bending knees. Forearms make contact with inner thighs permitting kettlebell to swing back under hips. Immediately repeat movement and continue to swing kettlebell. Maintain shoulder to eye level height swings.
Kettlebell/KBTwoArmSwing.comments: Swing kettlebell back down between legs. Allow kettlebell to swing forward but do not extend hips and knees (as would be required to continue the swing). Slow kettlebell's swing and place on floor in original deadlift posture.

LatissimusDorsi/ASChinupBand.name: Band-assisted Chin-up
LatissimusDorsi/ASChinupBand.preparation: Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip while keeping banded leg straight.
LatissimusDorsi/ASChinupBand.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/ASChinupBand.comments: At conclusion of set, step down with free foot at bottom of exercises. Dismount band by grasping each side of exercise band, stretch exercise band down, and step out. Continuing to hold on to each side of band while allowing band to contract to normal length.

Kettlebell/KBWindmill.name: Kettlebell Windmill
Kettlebell/KBWindmill.preparation: Raise kettlebell over head. Stand with left arm fully extended upward supporting kettlebell and right arm extended out to side. Stand with legs far apart with feet angled slightly out to the sides.
Kettlebell/KBWindmill.execution: Bend over to right side with knees straight. Reach toward toes of left foot with right hand. Keep knees straight and kettlebell balanced over left shoulder with both arms extended. Touch left foot. Raise back up to original position, maintaining balance of kettlebell over head above left shoulder. Repeat. Continue movement on opposite side.
Kettlebell/KBWindmill.comments: Exercise emphasizes load balance, shoulder mobility, and hamstring flexibility. Also see

Kettlebell/KBTwoArmSwingCatch.name: Kettlebell Two Arm Swing Catch
Kettlebell/KBTwoArmSwingCatch.comments: As kettlebell rises vertically in front of chest, pull kettlebell inward slightly and quickly release grip. Immediately rotate wrists while pointing bent elbows downward. As kettlebell begins to fall back down, grasp kettlebell handle with both hands with underhand grip. Immediately bend over at hips while bending knees. Allow arms to straighten and forearms to make contact with inner thighs while kettlebell swings back under hips.

LatissimusDorsi/ASNeutralGripChinupBand.name: Band-assisted Neutral Grip Chin-up
LatissimusDorsi/ASNeutralGripChinupBand.preparation: Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp bars angled inward with underhand shoulder width grip while keeping banded leg straight.
LatissimusDorsi/ASNeutralGripChinupBand.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/ASNeutralGripChinupBand.comments: At conclusion of set, step down with free foot at bottom of exercises. Dismount band by grasping each side of exercise band, stretch exercise band down, and step out. Continuing to hold on to each side of band while allowing band to contract to normal length.

LatissimusDorsi/ASOpenCenteredPullupBand.name: Band-assisted Open Centered Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/ASOpenCenteredPullupBand.preparation: Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and place bent knee inside of band. Stretch band down further by pointing knee downward. Reach up and grasp bars to each side with wide overhand grip.
LatissimusDorsi/ASOpenCenteredPullupBand.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/ASOpenCenteredPullupBand.comments: Range of motion will decrease if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/ASNeutralGripPullupFootB.name: Band-assisted Neutral Grip Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/ASNeutralGripPullupFootB.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/ASNeutralGripPullupFootB.comments: Special angled pull-up bar assembly is shown.

LatissimusDorsi/ASParallelGripPullupBand.name: Band-assisted Parallel Grip Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/ASParallelGripPullupBand.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/ASParallelGripPullupBand.comments: To increase difficulty, use thinner band or place bent knee onto bottom inside of band. See video Band-assisted

LatissimusDorsi/ASPullupBand.name: Band-assisted Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/ASPullupBand.preparation: Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip while keeping banded leg straight.
LatissimusDorsi/ASPullupBand.execution: Pull body up until chin is above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/ASPullupBand.comments: Free foot can be placed on top of foot in band for safety in case band slips from foot. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/ASRearPullupSelf.name: Self-assisted Rear Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/ASRearPullupSelf.preparation: Grasp bar with overhand wide grip. Position forefeet on floor just behind low bar or on bench just behind high bar.
LatissimusDorsi/ASRearPullupSelf.execution: Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent allowing knees to bend. Pull body up until bar touches back of neck, again with minimal assistance from lower body. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/ASRearPullupSelf.comments: If bar is too low, knees may need to spread apart at bottom of motion (as shown) to achieve full range of motion. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/ASRearPullupBand.name: Band-assisted Rear Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/ASRearPullupBand.preparation: Grasp middle of hanging exercise band and pull down to side of leg. Lift foot and hook band under heel. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Face perpendicular under pullup bar and position band behind body. Pull band apart and place other foot onto band so both feet are together inside of band. Reach up and grasp pull-up bar with overhand wide grip while keeping legs straight.
LatissimusDorsi/ASRearPullupBand.execution: Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/ASRearPullupBand.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/AsChinupPartner.name: Partner-assisted Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/AsChinupPartner.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Bend knees so partner can assist from behind.
LatissimusDorsi/AsChinupPartner.execution: Pull body up until chin is just above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/AsChinupPartner.comments: Partner can assist as needed by pulling ankles or top feet up from behind. Exercise can be used until

LatissimusDorsi/AsChinupSelf.name: Self-assisted Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/AsChinupSelf.preparation: Stand facing fixed horizontal bar at neck height. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Position feet forward on floor, slightly in front of bar.
LatissimusDorsi/AsChinupSelf.execution: Lower body under bar until arms and shoulders are fully extended. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees and hips to bend, keeping flat on floor. Pull body up until chin is just above bar, again with minimal assistance from legs. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/AsChinupSelf.comments: If lower body is used for assistance,

LatissimusDorsi/AsCloseGripChinupKneelin.name: Machine-assisted Parallel Close Grip Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/AsCloseGripChinupKneelin.preparation: Step up and grasp parallel grips. Kneel on padded platform and lower body down with arm extended.
LatissimusDorsi/AsCloseGripChinupKneelin.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/AsCloseGripChinup.name: Machine-assisted Parallel Close Grip Pull-up (standing)
LatissimusDorsi/AsCloseGripChinup.preparation: Step up and grasp parallel grips. Step down onto assistance lever or platform.
LatissimusDorsi/AsCloseGripChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/AsPullupKneeling.name: Machine-assisted Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/AsPullupKneeling.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Kneel on padded platform and lower body down with arm extended.
LatissimusDorsi/AsPullupKneeling.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/AsPullupOpen.name: Machine-assisted Pull-up (open-centered bar, standing)
LatissimusDorsi/AsPullupOpen.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Step down onto assistance lever or platform.
LatissimusDorsi/AsPullupOpen.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/AsPullupOpen.comments: Some assisted machines require you to

LatissimusDorsi/AsRearPullupPartner.name: Partner-assisted Rear Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/AsRearPullupPartner.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip. Bend knees so partner can assist from behind.
LatissimusDorsi/AsRearPullupPartner.execution: Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/AsRearPullupPartner.comments: Partner can assist as needed by pulling ankles or top feet up from behind. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/AsPullupOpenKneeling.name: Machine-assisted Pull-up (open-centered bar)
LatissimusDorsi/AsPullupOpenKneeling.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Kneel on padded platform and lower body down with arm extended.
LatissimusDorsi/AsPullupOpenKneeling.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/AsUnderhandChinup.name: Machine-assisted Chin-up
LatissimusDorsi/AsUnderhandChinup.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip. Kneel onto platform or step onto bar.
LatissimusDorsi/AsUnderhandChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/AsUnderhandChinupPartner.name: Partner-assisted Chin-up
LatissimusDorsi/AsUnderhandChinupPartner.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip. Bend knees so partner can assist from behind.
LatissimusDorsi/AsUnderhandChinupPartner.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides or chin is just above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/AsUnderhandChinupPartner.comments: Partner can assist as needed by pulling ankles or top feet up from behind. Also see

LatissimusDorsi/BBBentArmPullover.name: Barbell Bent Arm Pullover
LatissimusDorsi/BBBentArmPullover.preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent approximately 90°.
LatissimusDorsi/BBBentArmPullover.execution: With elbow bent, lower bar over and just behind head until upper arm is approximately parallel to torso. Return and repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/BBBentArmPullover.comments: Keep elbows bent approximately 90° throughout exercise. Keep hips from raising up significantly. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see

LatissimusDorsi/AsUnderhandChinupSelf.name: Self-assisted Chin-up
LatissimusDorsi/AsUnderhandChinupSelf.preparation: Stand facing fixed horizontal bar at neck height. Grasp bar with underhand grip shoulder width. Position feet forward on floor, slightly in front of bar.
LatissimusDorsi/AsUnderhandChinupSelf.execution: Lower body under bar until arms and shoulders are fully extended. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees and hips to bend, keeping flat on floor. Pull body up until elbows are to sides, again with minimal assistance from lower body. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/AsUnderhandChinupSelf.comments: If lower body is used for assistance,

LatissimusDorsi/BBPullover.name: Barbell Pullover
LatissimusDorsi/BBPullover.preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent slightly.
LatissimusDorsi/BBPullover.execution: With elbows bent slightly, lower bar over and beyond head until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are approximately parallel to torso. Return and repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/BBPullover.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see

LatissimusDorsi/BWCloseGripChinup.name: Parallel Close Grip Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/BWCloseGripChinup.preparation: Step up and grasp parallel bars.
LatissimusDorsi/BWCloseGripChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/BWCloseGripChinup.comments: To decrease difficulty, use assisted version of this exercise.

LatissimusDorsi/BWNeutralGripChinup.name: Neutral Grip Chin-up
LatissimusDorsi/BWNeutralGripChinup.preparation: Reach up and grasp bars angled inward with underhand shoulder width grip.
LatissimusDorsi/BWNeutralGripChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/BWNeutralGripChinup.comments: To decrease difficulty, use assisted version of exercise.

LatissimusDorsi/BWPullupN.name: Neutral Grip Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/BWPullupN.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with neutral grip.
LatissimusDorsi/BWPullupN.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/BWPullupN.comments: Special angled pull-up bar assembly is shown.

LatissimusDorsi/BWPullup.name: Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/BWPullup.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip.
LatissimusDorsi/BWPullup.execution: Pull body up until chin is above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/BWPullup.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/BWPullupOpen.name: Pull-up (open-centered bar)
LatissimusDorsi/BWPullupOpen.preparation: Reach up and grasp bars to each side with wide overhand grip.
LatissimusDorsi/BWPullupOpen.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/BWPullupOpen.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/BWUnderhandChinup.name: Chin-up
LatissimusDorsi/BWUnderhandChinup.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip.
LatissimusDorsi/BWUnderhandChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/BWUnderhandChinup.comments: To decrease difficulty, use assisted version of exercise.

LatissimusDorsi/BWRearPullup.name: Rear Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/BWRearPullup.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip.
LatissimusDorsi/BWRearPullup.execution: Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/BWRearPullup.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/CBAlternatingCloseGripPu.name: Cable Alternating Close Grip Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/CBAlternatingCloseGripPu.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/CBAlternatingCloseGripPu.execution: Pull down one cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.

LatissimusDorsi/CBAlternatingPulldown.name: Cable Alternating Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/CBAlternatingPulldown.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/CBAlternatingPulldown.execution: Pull down one cable attachment to front side shoulder. Return until arm and shoulder are fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.

LatissimusDorsi/CBAlternatingStandingPul.name: Cable Alternating Standing Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/CBAlternatingStandingPul.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Lean forward and step back with one foot so stance is staggered. Position hands with underhand or neutral grip.
LatissimusDorsi/CBAlternatingStandingPul.execution: Pull down one cable attachment to front of shoulder. Return until arm and shoulder are fully extended. Repeat movement with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
LatissimusDorsi/CBAlternatingStandingPul.comments: Video shows appartus with stirrups attached to dual pulley.

LatissimusDorsi/CBBentoverPullover.name: Cable Bent-over Pullover
LatissimusDorsi/CBBentoverPullover.preparation: Face high pulley and grasp revolving cable attachment with arm slightly bent. Place one foot slightly back and bend over at hip until shoulder is fully flexed (upper arms at sides of head).
LatissimusDorsi/CBBentoverPullover.execution: With elbows fixed approximately 30°, pull cable attachment down until upper arms are to sides. Return attachment overhead. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/CBBentoverPullover.comments: Fix elbows approximately 30° throughout exercise. Also known as Straight Arm Pulldown.

LatissimusDorsi/CBCloseGripPulldown.name: Cable Close Grip Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/CBCloseGripPulldown.preparation: Grasp parallel cable attachment. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/CBCloseGripPulldown.execution: Pull down cable attachment to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/CBCloseGripPulldown.comments: Exercise can be performed with V-Bar or Multi-exercise Bar.

LatissimusDorsi/CBCloseGripPulldownStirr.name: Cable Close Grip Pulldown (stirrups)
LatissimusDorsi/CBCloseGripPulldownStirr.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/CBCloseGripPulldownStirr.execution: Pull down cable attachments to sides of chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/CBFrontPulldown.name: Cable Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/CBFrontPulldown.preparation: Grasp cable bar with wide grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/CBFrontPulldown.execution: Pull down cable bar to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/CBFrontPulldown.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/CBFrontPulldownProLatBar.name: Cable Pulldown (pro lat bar)
LatissimusDorsi/CBFrontPulldownProLatBar.preparation: Grasp pro lat bar with wide parallel grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/CBFrontPulldownProLatBar.execution: Pull down cable bar to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/CBFrontPulldownProLatBar.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/CBKneelingBentoverPullov.name: Cable Kneeling Bent-over Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/CBKneelingBentoverPullov.preparation: Kneel on mat slightly away from high pulley. Grasp cable rope attachment with both hands. Sit with hips back and bend down by flexing hips so torso is bent over at approximately 30º angle. Allow resistance on cable pulley to pull arms upward with elbows bent.
LatissimusDorsi/CBKneelingBentoverPullov.execution: Pull cable rope down until elbows are back and inside of rope attachment is behind neck. Return attachment over head until shoulder is completely flexed upward. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/CBKneelingBentoverPullov.comments: Keep hips and torso in same position throughout movement.

LatissimusDorsi/CBOneArmKneelingPulldown.name: Cable One Arm Kneeling Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/CBOneArmKneelingPulldown.preparation: Grasp stirrup in one hand and kneel on floor.
LatissimusDorsi/CBOneArmKneelingPulldown.execution: Pull down cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. Repeat and continue with other arm.
LatissimusDorsi/CBOneArmKneelingPulldown.comments: Muscles listed as Stabilizers become Synergists if

LatissimusDorsi/CBOneArmPulldown.name: Cable One Arm Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/CBOneArmPulldown.preparation: Grasp stirrup in one hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/CBOneArmPulldown.execution: Pull down cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. Repeat and continue with other arm.
LatissimusDorsi/CBOneArmPulldown.comments: Muscles listed as Stabilizers become Synergists if

LatissimusDorsi/CBParallelCloseGripChinu.name: Cable Parallel Close Grip Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/CBParallelCloseGripChinu.preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel as close as possible to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt in front between legs. Step up and grasp close grip p   arallel bars with hands facing inward. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
LatissimusDorsi/CBParallelCloseGripChinu.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/CBParallelCloseGripChinu.comments: If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.

LatissimusDorsi/CBParallelGripChinup.name: Cable Parallel Grip Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/CBParallelGripChinup.preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel as close as possible to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt in front between legs. Step up and grasp parallel bars with hands facing inward. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
LatissimusDorsi/CBParallelGripChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/CBParallelGripChinup.comments: This particular apparatus could arguably be referred to as lever machine since dip belt attaches to lever arm, although relatively free movement between lever and dip belt offers qualities similar to cable machine. If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.

LatissimusDorsi/CBParallelGripPulldown.name: Cable Parallel Grip Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/CBParallelGripPulldown.preparation: Grasp parallel cable attachment. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/CBParallelGripPulldown.execution: Pull down cable attachment to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/CBParallelGripPulldown.comments: Parallel Grip Cable Attachment is shorter than

LatissimusDorsi/CBPulldownStirrups.name: Cable Pulldown (stirrups)
LatissimusDorsi/CBPulldownStirrups.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/CBPulldownStirrups.execution: Pull down cable attachments to front sides of shoulders. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/CBPullover.name: Cable Pullover
LatissimusDorsi/CBPullover.preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly, so hips are slightly lower than torso. Grasp revolving barbell cable attachment from behind. Pull to position cable attachment over chest. Fix elbows with small bend.
LatissimusDorsi/CBPullover.execution: Lower cable attachment toward pulley with elbows bent only slightly. Lower until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are in-line with upper torso. Raise cable attachment over head and continue toward lower body until cable becomes very close to head. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/CBPullover.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise.

LatissimusDorsi/CBPullup.name: Cable Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/CBPullup.preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt. Step up and grasp bars with overhand wide grip. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
LatissimusDorsi/CBPullup.execution: Pull body up until chin is above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/CBPullup.comments: If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/CBRearPulldown.name: Cable Rear Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/CBRearPulldown.preparation: Grasp cable bar with wide grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/CBRearPulldown.execution: Pull cable bar down behind neck. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/CBRearPulldown.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/CBRearPullup.name: Cable Rear Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/CBRearPullup.preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt. Step up and grasp bars with overhand wide grip. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
LatissimusDorsi/CBRearPullup.execution: Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/CBRearPullup.comments: If weight bottoms out at bottom of motion, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/CBSeatedStraightArmPullo.name: Cable Seated Pullover
LatissimusDorsi/CBSeatedStraightArmPullo.preparation: Sit on bench facing away from cable pulley apparatus. Grasp revolving cable attachment over head with overhand grip.
LatissimusDorsi/CBSeatedStraightArmPullo.execution: With elbows fixed with slight bend, pull cable attachment forward and down as far as possible. Return cable attachment forward and overhead. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/CBSeatedStraightArmPullo.comments: If cable attachment is too high, grasp attachment first, then sit down. Fix elbows approximately 30° throughout exercise. Also known as Cable Seated Straight Arm Pulldown.

LatissimusDorsi/CBSimultaneousAlternatin.name: Cable Simultaneous Alternating Standing Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/CBSimultaneousAlternatin.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Lean forward and step back with one foot so stance is staggered. Bend forward knee slightly. Position hands with underhand or neutral grip.
LatissimusDorsi/CBSimultaneousAlternatin.execution: Pull down left cable attachment to front of shoulder. Pull right cable attachment down to front of other shoulder while returning left cable attachment to front of shoulder. Repeat movement with both arms in opposite pattern by pulling left cable attachment while returning right pully attachment. Continuing by alternating movement pattern between sides.
LatissimusDorsi/CBSimultaneousAlternatin.comments: Video shows appartus with stirrups attached to dual pulley.

LatissimusDorsi/CBTwistingOverheadPull.name: Cable Twisting Standing Overhead Pull
LatissimusDorsi/CBTwistingOverheadPull.preparation: Stand facing very high pulley. Grasp stirrup in one hand and step back so arm is straight. With leg of opposite side as loaded arm, plant forefoot far back on floor. Slightly bend knee of forward leg, same direction as foot.
LatissimusDorsi/CBTwistingOverheadPull.execution: Pull down cable attachment to side of chest and rotate body toward side of pulling arm. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
LatissimusDorsi/CBTwistingOverheadPull.comments: In standing position, both spinal rotation and hip rotation contribute to body's rotation. Because rear leg is only supported by forefoot, hip of forward leg is utilized (hip

LatissimusDorsi/CBUnderhandChinup.name: Cable Chin-up
LatissimusDorsi/CBUnderhandChinup.preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt chains. Step up and grasp bars with shoulder width underhand grip. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
LatissimusDorsi/CBUnderhandChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/CBUnderhandChinup.comments: If weight bottoms out at bottom, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.

LatissimusDorsi/CBUnderhandPulldown.name: Cable Underhand Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/CBUnderhandPulldown.preparation: Grasp cable bar with underhand grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/CBUnderhandPulldown.execution: Pull down cable bar to upper chest until elbows are to sides. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/LVAltUnderhandPulldownS.name: Lever Alternating Underhand Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/LVAltUnderhandPulldownS.preparation: Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/LVAltUnderhandPulldownS.execution: Pull down one lever handle to side until elbow is down to side. Return until arm and shoulder are fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate pulldown between arms.
