LatissimusDorsi/LVCloseGripPulldown.name: Lever Close Grip Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/LVCloseGripPulldown.preparation: Grasp parallel lever bars. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/LVCloseGripPulldown.execution: Pull down handles to sides of chest while leaning back slightly. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/LVCloseGripPulldown.comments: can become slightly engaged when torso arches back.

LatissimusDorsi/LVCloseGripPulldown2.name: Lever Close Grip Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/LVCloseGripPulldown2.preparation: Grasp parallel lever bars. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/LVCloseGripPulldown2.execution: Pull down handles to sides of chest while leaning back slightly. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/LVCloseGripPulldown2.comments: can become slightly engaged when torso arches back.

LatissimusDorsi/LVCloseGripPulldownPL.name: Lever Close Grip Pulldown (plate-loaded)
LatissimusDorsi/LVCloseGripPulldownPL.preparation: Grasp handles and sit with thighs under padded supports.
LatissimusDorsi/LVCloseGripPulldownPL.execution: Pull down handles to sides of chest while leaning back slightly. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/LVCloseGripPulldownPL.comments: can become slightly engaged when torso arches back.

LatissimusDorsi/LVFrontPulldown.name: Lever Front Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/LVFrontPulldown.preparation: Grasp lever handles. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/LVFrontPulldown.execution: Pull down lever to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/LVFrontPulldownPL.name: Lever Front Pulldown (plate loaded)
LatissimusDorsi/LVFrontPulldownPL.preparation: Grasp lever bar with wide grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/LVFrontPulldownPL.execution: Pull down lever bar to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/LVFrontPulldownPL.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/LVIronCross.name: Lever Iron Cross
LatissimusDorsi/LVIronCross.preparation: Stand on platform and grasp handles to sides with palms down grip.
LatissimusDorsi/LVIronCross.execution: With arms straight, pull lever handles down below hips. Return lever handles upward just above shoulder high, or just before slight pressure in shoulder is felt. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/LVIronCross.comments: Platform should be adjusted so shoulder joint and girdle are approximate height as lever fulcrum. Also See

LatissimusDorsi/LVPulldown.name: Lever Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/LVPulldown.preparation: Sit on seat. Reach up and grasp handles with wide overhand grip.
LatissimusDorsi/LVPulldown.execution: Pull levers down to sides of shoulders. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/LVPulldown.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/LVPulldown2.name: Lever Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/LVPulldown2.preparation: Sit on seat. Reach up and grasp handles with overhand grip.
LatissimusDorsi/LVPulldown2.execution: Pull levers down to sides of shoulders. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/LVPulldownH.name: Lever Pulldown (plate loaded)
LatissimusDorsi/LVPulldownH.preparation: Grasp handles to each side with overhand grip. Sit on seat and position thighs under leg pads.
LatissimusDorsi/LVPulldownH.execution: Pull levers down to sides of shoulders. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/LVPulldownParallelGrip.name: Lever Pulldown (parallel grip)
LatissimusDorsi/LVPulldownParallelGrip.preparation: Sit on seat. Reach up and grasp parallel handles.
LatissimusDorsi/LVPulldownParallelGrip.execution: Pull levers down to sides of shoulders. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/LVPullover.name: Lever Pullover
LatissimusDorsi/LVPullover.preparation: Adjust seat height so lever is near shoulder axis. Sit on machine and push foot lever. Place elbows on pads and grasp bar from behind. Release foot lever and place feet on platform or to sides.
LatissimusDorsi/LVPullover.execution: Pull lever forward and down until elbows are to sides. Return until shoulders are fully flexed, or upper arms are parallel to torso. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/LVPullover.comments: When finished, push foot lever before releasing arm from lever. Release foot lever after releasing arm from lever. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility.

LatissimusDorsi/LVPulloverH.name: Lever Pullover (plate loaded)
LatissimusDorsi/LVPulloverH.preparation: Adjust seat height so lever is near shoulder axis. Sit on machine. Place elbows on pads and grasp bar from behind.
LatissimusDorsi/LVPulloverH.execution: Pull lever forward and down until elbows are to sides. Return until shoulders are fully flexed, or upper arms are parallel to torso. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/LVPulloverH.comments: Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility.

LatissimusDorsi/LVRearPulldownPL.name: Lever Rear Pulldown (plate loaded)
LatissimusDorsi/LVRearPulldownPL.preparation: Grasp lever bar with wide grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/LVRearPulldownPL.execution: Pull lever bar down behind neck. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/LVRearPulldownPL.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/LVUnderhandPulldown.name: Lever Underhand Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/LVUnderhandPulldown.preparation: Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/LVUnderhandPulldown.execution: Pull down lever handles to upper chest until elbows are to sides. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/LVUnderhandPulldownH.name: Lever Underhand Pulldown (plate loaded)
LatissimusDorsi/LVUnderhandPulldownH.preparation: Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/LVUnderhandPulldownH.execution: Pull down lever handles toward sides until elbows are to sides. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/LVUnderhandPulldownPL.name: Lever Underhand Pulldown (plate loaded)
LatissimusDorsi/LVUnderhandPulldownPL.preparation: Grasp lever bar with underhand grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/LVUnderhandPulldownPL.execution: Pull down lever handles toward sides until elbows are to sides. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/LVUnderhandPulldownS.name: Lever Underhand Pulldown
LatissimusDorsi/LVUnderhandPulldownS.preparation: Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
LatissimusDorsi/LVUnderhandPulldownS.execution: Pull down lever handles to sides until elbows are to sides. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/STPullup.name: Suspended Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/STPullup.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/STPullup.comments: This exercise can be performed on adjustable length gymnastics rings or a dual anchored suspension trainer where the handles can be placed a short distance apart. Performing this exercise on a TRXⓇ style suspension trainer would require a narrower grip, with the hands closer together.

LatissimusDorsi/STSelfAssistedPullup.name: Suspended Self-assisted Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/STSelfAssistedPullup.preparation: Stand facing suspension handles placed at neck height. Grasp handles and position feet forward on floor, slightly in front of handles.
LatissimusDorsi/STSelfAssistedPullup.execution: Lower body under handles until arms and shoulders are fully extended. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees and hips to bend, keeping flat on floor. Pull body up until chin is just above handles, again with minimal assistance from legs. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/STSelfAssistedPullup.comments: If lower body is used for assistance,

LatissimusDorsi/WtCloseGripChinup.name: Weighted Parallel Close Grip Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/WtCloseGripChinup.preparation: Step up and grasp close grip parallel bars.
LatissimusDorsi/WtCloseGripChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/WtCloseGripChinup.comments: Added weight can be placed on dip belt or dumbbell can be placed between ankles. Also see

LatissimusDorsi/WtNeutralGripChinup.name: Weighted Neutral Grip Chin-up
LatissimusDorsi/WtNeutralGripChinup.preparation: Reach up and grasp bars angled inward with underhand shoulder width grip.
LatissimusDorsi/WtNeutralGripChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/WtNeutralGripChinup.comments: Added weight can be placed on dip belt or dumbbell can be placed between ankles. Also see

LatissimusDorsi/WtPullupN.name: Weighted Neutral Grip Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/WtPullupN.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with neutral grip.
LatissimusDorsi/WtPullupN.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/WtPullupN.comments: Added weight can be placed on dip belt or dumbbell can be placed between ankles.  Also see

LatissimusDorsi/WtPullup.name: Weighted Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/WtPullup.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip.
LatissimusDorsi/WtPullup.execution: Pull body up until chin is above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

LatissimusDorsi/WtPullupOpen.name: Weighted Pull-up (open-centered bar)
LatissimusDorsi/WtPullupOpen.preparation: Reach up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
LatissimusDorsi/WtPullupOpen.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/WtPullupOpen.comments: Added weight can be placed on dip belt or dumbbell can be placed between ankles. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LatissimusDorsi/WtRearPullup.name: Weighted Rear Pull-up
LatissimusDorsi/WtRearPullup.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip.
LatissimusDorsi/WtRearPullup.execution: Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/WtRearPullup.comments: Added weight can be placed on dip belt (as shown) or

LatissimusDorsi/WtUnderhandChinup.name: Weighted Chin-up
LatissimusDorsi/WtUnderhandChinup.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip.
LatissimusDorsi/WtUnderhandChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
LatissimusDorsi/WtUnderhandChinup.comments: Added weight can be placed on dip belt or dumbbell can be placed between ankles. Also see

Obliques/BWAngledSideBridge.name: Angled Side Bridge
Obliques/BWAngledSideBridge.preparation: Place forearm on padded elevated surface, positioned perpendicular to body. Position feet out away from elevated surface, one foot in front of other with hips and knees straight. Place free hand on upper hip and allow lower hip and waist to bend downward.
Obliques/BWAngledSideBridge.comments: . Lower to original position and repeat. Repeat with opposite side.

Obliques/BWBallSideBend.name: Side Bend (on stability ball)
Obliques/BWBallSideBend.preparation: Lie on ball on side of torso, waist, and hip. Position legs outward with feet on floor or against floor board.
Obliques/BWBallSideBend.execution: Raise side of torso up by lateral flexing waist. Lower torso back on ball and repeat. Position other side on ball and repeat with opposite side.

Obliques/BWBentKneeLyingTwist.name: Bent-knee Lying Twist
Obliques/BWBentKneeLyingTwist.preparation: Lie on back on floor or mat with arms extended out to sides. Raise bent legs so thighs are vertical and lower legs are horizontal.
Obliques/BWBentKneeLyingTwist.execution: Lower legs to one side until side of thigh is on floor. Raise and lower legs to opposite side. Repeat.
Obliques/BWBentKneeLyingTwist.comments: Maintain knee position throughout movement. See

Obliques/BWBentKneeSidePlank.name: Bent Knee Side Plank
Obliques/BWBentKneeSidePlank.execution: Lie on side on mat. Place forearm on mat under shoulder perpendicular to body. Bend knees at a right angle. Place upper leg directly on top of lower leg and straighten hips.

Obliques/BWBentKneeSideBridge.name: Bent Knee Side Bridge
Obliques/BWBentKneeSideBridge.preparation: Lie on side on mat. Place forearm on mat under shoulder perpendicular to body. Bend knees at a right angle. Place upper leg directly on top of lower leg and straighten hips.
Obliques/BWBentKneeSideBridge.comments: . Lower to original position and repeat. Repeat with opposite side.

Obliques/BWExerciseBallPlankTwist.name: Plank Twist (on stability ball)
Obliques/BWExerciseBallPlankTwist.preparation: Kneel with chest or waist on exercise ball. Dive over top and place hands on floor with arms extended down supporting upper body. While keeping body horizontal, walk hands further away from ball until thighs are positioned on top of ball. Bend knees so feet are up above knees.
Obliques/BWExerciseBallPlankTwist.execution: Rotate hips so thighs roll over top of ball to one side. Rotate to opposite side and repeat.

Obliques/BWHangingTwistingLegRaise.name: Hanging Twisting Leg Raise
Obliques/BWHangingTwistingLegRaise.preparation: Grasp and hang from high bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip.
Obliques/BWHangingTwistingLegRaise.execution: Raise legs to one side by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed or knees are well above hips. Return until hips and knees are extended downward. Raise legs to opposite side in same manner. Continue by bending and lifting legs, alternating between sides.
Obliques/BWHangingTwistingLegRaise.comments: Obliques are largely exercised isometrically with relatively little movement. Obliques and Rectus Abdominis only

Obliques/BWHangingVerticalLegRaise.name: Vertical Twisting Leg Raise
Obliques/BWHangingVerticalLegRaise.preparation: Position forearms on padded parallel bars with hands on handles, and back on vertical pad.
Obliques/BWHangingVerticalLegRaise.execution: Raise legs to one side by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed or knees are above hips. Return until hips and knees are extended downward. Raise legs to opposite side in same manner. Continue by bending and lifting legs, alternating between sides.
Obliques/BWHangingVerticalLegRaise.comments: Obliques are largely exercised isometrically with relatively little movement. Obliques and Rectus Abdominis only

Obliques/BWHangingVerticalLegRaiseDipBar.name: Vertical Twisting Leg Raise (on dip bar)
Obliques/BWHangingVerticalLegRaiseDipBar.preparation: Stand between parallel bars and grip bar on each side with overhand grip. Lift body off floor and balance body upright with arms straight.
Obliques/BWHangingVerticalLegRaiseDipBar.execution: Raise legs to one side by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed or knees are above hips. Return until hips and knees are extended downward. Raise legs to opposite side in same manner. Continue by bending and lifting legs, alternating between sides.
Obliques/BWHangingVerticalLegRaiseDipBar.comments: Obliques are largely exercised isometrically with relatively little movement. Obliques and Rectus Abdominis only

Obliques/BWInclineTwistingCrunch.name: Incline Twisting Crunch
Obliques/BWInclineTwistingCrunch.preparation: Hook feet under foot bar and lie supine on incline bench with hips bent. Place hands behind neck.
Obliques/BWInclineTwistingCrunch.execution: Flex and twist waist to raise upper torso from bench to one side. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline board. Repeat to opposite side alternating twists.
Obliques/BWInclineTwistingCrunch.comments: Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. If no knee support is built in to incline board, ball can be placed under legs. Hip and knee flexors may be involved as stabilizers if incline is steep and no calf support is used. See

Obliques/BWInclineTwistingCrunchX.name: Incline Twisting Crunch (arms crossed)
Obliques/BWInclineTwistingCrunchX.preparation: Hook feet under foot bar and lie supine on incline bench with hips bent. Cross arms on chest.
Obliques/BWInclineTwistingCrunchX.execution: Flex and twist waist to raise upper torso from bench to one side. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline board. Repeat to opposite side alternating twists.
Obliques/BWInclineTwistingCrunchX.comments: If no knee support is built in to incline board, ball can be placed under legs. Hip and knee flexors may be involved as stabilizers if incline is steep and no calf support is used. See

Obliques/BWInclineTwistingSitUp.name: Incline Twisting Sit-up
Obliques/BWInclineTwistingSitUp.preparation: Hook feet under foot or ankle brace and lie supine on incline bench with hips and knees bent. Place hands behind neck.
Obliques/BWInclineTwistingSitUp.execution: Flex and twist waist to one direction while raising torso from bench by bending hips. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline board. Repeat to opposite side alternating twists.
Obliques/BWInclineTwistingSitUp.comments: Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. If no knee support is built in to incline board, ball can be placed under legs. If upper back does not come completely down at end of movement, abdominal muscles may only be

Obliques/BWInclineTwistingSitUpX.name: Incline Twisting Sit-up (arms crossed)
Obliques/BWInclineTwistingSitUpX.preparation: Hook feet under foot or ankle brace and lie supine on incline bench with hips and knees bent. Cross arms on chest.
Obliques/BWInclineTwistingSitUpX.execution: Flex and twist waist to one direction while raising torso from bench by bending hips. Raise crossed arm over opposite knees at top. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline board. Repeat to opposite side alternating twists.
Obliques/BWInclineTwistingSitUpX.comments: Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. If no knee support is built in to incline board, ball can be placed under legs. If upper back does not come completely down at end of movement, abdominal muscles may only be

Obliques/BWLyingTwist.name: Lying Twist
Obliques/BWLyingTwist.preparation: Lie on back on floor or mat with arms extended out to sides. Raise legs upward with knees slightly bent.
Obliques/BWLyingTwist.execution: Lower legs to one side until side of thigh is on floor. Raise and lower legs to opposite side. Repeat.
Obliques/BWLyingTwist.comments: Maintain knee position throughout movement. See

Obliques/BWSideBridge.name: Side Bridge
Obliques/BWSideBridge.execution: Lie on side on mat. Place forearm on mat under shoulder perpendicular to body. Place upper leg directly on top of lower leg and straighten knees and hips.

Obliques/BWSideCrunch.name: Side Crunch
Obliques/BWSideCrunch.preparation: Lie upper back supine on floor or mat. With both legs together, knees and hips bent, position outside of leg down to side. Place one hand base on of neck or place arms across upper chest.
Obliques/BWSideCrunch.execution: Flex waist, raising upper torso off mat or floor. Return until back of shoulders return to mat or floor. Repeat and continue with movement in opposite position.
Obliques/BWSideCrunch.comments: Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. See

Obliques/BWSidePlank.name: Side Plank
Obliques/BWSidePlank.execution: Lie on side on mat. Place forearm on mat under shoulder perpendicular to body. Place upper leg directly on top of lower leg and straighten knees and hips.

Obliques/BWSideCrunchOnBall.name: Side Crunch (on stability ball)
Obliques/BWSideCrunchOnBall.preparation: Sit on exercise ball. Walk forward on ball and lie back on ball with shoulders and head hanging off. Switch position of feet by positioning bent leg under extended leg so waist is twisted with hip positioned sideways. Gently hyperextend back to contour of ball. Place hands behind neck or cross arms across chest.
Obliques/BWSideCrunchOnBall.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso. Return to original position and repeat. Position legs in opposite position and continue.
Obliques/BWSideCrunchOnBall.comments: Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. Some individuals may experience low back discomfort if hips are not bent, so they must use smaller

Obliques/BWTwistingBallCrunch.name: Twisting Crunch (on stability ball)
Obliques/BWTwistingBallCrunch.preparation: Sit on exercise ball. Walk forward on ball and lie back on ball with shoulders and head hanging off, and knees and hips bent. Gently hyperextend back to contour of ball. Hold plate behind neck or on chest with both hands or use no weight.
Obliques/BWTwistingBallCrunch.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso. Return to original position. Repeat.
Obliques/BWTwistingBallCrunch.comments: Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. Some individuals may experience low back discomfort if hips are not bent, so they must use smaller

Obliques/BWTwistingCrunchX.name: Twisting Crunch (arms crossed)
Obliques/BWTwistingCrunchX.preparation: Lie supine on mat with lower legs on bench. Cross arms on chest.
Obliques/BWTwistingCrunchX.execution: Flex and twist waist to raise upper torso from mat to one side. Return until back of shoulders contact mat. Repeat to opposite side alternating twists.
Obliques/BWTwistingCrunchX.comments: Leg elevation keeps pelvis tilted back keeping low back on mat. See

Obliques/BWTwistingCrunch.name: Twisting Crunch
Obliques/BWTwistingCrunch.preparation: Lie supine on mat with lower legs on bench. Place hands behind neck or head.
Obliques/BWTwistingCrunch.execution: Flex and twist waist to raise upper torso from mat to one side. Return until back of shoulders contact mat. Repeat to opposite side alternating twists.
Obliques/BWTwistingCrunch.comments: Leg elevation keeps pelvis tilted back keeping low back on mat. Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum, particularly with their hands are behind their heads. See

Obliques/BWTwistingSitUpX.name: Twisting Sit-up (arms crossed)
Obliques/BWTwistingSitUpX.preparation: Place feet under foot bar or low overhanging stationary object. Lie supine on floor, mat, or sit-up bench with hips and knees bent. Cross arms on chest.
Obliques/BWTwistingSitUpX.execution: Flex and twist waist to one direction while raising torso from bench by bending hips. Return until back of shoulders contact floor or mat. Repeat to opposite side alternating twists.
Obliques/BWTwistingSitUpX.comments: If upper back does not come completely down at end of movement, abdominal muscles may only be

Obliques/BWTwistingSitUp.name: Twisting Sit-up
Obliques/BWTwistingSitUp.preparation: Place feet under foot bar or low overhanging stationary object. Lie supine on floor, mat, or sit-up bench with hips and knees bent. Place hands behind neck.
Obliques/BWTwistingSitUp.execution: Flex and twist waist to one direction while raising torso from bench by bending hips. Return until back of shoulders contact floor or mat. Repeat to opposite side alternating twists.
Obliques/BWTwistingSitUp.comments: instead of foot bar. Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. If upper back does not come completely down at end of movement, abdominal muscles may only be

Obliques/BWWindshieldWiper.name: Hanging Windshield Wiper
Obliques/BWWindshieldWiper.preparation: Grasp and hang from high bar with shoulder width overhand grip. With arms straight, raise hips and position legs vertically by extending shoulders and flexing hips.
Obliques/BWWindshieldWiper.execution: Turn legs to one side by rotating waist until stretch is felt through waist. Rotate legs to opposite side in same manner. Continue by rotating from side to side.
Obliques/BWWindshieldWiper.comments: Alternative easier mount involves raising hips with knees bent, then extending legs upward. Arms and legs may bend slightly throughout movement. Knees may bend more during movement if hamstrings are somewhat tight. Although some movement occurs through shoulders and scapula, engaged musculature is classified as stabilizer since movement is relatively limited.

Obliques/CBCrossArmTwist.name: Cable Seated Cross Arm Twist
Obliques/CBCrossArmTwist.preparation: Grasp stirrup from medium height cable pulley with far hand. Sit on stool or straddle bench with lower body facing away from pulley. Allow torso to turn to side of near arm. Place far arm across body onto near arm. Support far elbow with near hand.
Obliques/CBCrossArmTwist.execution: Rotate torso through waist to face opposite side until slight stretch if felt. Return to original side until slight stretch is felt. Repeat. Continue with opposite side.
Obliques/CBCrossArmTwist.comments: Place feet wide for support, or if straddling bench, slightly squeeze legs on sides of bench to prevent shifting. Upper body stabilizing occurs primarily on far side through isometric shoulder abduction and isometric scapular upward rotation. Upper body stabilization also occurs somewhat on near side through shoulder protraction. See

Obliques/CBDownUpTwist.name: Cable Twist (down up)
Obliques/CBDownUpTwist.preparation: Grasp stirrup from low cable pulley. Turn to one side, away from pulley. Position feet wide apart with furthest foot away from pulley and nearest foot close to pulley. Point both feet away from pulley. Raise heel of nearest foot off floor. Bend knees of both legs slightly. Place far hand over other hand or interlace fingers.
Obliques/CBDownUpTwist.execution: Keeping arms straight, pull stirrup diagonally upward around shoulders by rotating torso and raising arms gradually upward until cable makes contact with side of body. Bend knees slightly more as stirrup approaches top. Return to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite side.
Obliques/CBDownUpTwist.comments: Both arms should be straight following diagonal path upward. Both arms should be horizontal and straight. This movement arguably involves more hip

Obliques/CBKneelingTwistingCrunch.name: Cable Kneeling Twisting Crunch
Obliques/CBKneelingTwistingCrunch.preparation: Kneel below high pulley. Grasp cable rope attachment with both hands. Place wrists against head. Position hips back and flex hips, allowing resistance on cable pulley to lift torso upward so spine is hyperextended.
Obliques/CBKneelingTwistingCrunch.execution: With hips stationary, flex waist to one side so elbow travels toward mid-thigh on opposite side. Return to original position and repeat on opposite side. Continue by alternating between sides.
Obliques/CBKneelingTwistingCrunch.comments: Note movement occurs in waist, not hips. See

Obliques/CBRussianTwistBall.name: Cable Russian Twist (on stability ball)
Obliques/CBRussianTwistBall.preparation: Grasp stirrup and sit on stability ball with side facing low cable pulley. Roll body down and lie with back on ball, hips nearly straight, and feet apart on floor. Hold onto stirrup with both hands with arms extending straight upward.
Obliques/CBRussianTwistBall.execution: Allow resistance from cable to turn torso downward, toward direction of pulley while keeping arms straight and perpendicular to torso throughout movement. Pull stirrup in an arch over shoulders by rotating torso to opposite direction of pulley until cable makes contact with shoulder. Return to original position in opposite direction and repeat. Continue with opposite side.
Obliques/CBRussianTwistBall.comments: Both arms should be kept straight and perpendicular to torso. Hips should also be kept nearly straight, only slightly bent. Also see

Obliques/CBSeatedTwist.name: Cable Seated Twist
Obliques/CBSeatedTwist.preparation: Grasp stirrup and straddle bench orientated with side facing medium height cable pulley. Sit with feet on floor. Hold onto stirrup with both hands with arms extending out straight toward stirrup.
Obliques/CBSeatedTwist.execution: Keeping arms straight, rotate torso to opposite side until cable makes contact with shoulder. Return to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite side.
Obliques/CBSeatedTwist.comments: Slightly squeeze legs on sides of bench to prevent shifting. Bench should be far enough away from cable pulley so cable is taut when stirrup is turned back toward cable pulley. See

Obliques/CBSideCrunch.name: Cable Side Crunch
Obliques/CBSideCrunch.preparation: With side close to high pulley, grasp stirrup attachment with near hand. Position stirrup at side of shoulder, palm orientated inward, and elbow down to side.
Obliques/CBSideCrunch.execution: Pull stirrup downward by bending toward cable column through waist so torso moves toward base of cable column. Bend in opposite direction by leaning torso away from cable column, allowing stirrup to rise upward. Repeat. Continue with opposite side.
Obliques/CBSideCrunch.comments: Keep stirrup attachment near side of shoulder with elbow down to side. See

Obliques/CBSideBend.name: Cable Side Bend
Obliques/CBSideBend.preparation: With side to low pulley, grasp stirrup attachment with near arm. Stand with arm straight.
Obliques/CBSideBend.execution: Pull stirrup by bending sideways through waist so torso moves away from pulley. Lower stirrup by leaning torso toward pulley. Repeat. Continue with opposite side.

Obliques/CBStandingTwistingCrunch.name: Cable Standing Twisting Crunch
Obliques/CBStandingTwistingCrunch.preparation: Position back against back pad with knees slightly bent, shoulders back, and chest high. Place both cable straps over shoulders, one in each hand. Place hands with cable strap in front of each shoulder so that cable is taut. If available, place hands in strap slots that allow cable to be taut when hands are in position with shoulders back.
Obliques/CBStandingTwistingCrunch.execution: Flex and twist spine so torso pulls strap forward and downward while twisting one shoulder to forward center. Return until back of shoulders return to back pad. Repeat alternating twists with opposite sides.
Obliques/CBStandingTwistingCrunch.comments: To allow for full range of motion, grip height on strap should not allow weight to bottom out (weights touching stack) when shoulders are back. Padded hump should be adjusted to height of low back. See

Obliques/CBTwist.name: Cable Twist
Obliques/CBTwist.preparation: Grasp stirrup from shoulder height cable pulley with both hands. Step and turn lower body away from pulley until near arm is horizontal and straight. Position feet wide apart facing away from pulley, furthest foot further away from pulley. Raise heel of nearest foot off floor. Bend knees of both legs slightly. Place far hand over other hand or interlace fingers.
Obliques/CBTwist.execution: Keeping arms straight, rotate torso to opposite side until cable makes contact with shoulder. Return to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite side.
Obliques/CBTwist.comments: Both arms should be horizontal and straight. This movement arguably involves more hip

Obliques/CBStandingTwistingCrunchSingle.name: Cable Standing Twisting Crunch (single side)
Obliques/CBStandingTwistingCrunchSingle.preparation: Position back against back pad with knees slightly bent, shoulders back, and chest high. Place cable straps over shoulder. Hold against front of body with opposite hand so that cable is taut. If available, place hand in rope slot that allows cable to be taut when hand is in position with shoulders back.
Obliques/CBStandingTwistingCrunchSingle.execution: Flex and twist spine so shoulder pulls strap diagonally forward and downward away from pulley. Return until back of shoulder returns to back pad and repeat.
Obliques/CBStandingTwistingCrunchSingle.comments: To allow for full range of motion, grip height on strap should not allow weight to bottom out (weights touching stack) when shoulders are back. Padded hump should be adjusted to height of low back. See

Obliques/CBUpDownTwist.name: Cable Twist (up down)
Obliques/CBUpDownTwist.preparation: Grasp stirrup from shoulder height cable pulley. Turn to one side, away from pulley until near arm is extended straight. Position feet wide apart with furthest foot away from pulley and nearest foot close to pulley. Point both feet away from pulley. Raise heel of nearest foot off floor. Place far hand over other hand or interlace fingers.
Obliques/CBUpDownTwist.execution: Keeping arms straight, pull stirrup diagonally downward around shoulders by rotating torso and gradually lowering arms downward until cable is just above shoulder. Gradually bend knees as stirrup makes its way around body and approaches bottom. Return to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite side.
Obliques/CBUpDownTwist.comments: Both arms should be straight following diagonal path downward. This movement arguably involves more hip

Obliques/DB45SideBend.name: Dumbbell 45° Side Bend
Obliques/DB45SideBend.preparation: Position side of thigh on padding and side of feet on leg padding or platform lip. Hold dumbbell straight downward with lower arm.
Obliques/DB45SideBend.execution: Raise torso upward by lateral flexing waist. Lower torso by bending waist downward. Repeat. Position body facing opposite side and continue with opposite side.
Obliques/DB45SideBend.comments: Keep arm holding dumbbell approximately vertical (below shoulder) throughout movement. See

Obliques/DBRussianTwistBall.name: Dumbbell Russian Twist (on stability ball)
Obliques/DBRussianTwistBall.preparation: With dumbbell in hand, sit on stability ball. Roll body down and lie with back on ball, hips nearly straight, and feet apart on floor. Hold onto dumbbell with both hands with arms extending straight upward.
Obliques/DBRussianTwistBall.execution: Turn torso to one side while keeping arms straight and perpendicular to torso throughout movement. Return dumbbell back over shoulders by rotating torso to original position. Continue lowering dumbbell to opposite side. Repeat.
Obliques/DBRussianTwistBall.comments: Both arms should be kept straight and perpendicular to torso. Hips should also be kept nearly straight, only slightly bent. See

Obliques/DBSideBend.name: Dumbbell Side Bend
Obliques/DBSideBend.preparation: Grasp dumbbell with arm straight to side.
Obliques/DBSideBend.execution: Bend waist to opposite side of dumbbell until slight stretch is felt. Lower to opposite side, same distance and repeat. Continue with opposite side.

Obliques/LVKneelingTwist.name: Lever Kneeling Twist
Obliques/LVKneelingTwist.preparation: Adjust range of motion setting on machine to one side. Kneel on padded stool with both knees between leg pads. Place torso against upper pads and grasp handles.
Obliques/LVKneelingTwist.execution: Rotate lower body through waist to opposite side. Return and repeat. Adjust range of motion setting to opposite side and repeat in opposite direction.

Obliques/LVBBSideBend.name: Lever Barbell Side Bend (plate loaded)
Obliques/LVBBSideBend.preparation: Stand with side to bar mid-thigh height. Grasp bar and disengage.
Obliques/LVBBSideBend.execution: Bend waist to opposite side of bar. Lower weight by bending toward side with bar and repeat. Continue with opposite side facing opposite direction.

Obliques/LVLyingTwist.name: Lever Lying Twist
Obliques/LVLyingTwist.preparation: Lie in machine with hands on handles, head on pad, partition between legs, and feet on foot bars. Disengage hand lever and rotate apparatus to one side until full spinal rotation is felt. Re-engage hand lever.
Obliques/LVLyingTwist.execution: Rotate torso through waist to opposite side. Return and repeat. Readjust range of motion setting to opposite side and repeat in opposite direction.
Obliques/LVLyingTwist.comments: Greater surface area of torso resting padded lever supports significantly reduces involvement of upper body stablizing muscles as compared to

Obliques/LVSeatedSideBend.name: Lever Seated Side Bend
Obliques/LVSeatedSideBend.preparation: Position seat so shoulders are same height of padded lever. Sit in machine with legs to one side. Place over lever pad. Push padded lever down slightly until shoulder is fixed at approximately 90º; upper arm parallel to floor.
Obliques/LVSeatedSideBend.execution: With hips stationary, push down lever by bending to side so elbow points downward. Return and repeat. Position lower body to opposite side and repeat.
Obliques/LVSeatedSideBend.comments: Maintain shoulder fixed at approximately 90º so upper arm and upper back are perpendicular. See

Obliques/LVSeatedSideLegRaiseCrunch.name: Lever Seated Side Leg Raise Crunch (plate loaded)
Obliques/LVSeatedSideLegRaiseCrunch.preparation: Sit on machine with seat turned to one side. Position back against back support and lower legs under padded bar. Grasp handles above to each side.
Obliques/LVSeatedSideLegRaiseCrunch.execution: Pull handles down while pulling lower leg bar up by flexing waist and pelvis. Return and repeat. Turn seat to opposite side and repeat.
Obliques/LVSeatedSideLegRaiseCrunch.comments: Weight plates added to upper segment adds resistance, whereas, weight plates added to lower segment decreases resistance. Seat can also be oriented

Obliques/LVSeatedTwistingLegRaiseCrunch.name: Lever Seated Twisting Leg Raise Crunch (plate loaded)
Obliques/LVSeatedTwistingLegRaiseCrunch.preparation: Sit on machine with position back against back support and lower legs under padded bar. Grasp handles above to each side.
Obliques/LVSeatedTwistingLegRaiseCrunch.execution: Pull handles down while pulling lower leg bar up and over to one side by flexing and twisting waist and pelvis. Return and repeat movement to opposite side. Continue alternating between sides.

Obliques/LVSideCrunch.name: Lever Seated Side Crunch
Obliques/LVSideCrunch.preparation: Position seat so shoulders are same height of padded lever. Sit on machine with legs angled to one side. Place arms over lever pad. Push padded lever down slightly until shoulders are are approximately 90º; upper arm parallel to floor.
Obliques/LVSideCrunch.execution: With hips stationary, flex waist in "C" shape so elbows point downward. Return and repeat. Position lower body to opposite side and repeat.
Obliques/LVSideCrunch.comments: Maintain shoulders fixed at approximately 90º so upper arm and upper back are perpendicular. Men should keep chest close to padded lever. Women may choose to position chest as close as possible without making contact with inside of padded bar. See

Obliques/LVStandingSideBend.name: Lever Standing Side Bend
Obliques/LVStandingSideBend.preparation: Stand with side to lever handle and grasp. Stand upright.
Obliques/LVStandingSideBend.execution: Bend waist to opposite side of lever. Lower weight by bending to opposite side and repeat. Continue with opposite side facing opposite direction.
Obliques/LVStandingSideBend.comments: Stand on platform if lever is too high to allow for full range of movement. See

Obliques/LVTwist.name: Lever Seated Twist
Obliques/LVTwist.preparation: Adjust range of motion setting on machine to one side. Sit with legs against padding. Place torso against pad and grasp handles.
Obliques/LVTwist.execution: Rotate torso through waist to opposite side. Return and repeat. Adjust range of motion setting to opposite side and repeat in opposite direction.

Obliques/LVTwistAltMach.name: Lever Seated Twist
Obliques/LVTwistAltMach.preparation: Adjust range of motion setting on arm levers to one side. Sit on seat with feet on platform. Position arms between pads and grasp handles above to each side.
Obliques/LVTwistAltMach.execution: Rotate torso through waist to opposite side. Return and repeat. Adjust range of motion setting to opposite side and repeat in opposite direction.

Obliques/LVTwistGripless.name: Lever Seated Twist (gripless)
Obliques/LVTwistGripless.preparation: Adjust range of motion setting on seat to one side. Sit with legs straddled against padding. Wrap arms behind and under padded bars around each side.
Obliques/LVTwistGripless.execution: Rotate torso through waist to opposite side. Return and repeat. Adjust range of motion setting to opposite side and repeat in opposite direction.

Obliques/LVTwistLower.name: Lever Seated Twist
Obliques/LVTwistLower.preparation: Adjust range of motion setting on machine to one side. Sit with legs against padding. Place torso against pad and grasp handles.
Obliques/LVTwistLower.execution: Rotate lower body through waist to opposite side. Return and repeat. Adjust range of motion setting to opposite side and repeat in opposite direction.

Obliques/SLSideHipRaiseAbCoaster.name: Sled Side Leg Hip Raise (ab coaster)
Obliques/SLSideHipRaiseAbCoaster.preparation: Straddle machine facing handles with seat turned to one side. Grasp handles on each side and place forearms on pads. Place shins on padded sled with knees in front of turned seat and feet hanging off of back end. Sit back toward heels without bending over.
Obliques/SLSideHipRaiseAbCoaster.execution: Slide forward and up by pulling knees up high. Deliberately attempt to flex waist in a "C" shape. Return sled down and back arching spine in opposite direction while keeping hips bent. Repeat. Turn seat to opposite side and repeat.
Obliques/SLSideHipRaiseAbCoaster.comments: If low back does flex near top of motion, abdominal muscles may only be

Obliques/STPendulum.name: Suspended Pendulum
Obliques/STPendulum.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Place right foot in left lower loop. Cross left leg over right leg placed in right lower loop. Turn body to right and place hands on floor shoulder width apart. Turn body to kneel on hands and knees. Reposition hands (shoulder width or slightly wider) at desired distance from suspension trainer so that body is square with suspension trainer straps. With arms straight, raise knees from ground, so body is supported by arms and suspension trainer.
Obliques/STPendulum.execution: Move both legs to one side then to opposite side by moving through waist and hips. Continue swinging legs side to side.
Obliques/STPendulum.comments: Keep arms straight with shoulders positioned above hands. Hips abduct and adduct slightly as waist rotates and laterally flexes as it remains somewhat flexed. Dismount by removing straps while kneeling or after sitting on one side of hip before rotating body to seated position. See

Obliques/STSideBend.name: Suspended Side Bend
Obliques/STSideBend.preparation: Grasp handles, step away, and face body to one side of suspension trainer anchor. Hold handles above head with arms bent. Stand far enough away to make suspension trainer straps taut. Step in just enough to achieve desired lean of body, while keeping tension on suspension trainer straps.
Obliques/STSideBend.execution: Lower hips away from direction of suspension trainer anchor by laterally flexing spine. Return to original upright position and repeat. Reposition body facing opposite direction. Continue with other side.
Obliques/STSideBend.comments: Suspension handle(s) can also be gripped with both hands together with either one hand over other hand or with interlaced fingers. In addition to

Obliques/STSideBridge.name: Suspended Side Bridge
Obliques/STSideBridge.preparation: Sit on floor or mat, facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Grasp bottom of loops, then lay supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles. Extend legs out with one leg crossed over other. Turn on side of lower leg so legs are parallel. Place forearm on mat or floor under shoulder perpendicular to body.
Obliques/STSideBridge.comments: . Lower to original position and repeat. Reposition to opposite side and continue.

Obliques/STTwistingJackknife.name: Suspended Twisting Jack-knife
Obliques/STTwistingJackknife.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Place right foot in left lower loop. Cross left leg over right leg placed in right lower loop. Turn body to right and place hands on floor, shoulder width apart. Turn body to kneel on hands and knees. Reposition hands (shoulder width or slightly wider) at desired distance from suspension trainer so that body is square with suspension trainer straps. With arms straight, raise knees from ground so body is supported by arms and suspension trainer.
Obliques/STTwistingJackknife.execution: Pull knees toward one elbow by bending hips a   nd knees to one side. Twist legs to one side, until hips and knees are completely flexed. Return by extending hips and knees to original straight position. Perform movement to opposite side. Continue by alternating each side.

Obliques/WT45SideBend.name: Weighted 45° Side Bend
Obliques/WT45SideBend.preparation: Position side of thigh on padding and side of feet on leg padding or platform lip. Hold weight to chest or
Obliques/WT45SideBend.comments: Raise torso upward by lateral flexing waist. Lower torso by bending waist downward. Repeat. Position body facing opposite side and continue with opposite side.

Obliques/STTwist.name: Suspended Twist
Obliques/STTwist.preparation: Grasp suspension handle(s) with both hands, together with either one hand over other hand or with interlaced fingers. Momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handle(s). Position body and legs straight at desired angle, hanging from handles with arms straight. Feet can be either shoulder width or as wide as desired.
Obliques/STTwist.execution: While keeping arms straight and shoulders fixed, rotate torso up to one side. Twist until upright or slight stretch is felt in waist, whichever comes soonest. Rotate back to starting position and repeat. Continue on opposite side.
Obliques/STTwist.comments: The exercise can also be mounted from top position in fully rotated position facing perpendicular to suspension straps while positioning feet parallel to straps. Exercise can also be executed by alternating sides, rotating from one side to the other. Dismounting can be achieved either at top of movement when body is fully rotated or hanging at bottom position by walking backward until body is upright. This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings.

Obliques/WTBallSideBend.name: Weighted Side Bend (on stability ball)
Obliques/WTBallSideBend.preparation: Lie on ball on side of torso, waist, and hip. Position legs outward with feet on floor or against floor board. Hold weight
Obliques/WTBallSideBend.comments: Raise side of torso up by laterally flexing waist. Lower torso back on ball and repeat. Position other side on ball and repeat with opposite side.

Obliques/WTRussianTwistBall.name: Weighted Russian Twist (on stability ball)
Obliques/WTRussianTwistBall.preparation: With weight plate or medicine ball in hand, sit on stability ball. Roll body down and lie with back on ball, hips nearly straight, and feet apart on floor. Hold onto weight with both hands with arms extending straight upward.
Obliques/WTRussianTwistBall.execution: Turn torso to one side while keeping arms straight and perpendicular to torso throughout movement. Return weight back over shoulders by rotating torso to original position. Continue lowering weight to opposite side. Repeat.
Obliques/WTRussianTwistBall.comments: Both arms should be kept straight and perpendicular to torso. Hips should also be kept nearly straight, only slightly bent. See

Obliques/WTStraightArmRussionTwist.name: Medicine Ball Straight Arm Russian Twist (legs extended)
Obliques/WTStraightArmRussionTwist.preparation: Sit on floor with medicine ball. Lean torso back while extending legs well above floor so thighs and torso are perpendicular. Hold onto medicine ball with both hands and position it well above knees with arms extended straight parallel to thighs.
Obliques/WTStraightArmRussionTwist.execution: Turn torso to one side while keeping arms straight and perpendicular to torso throughout movement. Return weight back over shoulders by rotating torso to original position. Continue lowering weight to opposite side. Repeat.
Obliques/WTStraightArmRussionTwist.comments: Knees can be held straight as shown or bent with feet kept above ground. Both arms should be kept straight and perpendicular to torso. Primary movement is

Obliques/WTSideCrunchOnBall.name: Weighted Side Crunch (on stability ball)
Obliques/WTSideCrunchOnBall.preparation: Sit on exercise ball. Walk forward on ball and lie back on ball with shoulders and head hanging off. Switch position of feet by positioning bent leg under extended leg so waist is twisted with hip positioned sideways. Gently hyperextend back to contour of ball. Hold plate behind neck or on chest with both hands or use no weight.
Obliques/WTSideCrunchOnBall.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso. Return to original position and repeat. Position legs in opposite position and continue.
Obliques/WTSideCrunchOnBall.comments: Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. Exercise can be performed without added weight until more resistance is needed. Movement can also be made easier by po   sitioning hip low on ball or by using

Obliques/WtBentKneeLyingTwist.name: Weighted Bent-knee Lying Twist
Obliques/WtBentKneeLyingTwist.preparation: On floor or mat, place medicine ball between bent knees. Lie on back with arms extended out to sides. Raise bent legs so thighs are vertical and lower legs are horizontal.
Obliques/WtBentKneeLyingTwist.execution: Lower legs to one side until side of thigh is on floor. Raise and lower legs to opposite side. Repeat.
Obliques/WtBentKneeLyingTwist.comments: Maintain knee position throughout movement. For less resistance, do not use additional weight (See

Obliques/WtInclineTwistingCrunch.name: Weighted Incline Twisting Crunch (arms crossed)
Obliques/WtInclineTwistingCrunch.preparation: Hook feet under padding and lie supine on incline bench with hips bent. Hold plate on upper chest with both hands or use no weight.
Obliques/WtInclineTwistingCrunch.execution: Flex and twist waist to raise upper torso from bench to one side. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline board. Repeat to opposite side alternating twists.

Obliques/WtInclineTwistingSitUp.name: Weighted Incline Twisting Sit-up
Obliques/WtInclineTwistingSitUp.preparation: Hook feet under foot or ankle brace and lie supine on incline bench with hips and knees bent. Hold plate behind neck with both hands.
Obliques/WtInclineTwistingSitUp.execution: Flex and twist waist to one direction while raising torso from bench by bending hips. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline board. Repeat to opposite side, alternating twists.
Obliques/WtInclineTwistingSitUp.comments: Exercise can be performed without added weight until more resistance is needed. Elevate incline to increase resistance. See

Obliques/WtInclineTwistingSitUpX.name: Weighted Incline Twisting Sit-up (arms crossed)
Obliques/WtInclineTwistingSitUpX.preparation: Hook feet under foot brace and lie supine on incline board with hips and knees bent. Hold plate on chest with both hands or use no weight.
Obliques/WtInclineTwistingSitUpX.execution: Flex and twist waist to one direction while raising torso from bench by bending hips. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline board. Repeat to opposite side alternating twists.
Obliques/WtInclineTwistingSitUpX.comments: Crossed arms can also be brought up above knees at top to increase range of motion. Exercise can be performed without added weight until more resistance is needed. Elevate incline to increase resistance. See

Obliques/WtLyingTwist.name: Weighted Lying Twist
Obliques/WtLyingTwist.preparation: On floor or mat, place exercise ball between lower legs. Lie on back with arms extended out to sides. Raise legs upward with knees slightly bent.
Obliques/WtLyingTwist.execution: Lower legs to one side until side of thigh is on floor. Raise and lower legs to opposite side. Repeat.
Obliques/WtLyingTwist.comments: Maintain knee position throughout movement. For less resistance, bend knees more and/or do not use additional weight. See

Obliques/WtSideCrunch.name: Weighted Side Crunch
Obliques/WtSideCrunch.preparation: Lie upper back supine on floor or mat. With both legs together, knees and hips bent, position outside of leg down to side. Use no weight or hold weight to opposite side of head or across upper chest.
Obliques/WtSideCrunch.execution: Flex waist, raising upper torso off surface. Return until back of shoulders return to surface. Repeat and continue with movement in opposite position.

Obliques/WtTwistingBallCrunch.name: Weighted Twisting Crunch (on stability ball)
Obliques/WtTwistingBallCrunch.preparation: Sit on exercise ball. Walk forward on ball and lie back on ball with shoulders and head hanging off and knees and hips bent. Gently hyperextend back to contour of ball. Hold plate behind neck or on chest with both hands or use no weight.
Obliques/WtTwistingBallCrunch.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso. Return to original position and repeat.
Obliques/WtTwistingBallCrunch.comments: Weight can be held behind neck. Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. Exercise can be performed

Obliques/WtTwistingCrunch.name: Weighted Twisting Crunch
Obliques/WtTwistingCrunch.preparation: Lie supine on floor or bench with knees and hips bent. Hold plate behind neck or on chest with both hands.
Obliques/WtTwistingCrunch.execution: Flex and twist waist to raise upper torso off surface to one side. Return until back of shoulders return to surface. Repeat to opposite side alternating twists.
Obliques/WtTwistingCrunch.comments: If weight is held behind head, position head hanging off bench. See

Obliques/WtTwistingSitUp.name: Weighted Twisting Sit-up
Obliques/WtTwistingSitUp.preparation: Place feet under low overhanging stationary object. Lie supine on floor or mat with hips and knees bent. Hold plate behind neck with both hands.
Obliques/WtTwistingSitUp.execution: Flex and twist waist to one direction while raising torso from bench by bending hips. Return until back of shoulders contact floor or mat. Repeat to opposite side alternating twists.
Obliques/WtTwistingSitUp.comments: instead of foot bar. Exercise can be performed

Obliques/WtTwistingSitUpX.name: Weighted Twisting Sit-up (arms crossed)
Obliques/WtTwistingSitUpX.preparation: Place feet under low overhanging stationary object. Lie supine on floor or mat with hips and knees bent. With both hands, hold plate on chest with forearms crossed.
Obliques/WtTwistingSitUpX.execution: Flex and twist waist to one direction while raising torso from bench by bending hips. Return until back of shoulders contact floor or mat. Repeat to opposite side alternating twists.

OlympicLifts/BlockClean.name: Block Clean
OlympicLifts/BlockClean.preparation: Stand over barbell on blocks with balls of feet positioned under bar pointing forward, hip width's apart or slightly wider. Squat down and grip bar with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width (thumbs length from ends of knurlings on Olympic bar). Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/BlockClean.execution: Pull bar up off blocks by extending hips and knees. As bar reaches knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping barbell close to thighs. When barbell passes mid-thigh, allow it to contact thighs. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to flex out to sides, keeping bar close to body. Aggressively pull body under bar, rotating elbows around bar. Catch bar on shoulders while moving into squat position. Hitting bottom of squat, stand up immediately.
OlympicLifts/BlockClean.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to mid-thigh position. Slowly lower bar with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical. The advanced athlete may

OlympicLifts/BelowKneeHighPull.name: Below Knee High Pull
OlympicLifts/BelowKneeHighPull.preparation: Pull bar up by extending hips and straightening knees. As bar reaches knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping barbell close to thighs, jump upward extending body. Flex elbows out to sides, pulling bar upward to mid-chest height.
OlympicLifts/BelowKneeHighPull.execution: Lower bar and bend knees and hips slightly to absorb impact of arms straightening and barbell falling to upper thighs. Immediately straightening knees and hips.
OlympicLifts/BelowKneeHighPull.comments: Pull bar up in straight path, keeping bar close to body. Optional: Knees and hips can bend slightly as bar reaches upper chest.

OlympicLifts/BlockPowerClean.name: Block Power Clean
OlympicLifts/BlockPowerClean.preparation: Stand over barbell on blocks with balls of feet positioned under bar pointing forward, hip width's apart or slightly wider. Squat down and grip bar with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width (thumbs length from ends of knurlings on Olympic bar). Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/BlockPowerClean.execution: Pull bar up off blocks by extending hips and knees. As bar reaches knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping barbell close to thighs. When barbell passes mid-thigh, allow it to contact thighs. Jump upward, extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to flex out to sides, keeping bar close to body. Aggressively pull body under bar, rotating elbows around bar. Catch bar on shoulders before knees bend lower than 90°. Stand up immediately so thighs ride no lower than parallel to floor.
OlympicLifts/BlockPowerClean.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to mid-thigh position. Slowly lower bar with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical. The advanced athlete may

OlympicLifts/BlockPowerSnatch.name: Block Power Snatch
OlympicLifts/BlockPowerSnatch.preparation: Stand over barbell on blocks with balls of feet positioned under bar hip width or slightly wider than hip width apart. Squat down and grip bar with very wide overhand grip. Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/BlockPowerSnatch.execution: Pull bar up off blocks by extending hips and knees while keeping back arched. When barbell passes knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping bar as close to legs as possible. When bar passes upper thighs, allow it to contact thighs. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to pull up to sides, keeping them over bar as long as possible. Aggressively pull body under bar. Catch bar at arm's length before knees bend lower than 90°. As soon as barbell is caught on locked out arms in partial squat position, stand up with barbell over head immediately so thighs ride no lower than parallel to floor.
OlympicLifts/BlockPowerSnatch.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to mid-thigh position. Slowly lower bar with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical. The advanced athlete may

OlympicLifts/BlockPull.name: Block Pull
OlympicLifts/BlockPull.preparation: Stand with barbell on blocks with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width. Bend knees and hips so barbell touches thigh, shoulders over bar with back arched. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/BlockPull.execution: Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to flex out to sides.
OlympicLifts/BlockPull.comments: Lower bar immediately by relaxing shoulders and arms. Return barbell to blocks by bending hips and knees while keeping back arched.

OlympicLifts/Clean.name: Clean
OlympicLifts/Clean.preparation: Stand over barbell with balls of feet positioned under bar pointing forward, hip width's apart or slightly wider. Squat down and grip bar with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width (thumbs length from ends of knerlings on Olympic bar). Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/Clean.execution: Pull bar up off floor by extending hips and knees. As bar reaches knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping barbell close to thighs. When barbell passes mid-thigh, allow it to contact thighs. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to flex out to sides, keeping bar close to body. Aggressively pull body under bar, rotating elbows around bar. Catch bar on shoulders while moving into squat position. Hitting bottom of squat, stand up immediately.
OlympicLifts/Clean.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to mid-thigh position. Slowly lower bar with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical. The advanced athlete may

OlympicLifts/DBClean.name: Dumbbell Clean
OlympicLifts/DBClean.preparation: Squat down with dumbbells near sides of ankles, palms facing together. Position shoulders over dumbbells with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed outward.
OlympicLifts/DBClean.execution: Pull dumbbells up off floor by extending hips and knees. As dumbbells reach knees vigorously, raise shoulders while keeping dumbbells close to thighs. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull dumbbells upward with arms, allowing elbows to bend out to sides, keeping dumbbells close to body. Aggressively pull body under dumbbells, rotating elbows around dumbbells. Catch dumbbells on shoulders while moving into squat position. Hitting bottom of squat, stand up immediately.
OlympicLifts/DBClean.comments: Lower dumbbells to mid-thigh position. With chest high and taut lower back, squat down into original position until dumbbells make contact with floor. Repeat.

OlympicLifts/CleanAndJerk.name: Clean and Jerk
OlympicLifts/CleanAndJerk.preparation: Stand over barbell with balls of feet positioned under bar slightly wider apart than hip width. Squat down and grip bar with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width. Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/CleanAndJerk.execution: Pull bar up off floor by extending hips and knees. As bar reaches knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping barbell close to thighs. When barbell passes mid-thigh, allow it to contact thighs. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to flex out to sides, keeping bar close to body. Aggressively pull body under bar, rotating elbows around bar. Catch bar on shoulders while moving into squat position. Hitting bottom of squat, stand up immediately.
OlympicLifts/CleanAndJerk.comments: Adjust grip if necessary. Inhale and position chest high with torso tight. Keeping pressure on heels, dip body by bending knees and ankles slightly. Explosively drive upward with legs, driving barbell up off shoulders. Drop body downward and split one foot forward and other backward as fast as possible, while vigorously extending arms over head.

OlympicLifts/DBHangClean.name: Dumbbell Hang Power Clean
OlympicLifts/DBHangClean.preparation: Stand shoulder width apart with dumbbells down to sides, palms facing inward and arms straight.
OlympicLifts/DBHangClean.execution: Bend knees and hips until dumbbells are just above knees. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull dumbbells upward with arms, allowing elbows to bend out to sides, keeping dumbbells close to body. Aggressively pull body under dumbbells, rotating elbows around dumbbells. Catch dumbbells on shoulders while moving into squat position. Stand up immediately.
OlympicLifts/DBHangClean.comments: Lower dumbbells down to sides. Repeat.

OlympicLifts/DBHangCleanJerk.name: Dumbbell Hang Clean and Jerk
OlympicLifts/DBHangCleanJerk.preparation: Stand shoulder width apart with dumbbells down to sides, palms facing inward and arms straight.
OlympicLifts/DBHangCleanJerk.execution: Bend knees and hips until dumbbells are just above knees. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull dumbbells upward with arms, allowing elbows to bend out to sides, keeping dumbbells close to body. Aggressively pull body under dumbbells, rotating elbows around dumbbells. Catch dumbbells on shoulders while moving into squat position. Stand up immediately.
OlympicLifts/DBHangCleanJerk.comments: Inhale and position chest high with torso tight. Keeping pressure on heels, dip body by bending knees and ankles slightly. Explosively drive upward with legs, driving dumbbells up off shoulders. Drop body downward and split one foot forward and other backward as fast as possible, while vigorously extending arms over head.

OlympicLifts/DBSnatch.name: Dumbbell Power Snatch
OlympicLifts/DBSnatch.preparation: Stand with feet apart and toes pointing outward slightly. Position dumbbell in front of thigh with knuckles forward.
OlympicLifts/DBSnatch.execution: Squat down with back arched and lower dumbbell between knees with arm straight and shoulder over dumbbell. Pull dumbbell up by extending hips and knees. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull dumbbell upward with arm, allowing elbow to pull up to side, keeping elbow over dumbbell as long as possible. Aggressively pull body under dumbbell. Catch dumbbell at arm's length while moving into squat position. As soon as dumbbell is caught on locked out arm in squat position, squat up into standing position with dumbbell over head.
OlympicLifts/DBSnatch.comments: Lower dumbbell to front of shoulder, then down to original position in front of thigh. Repeat.

OlympicLifts/DBHangPowerCleanJerk.name: Dumbbell Hang Power Clean and Jerk
OlympicLifts/DBHangPowerCleanJerk.preparation: Stand shoulder width apart with dumbbells down to sides, palms facing inward and arms straight.
OlympicLifts/DBHangPowerCleanJerk.execution: Bend knees and hips until dumbbells are just above knees. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull dumbbells upward with arms, allowing elbows to bend out to sides, keeping dumbbells close to body. Aggressively pull body under dumbbells, rotating elbows around dumbbells. Catch dumbbells on shoulders before knees bend lower than 90°. Stand up immediately so thighs ride no lower than parallel to floor. Stand up immediately.
OlympicLifts/DBHangPowerCleanJerk.comments: Inhale and position chest high with torso tight. Keeping pressure on heels, dip body by bending knees and ankles slightly. Explosively drive upward with legs, driving dumbbells up off shoulders. Drop body downward and split one foot forward and other backward as fast as possible, while vigorously extending arms over head.

OlympicLifts/DeficitClean.name: Deficit Clean
OlympicLifts/DeficitClean.preparation: Stand on shallow platform positioned under barbell with balls of feet under bar pointing forward, hip width's apart or slightly wider. Squat down and grip bar with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width (thumbs length from ends of knurlings on Olympic bar). Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/DeficitClean.execution: Pull bar up off floor by extending hips and knees. As bar reaches knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping barbell close to thighs. When barbell passes mid-thigh, allow it to contact thighs. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to flex out to sides, keeping bar close to body. Aggressively pull body under bar, rotating elbows around bar. Catch bar on shoulders while moving into squat position. Hitting bottom of squat, stand up immediately.
OlympicLifts/DeficitClean.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to mid-thigh position. Slowly lower bar with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical. The advanced athlete may

OlympicLifts/DeficitSnatch.name: Deficit Snatch
OlympicLifts/DeficitSnatch.preparation: Stand on shallow platform positioned under barbell with balls of feet under bar, hip width or slightly wider than hip width apart. Squat down and grip bar with very wide overhand grip. Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/DeficitSnatch.execution: Pull bar up off floor by extending hips and knees. As bar reaches knees, back stays arched and maintains same angle to floor as in starting position. When barbell passes knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping bar as close to legs as possible. When bar passes upper thighs, allow it to contact thighs. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to pull up to sides, keeping them over bar as long as possible. Aggressively pull body under bar. Catch bar at arm's length while moving into squat position. As soon as barbell is caught on locked out arms in squat position, squat up into standing position with barbell over head.
OlympicLifts/DeficitSnatch.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to mid-thigh position. Slowly lower bar with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical. The advanced athlete may

OlympicLifts/FrontSquat.name: Front Squat (weightlifting style)
OlympicLifts/FrontSquat.execution: barbell from floor with overhand open grip, slightly wider than shoulder width. Position barbell chest high with back arched. Place bar in front of shoulders with
OlympicLifts/FrontSquat.comments: and finger under bar to each side. Position heels hip width or slightly wider with feet angled outward.

OlympicLifts/HangClean.name: Hang Clean
OlympicLifts/HangClean.preparation: Stand with barbell with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width. Feet point forward hip's width apart or slightly wider. Bend knees and hips so barbell touches mid-thigh; shoulders over bar with back arched. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar. Chest is spread and wrists are slightly flexed.
OlympicLifts/HangClean.execution: Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to flex out to sides, keeping bar close to body. Aggressively pull body under bar, rotating elbows around bar. Catch bar on shoulders while moving into squat position. Hitting bottom of squat, stand up immediately.
OlympicLifts/HangClean.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to mid-thigh position.

OlympicLifts/HangCleanJerk.name: Hang Clean and Jerk (from floor)
OlympicLifts/HangCleanJerk.preparation: Stand over barbell with balls of feet positioned under bar slightly wider apart than hip width. Squat down and grip bar with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width. Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar. Pull bar up off floor by extending hips and knees.
OlympicLifts/HangCleanJerk.execution: From standing position, bend knees and hips so barbell touches mid-thigh, shoulders over bar with back arched. Maintain arms' alignment with elbows pointed along bar. Chest is spread and wrists are slightly flexed. As bar reaches knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping barbell close to thighs. When barbell passes mid-thigh, allow it to contact thighs. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to flex out to sides, keeping bar close to body. Aggressively pull body under bar, rotating elbows around bar. Catch bar on shoulders while moving into squat position. Hitting bottom of squat, stand up immediately.
OlympicLifts/HangCleanJerk.comments: Adjust grip if necessary. Inhale and position chest high with torso tight. Keeping pressure on heels, dip body by bending knees and ankles slightly. Explosively drive upward with legs, driving barbell up off shoulders. Drop body downward and split one foot forward and other backward as fast as possible, while vigorously extending arms over head.

OlympicLifts/HangJumpShrug.name: Hang Jump Shrug
OlympicLifts/HangJumpShrug.preparation: Stand with barbell with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width. Bend knees and hips slightly; shoulders over bar with back arched. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/HangJumpShrug.comments: Bend hip and slightly bed knees and return bar to thigh.

OlympicLifts/HangPowerClean.name: Hang Power Clean
OlympicLifts/HangPowerClean.preparation: Stand with barbell with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width. Feet point forward hip's width apart or slightly wider. Bend knees and hips so barbell touches mid-thigh; shoulders over bar with back arched. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar. Chest is spread and wrists are slightly flexed.
OlympicLifts/HangPowerClean.execution: Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to flex out to sides, keeping bar close to body. Aggressively pull body under bar, rotating elbows around bar. Catch bar on shoulders before knees bend lower than 90°. Stand up immediately so thighs ride no lower than parallel to floor.
OlympicLifts/HangPowerClean.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to mid-thigh position.

OlympicLifts/HangPowerCleanJerk.name: Hang Power Clean and Jerk
OlympicLifts/HangPowerCleanJerk.preparation: Stand with barbell with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width. Feet point forward hip's width apart or slightly wider. Bend knees and hips so barbell touches mid-thigh; shoulders over bar with back arched. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar. Chest is spread and wrists are slightly flexed.
OlympicLifts/HangPowerCleanJerk.execution: Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to flex out to sides, keeping bar close to body. Aggressively pull body under bar, rotating elbows around bar. Catch bar on shoulders before knees bend lower than 90°. Stand up immediately so thighs ride no lower than parallel to floor.
OlympicLifts/HangPowerCleanJerk.comments: Adjust grip if necessary. Inhale and position chest high with torso tight. Keeping pressure on heels, dip body by bending knees and ankles slightly. Explosively drive upward with legs, driving barbell up off shoulders. Drop body downward and split one foot forward and other backward as fast as possible, while vigorously extending arms over head.

OlympicLifts/HangPowerCleanJerkFloor.name: Hang Power Clean and Jerk (from floor)
OlympicLifts/HangPowerCleanJerkFloor.preparation: Stand over barbell with balls of feet positioned under bar slightly wider apart than hip width. Squat down and grip bar with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width. Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar. Pull bar up off floor by extending hips and knees.
OlympicLifts/HangPowerCleanJerkFloor.execution: From standing position, bend knees and hips so barbell touches mid-thigh, shoulders over bar with back arched. Mantain arm's alignment with elbows pointed along bar. Chest is spread and wrists are slightly flexed. As bar reaches knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping barbell close to thighs. When barbell passes mid-thigh, allow it to contact thighs. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to flex out to sides, keeping bar close to body. Aggressively pull body under bar, rotating elbows around bar. Catch bar on shoulders before knees bend lower than 90°. Stand up immediately so thighs ride no lower than parallel to floor.
OlympicLifts/HangPowerCleanJerkFloor.comments: Adjust grip if necessary. Inhale and position chest high with torso tight. Keeping pressure on heels, dip body by bending knees and ankles slightly. Explosively drive upward with legs, driving barbell up off shoulders. Drop body downward and split one foot forward and other backward as fast as possible, while vigorously extending arms over head.

OlympicLifts/HangPowerSnatch.name: Hang Power Snatch
OlympicLifts/HangPowerSnatch.execution: Stand with barbell with very wide overhand grip. Bend knees and hips so barbell touches upper-thigh; shoulders over bar with back arched. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.

OlympicLifts/HangPull.name: Hang High Pull
OlympicLifts/HangPull.preparation: Stand with barbell using overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder width. Bend knees and hips so barbell touches mid-thigh, shoulders over bar with back arched. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/HangPull.execution: Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to flex out to sides. Pull bar upward to mid-chest height, keeping bar close to body.
OlympicLifts/HangPull.comments: Lower bar and bend knees and hips slightly to absorb inpact of arms straightening and barbell falling to upper thighs. Immediately straightening knees and hips.

OlympicLifts/HangSnatch.name: Hang Snatch
OlympicLifts/HangSnatch.execution: Stand with barbell with very wide overhand grip. Bend knees and hips so barbell touches upper-thigh; shoulders over bar with back arched. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.

OlympicLifts/HighBlockPowerSnatch.name: High Block Power Snatch
OlympicLifts/HighBlockPowerSnatch.preparation: Stand with barbell on high blocks with very wide overhand grip. Bend knees and hips so barbell touches thighs, shoulders over bar with back arched. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/HighBlockPowerSnatch.execution: Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to pull up to sides, keeping them over bar as long as possible. Aggressively pull body under bar. Catch bar at arm's length before knees bend lower than 90°. As soon as barbell is caught on locked out arms in partial squat position, stand up with barbell overhead immediately so thighs ride no lower than parallel to floor.
OlympicLifts/HighBlockPowerSnatch.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to blocks.

OlympicLifts/HighBlockSnatch.name: High Block Snatch
OlympicLifts/HighBlockSnatch.preparation: Stand with barbell on high blocks with very wide overhand grip. Bend knees and hips so barbell touches thighs, shoulders over bar with back arched. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/HighBlockSnatch.execution: Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to pull up to sides, keeping them over bar as long as possible. Aggressively pull body under bar. Catch bar at arm's length while moving into squat position.
