As soon as barbell is caught on locked out arms in squat position, squat up into standing position with barbell overhead.
OlympicLifts/HighBlockSnatch.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to blocks.

OlympicLifts/HighPull.name: High Pull
OlympicLifts/HighPull.preparation: Stand over barbell with balls of feet positioned under bar slightly wider apart than hip width. Squat down and grip bar with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width. Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/HighPull.execution: Pull bar up off floor by extending hips and knees. As bar reaches knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping barbell close to thighs, jump upward extending body. Flex elbows out to sides, pulling bar up to mid-chest height.
OlympicLifts/HighPull.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to mid-thigh position. Slowly lower bar with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical. The advanced athlete may

OlympicLifts/JumpShrug.name: Jump Shrug
OlympicLifts/JumpShrug.preparation: Stand over barbell with balls of feet positioned under bar hip's width apart or slightly wider. Squat down and grip bar with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width. Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar. Chest is spread and wrists are slightly flexed.
OlympicLifts/JumpShrug.execution: Pull bar up off floor by extending hips and knees. Jump up as high as possible and shrug shoulders.
OlympicLifts/JumpShrug.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to mid-thigh position. Slowly lower bar with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical.

OlympicLifts/OverheadSquat.name: Overhead Squat
OlympicLifts/OverheadSquat.execution: barbell over head with very wide overhand grip. Position toes outward with wide stance. Maintain bar behind head with arms extended.
OlympicLifts/OverheadSquat.comments: Descend until knees and hips are fully bent or until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Knees travel in direction of toes. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.

OlympicLifts/OverheadLunge.name: Overhead Lunge
OlympicLifts/OverheadLunge.execution: barbell from floor with overhand open grip, slightly wider than shoulder width.

OlympicLifts/PowerClean.name: Power Clean
OlympicLifts/PowerClean.preparation: Stand over barbell with balls of feet positioned under bar pointing forward, hip width's apart or slightly wider. Squat down and grip bar with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width (thumbs length from ends of knurlings on Olympic bar). Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/PowerClean.execution: Pull bar up off floor by extending hips and knees. As bar reaches knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping barbell close to thighs. When barbell passes mid-thigh, allow it to contact thighs. Jump upward, extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to flex out to sides, keeping bar close to body. Aggressively pull body under bar, rotating elbows around bar. Catch bar on shoulders before knees bend lower than 90°. Stand up immediately so thighs ride no lower than parallel to floor.
OlympicLifts/PowerClean.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to mid-thigh position. Slowly lower bar with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical. The advanced athlete may

OlympicLifts/PowerCleanJerk.name: Power Clean and Jerk
OlympicLifts/PowerCleanJerk.preparation: Stand over barbell with balls of feet positioned under bar slightly wider apart than hip width. Squat down and grip bar with overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder width. Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/PowerCleanJerk.execution: Pull bar up off floor by extending hips and knees. As bar reaches knees vigorously, raise shoulders while keeping barbell close to thighs. When barbell passes mid-thigh, allow it to contact thighs. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to flex out to sides, keeping bar close to body. Aggressively pull body under bar, rotating elbows around bar. Catch bar on shoulders before knees bend lower than 90°. Stand up immediately so thighs ride no lower than parallel to floor.
OlympicLifts/PowerCleanJerk.comments: Adjust grip if necessary. Inhale and position chest high with torso tight. Keeping pressure on heels, dip body by bending knees and ankles slightly. Explosively drive upward with legs, driving barbell up off shoulders. Drop body downward and split one foot forward and other backward as fast as possible, while vigorously extending arms over head. The split position places front shin vertical to floor with front foot flat on floor. The rear knee is slightly bent with rear foot positioned on toes. The bar should be positioned directly over ears at arm's length with back straight. Push up with both legs. Position feet side by side by bringing front foot back part way and then rear foot forward.

OlympicLifts/PowerSnatch.name: Power Snatch
OlympicLifts/PowerSnatch.execution: Stand over barbell with balls of feet positioned under bar hip width or slightly wider than hip width apart. Squat down and grip bar with very wide overhand grip. Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.

OlympicLifts/PressUnder.name: Press Under
OlympicLifts/PressUnder.preparation: barbell from floor a   nd position on shoulders or dismount barbell from rack. Grasp barbell to sides with very wide overhand grip. Position toes outward with wide stance.
OlympicLifts/PressUnder.execution: While pressing bar over head, squat down until knees and hips are fully bent or until thighs are just past parallel to floor and arms are extended.
OlympicLifts/PressUnder.comments: Maintain barbell over head with arms extended while extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Bend knees slightly and drop barbell to back of shoulders. Straighten legs and repeat execution.

OlympicLifts/PushPress.name: Push Press
OlympicLifts/PushPress.execution: barbell from floor with overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder width. Position bar chest high with torso tight. Retract head back.

OlympicLifts/PushPressBehindNeck.name: Push Press (behind neck)
OlympicLifts/PushPressBehindNeck.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders from rack or
OlympicLifts/PushPressBehindNeck.execution: barbell from floor with overhand grip and
OlympicLifts/PushPressBehindNeck.comments: bar to back of shoulders. Hands should be slightly wider than shoulder width with torso tight.

OlympicLifts/RomanianDeadlift.name: Romanian Deadlift
OlympicLifts/RomanianDeadlift.execution: from floor with shoulder width to wide overhand grip. Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance.
OlympicLifts/RomanianDeadlift.comments: Lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips while tracing front contour of legs through downward motion. Gradually bend knees through descent and keep spine straight so back is near horizontal at lowest position. Once hamstring is stretched fully just before lowering bar to completely to floor, lift bar by extending hips and knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.

OlympicLifts/QuickDrop.name: Quick Drop
OlympicLifts/QuickDrop.preparation: barbell from floor and position on shoulders or dismount barbell from rack. Grasp barbell to sides with very wide overhand grip. Position toes outward with wide stance.
OlympicLifts/QuickDrop.execution: Quickly dip body by bending knees, hips and ankles slightly. Explosively drive upward with legs, driving barbell up off shoulders, then immediately drop body downward into full squat position while vigorously extending arms over head.
OlympicLifts/QuickDrop.comments: Maintain barbell over head with arms extended while extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Bend knees slightly and drop barbell to back of shoulders. Straighten legs and repeat execution.

OlympicLifts/Snatch.name: Snatch
OlympicLifts/Snatch.preparation: Stand over barbell with balls of feet positioned under bar, hip width or slightly wider than hip width apart. Squat down and grip bar with very wide overhand grip. Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
OlympicLifts/Snatch.execution: Pull bar up off floor by extending hips and knees. As bar reaches knees, back stays arched and maintains same angle to floor as in starting position. When barbell passes knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping bar as close to legs as possible. When bar passes upper thighs, allow it to contact thighs. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to pull up to sides, keeping them over bar as long as possible. Aggressively pull body under bar. Catch bar at arm's length while moving into squat position. As soon as barbell is caught on locked out arms in squat position, squat up into standing position with barbell over head.
OlympicLifts/Snatch.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to mid-thigh position. Slowly lower bar with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical. The advanced athlete may

OlympicLifts/SotsPress.name: Sots Press
OlympicLifts/SotsPress.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders from rack or
OlympicLifts/SotsPress.execution: barbell from floor with overhand grip and
OlympicLifts/SotsPress.comments: bar to back of shoulders. Position feet shoulder width or slightly wider with feet angled outward. Place hands far apart using snatch width grip. Press bar overhead. With bar overhead, squat down in deep squat position with knees pointing outward, same angle as feet.

OlympicLifts/SplitJerk.name: Split Jerk
OlympicLifts/SplitJerk.execution: barbell from floor with overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder width. Position bar chest high with torso tight. Retract head back.

OlympicLifts/SplitJerkBehindNeck.name: Split Jerk (behind neck)
OlympicLifts/SplitJerkBehindNeck.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders from rack or
OlympicLifts/SplitJerkBehindNeck.execution: barbell from floor with overhand grip and

Other/ArmCircle.name: Arm Circle
Other/ArmCircle.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or slightly wider. Extend arms straight out to each side horizontally.
Other/ArmCircle.execution: Rotate arms together in small circular motions. Gradually increase size of rotations until arms eventially rotating in wide circular motions. Repeat in opposite circular direction.
Other/ArmCircle.comments: Circles can rotate either direction (1) down and back to up and forward or (2) up and back to down and forward; most commonly performing first set one direction followed by second set in opposite direction. Movement can serve to warm up shoulders before athletic performance or sports training session. The wide movements also can

Other/BalanceBoardStand.name: Balance Board Stand
Other/BalanceBoardStand.preparation: Stand facing balance board. Step on one end of board. Slowly step on other end of board.
Other/BalanceBoardStand.execution: Balance body weight on top of balance board so board is nearly vertical with little movement.
Other/BalanceBoardStand.comments: Use upper arm movement to assist with balance. When finished, shift weight to one side. Step off with highest foot first.

Other/BalanceBoardSquat.name: Balance Board Squat
Other/BalanceBoardSquat.preparation: Stand facing balance board. Step on one end of board. Slowly step on other end of board. Balance body weight on top of balance board so board is nearly vertical with little movement. See
Other/BalanceBoardSquat.comments: Extend arms forward in front of body. Squat down by bending knees slightly forward while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Squat up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.

Other/BBTurkishGetUp.name: Barbell Turkish Get-up
Other/BBTurkishGetUp.execution: Lie supine on floor. Position barbell above shoulders with arm straight and vertical.

Other/DBProneInclineBreaststroke.name: Dumbbell Prone Incline Breaststroke
Other/DBProneInclineBreaststroke.preparation: With dumbbells in each hand, lie prone on 45
Other/DBProneInclineBreaststroke.execution: Incline bench with head over top of bench and arms extended down to each side.
Other/DBProneInclineBreaststroke.comments: With arms straight, extend arms forward until arms are parallel, keeping dumbbells as high as possible. Pull arms outward to each side so dumbbells and shoulders are inline and horizontal. Pull dumbbells back behind hips to each side. Lower arms down to original position, extended down to each side. Repeat.

Other/DBProneInclineButterfly.name: Dumbbell Prone Incline Butterfly
Other/DBProneInclineButterfly.preparation: With dumbbells in each hand, lie prone on 45
Other/DBProneInclineButterfly.execution: Incline bench with head over top of bench and arms extended down to each side.
Other/DBProneInclineButterfly.comments: With arms straight, pull dumbbells back behind hips to each side. Extend arms outward to each side so dumbbells and shoulders are inline and horizontal. Extend arms forward until arms are parallel, keeping dumbbells as high as possible. Lower arms down to original position, extended down to each side. Repeat.

Other/DBTurkishGetUp.name: Dumbbell Turkish Get-up
Other/DBTurkishGetUp.execution: Lie supine on floor. Position dumbbell straight above shoulder with arm straight and vertical. Lie left arm out to side.

Other/DBWindmill.name: Dumbbell Windmill
Other/DBWindmill.preparation: Raise dumbbell over head. Stand with left arm fully extended upward supporting kettlebell and right arm out extended out to side. Stand with legs far apart with feet angled slightly out to the sides.
Other/DBWindmill.execution: Bend over to right side with knees straight. Reach toward toes of left foot with right hand. Keep knees straight and kettlebell balanced over left shoulder with both arms extended. Touch left foot. Raise back up to original position, maintaining balance of dumbbell over head above left shoulder. Repeat. Continue movement on opposite side.
Other/DBWindmill.comments: Exercise emphasizes load balance, shoulder mobility, and hamstring flexibility. Also see

Other/SBFarmersWalk.name: Farmer's Walk
Other/SBFarmersWalk.preparation: Squat down between two heavy loaded bars specialized for Farmer's Walk and grasp one in each hand. Deadlift weighted bars from floor using legs. Stand holding bars with arms straight down to sides.
Other/SBFarmersWalk.execution: Walk for distance while counting laps.
Other/SBFarmersWalk.comments: Suggested lifting and lower technique from floor will be similar to

Other/STSupineFeedMountDismount.name: Suspended Supine Feet Mount / Dismount
Other/STSupineFeedMountDismount.execution: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Grasp bottom of loops, then lay supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles. Extend legs out and place arms on floor off to sides.

Other/STProneFeedMountDismount.name: Suspended Prone Feet Mount / Dismount
Other/STProneFeedMountDismount.execution: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Place right foot in left lower loop. Cross left leg over right leg placed in right lower loop. Turn body to right and place hands on floor shoulder width apart. Turn body to kneel on hands and knees. Reposition forearms or hands at desired distance from suspension trainer so that body is square with suspension trainer straps. raise knees from ground, so body is supported by arms and suspension trainer.

Other/STChestMountDismount.name: Suspended Prone Mount / Dismount
Other/STChestMountDismount.execution: Grasp handles and step forward between suspension trainers. Position arms downward and slightly forward, nearly parallel with suspension straps. Lean forward, placing upper body weight onto handles with arms straight, while stepping back onto forefeet so body is leaning forward at desired angle. Straighten body so torso is in-line with legs.

Other/WindmillPushupMB.name: Windmill Push-up (on medicine ball)
Other/WindmillPushupMB.preparation: Kneel before medicine ball. Place one hand on top of ball and other hand on floor, slightly wider than shoulder width away. Position upper body above both hands with one arm straight on floor and other arm bent with hand on ball. Straighten body with forefeet back away from ball on floor, shoulder width apart.
Other/WindmillPushupMB.execution: Keeping body straight, lower body by bending arms until slight stretch is felt in shoulder or chest. Push body up by extending arms. Support upper body weight on medicine ball as hand on floor is raised off of floor. Rotate body, facing toward opposite direction of ball and lift extended arm back and over body. Lower raised arm and body, back down to original position. Repeat. Continue with medicine ball under opposite hand.
Other/WindmillPushupMB.comments: Also known as Push-up to Side Plank on Medicine Ball.

PectoralClavicular/BBInclineBenchPress.name: Barbell Incline Bench Press
PectoralClavicular/BBInclineBenchPress.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench. Dismount barbell from rack over upper chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
PectoralClavicular/BBInclineBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to upper chest. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/BBInclineBenchPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralClavicular/BWDeclinePushup.name: Decline Push-up
PectoralClavicular/BWDeclinePushup.preparation: Kneel on floor with bench or elevation behind body. Position hands on floor slightly wider than shoulder width. Place feet on bench or elevation. Raise body in plank position with body straight and arms extended.
PectoralClavicular/BWDeclinePushup.execution: Keeping body straight, lower upper body to floor by bending arms. To allow for full descent, pull head back slightly without arching back. Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/BWDeclinePushup.comments: Both upper and lower body must be kept straight throughout movement. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralClavicular/BWDeclinePushupOnBall.name: Decline Push-up (on stability ball)
PectoralClavicular/BWDeclinePushupOnBall.preparation: Kneel with chest or waist on exercise ball. Dive over top and place hands on floor with arms extended down supporting upper body. While keeping body horizontal, walk hands further away from ball until thighs are positioned on top of ball and hands are slightly wider than shoulder width. Bend knees so feet are up above knees.
PectoralClavicular/BWDeclinePushupOnBall.execution: Keeping hips straight, lower upper body to floor by bending arms. To allow for full descent, pull head back slightly without arching back. Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/BWDeclinePushupOnBall.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralClavicular/BWPikePushup.name: Pike Push-up
PectoralClavicular/BWPikePushup.preparation: Kneel on two benches positioned side by side slightly apart at end nearest head. Place hands on ends of benches. With forefeet on opposite ends of bench, raise rear end high up with arms, back, and knees straight.
PectoralClavicular/BWPikePushup.execution: Lower head between ends of benches by bending arms. Push body back up to original position by extending arms. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/BWPikePushup.comments: Pike Push-up (for upper chest) differs from

PectoralClavicular/CBBarStandingInclineC.name: Cable Bar Standing Incline Chest Press
PectoralClavicular/CBBarStandingInclineC.preparation: Stand facing behind cable bar, mounted on each side to lower chest height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip. Position bar upper mid-chest height with elbows angled behind and downward. Lean and step forward with one foot in front, bending forward knee.
PectoralClavicular/CBBarStandingInclineC.execution: Push cable bar forward and upward at 30º to 45º until arms are straight. Return cable bar to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/CBBarStandingInclineC.comments: Cable pulleys should be closer together than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralClavicular/CBBarInclineBenchPres.name: Cable Bar Incline Bench Press
PectoralClavicular/CBBarInclineBenchPres.preparation: Position adjustable pulley higher than intended height, but within arms reach from incline bench. Position incline bench under cable bar. Lie supine on incline bench. While lying on bench, reach over and lower each pulley into intended position so that cables are taut in lowest position with bar on chest. Grasp bar with both hands using wide oblique overhand grip.
PectoralClavicular/CBBarInclineBenchPres.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended. Lower bar to upper chest or until slight stretch is felt in shoulders. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/CBBarInclineBenchPres.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralClavicular/CBInclineBenchPress.name: Cable Incline Bench Press
PectoralClavicular/CBInclineBenchPress.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side (attached to low cable pulleys). Lie back on incline back support. Position stirrups out to each side of chest with bent arm under each wrist.
PectoralClavicular/CBInclineBenchPress.execution: Push stirrups up over each shoulder until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/CBInclineBenchPress.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at top.

PectoralClavicular/CBInclineChestPress.name: Cable Incline Chest Press
PectoralClavicular/CBInclineChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side (attached to medium height pulleys). Position elbows out to sides, slightly lower than shoulder height. Position hands back approximately shoulder height and elbow width.
PectoralClavicular/CBInclineChestPress.execution: Push stirrups away from body, slightly upward at 30º to 45º until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/CBInclineChestPress.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front/above of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, travelling inward in front/above each shoulder at contracted position.

PectoralClavicular/CBInclineFly.name: Cable Incline Fly
PectoralClavicular/CBInclineFly.preparation: Sit on seat with stirrups in each hand (attached to low cable pulleys). Lie back on incline back support. Position stirrups out to each side of chest with bent arm under each wrist. Press stirrups over each shoulder until arms vertical. Bend elbows slightly and internally rotate shoulders so elbows point out to sides.
PectoralClavicular/CBInclineFly.execution: Lower stirrups outward to sides of shoulders. Keep elbows fixed in slightly bent position. When a stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, bring stirrups back together in hugging motion above upper chest until stirrups are nearly together Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/CBInclineFly.comments: Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Shoulder will likely have less range of motion in lower position as compared to

PectoralClavicular/CBStandTwistInclineCh.name: Cable One Arm Standing Incline Chest Press
PectoralClavicular/CBStandTwistInclineCh.preparation: Grasp cable stirrup from hip height pulley. Turn body away from pulley. Position elbow of loaded arm out to side, lower chest height. Position loaded hand back approximately shoulder height and elbow width. Step far forward with foot of opposite side of loaded arm. Bend knees and position heel of rear foot off floor.
PectoralClavicular/CBStandTwistInclineCh.execution: Push stirrups forward and upward at 30º to 45º until arm is straight and in-line with cable. Return stirrup to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
PectoralClavicular/CBStandTwistInclineCh.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front/above of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, travelling inward in front/above shoulder at contracted position.

PectoralClavicular/CBStandingInclineChes.name: Cable Standing Incline Chest Press
PectoralClavicular/CBStandingInclineChes.preparation: Stand between two hip height pulleys, facing away from cable columns. Grasp cable stirrups from each side. Position elbows out to sides, lower chest height. Position hands back approximately shoulder height and elbow width. Lean and step forward with one foot in front bending forward knee.
PectoralClavicular/CBStandingInclineChes.execution: Push stirrups forward and upward at 30º to 45º angle until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/CBStandingInclineChes.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front/above of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, travelling inward in front/above each shoulder at contracted position. Cable pulleys should be closer together than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.

PectoralClavicular/CBStandingInclineFly.name: Cable Standing Incline Fly
PectoralClavicular/CBStandingInclineFly.preparation: Stand between two pulleys position hip height and arms width or slightly wider apart. Grasp stirrups, one in each hand. Extend arms out with elbows slightly bent, pointed back and downward slightly. Step forward until cables are taut or when weights are lifted up slightly. Stand with feet staggered.
PectoralClavicular/CBStandingInclineFly.execution: Keeping elbows fixed in slightly bent position, bring stirrups together in upwardly arching, hugging motion, at 30º to 45º angle until they meet at top of motion. Lower stirrups to original position in reverse pattern. As soon as stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, repeat motion.

PectoralClavicular/DBInclineBenchPress.name: Dumbbell Incline Bench Press
PectoralClavicular/DBInclineBenchPress.preparation: Sit down on incline bench with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. Kick weights to shoulders and lean back. Position dumbbells to sides of chest with upper arm under each dumbbell.
PectoralClavicular/DBInclineBenchPress.execution: Press dumbbells up with elbows to sides until arms are extended. Lower weight to sides of upper chest until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/DBInclineBenchPress.comments: Dumbbell should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at top. See suggested

PectoralClavicular/DBInclineFly.name: Dumbbell Incline Fly
PectoralClavicular/DBInclineFly.preparation: Grasp two dumbbells. Lie supine on bench. Support dumbbells above upper chest with arms fixed in slightly bent position. Bend elbows slightly and internally rotate shoulders so elbows point out to sides.
PectoralClavicular/DBInclineFly.execution: Lower dumbbells outward to sides of shoulders. Keep elbows fixed in slightly bent position. When a stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, bring dumbbells back together in hugging motion above upper chest until dumbbells are nearly together. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/DBInclineFly.comments: Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Shoulder will likely have less range of motion in lower position as compared to

PectoralClavicular/LVAlternatingInclineC.name: Lever Alternating Incline Chest Press
PectoralClavicular/LVAlternatingInclineC.preparation: Sit on seat with upper chest just above grips on lever. Grasp grips with wide overhand grip and position elbows out to sides.
PectoralClavicular/LVAlternatingInclineC.execution: Press one lever until arm is extended. Return lever back down until chest muscle is slightly stretched. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
PectoralClavicular/LVAlternatingInclineC.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralClavicular/LVBBInclineBenchPress.name: Lever Barbell Incline Bench Press (plate loaded)
PectoralClavicular/LVBBInclineBenchPress.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench with upper chest under bar. Grasp bar with wide oblique overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
PectoralClavicular/LVBBInclineBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to chest. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/LVBBInclineBenchPress.comments: Orientation relative to lever will depend upon height of fulcrum relative to bench. Position body so bar is over shoulders during extension, yet lower on chest in lowest position. Feet can be placed on bench as shown for more comfortable low back positioning. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralClavicular/LVInclineBenchPress.name: Lever Incline Bench Press
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineBenchPress.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench with upper chest under lever bar. Grasp lever bar with wide oblique overhand grip.
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineBenchPress.execution: Press bar until arms are extended. Lower weight to upper chest. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineBenchPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralClavicular/LVInclineBenchPressPL.name: Lever Incline Bench Press (plate loaded)
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineBenchPressPL.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench with lever bars out to sides of chest. Grasp handles with wide overhand grip.
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineBenchPressPL.execution: Press lever bars up until arms are extended. Lower weight toward upper chest. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineBenchPressPL.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralClavicular/LVInclineChestPress.name: Lever Incline Chest Press
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat with upper chest just above grips on lever. If available, push foot lever until handles are within grasping range. Grasp handles with wide oblique overhand grip and position elbows out to sides. Release foot lever.
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineChestPress.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until shoulders or chest feels slightly stretched. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineChestPress.comments: Some machines have foot levers to position handles in a more comfortable starting and ending position. If foot lever is available, engage it before releasing grips.

PectoralClavicular/LVInclineChestPressH.name: Lever Incline Chest Press (plate loaded)
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineChestPressH.preparation: Sit on seat with upper chest just above grips on lever. Grasp grips with wide overhand grip and position elbows out to sides.
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineChestPressH.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineChestPressH.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralClavicular/LVInclineFly.name: Lever Incline Fly
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineFly.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Position inside of forearms under roller pads with arms out to each side. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineFly.execution: Raise lever upward and together in hugging motion. Lower weight until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineFly.comments: Elbows should be pointing downward at bottom of motion and outward on top of motion.

PectoralClavicular/LVInclineChestPressOn.name: Lever Incline Chest Press (on Hammer military press)
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineChestPressOn.preparation: Sit on seat with upper chest just above base of handles on lever. Grasp grips with wide overhand grip. Lift levers into starting position with elbows slightly low.
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineChestPressOn.execution: Press levers until arms are extended. Return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched with elbows positioned out to sides. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/LVInclineChestPressOn.comments: This exercise is typically performed on

PectoralClavicular/LVParallelGripIncline.name: Lever Parallel Grip Incline Bench Press
PectoralClavicular/LVParallelGripIncline.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench with parallel lever bars out to sides of rib cage. Grasp parallel handles.
PectoralClavicular/LVParallelGripIncline.execution: Press lever bars up until arms are extended. Lower weight toward upper chest. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/LVParallelGripIncline.comments: Seat should be adjusted so handles are to sides of lower chest. Parallel grip tends to place shoulders in a more stable position, with arms closer to sides, which may be more ideal for those with certain shoulder issues. Also see exercise performed with

PectoralClavicular/LVParallelGripIncline.name: Lever Parallel Grip Incline Bench Press (plate loaded)
PectoralClavicular/LVParallelGripIncline.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench with parallel lever bars out to sides of rib cage. Grasp parallel handles.
PectoralClavicular/LVParallelGripIncline.execution: Press lever bars up until arms are extended. Lower weight toward upper chest. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/LVParallelGripIncline.comments: Seat should be adjusted, so handles are to sides of lower chest. Parallel grip tends to place shoulders in a more stable position, with arms closer to sides, which may be more ideal for those with certain shoulder issues. See exercise on

PectoralClavicular/LVParallelGripIncline.name: Lever Parallel Grip Incline Chest Press
PectoralClavicular/LVParallelGripIncline.preparation: Sit on seat with lower chest at height of parallel handles. If available, push foot lever until handles are within grasping range. Grasp parallel handles.
PectoralClavicular/LVParallelGripIncline.execution: Press lever bars up until arms are extended. Return weight until shoulders or chest feels slightly stretched. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/LVParallelGripIncline.comments: Some machines have foot levers to position handles in a more comfortable starting position. If available, push lever with foot, grasp bar, and release foot lever.

PectoralClavicular/SMInclineBenchPress.name: Smith Incline Bench Press
PectoralClavicular/SMInclineBenchPress.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench with upper chest under bar. Grasp bar with wide oblique overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
PectoralClavicular/SMInclineBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to upper chest. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralClavicular/SMInclineBenchPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/ASChestDipBand.name: Band-assisted Chest Dip
PectoralSternal/ASChestDipBand.preparation: Place one foot on middle of exercise band with ends looped on
PectoralSternal/ASChestDipBand.execution: . Push band down partially by extending leg. Mount dip bar with oblique grip (bar diagonal under palm), arms straight, and shoulders above hands. Place other foot on exercise band next to other foot. Bend knees and hips slightly.
PectoralSternal/ASChestDipBand.comments: Lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to flare out to sides. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/AsChestDip.name: Machine-assisted Chest Dip
PectoralSternal/AsChestDip.execution: with oblique grip (bar diagonal under palm), arms straight with shoulders above hands. Step down onto assistance lever with hips and knees bent.
PectoralSternal/AsChestDip.comments: Lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to flare out to sides. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/AsChestDipKneeling.name: Machine-assisted Chest Dip (kneeling)
PectoralSternal/AsChestDipKneeling.execution: with oblique grip (bar diagonal under palm), arms straight with shoulders above hands. Kneel on padded platform, lowering it down slightly so hips are slightly bent.
PectoralSternal/AsChestDipKneeling.comments: Lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to flare out to sides. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/AsChestDipSelf.name: Self-assisted Chest Dip
PectoralSternal/AsChestDipSelf.preparation: Stand on bench or elevation between parallel bars. Mount
PectoralSternal/AsChestDipSelf.execution: with oblique grip (bar diagonal under palm), arms straight with shoulders above hands. Bend knees and hips slightly and place forefoot on bench or elevation below.
PectoralSternal/AsChestDipSelf.comments: Lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to flare out to sides. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees and hips to bend, keeping forefeet in contact with bench or elevation. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up until arms are straight and repeat, again with minimal assistance from legs.

PectoralSternal/BBBenchPress.name: Barbell Bench Press
PectoralSternal/BBBenchPress.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Dismount barbell from rack over upper chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
PectoralSternal/BBBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to chest. Press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/BBBenchPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/BBBenchPressChain.name: Barbell Bench Press (with chains)
PectoralSternal/BBBenchPressChain.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Grasp barbell loaded with thick chains from each side, with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Dismount barbell from rack over chest.
PectoralSternal/BBBenchPressChain.execution: Lower weight to chest. Press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/BBBenchPressChain.comments: Chains provide increasing resistance as barbell moves away from floor. Chains can be used during either

PectoralSternal/BBBenchPressPowerLift.name: Barbell Bench Press (power lift)
PectoralSternal/BBBenchPressPowerLift.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Grasp bar with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Arch back, extend hips, and position feet back flat on floor. Dismount barbell from rack over chest.
PectoralSternal/BBBenchPressPowerLift.execution: Lower weight to lower chest. Press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/BBBenchPressPowerLift.comments: Competitive lifting requires bar to make contact with chest above bottom of the sternum with momentary pause. Gluteus Maximus, Erector Spinae, Quadriceps, and other muscles may be considered significant stabilizers during actual powerlift.

PectoralSternal/BBBoardPress.name: Barbell Board Press
PectoralSternal/BBBoardPress.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Grasp bar with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Arch back, extend hips, and position feet back flat on floor. Dismount barbell from rack over chest. Have assistant hold board on center of chest.
PectoralSternal/BBBoardPress.execution: Lower weight toward lower chest on   to board. Press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/BBBoardPress.comments: Instead of assistant holding bench board, it can be strapped to torso, as shown. Boards of varying thicknesses (1, 2, or 3) can be used. Board Press develops strength in middle range of motion for

PectoralSternal/BBDeclineBenchPress.name: Barbell Decline Bench Press
PectoralSternal/BBDeclineBenchPress.preparation: Lie supine on decline bench with feet under leg brace. Dismount barbell from rack over chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
PectoralSternal/BBDeclineBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to chest. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/BBDeclineBenchPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/BBFloorPress.name: Barbell Floor Press
PectoralSternal/BBFloorPress.preparation: Lie supine on floor at base of power rack. Place feet on floor with knees bent. Grasp bar from rack with overhand and slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Dismount barbell from rack over chest.
PectoralSternal/BBFloorPress.execution: Lower weight to lower chest until the triceps are completely on the floor. Relax momentarily, then press bar upward until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/BBFloorPress.comments: Floor Presses are also said to build explosive strength by breaking eccentric/concentric chain (AKA:

PectoralSternal/BBGuillotineBenchPress.name: Barbell Guillotine Bench Press
PectoralSternal/BBGuillotineBenchPress.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Dismount barbell from rack over upper chest using wide oblique overhand grip.
PectoralSternal/BBGuillotineBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to neck to upper chest. Upper arms will be perpendicular to torso. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/BBGuillotineBenchPress.comments: Upper arm travels in perpendicular path to torso to minimize anterior deltoid involvement and mimics upper arm positioning of

PectoralSternal/BWChestDip.name: Chest Dip
PectoralSternal/BWChestDip.execution: with oblique grip (bar diagonal under palm), arms straight with shoulders above hands. Bend knees and hips slightly.
PectoralSternal/BWChestDip.comments: Lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to flare out to sides. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/BWChestDipBenches.name: Chest Dip (between benches)
PectoralSternal/BWChestDipBenches.preparation: Stand between ends of two benches. Place hands on ends of benches with fingers off ends of benches. Grip should be somewhat
PectoralSternal/BWChestDipBenches.execution: . Position feet out in front with legs straight, heels on floor, and torso upright.
PectoralSternal/BWChestDipBenches.comments: Lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to flare out to sides. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/BWChestDipBenchesBentKne.name: Chest Dip (bent knees between benches)
PectoralSternal/BWChestDipBenchesBentKne.preparation: Stand between ends of two benches. Place hands on ends of benches with fingers off ends of benches. Position feet out in front with legs bent and torso upright.
PectoralSternal/BWChestDipBenchesBentKne.execution: Lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to flare out to sides. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/BWChestDipBenchesBentKne.comments: In above clip, hands are positioned at ends of main segments of benches with fingers between gaps. On standard benches, hands should be placed near ends of benches. Perform on higher benches if slight stretch is not felt. Also see

PectoralSternal/BWInclinePushup.name: Incline Push-up
PectoralSternal/BWInclinePushup.preparation: Stand facing bench or sturdy elevated platform. Place hands on edge of bench or platform, slightly wider than shoulder width. Position forefoot back from bench or platform with arms and body straight. Arms should be perpendicular to body.
PectoralSternal/BWInclinePushup.execution: Keeping body straight, lower chest to edge of box or platform by bending arms. Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/BWInclinePushup.comments: Both upper and lower body must be kept straight throughout movement. Height of bench or platform affects difficulty of movement.

PectoralSternal/BWInclinePushupBar.name: Incline Push-up (on bar)
PectoralSternal/BWInclinePushupBar.preparation: Grasp horizontal bar (lower than chest height) with hands slightly wider than shoulder width. Position forefeet back from bar with arms and body straight. Arms should be perpendicular to body.
PectoralSternal/BWInclinePushupBar.execution: Keeping body straight, lower chest to bar by bending arms. Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/BWInclinePushupBar.comments: Both upper and lower body must be kept straight throughout movement. Height of bar affects difficulty of movement. See

PectoralSternal/BWPushup.name: Push-up
PectoralSternal/BWPushup.preparation: Lie prone on floor with hands slightly wider than shoulder width. Raise body up off floor by extending arms with body straight.
PectoralSternal/BWPushup.execution: Keeping body straight, lower body to floor by bending arms. Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/BWPushup.comments: Both upper and lower body must be kept straight throughout movement. See

PectoralSternal/BWPushupKnee.name: Push-up (on knees)
PectoralSternal/BWPushupKnee.preparation: Lie prone on floor with hands slightly wider than shoulder width. Bend knees and raise body up off floor by extending arms with body straight.
PectoralSternal/BWPushupKnee.execution: Keeping body straight and knees bent, lower body to floor by bending arms. Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/BWPushupKnee.comments: Both upper and lower body must be kept straight throughout movement. Forefeet can remain on floor as long as body is pivoting on knees.

PectoralSternal/CBBarBenchPress.name: Cable Bar Bench Press
PectoralSternal/CBBarBenchPress.preparation: Position adjustable pulley higher than intended height but within arms reach from bench. Position bench under cable bar. Lie supine on bench. While lying on bench, reach over and lower each pulley into intended position so that cables are taut in lowest position with bar on chest. Grasp bar with both hands using wide oblique overhand grip.
PectoralSternal/CBBarBenchPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended. Lower bar to chest or until slight stretch is felt in shoulders. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/CBBarBenchPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/CBBarStandingChestPress.name: Cable Bar Standing Chest Press
PectoralSternal/CBBarStandingChestPress.preparation: Stand facing behind cable bar, mounted on each side to shoulder height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip. Position bar chest height with elbows angled behind. Lean and step forward with one foot in front, bending forward leg.
PectoralSternal/CBBarStandingChestPress.execution: Push cable bar forward until arms are straight. Return cable bar to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/CBBarStandingChestPress.comments: Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/CBBarStandingDeclineChes.name: Cable Bar Standing Decline Chest Press
PectoralSternal/CBBarStandingDeclineChes.preparation: Stand facing behind cable bar mounted on each side to shoulder height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip. Position bar   chest height with elbows angled behind and above. Lean and step forward with one foot in front, bending forward knee.
PectoralSternal/CBBarStandingDeclineChes.execution: Push cable bar forward and downward until bar is about hip height and arms are straight. Return cable bar to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/CBBarStandingDeclineChes.comments: Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.

PectoralSternal/CBBenchPress.name: Cable Bench Press
PectoralSternal/CBBenchPress.preparation: Lie on bench and grasp stirrups attached to low cable pulley on each side. Position stirrups out to each side of chest with bent arm under each wrist.
PectoralSternal/CBBenchPress.execution: Push stirrups up over each shoulder until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch is felt in shoulders or chest. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/CBBenchPress.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at t   op. Also see

PectoralSternal/CBChestDip.name: Cable Chest Dip
PectoralSternal/CBChestDip.comments: with dip belt around waist. Kneel as close as possible to low pulley and attach cable to dip belt. Stand up and mount dip bar with oblique grip (bar diagonal under palm), arms straight with shoulders above hands. Keep hips and knees bent.

PectoralSternal/CBChestPress.name: Cable Chest Press
PectoralSternal/CBChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side. Position elbows out to sides, slightly lower than shoulder height. Position hands slightly narrower than elbow width in front of upper arms.
PectoralSternal/CBChestPress.execution: Push stirrups out straight until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch is felt in shoulders or chest. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/CBChestPress.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, traveling inward in front of each shoulder at extended position.

PectoralSternal/CBDeclineChestPress.name: Cable Decline Chest Press
PectoralSternal/CBDeclineChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side. Position elbows out to sides, slightly lower than shoulder height. Position hands slightly narrower than elbow width in front of upper arms.
PectoralSternal/CBDeclineChestPress.execution: Push stirrups forward and slightly downward until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch is felt in shoulders or chest. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/CBDeclineChestPress.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, traveling inward and slightly downward just below each shoulder at ex   tended position.

PectoralSternal/CBDeclineFly.name: Cable Decline Fly
PectoralSternal/CBDeclineFly.preparation: Grasp two opposing high pulley dumbbell attachments. Lie supine on decline bench, in middle and perpendicular to both pulleys. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
PectoralSternal/CBDeclineFly.execution: Bring cable stirrups together above upper abdomen in hugging motion; elbows in fixed position and shoulders internally rotated so elbows are to sides. Return to starting position until chest is slightly stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/CBDeclineFly.comments: Since incline of bench does not actually affect angle of pull as with dumbbells, similar effect can be achieved on flat bench if cable stirrups are brought together above upper abdomen instead of chest.   Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent. Anterior Deltoid will no longer act as synergist in steep decline bench position.

PectoralSternal/CBLyingFly.name: Cable Lying Fly
PectoralSternal/CBLyingFly.preparation: Grasp two opposing low pulley stirrup attachments. Lie supine on bench, in middle and perpendicular to both pulleys. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
PectoralSternal/CBLyingFly.execution: Bring cable attachments together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position and shoulders internally rotated so elbows are to sides. Return to starting position until slight stretch. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/CBLyingFly.comments: Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent.

PectoralSternal/CBOneArmChestPress.name: Cable One Arm Chest Press
PectoralSternal/CBOneArmChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp stirrup to one side. Position elbows out to side, slightly lower than shoulder height. Position hand slightly narrower than elbow width in front of upper arm.
PectoralSternal/CBOneArmChestPress.execution: Push stirrups out straight in front of shoulder until arm is straight. Return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt through shoulder or chest. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/CBSeatedFly.name: Cable Seated Fly
PectoralSternal/CBSeatedFly.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
PectoralSternal/CBSeatedFly.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, bring cable attachments together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position. Return to starting position until slight stretch. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/CBSeatedFly.comments: Shoulders are kept internally rotated so elbows are pointing back   and out to sides.

PectoralSternal/CBStandingChestPress.name: Cable Standing Chest Press
PectoralSternal/CBStandingChestPress.preparation: Stand between two shoulder height pulleys, facing away from cable columns. Grasp cable stirrups from each side. Position stirrups to sides of chest with elbows out to sides. Position forearms horizontally and parallel with hands elbow width. Step forward in lunging posture (one foot in front and other foot behind). Lean and step forward with one foot in front, bending forward leg.
PectoralSternal/CBStandingChestPress.execution: Push stirrups forward until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/CBStandingChestPress.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern as hands travel closer together toward extension. Cable pulleys should be relatively close together, narrower than width of arms extended out to sides (but not too close), closer than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.

PectoralSternal/CBStandingDeclineChestPr.name: Cable Standing Decline Chest Press
PectoralSternal/CBStandingDeclineChestPr.preparation: Stand between two high pulleys, facing away from cable columns. Grasp cable stirrups from each side. Position stirrups down to sides of lower chest with elbows high out to sides. Angle forearms downward with hands elbow width or slightly narrower. Lean and step forward with
PectoralSternal/CBStandingDeclineChestPr.execution: or stand feet side by side with both legs slightly bent (as shown).
PectoralSternal/CBStandingDeclineChestPr.comments: Push stirrups at forward/downward angle until arms are straight and parallel to one another. Return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/CBStandingFly.name: Cable Standing Fly
PectoralSternal/CBStandingFly.preparation: Grasp two opposing high pulley dumbbell attachments. Stand with pulleys to each side. Bend over slightly by flexing hips and knees. Bend elbows slightly and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back initially.
PectoralSternal/CBStandingFly.execution: Bring cable attachments together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position. Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows are pointed upward at top and out to sides at bottom. Return to starting position until chest muscles are stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/CBStandingFly.comments: Under greater resistance, positioning torso at lower angle downward (by bending over at hips), will allow upper body weight to counterbalance upward pull of cables, as opposed to stepping forward and struggling with   backward pull of cables.

PectoralSternal/CBTwistingChestPress.name: Cable Twisting Chest Press
PectoralSternal/CBTwistingChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp stirrup to one side. Position elbow out to side, slightly lower than shoulder height. Position hand slightly narrower than elbow width, in front of upper arm. Lean forward in seat.
PectoralSternal/CBTwistingChestPress.execution: Push stirrup out in front of upper chest while turning torso away from pulley. Return stirrup and torso back to original position allowing torso to rotate back until slight stretch is felt through chest, shoulder or waist. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/CBTwistingChestPress.comments: The effective range of motion of Pectoralis Major is only about half of what it is in

PectoralSternal/CBTwistingStandingChestP.name: Cable Twisting Standing Chest Press
PectoralSternal/CBTwistingStandingChestP.preparation: Grasp cable stirrup from chest height pulley. Turn body away from pulley. Position elbow of loaded arm out to side, lower chest height. Position loaded hand back approximately shoulder height and elbow width. Step far forward with foot of opposite side of loaded arm. Bend knees and position heel off rear foot off floor.
PectoralSternal/CBTwistingStandingChestP.execution: Push stirrups away from body, horizontally until arm is straight and inline with cable. Return stirrups to original position until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
PectoralSternal/CBTwistingStandingChestP.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, in front of upper arm between elbow and chest in stretched position, traveling inward in front shoulder at contracted position.

PectoralSternal/DBBenchPress.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
PectoralSternal/DBBenchPress.preparation: Sit down on bench with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. Kick weights to shoulder and lie back. Position dumbbells to sides of chest with bent arm under each dumbbell.
PectoralSternal/DBBenchPress.execution: Press dumbbells up with elbows to sides until arms are extended. Lower weight to sides of chest until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/DBBenchPress.comments: Dumbbells should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at top. No need to drop weights - see suggested mount and dismount techniques:

PectoralSternal/DBDeclineBenchPress.name: Dumbbell Decline Bench Press
PectoralSternal/DBDeclineBenchPress.preparation: Sit down on decline bench with feet under leg brace and dumbbells resting on thigh. Lie back with dumbbells. Position dumbbells to sides of chest with bent arm under each dumbbell.
PectoralSternal/DBDeclineBenchPress.execution: Press dumbbells up with elbows to sides until arms are extended. Lower weight to sides of chest until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/DBDeclineBenchPress.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at top. No need to drop weights - see suggested

PectoralSternal/DBDeclineFly.name: Dumbbell Decline Fly
PectoralSternal/DBDeclineFly.preparation: Grasp two dumbbells. Lie supine on decline bench. Support dumbbells above upper abdomen with arms fixed in slightly bent position. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows are to sides.
PectoralSternal/DBDeclineFly.execution: Lower dumbbells to sides until chest muscles are stretched with elbows fixed. Bring dumbbells together in wide hugging motion until dumbbells are nearly together. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/DBDeclineFly.comments: Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent, and pointing outward, opposite direction of upward motion. Anterior Deltoid will no longer act as synergist in steep decline bench position.

PectoralSternal/DBFly.name: Dumbbell Fly
PectoralSternal/DBFly.preparation: Grasp two dumbbells. Lie supine on bench. Support dumbbells above chest with arms fixed in slightly bent position. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows point out to sides.
PectoralSternal/DBFly.execution: Lower dumbbells to sides until chest muscles are stretched with elbows fixed in slightly bent position. Bring dumbbells together in wide hugging motion until dumbbells are nearly together. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/DBFly.comments: Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent.

PectoralSternal/DBPullover.name: Dumbbell Pullover
PectoralSternal/DBPullover.preparation: Lie on upper back perpendicular to bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp one dumbbell from behind or from side with both hands under inner plate of dumbbell. Position dumbbell over chest with elbows slightly bent.
PectoralSternal/DBPullover.execution: Keeping elbows slightly bent throughout movement, lower dumbbell over and beyond head until upper arms are in-line with torso. Pull dumbbell up and over chest. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/DBPullover.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. See suggested

PectoralSternal/DBPulloverAp.name: Dumbbell Pullover (on apparatus)
PectoralSternal/DBPulloverAp.preparation: Sit on lower pad with back against upper pad, facing dumbbell in rack. Position feet under padded bars. Grasp dumbbell by handle with both hands. Pull top of dumbbell to chest. Push dumbbell up over chest with both hands under inner plate of dumbbell. Raise hips up from pad and recline torso back so chest faces upward. Keep hips and elbows slightly bent.
PectoralSternal/DBPulloverAp.execution: Keeping elbows slightly bent throughout movement, lower dumbbell over and beyond head until upper arms are in-line with torso. Pull dumbbell up and over chest. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/DBPulloverAp.comments: Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. See suggested

PectoralSternal/DBPulloverArchedBench.name: Dumbbell Pullover (on arched bench)
PectoralSternal/DBPulloverArchedBench.preparation: Sit on seat of arched bench with dumbbell on lower thigh. Kick dumbbell up to shoulder while lying back on bench. Grasp both hands under inner plate of dumbbell. Position dumbbell over chest with elbows slightly bent.
PectoralSternal/DBPulloverArchedBench.execution: Keeping elbows slightly bent throughout movement, lower dumbbell over and beyond head until upper arms are in-line with torso. Pull dumbbell up and over chest. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/DBPulloverArchedBench.comments: Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. See suggested

PectoralSternal/LVAlternatingChestPress.name: Lever Alternating Chest Press
PectoralSternal/LVAlternatingChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat with lever grips lower chest height. Grasp grips with wide overhand grip; elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
PectoralSternal/LVAlternatingChestPress.execution: Press one lever until arm is extended. Return lever back until chest muscle is slightly stretched. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
PectoralSternal/LVAlternatingChestPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/LVAlternatingDeclineChes.name: Lever Alternating Decline Chest Press
PectoralSternal/LVAlternatingDeclineChes.preparation: Sit on seat with lever grips lower chest height. Grasp grips with wide overhand grip; elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
PectoralSternal/LVAlternatingDeclineChes.execution: Press one lever until arm is extended. Return lever back until chest muscle is slightly stretched. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
PectoralSternal/LVAlternatingDeclineChes.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/LVBBBenchPress.name: Lever Barbell Bench Press (plate loaded)
PectoralSternal/LVBBBenchPress.preparation: Lie supine on bench with upper chest under bar. Grasp bar with wide oblique overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar.
PectoralSternal/LVBBBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to chest. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVBBBenchPress.comments: Orientation relative to lever will depend upon height of fulcrum relative to bench. Position body so bar is over shoulders during extension, yet lower on chest in lowest position. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/LVBenchPress.name: Lever Bench Press
PectoralSternal/LVBenchPress.preparation: Lie supine on bench with chest under lever bar. Grasp lever bar with wide oblique overhand grip.
PectoralSternal/LVBenchPress.execution: Press bar until arms are extended. Lower weight to upp   er chest. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVBenchPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/LVBenchPressH.name: Lever Bench Press (plate loaded)
PectoralSternal/LVBenchPressH.preparation: Lie supine on bench with chest under lever bar. Grasp lever bar with wide oblique overhand grip.
PectoralSternal/LVBenchPressH.execution: Press bar until arms are extended. Lower weight to upper chest. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVBenchPressH.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/LVBentoverFlyIronCross.name: Lever Bent-over Fly (on iron cross machine)
PectoralSternal/LVBentoverFlyIronCross.preparation: Stand on platform in front of Lever Iron Cross Machine. Grasp handles to each side. Bend over at hips with knees and elbows bent slightly. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows are pointing upward.
PectoralSternal/LVBentoverFlyIronCross.execution: Bring lever handles together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position. Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows are pointed upward at top and out to sides at bottom. Return to starting position until chest muscles are stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVBentoverFlyIronCross.comments: Height of platform should allow shoulders to be near the same height of fulcrums.

PectoralSternal/LVChestDip.name: Lever Chest Dip
PectoralSternal/LVChestDip.execution: . Sit on seat and grasp handles with oblique grip. Lean forward slightly and allow elbows to flare out.
PectoralSternal/LVChestDip.comments: Push lever down by straightening arms. Return lever up with elbows flaring out until chest is slightly stretched. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/LVChestDip2.name: Lever Chest Dip
PectoralSternal/LVChestDip2.execution: . Sit on seat with legs under pads. Grasp handles with oblique grip. Lean slightly forward and allow elbows to flare out.
PectoralSternal/LVChestDip2.comments: Push lever down by straightening arms. Return lever up with elbows flaring out until chest is slightly stretched. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/LVChestDipH.name: Lever Chest Dip (plate loaded)
PectoralSternal/LVChestDipH.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles with oblique grip. If possible, place handles in
PectoralSternal/LVChestDipH.comments: Push lever down with elbows away from body. Return until chest is slightly stretched. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/LVChestPress.name: Lever Chest Press
PectoralSternal/LVChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat with chest approximately height of horizontal handles. If available, push foot lever until lever is within grasping range. Grasp handles with wide overhand grip; elbows out to sides just below shoulders. Release foot lever.
PectoralSternal/LVChestPress.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVChestPress.comments: Some machines have foot levers to position handles in a more comfortable starting and ending position. If foot lever is available, engage it before grasping handles, release it before performing exercise, and engage it again just before releasing grips.

PectoralSternal/LVChestPressH.name: Lever Chest Press (plate loaded)
PectoralSternal/LVChestPressH.preparation: Sit on seat with chest approximately height of handles. Grasp handles with wide overhand grip; elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
PectoralSternal/LVChestPressH.execution: Press levers until arms are extended. Return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVChestPressH.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/LVChestPressS.name: Lever Chest Press
PectoralSternal/LVChestPressS.preparation: Sit on seat with chest approximately height of handles. Grasp handles with wide overhand grip; elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
PectoralSternal/LVChestPressS.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVChestPressS.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/LVDeclineBenchPress.name: Lever Decline Bench Press
PectoralSternal/LVDeclineBenchPress.preparation: Lie supine on decline bench with feet under leg brace and chest under lever bar. Grasp lever bar with wide oblique overhand grip.
PectoralSternal/LVDeclineBenchPress.execution: Press bar until arms are extended. Lower weight to chest. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVDeclineBenchPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/LVDeclineChestPress.name: Lever Decline Chest Press
PectoralSternal/LVDeclineChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat with lever grips lower chest height. Grasp grips with wide overhand grip; elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
PectoralSternal/LVDeclineChestPress.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVDeclineChestPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/LVDeclineChestPressH.name: Lever Decline Chest Press (plate loaded)
PectoralSternal/LVDeclineChestPressH.preparation: Sit on seat with handles lower chest height. Grasp handle with wide overhand grip; elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
PectoralSternal/LVDeclineChestPressH.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVDeclineChestPressH.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/LVDeclineChestPressPL.name: Lever Decline Chest Press (plate loaded)
PectoralSternal/LVDeclineChestPressPL.preparation: Sit on seat with lever grips lower chest height. Grasp grips with wide overhand grip; elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
PectoralSternal/LVDeclineChestPressPL.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVDeclineChestPressPL.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/LVDeclineFly.name: Lever Decline Pec Deck Fly
PectoralSternal/LVDeclineFly.preparation: Sit on machine with back on pad. If available, push foot lever until padded lever moves forward. Place forearms on padded lever. Position upper arms approximately parallel. Release foot lever.
PectoralSternal/LVDeclineFly.execution: Push levers together. Return until chest muscles are stretched. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/LVLyingFly.name: Lever Lying Fly
PectoralSternal/LVLyingFly.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Position both arms under padded levers. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
PectoralSternal/LVLyingFly.execution: Bring padded levers upward and together in hugging motion. Return to starting position until chest muscles are stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVLyingFly.comments: Shoulders should be internally rotated so elbows are pointing downward at bottom of motion and outward at top of motion.

PectoralSternal/LVPecDeckFly.name: Lever Pec Deck Fly
PectoralSternal/LVPecDeckFly.preparation: Sit on machine with back on pad. If available, push foot lever until padded lever moves forward. Place forearms on padded lever. Position upper arms approximately parallel. Release foot lever.
PectoralSternal/LVPecDeckFly.execution: Push levers together. Return until chest muscles are stretched. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/LVParallelGripChestPress.name: Lever Parallel Grip Chest Press
PectoralSternal/LVParallelGripChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat with sides of ribs approximately height of parallel handles. If available, push foot lever until handles are within grasping range. Grasp parallel handles. Release foot lever.
PectoralSternal/LVParallelGripChestPress.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until shoulders or chest feels slightly stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVParallelGripChestPress.comments: Some machines have foot levers to position handles in a more comfortable starting and ending position. If foot lever is available, engage it before grasping handles, release it before performing exercise, and engage it again just before releasing grips.

PectoralSternal/LVSeatedDeclineFly.name: Lever Seated Decline Fly (gripless)
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedDeclineFly.preparation: Sit on seat with back against seat. Position both arms over back of padded levers. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders, wrists are slightly lower than elbows.
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedDeclineFly.execution: Bring padded levers together by pushing pads forward and downward in hugging motion. Return to starting position until chests muscle are stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedDeclineFly.comments: Shoulders should be internally rotated so elbows are pointing back at beginning of motion and outward at end of motion.

PectoralSternal/LVSeatedFly.name: Lever Seated Fly
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedFly.preparation: Sit on machine with back on pad. Grasp handles to both sides, shoulder height. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedFly.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, push lever handles forward and together. Return to back toward original position until mild stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedFly.comments: Shoulders are kept internally rotated so elbows are pointing out to sides. The starting position of levers can be adjusted on many apparatuses, allowing for both rear delt and chest to be exercised. Exercise can be performed on

PectoralSternal/LVSeatedFly2.name: Lever Seated Fly
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedFly2.preparation: Sit on machine with back on pad. Grasp handles to both sides, shoulder height. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedFly2.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, push lever handles forward and together. Return to back toward original position until mild stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedFly2.comments: Shoulders are kept internally rotated so elbows are pointing out to sides. Adjust lever arms on machine so slight stretch is felt when weight is lowered. Also see exercises on

PectoralSternal/LVSeatedFlyGripless.name: Lever Seated Fly (gripless)
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedFlyGripless.preparation: Sit on seat with back against pad and feet on foot bar. Position both arms behind padded levers. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are pointed back.
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedFlyGripless.execution: Bring padded levers forward and together in hugging motion. Return to starting position until stretch in chests or shoulder is felt. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedFlyGripless.comments: Shoulders should be internally rotated so elbows are pointing backwards at beginning of motion and forward at completion of motion.

PectoralSternal/LVSeatedIronCrossFly.name: Lever Seated Iron Cross Fly
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedIronCrossFly.preparation: Straddle seat with both levers positioned slightly above horizontal. Grasp both lever ends with elbows slightly above levers. Sit down near end of seat with torso leaning  forward  slightly and slightly bent elbows pointing back.
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedIronCrossFly.execution: Push levers downward and together in hugging motion. Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows are pointed slightly upward at top and out to sides at bottom. Return to starting position until chest muscles are stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVSeatedIronCrossFly.comments: Under greater resistance, positioning torso at lower angle downward (by bending over at hips), will allow upper body weight to counterbalance upward pull of cables, as opposed to stepping forward and struggling with the backward pull of cables. Also see

PectoralSternal/LVWideGripChestPress.name: Lever Wide Grip Chest Press (plate loaded)
PectoralSternal/LVWideGripChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat with chest approximately height of handles. Grasp handles with wide overhand grip and elbows out to sides.
PectoralSternal/LVWideGripChestPress.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/LVWideGripChestPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/SLStandingChestDip.name: Sled Standing Chest Dip
PectoralSternal/SLStandingChestDip.preparation: Stand between handles facing machine. Bend forward slightly and grasp parallel handles with oblique grip. Position elbows upward and outward. Bend knees just enough to raise selected weight up from remaining weight stack.
PectoralSternal/SLStandingChestDip.execution: Push lever down by straightening arms. Return lever up with elbows flaring out until chest is slightly stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/SLStandingChestDip.comments: This particular machine design is rare. See typical dip machines:

PectoralSternal/SLStandingChestDipWideHo.name: Sled Horizontal Grip Standing Chest Dip
PectoralSternal/SLStandingChestDipWideHo.preparation: Stand between handles facing machine. Bend forward slightly and grasp transverse handles with overhand grip. Position elbows upward and outward. Bend knees just enough to raise selected weight up from remaining weight stack.
PectoralSternal/SLStandingChestDipWideHo.execution: Push lever down by straightening arms. Return lever up with elbows flaring out until chest is slightly stretched. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/SLStandingChestDipWideHo.comments: Both the machine design and handle orientation are rare. See typical dip machines:

PectoralSternal/SMBenchPress.name: Smith Bench Press
PectoralSternal/SMBenchPress.preparation: Lie supine on bench with chest under bar. Grasp bar with wide oblique overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
PectoralSternal/SMBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to chest. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/SMBenchPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/STChestPress.name: Suspended Chest Press
PectoralSternal/STChestPress.preparation: Grasp handles and step forward between suspension trainers. Position arms downward and slightly forward, nearly parallel with suspension straps.
