Lean forward, placing upper body weight onto handles with arms straight, while stepping back onto forefeet so body is leaning forward at desired angle. Straighten body so torso is in-line with legs.
PectoralSternal/STChestPress.execution: Lower body by bending arms while keeping body straight. Allow handles to come apart slightly to keep in-line with elbows flaring out. Stop descent once mild stretch is felt through shoulders or chest. Push body up to original position, allowing handles to travel inward to keep in line with elbows converging until arms are fully extended. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/SMDeclineBenchPress.name: Smith Decline Bench Press
PectoralSternal/SMDeclineBenchPress.preparation: Lie supine on decline bench with feet under leg brace and chest under bar. Grasp bar with wide oblique overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
PectoralSternal/SMDeclineBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to chest. Press bar until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/SMDeclineBenchPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

PectoralSternal/STChestDip.name: Suspended Chest Dip
PectoralSternal/STChestDip.preparation: Stand between two suspension handles and grasp handles on each side of torso. Hold position firmly and lift feet from floor.
PectoralSternal/STChestDip.execution: Push body up until arms are straight. Lower body until slight stretch is felt in shoulders. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/STChestDip.comments: To emphasize chest, position body bent over by bending hips. Also see

PectoralSternal/STSelfAssistedChestDip.name: Suspended Self-assisted Chest Dip
PectoralSternal/STSelfAssistedChestDip.preparation: Stand between two suspension handles, approximately mid-thigh height. Grasp handles on each side and straighten arms with shoulders above hands. Hold position firmly and place portion of body weight on handles.
PectoralSternal/STSelfAssistedChestDip.execution: Lower body by bending arms back. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees to bend, keeping feet in contact with floor. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up back up until arms are straight. Repeat with minimal assistance from legs.
PectoralSternal/STSelfAssistedChestDip.comments: If lower body is used for assistance,

PectoralSternal/STFly.name: Suspended Fly
PectoralSternal/STFly.preparation: Grasp handles and step forward between suspension trainer. Position arms downward and slightly forward, nearly parallel with suspension straps. Lean forward, placing upper body weight onto handles with arms straight, while stepping back onto forefeet, so body is leaning forward at desired angle. Straighten body so torso is in-line with legs. Bend elbows slightly and internally rotate shoulders, so elbows are pointed outward to each side.
PectoralSternal/STFly.execution: Lower body by allowing suspension handles to separate outward until mild stretch is felt in chest. Reverse motion by bringing handles back together in hugging motion. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/WtChestDip.name: Weighted Chest Dip
PectoralSternal/WtChestDip.preparation: Place weight on dip belt around waist or place dumbbell between lower legs just above feet. Mount
PectoralSternal/WtChestDip.execution: with oblique grip (bar diagonal under palm), arms straight with shoulders above hands. Keep hips and knees bent.
PectoralSternal/WtChestDip.comments: Lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to flare out to sides. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.

PectoralSternal/WtPushup.name: Weighted Push-up
PectoralSternal/WtPushup.preparation: Lie prone on floor with hands slightly wider than shoulder width. Raise body up off floor by extending arms with body straight. Partner can place weight plate(s) on back if needed.
PectoralSternal/WtPushup.execution: Keeping body straight, lower body to floor by bending arms. Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/WtPushup.comments: Both upper and lower body must be kept straight throughout movement. Exercise can be performed

PectoralSternal/WtPushupHandles.name: Weighted Push-up (on handles)
PectoralSternal/WtPushupHandles.preparation: Kneel before two push-up handles placed slightly wider than shoulder width apart. Grasp both handles and place feet back on floor or slightly elevated platform. Position body straight with arms extended. Partner can place weight plate(s) on back if needed.
PectoralSternal/WtPushupHandles.execution: Keeping body ridged, lower body downward by bending arms until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders. Push body back up until arms are extended. Repeat.
PectoralSternal/WtPushupHandles.comments: Both upper and lower body must be kept straight throughout movement. Exercise can be performed without additional weight,

Power/BBSumoDeadliftHighPull.name: Barbell Sumo Deadlift High Pull
Power/BBSumoDeadliftHighPull.preparation: Position feet under bar with very wide stance. Squat down with hips low and chest forward. With arms extended downward between legs, grasp bar with narrow overhand grip.
Power/BBSumoDeadliftHighPull.execution: Lift and accelerate initial pull of bar by extending hips and knees. As bar passes knees, continue pulling bar by raising arms and shoulders upward with elbows flexing out to sides. Continue pulling until body is upright and back and bar is raised to chin.
Power/BBSumoDeadliftHighPull.comments: Allow bar to fall downward. As bar falls past waist, squat down by flexing hips and knees. Arms extend straight as bar falls past knees. Return weight momentarily to floor so body is in original starting position. Immediately repeat movement.

Power/BBThruster.name: Barbell Thruster
Power/BBThruster.execution: barbell from floor with overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder width. Position bar on front of shoulders with elbows pointing slightly forward and torso tight. Position feet slightly wider than shoulder width, pointing outward slightly.
Power/BBThruster.comments: Descend until knees and hips are fully bent or until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Knees travel slightly outward in direction of toes. Raise body upward by extending knees and hips. Accelerate when nearing top of squat, drive barbell up off shoulders, pull head back, and throw weight overhead by extending arms upward. Pull head forward at lockout overhead. Immediately lower weight by bending arms. As weight descends, bend legs, pull head back, and catch barbell in front of shoulders as knees are bending at approximately 90°. Repeat movement sequence in quick succession.

Power/ASMuscleUpSelf.name: Suspended Muscle-up (self-assisted)
Power/ASMuscleUpSelf.preparation: Position suspended handles lower than arms reach from floor. Stand between handles and grasp with wrists flexed. Squat down until arms are extended straight up.
Power/ASMuscleUpSelf.execution: Push off floor with legs and pull body up to handles with wrists flexed inward. Bring legs forward during pull-up phase. Pulling above handles, wing elbows outward and behind handles so wrists flex forward. Lean shoulders forward over handles so elbows can continue to rise above handles from behind. Push body upward until arms and legs are straight.
Power/ASMuscleUpSelf.comments: Lower body into dip position. Allow elbows to fall behind handles. Lower body with wrists flexed until arms are straight over head and feet are on floor with legs in original squat position. Repeat.

Power/BWAngledPoleClimb.name: Angled Pole Climb
Power/BWAngledPoleClimb.preparation: Stand at base of underside of angled pole. Grasp pole with both hands, one hand above other slightly above head with arms slightly bent.
Power/BWAngledPoleClimb.execution: Reach up with lowest arm up and grasp pole above where other hand is gripping pole. Push off with foot and pull body up with both arms. Continue to pull body upward by grasping bar hand over hand to ascend underside of pole with lower body hanging downward. Once highest point on pole is reached, climb down underside of ladder using hand under hand movement pattern until feet can stand on ground. Repeat if required.

Power/BWAngledLadderClimb.name: Angled Ladder Climb
Power/BWAngledLadderClimb.preparation: Stand at base of underside of angled ladder. Place hands slightly narrower than shoulder width grip on rung of ladder above head with arms slightly bent.
Power/BWAngledLadderClimb.execution: Pull body up and reach one arm up to grasps next rung above. With hand on original rung and other hand on higher rung, pull body upward until next higher rung is within reach. Immediately grasp next higher rung with hand on lower rung. Continue climbing pattern to scale underside of latter with upper body. Once highest rung is reached, grasp highest rung with both hands. Then climb down underside of ladder in reverse movement pattern until feet can stand on ground. Repeat if required.
Power/BWAngledLadderClimb.comments: Keep elbows pointed more forward than to sides.

Power/BWButterflyPullup.name: Butterfly Pull-up
Power/BWButterflyPullup.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip. Flex knees with hips straight (heels to but).
Power/BWButterflyPullup.execution: Kick legs forward and swing upward behind bar. Quickly straighten hips, pull chest toward bar. As chest approaches bar, shift body's direction downward and forward under bar by continuing to kick feet back while hyperextending spine. Allow face to clear under bar, knees to flex behind, and arms to extend fully. Repeat.
Power/BWButterflyPullup.comments: Unlike Kipping Pull-up, forward leg kick is not as high, rear kick is directed more upward, and chin does not go over bar, allowing for clearance of face traveling behind and under bar.

Power/BWKippingHandStandPushup.name: Kipping Handstand Push-up
Power/BWKippingHandStandPushup.preparation: Kneel facing close to wall. Place top of head near wall. Position hands on floor to sides within sight so head and hands form triangle. Straighten knees and place knees on elbows. Lift both feet off of floor. Raise knees off of elbows by straightening spine. Allow hips to make contact with wall momentarily in this lower position.
Power/BWKippingHandStandPushup.execution: Rapidly extend legs up and back onto wall while pushing body upward with shoulders and arms. Pull head between arms while extending arms straight. Lower head to floor then lower legs by bending hips and knees until fully flexed. Kick legs up and repeat movement.
Power/BWKippingHandStandPushup.comments: In lower position, hips make contact with wall. In extended position, back of feet make contact with wall. Kipping Handstand Push-up is a common Crossfit movement. Related movements include

Power/BWPullupKip.name: Pull-up (with kip)
Power/BWPullupKip.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip. Swing legs forward and back to gain momentum. Retract shoulder girdle and hyperextend spine on back swing.
Power/BWPullupKip.execution: Swing legs forward and high, so thighs become horizontal. Swing upward behind bar, quickly open hips and pull body toward bar until upper chest makes contact. Allow body to fall back and under bar. As body swings under bar, swing legs back. Immediately repeat.
Power/BWPullupKip.comments: To avoid wear on bare hands from sudden shifting movements, use adequate chalk and/or grasp bar with fingers instead of palms and fingers. This technique will obviously require greater grip endurance.

Power/CBPushPull.name: Cable Push Pull
Power/CBPushPull.preparation: Stand between high and low pulleys, facing low pulley. Place one foot back and grasp high pulley stirrup from behind with hand on same side as rear foot. Position stirrup to side of chest and grasp low pulley stirrup with opposite hand (same side as forward foot) with arm extended straight. Face low pulley with hips turned out approximately 45 degrees.
Power/CBPushPull.execution: Pull low pulley stirrup back to side of ribcage while pushing high pulley stirrup forward until arm is extended, allowing torso to rotate to opposite side.
Power/CBPushPull.comments: Return to starting position and repeat.

Power/DBHighSwing.name: Dumbbell High Swing
Power/DBHighSwing.preparation: Straddle dumbbell positioned on its side with feet far apart and toes pointing slightly outward. Squat down and grasp top of dumbbell with hand on each side. Lift dumbbell from floor slightly with arms and low back straight.
Power/DBHighSwing.execution: With back straight, bend down slightly at hip. When forearm makes contact with inner thigh, immediately extend hips while keeping back straight. Allow dumbbell to rise upward over head while extending hips and knees fully.
Power/DBHighSwing.comments: Allow dumbbell to fall forward and downward, keeping arms and back straight. Bend knees when dumbbell falls below waist, allowing dumbbell to swing between legs. Repeat.

Power/DBLowSwing.name: Dumbbell Low Swing
Power/DBLowSwing.preparation: Straddle dumbbell positioned on its side with feet far apart and toes pointing slightly outward. Squat down and grasp top of dumbbell with hand on each side. Lift dumbbell from floor slightly with arms and low back straight.
Power/DBLowSwing.execution: With back straight, bend down slightly at hip. When forearm makes contact with inner thigh, immediately extend hips while keeping back straight. Allow dumbbell to rise upward (about upper chest to head height) while extending hips and knees fully.
Power/DBLowSwing.comments: Allow dumbbell to fall forward and downward, keeping arms and back straight. Bend knees when dumbbell falls below waist, allowing dumbbell to swing between legs. Repeat.

Power/DBThruster.name: Dumbbell Thruster
Power/DBThruster.preparation: Position dumbbell in front of shoulders with elbows pointing slightly forward and torso tight. Position feet slightly wider than shoulder width, pointing outward slightly.
Power/DBThruster.comments: Descend until knees and hips are fully bent or until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Knees travel slightly outward in direction of toes. Raise body upward by extending knees and hips. Accelerate when nearing top of squat, drive dumbbells up off shoulders, and throw weight overhead by extending arms upward. Immediately lower weight by bending arms. As weight descends, bend legs, and catch dumbbells in front of shoulders as knees are bending at approximately 90°. Repeat movement sequence in quick succession.

Power/LVDeclinePushPull.name: Lever Decline Push Pull (plate loaded)
Power/LVDeclinePushPull.preparation: Load weights plates on machine, right plate to rear side and left plate to front side. Stand inside machine and grasp lever handles, right hand forward and left hand to side. Place right foot forward and left foot back.
Power/LVDeclinePushPull.execution: Pull forward lever back while pushing other lever forward.
Power/LVDeclinePushPull.comments: Return to starting position and repeat.

Power/LVOneArmJam.name: Lever One Arm Jammer Press (plate loaded)
Power/LVOneArmJam.preparation: Stand inside jammer facing one side with feet slightly wide   r than shoulder width. With far arm, grasp handle with overhand grip. Squat down slightly with handle in front of chest.
Power/LVOneArmJam.execution: Push handles out and up while turning torso forward.
Power/LVOneArmJam.comments: Lower to starting position and repeat.

Power/LVJam.name: Lever Jammer Press (plate loaded)
Power/LVJam.preparation: Stand inside jammer facing handles. Grasp lever handles with shoulder width overhand grip. Position both feet back, slightly wider than shoulder width, and squat down slightly so body is leaning forward with handles close to body.
Power/LVJam.execution: Push handles out and up by extending hips, knees, ankles, shoulders, and arms.
Power/LVJam.comments: Lower to starting position and repeat.

Power/LVOneArmPress.name: Lever One Arm Press (plate loaded)
Power/LVOneArmPress.preparation: Stand to one side, near loaded end of barbell, opposite of landmine lever. Lift end of barbell and position near shoulder with underhand grip. With both knees bent, stand with feet far apart (leg on same side of loaded arm is back and opposite leg is forward).
Power/LVOneArmPress.execution: Extend legs forcefully while rapidly pushing end of barbell upward and forward until arm is extended. Lower to shoulder and squat down slightly to original position and repeat. Repeat with opposite side.
Power/LVOneArmPress.comments: Keep back straight when lifting end of barbell from floor. Also see

Power/LVPowerTwist.name: Lever Power Twist (plate loaded)
Power/LVPowerTwist.preparation: Stand to one side, near loaded end of barbell, opposite of landmine lever. Squat down and grasp end of barbell with one hand near end and other hand just below, thumbs facing back (toward nearest end of barbell). Lift end of barbell up to one side, upper thigh level. Stand with feet apart with each foot equal distance from landmine. Orientate foot and leg nearest to bar about 45 degrees toward (under) bar. Bend legs and raise heel of opposite leg (rear leg) so forefoot remains on floor.
Power/LVPowerTwist.execution: Move end of barbell upward, across, and downward to opposite side while shifting stance to opposite orientation by pivoting on forefeet and planting new forward foot.
Power/LVPowerTwist.comments: Immediately return to opposite side in same pattern and repeat.

Power/LVPushPull.name: Lever Push Pull (plate loaded)
Power/LVPushPull.preparation: Load weights plates on machine, right plate to front side and left plate to rear side. Stand inside machine and grasp lever handles, right hand forward and left hand to side. Place right foot forward on footstep.
Power/LVPushPull.execution: Pull forward lever back while pushing other lever forward.
Power/LVPushPull.comments: Return to starting position and repeat.

Power/LVSprintMachine.name: Lever Sprint Machine
Power/LVSprintMachine.preparation: Straddle machine facing handle bars with levers behind. Grasp handles and place feet on pedal within feet holsters. Extend arms straight to support torso.
Power/LVSprintMachine.execution: Push one pedal down by extending leg while pulling other pedal up by flexing hip and knee of opposite leg.
Power/LVSprintMachine.comments: Move levers in opposite direction, alternating pushing and pulling movements.

Power/RMSeatedVerticalPull.name: Rope Machine Seated Vertical Pull
Power/RMSeatedVerticalPull.preparation: Straddle bench facing high rope pulley. Sit with rope between legs and feet on floor to each side. Grasp rope with both hands, right arm close to side and left arm extended upward.
Power/RMSeatedVerticalPull.execution: With left hand, pull rope down, toward front of body. With right hand, release rope, reach up extending arm and shoulder, and grasp rope. Repeat motion with opposite hands alternating between sides.

Power/RMSeatedPull.name: Rope Machine Seated Pull
Power/RMSeatedPull.preparation: Straddle end of bench facing medium height rope pulley. With rope in hand, sit at end bench with feet forward, extended slightly out to sides. Grasp rope with both hands, right arm close to side and left arm extended forward.
Power/RMSeatedPull.execution: With left hand, pull rope toward side of body. With right hand, release rope, reach forward extending arm and shoulder, and grasp rope. Repeat motion with opposite hands, alternating between sides.
Power/RMSeatedPull.comments: Exercise can be performed seated or standing. If direction of pull is horizontal, shoulder girdle only retracts with no downward rotation.

Power/RopeAlternatingWave.name: Rope Alternating Wave
Power/RopeAlternatingWave.preparation: Face ends of two anchored, heavy ropes extended side by side. Grasp rope end in each hand. Stand with feet wide apart and knees and hips bent. Raise one rope up and lower other one down.
Power/RopeAlternatingWave.execution: Repetitively, whip ropes up and down in alternating fashion, so when one rope is thrown high, the opposite rope is thrown low.
Power/RopeAlternatingWave.comments: Movement through elbow and wrist are very subtle, bordering on static force classification. Early training and warmup bouts may involve slower motion.

Power/RopeWave.name: Rope Wave
Power/RopeWave.preparation: Face ends of two anchored, heavy ropes extended side by side. Grasp rope end in each hand. Stand with feet wide apart and knees and hips bent. Lean back slightly and raise ropes up to initiate wave.
Power/RopeWave.execution: Whip ropes downward and upward repetitively.
Power/RopeWave.comments: Rapid movement requires very short, and in some cases, barely discernible movement. Most notable range of motion occurs through shoulder girdle elevation and depression, although many other articulations are required.

Power/RopeWaveJump.name: Rope Wave Jump
Power/RopeWaveJump.preparation: Face ends of two anchored, heavy ropes extended side by side. Grasp rope end in each hand. Stand with feet wide apart and knees and hips bent. Lean back slightly and raise ropes up and down to initiate wave.
Power/RopeWaveJump.execution: Yank rope upward very high while extending body upward and jumping. Throw rope downward during descent. Continue to pull rope downward, squat into lower position, and bring ends of ropes between knees. Repeat movement.
Power/RopeWaveJump.comments: Rope Wave jump most notably evolves lower body explosiveness while using more greatly exaggerated motion than basic

Power/STMuscleUp.name: Suspended Muscle-up
Power/STMuscleUp.preparation: Hang from rings with wrists flexed, allowing palms to face downward.
Power/STMuscleUp.comments: Pull body upward and turn rings so knuckles face inward. Once shoulders approach height of rings, raise legs by flexing hips. Pull rings apart in front of shoulders while pulling elbows behind bent wrists. Lean body forward and downward while continuing to pull rings to sides of shoulder and elbows upward behind straightening wrists.

Power/STMuscleUpKip.name: Suspended Muscle-up (with kip)
Power/STMuscleUpKip.preparation: Hang from rings with wrists flexed, allowing palms to face downward. Swing body forward and back to gain momentum. Retract shoulder girdle and hyperextend spine on back swing.
Power/STMuscleUpKip.comments: On full forward upswing, swing very high, so body becomes horizontal. As approaching highest point, quickly pull rings toward rib cage, then pull knees and chest together, all while keeping wrists flexed . Allow momentum and weight of lower body to rotate body forward. As elbow rotate over straightened wrists, allow legs to fall below body so body becomes upright.

Power/TireFlip.name: Tire Flip
Power/TireFlip.preparation: Stand facing horizontally lying tire with leg far apart and feet angle out. Squat down, bend over, and position shoulders on upper edge and hands on underside corners of tire.
Power/TireFlip.execution: Pull tire up off ground by extending hips and knees. As bottom of tire reaches knees vigorously, pull tire up, driving hips forward and upward. When abdomen makes contact with tire, jump forward driving tire upright. Step rear foot more centered behind tire while repositioning hands to overhand grip. Lean into tire and step forward. Extend arms and flip tire over. Shuffle into original starting position. Repeat movement.

Power/WTPullSprint.name: Weighted Sled Pull Sprint
Power/WTPullSprint.preparation: Place arms in shoulder harness. Face away from weighted sled in starting sprint position.
Power/WTPullSprint.execution: On start, rapidly accelerate by leaning body forward with heels off ground, stepping forward as rapidly as possible.
Power/WTPullSprint.comments: Although upper body assists in propelling body forward, only articulations significantly affected by greater sled loads are noted.

Power/WTPushSprint.name: Weighted Drive Sled Sprint
Power/WTPushSprint.preparation: Stand facing drive sled with feet staggered. Bend down and grasp handles with both hands. Position hips low, foot back, torso nearly vertical, and arms straight.
Power/WTPushSprint.execution: On start, rapidly lean body weight into sled by dropping body downward with heels off ground. Keep weight low behind sled while stepping forward as rapidly as possible.

Pronators/DBLyingPronationDown.name: Dumbbell Lying Pronation (arm down)
Pronators/DBLyingPronationDown.preparation: Grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell with thumb next to weighted side. Lie on bench on side with weight and position arm with "half dumbbell" on bench. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and tucked bent elbow under body. Position thumb down (supinated).
Pronators/DBLyingPronationDown.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns upward (pronation). Return and repeat.
Pronators/DBLyingPronationDown.comments: Bench can be flat or slightly incline (0-30 degrees) so resistance occurs during initial range of motion. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with pinkie against inside surface. Also see conventiontal

Pronators/DBLyingPronationUp.name: Dumbbell Lying Pronation (arm up)
Pronators/DBLyingPronationUp.preparation: Lie on bench or mat. With hand of upper arm, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; pinkie positioned near weighted side. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place arm on hip or side of waist. Position thumb upward (supinated).
Pronators/DBLyingPronationUp.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns downward (pronation). Return and repeat.
Pronators/DBLyingPronationUp.comments: Pad or firm pillow (ball pictured) may be placed between hip and arm. Elevation of elbow allows resistance during initial range of motion. This exercise can also be performed seated by corner of table higher than shoulder height (See

Power/WtPowerStraight.name: Muscle-up (on horizontal bar)
Power/WtPowerStraight.preparation: Jump up and grasp high vertical bar with shoulder width or slightly wider grip. Grip higher around bar with wrists flexed and palm positioned over bar.
Power/WtPowerStraight.comments: Just before body swings backwards, forcefully pull body up behind bar and throw knees up for momentum. As elbows clear height of bar from behind, lean over bar and flex spine while keeping knee lifted in front of bar from below.

Pronators/DBSeatedPronation.name: Dumbbell Seated Pronation
Pronators/DBSeatedPronation.preparation: Sit next to elevated surface, approximately arm pit height. With hand of upper arm, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; pinkie positioned near weighted side. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place upperarm on elevated surface. Position thumb upward (supinated).
Pronators/DBSeatedPronation.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns downward (pronation). Return and repeat.
Pronators/DBSeatedPronation.comments: If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with thumb against inside surface.

Pronators/LVPronation.name: Lever Standing Forearm Pronation
Pronators/LVPronation.preparation: Grasp open handle at end of shaft with underhand grip.
Pronators/LVPronation.execution: Rotate shaft by turning palm downward. Return and repeat.
Pronators/LVPronation.comments: Depending on participant's range of motion and machine's design, handle may need to be prerotated so resistance is present throughout movement, particularly initial phase of rotation.

Quadriceps/ASSingleLegSquatSelfLeg.name: Self-assisted Single Leg Squat (leg wrapped)
Quadriceps/ASSingleLegSquatSelfLeg.preparation: Place hand on waist high prop or other tall, sturdy structure for support. Stand on one leg by wrapping leg around back of supporting leg so top of lifted foot is on outside of supporting leg's ankle.
Quadriceps/ASSingleLegSquatSelfLeg.execution: Squat down by bending knee forward and hip back behind. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Descend until thigh is just past parallel to floor. Return to standing position with minimal assistance from wrapped leg. Stand to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg are straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/ASSingleLegSquatSelfLeg.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement.

Quadriceps/ASSingleLegSquatSelf.name: Self-assisted Single Leg Squat (bar)
Quadriceps/ASSingleLegSquatSelf.preparation: Stand behind horizontal bar, lower chest to waist height. Place finger tips or inside base of thumbs on bar, hold with just enough contact for balance and self-assistance. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
Quadriceps/ASSingleLegSquatSelf.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as supporting foot. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/ASSingleLegSquatSelf.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

Pronators/LVSeatedPronation.name: Lever Seated Forearm Pronation
Pronators/LVSeatedPronation.preparation: Sit on seat. Grasp rotating handles with underhand grip on each side and place forearms on pads.
Pronators/LVSeatedPronation.execution: Rotate shafts by turning palm downward. Return and repeat.
Pronators/LVSeatedPronation.comments: Depending on participant's range of motion and machine's design, handles may need to be prerotated so resistance is present throughout movement, particularly initial phase of rotation. See

Quadriceps/ASSquatSelfST.name: Self-assisted Squat (on suspension trainer)
Quadriceps/ASSquatSelfST.preparation: Stand in front of suspension trainer handles positioned at height of upper abdomen to lower chest.  Grasp suspension trainer handles with arms extended forward.
Quadriceps/ASSquatSelfST.execution: While holding onto suspension trainer handles, squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Stand up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return to standing position and repeat.
Quadriceps/ASSquatSelfST.comments: Exercise can also be performed by placing hands on sturdy piece of furniture or

Quadriceps/ASSquatSelf.name: Self-assisted Squat
Quadriceps/ASSquatSelf.preparation: Stand in front of horizontal bar positioned at height of upper abdomen to lower chest.  Place hands on horizontal bar with arms extended forward.
Quadriceps/ASSquatSelf.execution: While holding onto horizontal bar, squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Stand up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return to standing position and repeat.
Quadriceps/ASSquatSelf.comments: Exercise can also be performed by placing hands on sturdy piece of furniture or railing. If assistance is needed, push down onto horizontal bar or furniture. Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface. Apply equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/ASSingleLegSquatSelfPole.name: Self-assisted Single Leg Reclining Squat (pole)
Quadriceps/ASSingleLegSquatSelfPole.preparation: Stand with feet behind vertical pole. Grasp pole with both hands, waist to hip height. Balance on one leg with opposite leg raised up off of floor to side of pole.
Quadriceps/ASSingleLegSquatSelfPole.execution: Squat down while keeping leg elevated off of floor. With arms slightly flexed, lean back slightly while only allowing knee to travel forward slightly. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as supporting foot. Descend to lowest position. Raise body back up to original position while keeping knee behind bar and arms slightly flexed until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/ASSingleLegSquatSelfPole.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement, yet only extend forward slightly. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

Quadriceps/ASStepDownSelf.name: Self-assisted Step-down
Quadriceps/ASStepDownSelf.preparation: Stand with one foot on bench or elevated surface. Position foot on elevated surface to side slightly forward of straight knee.
Quadriceps/ASStepDownSelf.execution: Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning foot off of bench to floor and repeat. Continue with opposite position.
Quadriceps/ASStepDownSelf.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Knee of exercised leg should point same direction as foot. Exercise can also be performed by placing traveling foot onto and off of bench next to foot of exercised leg (See

Quadriceps/BBFrontSquat.name: Barbell Front Squat
Quadriceps/BBFrontSquat.execution: From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar in front of shoulders. Cross arms and place hands on top of barbell with upper arms parallel to floor. Dismount bar from rack.

Quadriceps/BBFullSquat.name: Barbell Full Squat
Quadriceps/BBFullSquat.preparation: From rack with barbell upper chest height, position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Dismount bar from rack.
Quadriceps/BBFullSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until knees and hips are fully bent. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/BBFullSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement.

Quadriceps/BBHackSquat.name: Barbell Hack Squat
Quadriceps/BBHackSquat.preparation: Position barbell just behind legs. With feet flat on floor, squat down and grasp barbell from behind with overhand grip.
Quadriceps/BBHackSquat.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are close to parallel to floor and bar is behind lower leg. Repeat.
Quadriceps/BBHackSquat.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/BBLateralStepUp.name: Barbell Lateral Step-up
Quadriceps/BBLateralStepUp.preparation: Stand between two benches, one to each side. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides.
Quadriceps/BBLateralStepUp.execution: Lift leg and place foot on bench to side slightly forward of straight knee. Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning feet to original position. Repeat with opposite leg alternating between legs.
Quadriceps/BBLateralStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Stepping knee should point same direction as foot. A modest degree of

Quadriceps/BBSideLunge.name: Barbell Side Lunge
Quadriceps/BBSideLunge.preparation: bar from floor or dismount bar from rack. From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides.
Quadriceps/BBSideLunge.execution: Lunge to one side with first leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of lead leg, keeping knee pointed same direction of foot. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of lead leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/BBSideLunge.comments: Keep torso upright during lunge. Lead knee should point same direction as foot throughout lunge. Flexible

Quadriceps/BBRearLunge.name: Barbell Rear Lunge
Quadriceps/BBRearLunge.preparation: From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack.
Quadriceps/BBRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

Quadriceps/BBLunge.name: Barbell Lunge
Quadriceps/BBLunge.preparation: bar from floor or dismount bar from rack. From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides.
Quadriceps/BBLunge.execution: Lunge forward with first leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/BBSideSplitSqaut.name: Barbell Side Split Squat
Quadriceps/BBSideSplitSqaut.preparation: Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar on each side. Stand with feet wide apart; foot of lead leg angled out to side.
Quadriceps/BBSideSplitSqaut.execution: Lower body toward side of angled foot by bending knee and hip of lead leg while keeping opposite leg only slightly bent. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of lead leg. Repeat.
Quadriceps/BBSideSplitSqaut.comments: Keep torso upright and knee of lead leg pointed same direction of foot. Flexible

Quadriceps/BBSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Barbell Single Leg Split Squat
Quadriceps/BBSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Stand facing away from bench. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Extend leg back and place top of foot on bench.
Quadriceps/BBSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/BBSingleLegSquat.name: Barbell Single Leg Squat
Quadriceps/BBSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand with arms extended out in front holding barbell. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
Quadriceps/BBSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep   supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/BBSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

Quadriceps/BBSplitSquat.name: Barbell Split Squat
Quadriceps/BBSplitSquat.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Stand with feet far apart; one foot forward and other foot behind.
Quadriceps/BBSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/BBSplitSquat.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement. Keep torso upright during squat;

Quadriceps/BBSquat.name: Barbell Squat
Quadriceps/BBSquat.preparation: From rack with barbell at upper chest height, position bar high on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and stand with shoulder width stance.
Quadriceps/BBSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/BBSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight throughout forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See:

Quadriceps/BBSquatChains.name: Barbell Squat (with chains)
Quadriceps/BBSquatChains.preparation: Stand facing barbell, racked upper chest height, with thick chains hanging to floor on each side. Position bar high on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and stand with shoulder width stance.
Quadriceps/BBSquatChains.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/BBSquatChains.comments: Chains provide increasing resistance as barbell moves away from floor. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight throughout forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/BBWalkingLunge.name: Barbell Walking Lunge
Quadriceps/BBWalkingLunge.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
Quadriceps/BBWalkingLunge.execution: Step forward with first leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Stand on forward leg with assistance of rear leg. Lunge forward with opposite leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite legs.

Quadriceps/BBStepUp.name: Barbell Step-up
Quadriceps/BBStepUp.preparation: Stand facing side of bench. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides.
Quadriceps/BBStepUp.execution: Place foot of first leg on bench. Stand on bench by extending hip and knee of first leg and place foot of second leg on bench. Step down with second leg by flexing hip and knee of first leg. Return to original standing position by placing foot of first leg to floor. Repeat first step with opposite leg, alternating first steps between legs.
Quadriceps/BBStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Lead knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Stepping distance from bench emphasizes Gluteus Maximus; stepping close to bench emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/BBZercherSquat.name: Barbell Zercher Squat
Quadriceps/BBZercherSquat.preparation: From rack with barbell upper waist high, position forearms under bar and in front of bar with elbows shoulder width apart. Cross wrists and pull bar in close against body. Lift barbell from rack. Step back with wide stance, feet pointing out 20-30°.
Quadriceps/BBZercherSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight, hands close to body, and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are near parallel. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/BBZercherSquat.comments: Turning knuckles up places bar more on

Quadriceps/BWHalfSquat.name: Half Squat
Quadriceps/BWHalfSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend to height which allows prescribed number of reps at suggested intensity, short of thighs descending just past parallel to floor. Stand up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return to standing position and repeat.
Quadriceps/BWHalfSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface. Apply equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Arms positioned forward allow torso to be positioned more upright. See

Quadriceps/BWAlternatingStepDown.name: Alternating Step Down
Quadriceps/BWAlternatingStepDown.preparation: Stand on bench or narrow platform, with feet side by side.
Quadriceps/BWAlternatingStepDown.execution: Step down with first foot to side of elevated surface onto floor. Stand back up on elevated surface by straightening upper leg and pushing body upward. Place foot to original position, next to opposite foot. Step down and back up with opposite leg in same manner. Repeat by alternating between sides.
Quadriceps/BWAlternatingStepDown.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Stepping knee should point same direction as foot. A modest degree of

Quadriceps/BWLateralStepUp.name: Lateral Step-up
Quadriceps/BWLateralStepUp.preparation: Stand between two benches, one to each side.
Quadriceps/BWLateralStepUp.execution: Lift leg and place foot on bench to side slightly forward of straight knee. Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning feet to original position. Repeat with opposite leg alternating between legs.
Quadriceps/BWLateralStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Stepping knee should point same direction as foot. A modest degree of

Quadriceps/BWLunge.name: Lunge
Quadriceps/BWLunge.preparation: Stand with hands on hips or in front of body.
Quadriceps/BWLunge.execution: Lunge forward with first leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/BWRearLunge.name: Rear Lunge
Quadriceps/BWRearLunge.preparation: Stand with hands on hips or in front of body.
Quadriceps/BWRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

Quadriceps/BWSingleLegBoxSquat.name: Single Leg Box Squat (pistol)
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegBoxSquat.preparation: Stand facing away from box, platform, or adjustable height bench positioned just behind legs. Extended arms out in front of body. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegBoxSquat.execution: Squat down while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Once buttock makes contact with bench or box, raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegBoxSquat.comments: Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength. Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Weighted versions of this exercise would normally be considered auxiliary in context of other basic exercises (ie: Barbell Squat, Sled Leg Press). However, in the context of 'body weight' only program, this exercise can be considered basic. Also known as Bench Pistol Squat or Single Leg Bench Squat.

Quadriceps/BWSingleLegHalfSquat.name: Single Leg Half Squat
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegHalfSquat.preparation: Stand with arms in front of body either extended or close to torso. Balance on one leg and bend raised leg back at knee.
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegHalfSquat.execution: Squat down to challenging depth while keeping raised leg from contacting floor. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Stand back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg are straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegHalfSquat.comments: Allow torso to lean forward slightly while hips travel to back and knee travels forward. Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength.

Quadriceps/BWSingleLegPartialBoxSquat.name: Single Leg Partial Box Squat (pistol)
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegPartialBoxSquat.preparation: Stand facing away from box, platform, or adjustable height bench positioned just behind legs. Extended arms out in front of body. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegPartialBoxSquat.execution: Squat down while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Once buttock makes contact with bench or box, raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegPartialBoxSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Partial range of motion, as name implies, can be considered hips descending to height above knee. Weighted versions of this exercise would normally be considered auxiliary in context of other basic exercises (ie: Barbell Squat, Sled Leg Press). However, in the context of 'body weight' only program, this exercise can be considered basic. Also known as Pistol Box Squat (partial).

Quadriceps/BWSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Single Leg Split Squat
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Stand facing away from bench. Extend leg back and place top of foot on bench.
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/BWSingleLegRecliningSquat.name: Single Leg Reclining Squat (bar)
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegRecliningSquat.preparation: Stand behind horizontal bar, lower chest to upper waist height. Grasp bar with both hands. Place feet slightly forward and lean back with arms straight. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegRecliningSquat.execution: While reclining back, squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep   back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as supporting foot. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegRecliningSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

Quadriceps/BWSingleLegSquat.name: Single Leg Squat (pistol)
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand with arms extended out in front. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep back as straight as possible and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

Quadriceps/BWSingleLegSquatLegBack.name: Single Leg Squat (with leg back)
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegSquatLegBack.preparation: Stand with arms extended out in front. Balance on one leg and bend raised leg back at knee.
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegSquatLegBack.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping raised leg from contacting floor as far down as possible. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. In lowest position, gently place elevated lower leg on floor. Raise body back up with minimal assistance from raised leg on floor. Stand to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg are straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/BWSingleLegSquatLegBack.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

Quadriceps/BWSissySquat.name: Sissy Squat
Quadriceps/BWSissySquat.preparation: With shoulder width stance, grasp fixed bar or support at hip level with one arm.
Quadriceps/BWSissySquat.execution: With hips and waist straight, bend knees to allow body to fall backwards as knees come forward. Allow heels to raise from floor. Lower body until knees are almost fully flexed or near floor. Return to original position by extending knees as heels return to floor.
Quadriceps/BWSissySquat.comments: Keep waist and hips straight throughout exercise. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Also see

Quadriceps/BWSissySquatAp.name: Sissy Squat (on apparatus)
Quadriceps/BWSissySquatAp.preparation: Place feet under lower padded bar with calves against upper pads. Cross arms and touch shoulders or place arms out straight in front of shoulders.
Quadriceps/BWSissySquatAp.execution: Allow body to fall backwards by bending knees. During descent, gradually bend hips, yet keep chest high and don't allow torso to angle forward. Lower body until back of thigh is against upper pad. Rise to original position by extending knees and hips while keeping shoulders behind hips. Repeat.
Quadriceps/BWSissySquatAp.comments: Keep chest high and shoulder behind hips, preventing torso to angle forward. If upper pad is too high, it can obstruct range of motion, and possibly create abrupt forward dislocating forces on knee, particularly if descent is not controlled. In contrast, inadequate support will be provided if upper pad is too low.

Quadriceps/BWSplitSquat.name: Split Squat
Quadriceps/BWSplitSquat.preparation: Stand with hands on hips. Position feet far apart; one foot forward and other foot behind.
Quadriceps/BWSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/BWSplitSquat.comments: Weighted versions of this exercise would normally be considered auxiliary in context of other basic exercises (ie: Barbell Squat, Sled Leg Press). However, in the context of 'body weight' only program, this exercise can be considered basic.

Quadriceps/BWSquat.name: Squat
Quadriceps/BWSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Squat up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/BWSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Arms positioned forward allow torso to be positioned more upright. See

Quadriceps/BWStepDown.name: Step-down
Quadriceps/BWStepDown.preparation: Stand with one foot on bench or elevated surface. Position foot on elevated surface to side, slightly forward of straight knee.
Quadriceps/BWStepDown.execution: Stand on elevated surface by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning foot off of elevated surface to floor and repeat. Continue with opposite position.
Quadriceps/BWStepDown.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Knee of exercised leg should point same direction as foot. See

Quadriceps/BWStepUp.name: Step-up
Quadriceps/BWStepUp.preparation: Stand facing side of bench, step or platform.
Quadriceps/BWStepUp.execution: Place foot of first leg on bench. Stand on bench by extending hip and knee of first leg and place foot of second leg on bench. Step down with second leg by flexing hip and knee of first leg. Return to original standing position by placing foot of first leg to floor. Repeat first step with opposite leg, alternating first steps between legs.
Quadriceps/BWStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Lead knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Stepping distance from bench emphasizes Gluteus Maximus; stepping close to bench emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/CB3QuarterSquatDipBelt.name: Cable Belt Half Squat
Quadriceps/CB3QuarterSquatDipBelt.preparation: Place cable belt or dip belt around waist. Kneel before low pulley and attach it to cable. Stand on elevated platform with feet shoulder width or slightly wider on platform between very low and close pulley cables. Place hand(s) on ballet bar or machine (not on guide rod!) for balance.
Quadriceps/CB3QuarterSquatDipBelt.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until weight stack taps or comes very close from making contact. Keeping chest high and back straight, raise back up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
Quadriceps/CB3QuarterSquatDipBelt.comments: More or less 3/4 squat depth can be achieved depending upon exerciser's height, chain length on dip belt, and height of elevated platform. If greater depth can be achieved, descend as low as thighs being parallel to floor. Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, arms straight to sides, and feet flat on platform; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/CBBarSquat.name: Cable Bar Squat
Quadriceps/CBBarSquat.preparation: Adjust cable pulleys to medium low positions. Kneel under attached cable bar while supporting it with both hands. Position body in lower squat position with cable bar on top of shoulders, both feet flat on floor with mid feet in line with both pulleys, knees positioned same direction as feet, back straight and angled forward, and hands grasping bar to each side.
Quadriceps/CBBarSquat.execution: Stand up by extending hips and knees until legs are straight. Squat back down to original squat position by bending hips back and knees forward while keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/CBBarSquat.comments: Position height of cable bar so moving weight plates makes contact with unused weight stack at bottom of squat when hips are slightly lower or same height as knees. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/CBLunge.name: Cable Split Squat (belt)
Quadriceps/CBLunge.preparation: Facing low pulley, kneel to attach cable belt or dip belt around waist. Place hand(s) on ballet bar or machine (not on guide rod!) for balance. Stand away from pulley with one leg forward and opposite leg to rear.
Quadriceps/CBLunge.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly, until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original straddle position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with legs in opposite position.
Quadriceps/CBLunge.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

Quadriceps/CBLungeOneArm.name: Cable One Arm Split Squat
Quadriceps/CBLungeOneArm.preparation: Face low pulley and grasp stirrup attachment with one hand. Stand away from pulley with one leg forward and opposite leg to rear. Place other hand on hip or on support to side.
Quadriceps/CBLungeOneArm.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original straddle position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with legs in opposite position.
Quadriceps/CBLungeOneArm.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

Quadriceps/CBLungeTwoArm.name: Cable Split Squat
Quadriceps/CBLungeTwoArm.preparation: Stand between two very low cable pulleys. Grasp stirrup attachments with each hand. Place one leg forward and opposite leg back to rear.
Quadriceps/CBLungeTwoArm.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original straddle position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with legs in opposite position.
Quadriceps/CBLungeTwoArm.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

Quadriceps/CBRearLunge.name: Cable Rear Lunge
Quadriceps/CBRearLunge.preparation: Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
Quadriceps/CBRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

Quadriceps/CBRearStepDownLunge.name: Cable Rear Step-down Lunge
Quadriceps/CBRearStepDownLunge.preparation: Stand on upper platform with stirrups grasped to sides.
Quadriceps/CBRearStepDownLunge.execution: Extend one leg back on forefoot. Lower body on other leg by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with lower platform. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat by alternating rear lunge with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/CBSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Cable Single Leg Split Squat
Quadriceps/CBSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Facing away from bench, stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides. Extend leg back and place top of foot on bench.
Quadriceps/CBSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/CBSingleLegSquat.name: Cable Step Down
Quadriceps/CBSingleLegSquat.preparation: Grasp cable stirrup(s) with both hands. Place one foot on elevated platform positioned near or between low pulleys.
Quadriceps/CBSingleLegSquat.execution: Raise body by extending knee and hip on platform until leg is straight. Return until foot of lower leg makes contact with lower platform or floor and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/CBSingleLegSquat.comments: Keep lower leg straight throughout movement. Forward knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Instead of grasping cable stirrups, dip belt attached to low pulley cable can be placed around waist.

Quadriceps/CBSingleLegSplitSquatOneArm.name: Cable One Arm Single Leg Split Squat
Quadriceps/CBSingleLegSplitSquatOneArm.preparation: Stand between bench and low pulley cable. Grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Facing low pulley, extend leg back and place top of foot or forefoot on bench. Place other hand on hip or support to side.
Quadriceps/CBSingleLegSplitSquatOneArm.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/CBSquatBelt.name: Cable Belt Squat
Quadriceps/CBSquatBelt.preparation: Place pin on lightest weight. Place belt around waist. Pull cable from pulley and attach to front of belt. Step onto platform and grasp pole. Squat or sit on platform and select desired weight. Stand with feet shoulder width or wider to each side of cable. Place both hands on pole at waist height.
Quadriceps/CBSquatBelt.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Squat up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/CBSquatBelt.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. When finished, squat or sit and place pin into lightest weight setting. Step off of platform and unclip cable from belt. Also known as

Quadriceps/CBStandingLegExtension.name: Cable Standing Leg Extension
Quadriceps/CBStandingLegExtension.preparation: Stand facing away from low pulley. Place foot in cable boot attachment (as shown) or
Quadriceps/CBStandingLegExtension.execution: . Grasp lateral bars or other prop for support. Stand forward on free leg. Raise knee up positioning thigh approximately 45° forward. Allow lower leg attached to cable to be pulled back.
Quadriceps/CBStandingLegExtension.comments: Keeping thigh stationary, extend lower leg forward until leg is straight. Return by lowering lower leg down and back to original position. Repeat.

Quadriceps/CBStepUp.name: Cable Step-up
Quadriceps/CBStepUp.preparation: Stand behind elevated platform and low and close pulley cables to sides. Grasp stirrups at each side of platform. Stand upright with arms straight down at sides.
Quadriceps/CBStepUp.execution: Place foot of first leg on elevated platform. Stand on elevated platform by extending hip and knee of first leg and place foot of second leg on bench. Step down with second leg by flexing hip and knee of first leg. Return to original standing position by placing foot of first leg to lower position. Repeat first step with opposite leg, alternating first steps between legs.
Quadriceps/CBStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Lead knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Stepping distance from bench emphasizes Gluteus Maximus; stepping close to bench emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/DBFrontSquat.name: Dumbbell Front Squat
Quadriceps/DBFrontSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides. Clean dumbbells up to shoulders so side of each dumbbell rests on top of each shoulder. Balance dumbbells on shoulder by holding on to dumbbells with elbows flaring outward. Position feet shoulder width or slightly narrower apart.
Quadriceps/DBFrontSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/DBFrontSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/CBSquat.name: Cable Squat
Quadriceps/CBSquat.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or slightly wider on platform between very low and close pulley cables. Squat down with knees slightly beyond foot, hips bent back behind, back straight, knees pointed same direction as feet, and shoulder above feet. Grasp stirrups to each side with arms straight.
Quadriceps/CBSquat.execution: Keeping chest high and back straight, raise stirrups by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Squat down until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/CBSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, arms straight to sides, and feet flat on platform; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/DBLateralStepUp.name: Dumbbell Lateral Step-up
Quadriceps/DBLateralStepUp.preparation: Stand between two benches, one to each side. Hold dumbbells in each hand down to sides
Quadriceps/DBLateralStepUp.execution: Lift leg and place foot on bench to side slightly forward of straight knee. Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning feet to original position. Repeat with opposite leg alternating between legs.
Quadriceps/DBLateralStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Stepping knee should point same direction as foot. A modest degree of

Quadriceps/DBLunge.name: Dumbbell Lunge
Quadriceps/DBLunge.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
Quadriceps/DBLunge.execution: Lunge forward with first leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/DBRearLunge.name: Dumbbell Rear Lunge
Quadriceps/DBRearLunge.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
Quadriceps/DBRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

Quadriceps/DBSideLunge.name: Dumbbell Alternating Side Lunge
Quadriceps/DBSideLunge.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
Quadriceps/DBSideLunge.execution: Lunge to one side with first leg. Position closest dumbbell behind thigh and opposite dumbbell to front. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of lead leg, keeping knee pointed same direction of foot. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of lead leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/DBSideLunge.comments: Keep torso upright during lunge. Flexible

Quadriceps/DBSideLunge2.name: Dumbbell Side Lunge
Quadriceps/DBSideLunge2.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
Quadriceps/DBSideLunge2.execution: Lunge to one side with first leg. Position closest dumbbell behind thigh and opposite dumbbell to front. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of lead leg, keeping knee pointed same direction of foot. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of lead leg. Repeat by

Quadriceps/DBSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Dumbbell Single Leg Split Squat
Quadriceps/DBSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides facing away from bench. Extend leg back and place top of foot on bench.
Quadriceps/DBSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/DBSingleLegSquat.name: Dumbbell Single Leg Squat
Quadriceps/DBSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
Quadriceps/DBSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep   supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/DBSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

Quadriceps/DBSplitSquat.name: Dumbbell Split Squat
Quadriceps/DBSplitSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides. Position feet far apart; one foot forward and other foot behind.
Quadriceps/DBSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/DBSplitSquat.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

Quadriceps/DBSquat.name: Dumbbell Squat
Quadriceps/DBSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
Quadriceps/DBSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/DBSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, arms straight to sides, and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/DBStepUp.name: Dumbbell Step-up
Quadriceps/DBStepUp.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides facing side of bench.
Quadriceps/DBStepUp.execution: Place foot of first leg on bench. Stand on bench by extending hip and knee of first leg and place foot of second leg on bench. Step down with second leg by flexing hip and knee of first leg. Return to original standing position by placing foot of first leg to floor. Repeat first step with opposite leg alternating first steps between legs.
Quadriceps/DBStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Lead knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Stepping distance from bench emphasizes Gluteus Maximus; stepping close to bench emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/DBStepDown.name: Dumbbell Step Down
Quadriceps/DBStepDown.preparation: Hold dumbbells in each hand down to sides and stand with one foot on bench. Position foot on bench to side slightly forward of straight knee.
Quadriceps/DBStepDown.execution: Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning foot off of bench to floor and repeat. Continue with opposite position.
Quadriceps/DBStepDown.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Knee of exercised leg should point same direction as foot. Exercise can also be performed by placing traveling foot onto and off of bench next to foot of exercised leg. See

Quadriceps/DBWalkingLunge.name: Dumbbell Walking Lunge
Quadriceps/DBWalkingLunge.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
Quadriceps/DBWalkingLunge.execution: Step forward with first leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Stand on forward leg with assistance of rear leg. Lunge forward with opposite leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite legs.

Quadriceps/LV45LegPress.name: Lever 45° Leg Press (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LV45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet on platform. Extend hips and knees. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/LV45LegPress.execution: Lower platform by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed. Return by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
Quadriceps/LV45LegPress.comments: Adjust safety brace and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps. Also see

Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegExtensionUnil.name: Lever Alternating Leg Extension (unilateral machine)
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegExtensionUnil.preparation: Sit on apparatus with back against padded back support. Place front of lower legs under padded levers. Position knee articulation at same axis as lever fulcrum. Grasp handles to sides for support.
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegExtensionUnil.execution: Move one lever forward and upward by extending one knee until leg is straight. Lower to original position. Repeat with opposite side. Continue to alternate between sides.
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegExtensionUnil.comments: Stabilizers may be used during heavy resistances to prevent body from rising off of seat. Also see exercises performed on

Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegExtension.name: Lever Alternating Leg Extension
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegExtension.preparation: Sit on apparatus with back against padded back support. Place front of lower legs under padded lever. Position knee articulation at same axis as lever fulcrum. Grasp handles to sides for support.
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegExtension.execution: Move lever forward and upward by extending one knee until leg is straight. Lower to original position. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue to alternate between sides.
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegExtension.comments: Stabilizers may be used during heavy resistances to prevent body rising off of seat.

Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegExtensionH.name: Lever Alternating Leg Extension (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegExtensionH.preparation: Sit on apparatus with back against padded back support. Place front of lower legs under padded lever. Position knee articulation at same axis as lever fulcrum. Grasp handles to sides for support.
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegExtensionH.execution: Move one lever forward and upward by extending one knee until leg is straight. Lower to original position. Repeat with opposite side. Continue to alternate between sides.
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegExtensionH.comments: Stabilizers may be used during heavy resistances to prevent body rising off of seat. Also see exercise perfomed on

Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegPress.name: Lever Alternating Seated Leg Press (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegPress.execution: Push one platform away by extending knee and hip. Return to original position. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue by alternating between sides.
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLegPress.comments: Adjust seat and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. This exercise may be performed by alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion.
