Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLyingLegPress.name: Lever Alternating Lying Leg Press
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie on machine with shoulder under pads. Place feet on individual lever platforms. Grasp handles to sides. Push both lever platforms away by extending knees and hips so knees are straight.
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLyingLegPress.execution: Lower one lever platform toward body by bending knee and hip until weight taps or nearly taps unused portion of weight stack. Push lever platform away by extending knee and hip. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue by alternating between sides.
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingLyingLegPress.comments: Adjust bench to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. This exercise may be performed by alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion.

Quadriceps/LVAlternatingSingleLegSplitVS.name: Lever Alternating Single Leg Split V-Squat
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingSingleLegSplitVS.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet slightly forward on platform. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until hip or knee is short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard). Raise lever by extending knees and hips.
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingSingleLegSplitVS.execution: Transfer right foot back to inside of rear vertical platform. Lower lever by flexing hips and knees until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Raise lever by extending knees and hips until knee is straight. Return right foot to original position by other foot. Repeat with opposite leg movement and continue alternating between sides.
Quadriceps/LVAlternatingSingleLegSplitVS.comments: When finished, keep both feet forward and descend lever downward. Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and legs are straight. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Push with both heel and forefoot. Do not allow forward heel to raise off of platform.

Quadriceps/LVBBRearLunge.name: Lever Barbell Rear Lunge (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVBBRearLunge.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet under bar. Straighten legs so weight is lifted. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Quadriceps/LVBBRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

Quadriceps/LVBBSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Lever Barbell Single Leg Split Squat (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVBBSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Place bench behind smith bar. With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place foot slightly forward under bar. Extend other leg back and place top of foot on bench. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Quadriceps/LVBBSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Lower body on leg by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/LVBBSplitSquat.name: Lever Barbell Split Squat (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVBBSplitSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place one foot slightly forward and forefoot of other leg further back. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Quadriceps/LVBBSplitSquat.execution: Lower body on other leg by flexing knees and hips of both legs until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original straddled position by extending hips and knees of both legs. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/LVBBSquat.name: Lever Barbell Squat (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVBBSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet under bar. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Quadriceps/LVBBSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/LVBBSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/LVFrontSquatPL.name: Lever Front Squat (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVFrontSquatPL.preparation: Step onto platform facing padded levers. Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width apart on platform. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Release support lever if it does not disengage by itself.
Quadriceps/LVFrontSquatPL.execution: Lower lever by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Lift lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
Quadriceps/LVFrontSquatPL.comments: Re-engage support lever before dismounting. Model shown uses foot pedal near base of platform to re-engage support lever. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on platform; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/LVFullSquatPL.name: Lever Full Squat (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVFullSquatPL.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width apart directly under shoulders. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Release support lever.
Quadriceps/LVFullSquatPL.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until knees and hips are fully bent. Lift lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
Quadriceps/LVFullSquatPL.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/LVHackPress.name: Lever Hack Press (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVHackPress.preparation: Sit on seat with back of hips against back pad. Place feet on platform shoulder width or slightly wider. Extend hips and knees. Disengage dock lever if it does not automatically disengage.
Quadriceps/LVHackPress.execution: Lower seat by flexing hips and knees until either is near complete flexion. Raise seat by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
Quadriceps/LVHackPress.comments: When finished, engage dock lever, and lower seat to starting position. If insufficient, hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps. Also see

Quadriceps/LVHackSquatPL.name: Lever Hack Squat (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVHackSquatPL.preparation: Lie supine on back pad with shoulders under shoulder pad. Place feet on platform. Extend hips and knees and release lever.
Quadriceps/LVHackSquatPL.execution: Lower lever by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
Quadriceps/LVHackSquatPL.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. If insufficient, hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps. Also see similar exercise

Quadriceps/LVLegExtension.name: Lever Leg Extension
Quadriceps/LVLegExtension.preparation: Sit on apparatus with back against padded back support. Place front of lower legs under padded lever. Position knee articulation at same axis as lever fulcrum. Grasp handles to sides for support.
Quadriceps/LVLegExtension.execution: Move lever forward and upward by extending knees until legs are straight. Return lever to original position by bending knees. Repeat.
Quadriceps/LVLegExtension.comments: Stabilizers may be used during heavy resistances to prevent body rising off of seat.

Quadriceps/LVLegExtensionH.name: Lever Leg Extension (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVLegExtensionH.preparation: Sit on apparatus with back against padded back support. Place front of lower legs under padded lever. Position knee articulation at same axis as lever fulcrum. Grasp handles to sides for support.
Quadriceps/LVLegExtensionH.execution: Move lever forward and upward by extending knees until legs are straight. Return lever to original position by bending knees. Repeat.
Quadriceps/LVLegExtensionH.comments: Stabilizers may be used during heavy resistances to prevent body rising off of seat.

Quadriceps/LVLyingLegPress.name: Lever Lying Leg Press (custom - plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie supine on padded platform. Place hands on bars above head or to sides. Place feet flat on lever platform with hips and knees bent.
Quadriceps/LVLyingLegPress.execution: Push lever platform by extending hips and knees until knees are straight. Flex hips and knees to descend until knees are just short of complete flexion. Repeat.
Quadriceps/LVLyingLegPress.comments: Adjust machine to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps. Unique apparatus is designed and built by

Quadriceps/LVLyingLegPressH.name: Lever Lying Leg Press (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVLyingLegPressH.preparation: Climb up steps to top of machine. Lie supine on horizontal padded platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet equally spaced on platform. Grip handles above shoulder pads.
Quadriceps/LVLyingLegPressH.execution: Push lever platform away by extending hips and knees until knees are straight. Return lever platform by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion or until hips are completely flexed. Repeat.
Quadriceps/LVLyingLegPressH.comments: Adjust shoulder pads to allow for full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Push with both heel and forefoot and do not allow heels to raise off of platform. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/LVRearLunge.name: Lever Rear Lunge (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVRearLunge.preparation: Stand between lever handles to sides. Squat down with feet flat on floor and grasp lower handles to sides. Lift lever by extending hips and knees to full extension.
Quadriceps/LVRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting   leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

Quadriceps/LVSeatedLegPress.name: Lever Seated Leg Press
Quadriceps/LVSeatedLegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/LVSeatedLegPress.execution: Push platform away by extending knees and hips. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/LVSeatedLegPress.comments: Adjust seat and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/LVSeatedLegPressH.name: Lever Seated Leg Press (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVSeatedLegPressH.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/LVSeatedLegPressH.execution: Push platform(s) away by extending knees and hips until knees are fully extended. Return until hips are completely flexed. Repeat.
Quadriceps/LVSeatedLegPressH.comments: Adjust seat and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/LVSingleLeg45LegPress.name: Lever Single Leg 45° Leg Press
Quadriceps/LVSingleLeg45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place one foot mid height to low on platform. Place outside of resting foot on lower surface with knee positioned out for greater clearance. Push platform up by extending hip and knee. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLeg45LegPress.execution: Lower platform by bending leg until knee is just short of complete flexion. Return by extending knee and hip. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLeg45LegPress.comments: Lower platform enough to achieve full range of motion without forcing pelvis to bend at waist. On exercised leg, keep pointed same direction as foot . Also, do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. For alternative view, see

Quadriceps/LVSingleLegLegPress.name: Lever Single Leg Seated Leg Press
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegLegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place one foot slightly low on platform and other foot on floor below platform.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegLegPress.execution: Push platform away by extending hip and knee. Return by bending leg until knee or hip is just short of complete flexion. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegLegPress.comments: Adjust back support back to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing pelvis to bend at waist. Keep knee pointed same direction as foot. Push with both heel and forefoot and do not allow heel to raise off of platform.

Quadriceps/LVSingleLegLyingLegPress.name: Lever Single Leg Lying Leg Press (custom - plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie supine on padded platform. Place hands on bars above head or to sides. Place one foot on platform and other foot on floor below platform.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegLyingLegPress.execution: Push platform away by extending hip and knee. Return by bending leg until knee or hip is just short of complete flexion. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegLyingLegPress.comments: Adjust machine to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing pelvis to bend at waist. Keep knee pointed same direction as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Unique apparatus is designed and built by

Quadriceps/LVSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Lever Single Leg Split Squat (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Stand between lever handles to sides. Extend leg back and place top of foot on cross bar. Squat down and grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: With chest high, lift lever by extending hips and knees to full extension. Return until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/LVSingleLegPressH.name: Lever Single Leg Seated Leg Press (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegPressH.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place one foot slightly low on platform and other foot near floor below platform or off to side.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegPressH.execution: Push platform away by extending hip and knee. Return by bending leg until knee or hip is just short of complete flexion. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegPressH.comments: Adjust back support back to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing pelvis to bend at waist. Keep knee pointed same direction as foot. Push with both heel and forefoot and do not allow heel to raise off of platform.

Quadriceps/LVSingleLegSplitVSquat.name: Lever Single Leg Split V-Squat
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegSplitVSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place one foot slightly forward on platform. Place other foot against rear vertical platform. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until hip or knee is short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled, just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard).
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegSplitVSquat.execution: Raise lever by extending knees and hips. Lower lever by flexing hips and knees until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg positions.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegSplitVSquat.comments: Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and legs are straight. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow forward heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

Quadriceps/LVSingleLegSquat.name: Lever Single Leg Squat (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand between handles facing away from fulcrum. Grasp both handles to sides and stand upright. Cross lower leg above knee of supporting leg.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegSquat.execution: Bend knees forward slightly while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Squat down as low as possible. Extend knee and hip until leg is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegSquat.comments: Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

Quadriceps/LVSingleLegStandingLegPress.name: Lever Single Leg Standing Leg Press (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegStandingLegPress.preparation: Step on left platform with left foot. Grasp handle bars to each side. Place right foot on highest lever platform.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegStandingLegPress.execution: Push platform down by extending hip and knee until straight. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg positions.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegStandingLegPress.comments: With greater resistances, more effort is required to pull on handle bars to keep body from rising upward.

Quadriceps/LVSingleLegVSquat.name: Lever Split V-Squat
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegVSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet on platform, shoulder or hip width apart, slightly back. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until knees or hips are just short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard). Raise sled by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Place one leg back behind platform with toes pointed downward over floor.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegVSquat.execution: Squat down with knee pointed same direction as foot. Allow leg to bend behind with forefoot on floor. Descend until forward hip is near complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knee and hip until leg is straight. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/LVSingleLegVSquat.comments: Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and leg is straight. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knee pointed same directions as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly forward on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly back on platform emphasizes Quadriceps. See manufacturer's suggested foot placement for

Quadriceps/LVSplitSquat.name: Lever Split Squat (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVSplitSquat.preparation: Stand between lever handles to sides. Place forefoot of one foot on floor to rear and other foot slightly forward. Squat down and grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/LVSplitSquat.execution: With chest high, lift lever by extending hips and knees to full extension. Return until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/LVSquat.name: Lever Squat
Quadriceps/LVSquat.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width apart directly under shoulders.
Quadriceps/LVSquat.execution: Lift lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Lower lever by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/LVSquat.comments: Lever height should be adjusted to accommodate full range, allowing hips to descend same height or slightly lower than knees. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/LVSquatPL.name: Lever Squat (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVSquatPL.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width apart directly under shoulders. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Release support lever.
Quadriceps/LVSquatPL.execution: Lower lever by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Lift lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
Quadriceps/LVSquatPL.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/LVSquatPL3.name: Lever Squat (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVSquatPL3.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width apart directly under shoulders. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Release support lever.
Quadriceps/LVSquatPL3.execution: Lower lever by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Lift lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
Quadriceps/LVSquatPL3.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/LVVSquat.name: Lever V-Squat
Quadriceps/LVVSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet on platform, shoulder or hip width apart. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until knees or hips are just short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard).
Quadriceps/LVVSquat.execution: Raise sled by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Squat down with knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until knees or hips are near complete flexion. Repeat.
Quadriceps/LVVSquat.comments: Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and legs are straight. If insufficient, hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly forward on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly back on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/LVVSquatH.name: Lever V-Squat (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/LVVSquatH.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet on platform, shoulder width apart. Extend hips and knees and release lever.
Quadriceps/LVVSquatH.execution: Lower lever by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
Quadriceps/LVVSquatH.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. If insufficient, hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly forward on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly back on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/LungeAndRearLunge.name: Barbell Alternating Lunge & Rear Lunge
Quadriceps/LungeAndRearLunge.execution: . Stand with feet slightly narrower than shoulder width apart.
Quadriceps/LungeAndRearLunge.comments: Lunge forward with right leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of right front leg until knee of rear left leg is almost in contact with floor. Forcibly extending hip and knee of forward right leg to return to original standing position.

Quadriceps/LungeRearLunge.name: Barbell Alternating Lunge To Rear Lunge
Quadriceps/LungeRearLunge.preparation: Stand facing rack with barbell at upper chest height and short platform behind. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and step back. Stand with feet slightly narrower than shoulder width apart.
Quadriceps/LungeRearLunge.execution: Lunge forward with right leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of right front leg until knee of rear left leg is almost in contact with floor. Forcibly extending hip and knee of forward right leg to return to upright position. Instead of returning right foot to side of left foot, instead continue to step back with right leg while bending supporting left leg. Plant right forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting left leg until knee of rear right leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to standing position by extending hip and knee of supporting left leg and return rear right leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

Quadriceps/SBSquat.name: Safety Barbell Squat
Quadriceps/SBSquat.preparation: Stand facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height. Position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. Hands can be placed on ends of yoke (as shown) or on safety bar out to sides. Dismount bar from rack and step back.
Quadriceps/SBSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Stand by extending hips and knees until legs are straight. Repeat.
Quadriceps/SBSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Exercise can also be performed

Quadriceps/SBSquatHandles.name: Safety Barbell Squat (long handles)
Quadriceps/SBSquatHandles.preparation: Stand facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height. Position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. Grasp ends of handles. Dismount bar from rack and step back.
Quadriceps/SBSquatHandles.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Stand with or without assistance of arms, extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
Quadriceps/SBSquatHandles.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Exercise can also be performed

Quadriceps/SBSquatSelfSpot.name: Safety Barbell Squat (self-spotting)
Quadriceps/SBSquatSelfSpot.execution: Stand facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height. Place hands vertical rack supports. Position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. Dismount bar from rack and step back so body is upright at arm's length from supports.

Quadriceps/SL45LegPress.name: Sled 45° Leg Press
Quadriceps/SL45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet on platform. Extend hips and knees. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/SL45LegPress.execution: Lower sled by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion. Return by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
Quadriceps/SL45LegPress.comments: Adjust safety brace and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps. See exercise performed on

Quadriceps/SLAlternating45LegPress.name: Sled Alternating 45° Leg Press
Quadriceps/SLAlternating45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet on individual platforms. Grasp handles to sides. Push both platforms away by extending knees and hips so knees are straight. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/SLAlternating45LegPress.execution: Lower one platform toward body by bending knee and hip until knees are just short of complete flexion or until hips are completely flexed. Push platform away by extending knee and hip. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue by alternating between sides.
Quadriceps/SLAlternating45LegPress.comments: Adjust safety brace and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Wide stance may allow for deeper range of motion. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps. See exercises performed

Quadriceps/SLHackPress.name: Sled Hack Press
Quadriceps/SLHackPress.preparation: Sit on sled with back of hips against back pad. Place feet on platform shoulder width or slightly wider. Extend hips and knees. Release dock lever(s).
Quadriceps/SLHackPress.execution: Lower sled by flexing hips and knees until either is near complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
Quadriceps/SLHackPress.comments: Re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/SLHackSquat.name: Sled Hack Squat
Quadriceps/SLHackSquat.preparation: Lie supine on back pad with shoulders under shoulder pad. Place feet on platform slightly higher than base of sled. Extend hips and knees. Release dock levers.
Quadriceps/SLHackSquat.execution: To lower sled, bend hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
Quadriceps/SLHackSquat.comments: Re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/SLLyingLegPress.name: Sled Lying Leg Press
Quadriceps/SLLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie supine on sled with shoulders against pad. Place feet on platform.
Quadriceps/SLLyingLegPress.execution: Extend hips and knees. Flex hips and knees to descend until knees are just short of complete flexion. Repeat.
Quadriceps/SLLyingLegPress.comments: Adjust machine to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/SLLyingLegPressPL.name: Sled Lying Leg Press (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/SLLyingLegPressPL.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet slightly high on platform. Extend hips and knees. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/SLLyingLegPressPL.execution: Bring sled toward platform by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion or until hips are completely flexed. Return by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
Quadriceps/SLLyingLegPressPL.comments: Re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Allow for full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/SLRearLunge.name: Sled Rear Lunge
Quadriceps/SLRearLunge.preparation: Position shoulders under padded bars handles. Place feet under bar. Straighten legs so weight is lifted. Disengage safety if available.
Quadriceps/SLRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs, alternating between sides.
Quadriceps/SLRearLunge.comments: Re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Keep torso upright during lunge;

Quadriceps/SLSeatedLegPress.name: Sled Seated Leg Press
Quadriceps/SLSeatedLegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/SLSeatedLegPress.execution: Push platform away by extending knees and hips. Return until hips are completely flexed. Repeat.
Quadriceps/SLSeatedLegPress.comments: Adjust seat and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/SLSingleLeg45LegPress.name: Sled Single Leg 45° Leg Press
Quadriceps/SLSingleLeg45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place one foot on platform and other foot on floor below platform. Extend hip and knee. Release dock levers and grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/SLSingleLeg45LegPress.execution: Lower sled by bending leg until knee is just short of complete flexion. Return by extending knees and hips. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/SLSingleLeg45LegPress.comments: Re-engage dock levers in extended position before dismounting. Adjust safety brace and back support (back) to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing pelvis to bend at waist. Keep knee pointed same direction as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

Quadriceps/SLSingleLegHackSquat.name: Sled Single Leg Hack Squat
Quadriceps/SLSingleLegHackSquat.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet on platform. Extend hips and knees. Cross lower leg above knee of supporting leg. Release dock levers.
Quadriceps/SLSingleLegHackSquat.execution: Lower sled by flexing hips and knee of supporting leg until knees are just short of complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knee and hips. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/SLSingleLegHackSquat.comments: Re-engage dock levers in extended position before dismounting. Adjust machine to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing pelvis to rise at waist. Keep knee pointed same direction as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

Quadriceps/SLSingleLegLyingLegPress.name: Sled Single Leg Lying Leg Press
Quadriceps/SLSingleLegLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place foot slightly low on platform. Position other leg with lower leg parallel to platform.
Quadriceps/SLSingleLegLyingLegPress.execution: Push platform by extending knee and hip until knee is straight. Return by bending hip and knee of supporting leg until knee is just short of complete flexion or until hip is completely flexed. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/SLSingleLegLyingLegPress.comments: Allow for full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knee pointed same directions as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing foot slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing foot slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/SLSingleLyingLegPressPL.name: Sled Single Leg Lying Leg Press (plate loaded)
Quadriceps/SLSingleLyingLegPressPL.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet on platform. Prop one leg up, on support if available. Extend hip and knee of leg positioned on platform. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/SLSingleLyingLegPressPL.execution: Bring sled toward platform by flexing hip and knee of supporting leg until knee is just short of complete flexion or until hip is completely flexed. Return by extending knee and hip. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/SLSingleLyingLegPressPL.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Allow for full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knee pointed same directions as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing foot slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing foot slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

Quadriceps/SLSingleLegVerticalLegPress.name: Sled Single Leg Vertical Leg Press
Quadriceps/SLSingleLegVerticalLegPress.preparation: Lie on declined back pad with hips under weighted sled. Place both feet on platform. Raise weight by extending hips and knees. Place foot down off of foot platform. Release dock levers and grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/SLSingleLegVerticalLegPress.execution: Lower sled by flexing leg until knees are just short of complete flexion or just before hips raise up from pad. Push weight up by extending knee and hip. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/SLSingleLegVerticalLegPress.comments: Re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting.

Quadriceps/SLSquat.name: Sled Squat
Quadriceps/SLSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under padded bars. Place feet shoulder width apart directly under shoulders. Disengage lever brace if available.
Quadriceps/SLSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Raise sled by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/SLSquat.comments: Re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/SLVerticalLegPress.name: Sled Vertical Leg Press
Quadriceps/SLVerticalLegPress.preparation: Lie on declined back pad with hips under weighted sled. Place feet on platform. Raise weight by extending hips and knees. Release dock levers and grasp handles to sides.
Quadriceps/SLVerticalLegPress.execution: Lower sled by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion or just before hips raise up from pad. Return by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
Quadriceps/SLVerticalLegPress.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting.

Quadriceps/SMFrontSquat.name: Smith Front Squat
Quadriceps/SMFrontSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, grasp bar with overhand shoulder width grip. Position bar on front of shoulders with elbows forward and wrists hyperextended. Place feet under bar. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Quadriceps/SMFrontSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/SMFrontSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefeet and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Also see bodybuilding style

Quadriceps/SMHackSquat.name: Smith Hack Squat
Quadriceps/SMHackSquat.preparation: Stand with back of thighs or glutes against bar. Grasp bar from behind with overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Quadriceps/SMHackSquat.execution: Squat down by bending knees forward slightly while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are too close to parallel to floor and bar is behind lower leg. Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Repeat.
Quadriceps/SMHackSquat.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/SMRearLunge.name: Smith Rear Lunge
Quadriceps/SMRearLunge.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet under bar. Straighten legs so weight is lifted. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Quadriceps/SMRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

Quadriceps/SMSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Smith Single Leg Split Squat
Quadriceps/SMSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Place bench behind smith bar. With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place foot slightly forward under bar. Extend other leg back and place top of foot on bench. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Quadriceps/SMSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Lower body on leg by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/SMSingleLegSquat.name: Smith Single Leg Squat
Quadriceps/SMSingleLegSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet slightly forward and cross lower leg above knee of supporting leg. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Quadriceps/SMSingleLegSquat.execution: Bend knees forward slightly while allowing hips to bend, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thigh of supporting leg is just past parallel to floor. Extend knee and hip until leg is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/SMSingleLegSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and foot flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement.

Quadriceps/SMSplitSquat.name: Smith Split Squat
Quadriceps/SMSplitSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place one foot forward slightly and forefoot of other leg further back. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Quadriceps/SMSplitSquat.execution: Lower body on other leg by flexing knees and hips of both legs until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original straddled position by extending hips and knees of both legs. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/SMSquat.name: Smith Squat
Quadriceps/SMSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet under bar. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Quadriceps/SMSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/SMSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/SMStepDown.name: Smith Step Down
Quadriceps/SMStepDown.preparation: Position smith bar upper chest height with platform under bar off to one side. Positioned shoulders under bar and one foot on platform with other leg extended slightly forward on floor.
Quadriceps/SMStepDown.execution: Raise bar upward by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Lower body downward by returning foot off of bench to floor and repeat. Continue with opposite position.
Quadriceps/SMStepDown.comments: Keep torso upright and foot flat on platform during exercise. Knee of exercised leg should point same direction as foot. Extended leg can be positioned slight forward.

Quadriceps/SMWideSquat.name: Smith Wide Squat
Quadriceps/SMWideSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet wide pointing outward 45° to 30°. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Quadriceps/SMWideSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/SMWideSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/STSingleLegSplitSquatSelfAss.name: Suspended Single Leg Split Squat (self-assisted)
Quadriceps/STSingleLegSplitSquatSelfAss.preparation: Grasp one or both suspension trainer handle(s) in lower position hanging. Stand facing nearby   fixed support and hold with one hand for balance. With other hand, secure foot in loop(s) from behind while balancing on one leg. With both hands, hold lightly on fixed support for balance and minimal assistance if needed.
Quadriceps/STSingleLegSplitSquatSelfAss.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of supporting leg. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/STSingleLegSquat.name: Suspended Single Leg Squat
Quadriceps/STSingleLegSquat.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Position body and legs straight at desired angle hanging from handles with arms straight. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
Quadriceps/STSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back, up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/STSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Dismounting can be achieved by placing elevated leg down and walking backward until body is upright.

Quadriceps/STSplitSquat.name: Suspended Single Leg Split Squat
Quadriceps/STSplitSquat.preparation: Grasp one or both suspension trainer handle(s) in lower position. Step and face away from suspension trainers. Balance on one leg while raising foot from behind and slipping single foot in loop(s). Release handle with hand and position leg back so it is supported behind body by suspension trainer. Place hands on hips and maintain balance throughout exercise.
Quadriceps/STSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

Quadriceps/STSquat.name: Suspended Reclining Squat
Quadriceps/STSquat.preparation: Stand in front of suspension trainer handles positioned at height of upper abdomen to lower chest. Grasp suspension trainer handles and step back with arms extended forward until suspension straps are taut. While leaning back, step forward with both feet. Recline back with feet apart with arms and body straight.
Quadriceps/STSquat.execution: While reclined back and holding onto suspension trainer handles, squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward while keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are perpendicular to body's angle of movement. Stand up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return to reclined standing position with body straight. Repeat.
Quadriceps/STSquat.comments: Apply equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/TBSquat.name: Trap Bar Squat
Quadriceps/TBSquat.preparation: Stand on platform under loaded trap bar. Squat down until thighs are just past parallel to floor with knees pointed same direction as feet and feet flat on platform. Grasp handles to sides. Posture chest up with back arched tightly.
Quadriceps/TBSquat.execution: Lift weight upward by extending knees and hips until straight. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weights to floor by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward. Repeat.
Quadriceps/TBSquat.comments: An inverted, squared open-ended trap bar is used in this demonstration. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/WTFrontSquat.name: Weighted Front Squat
Quadriceps/WTFrontSquat.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or slightly narrower apart. Holding weight plate upper chest height with both hands.
Quadriceps/WTFrontSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/WTFrontSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

Quadriceps/WTSingleLegSquat.name: Weighted Single Leg Squat
Quadriceps/WTSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand with arms extended out in front holding medicine ball or weight plate. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
Quadriceps/WTSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body   back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
Quadriceps/WTSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

Quadriceps/WTSissySquat.name: Weighted Sissy Squat
Quadriceps/WTSissySquat.preparation: With shoulder width stance, grasp fixed bar or support at hip level with one arm and secure plate across chest with other arm.
Quadriceps/WTSissySquat.execution: With hips and waist straight, bend knees to allow body to fall backwards as knees come forward. Allow heels to raise from floor. Lower body until knees are almost fully flexed or near floor. Return to original position by extending knees as heels return to floor.
Quadriceps/WTSissySquat.comments: Keep waist and hips straight throughout exercise. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement.

Quadriceps/WTSissySquatAp.name: Weighted Sissy Squat (on apparatus)
Quadriceps/WTSissySquatAp.preparation: Place feet under lower padded bar with calves against upper pads. Secure weight plate high on chest with both arms.
Quadriceps/WTSissySquatAp.execution: Allow body to fall backwards by bending knees. During descent, gradually bend hips, yet keep chest high and don't allow torso to angle forward. Lower body until back of thigh is against upper pad. Rise to original position by extending knees and hips while keeping shoulders behind hips. Repeat.
Quadriceps/WTSissySquatAp.comments: Keep chest high and shoulder behind hips, preventing torso to angle forward. If upper pad is too high, it can obstruct range of motion, and possibly create abrupt forward dislocating forces on knee particularly if descent is not controlled. In contrast, inadequate support will be provided if upper pad is too low.

Quadriceps/WtSquat.name: Weighted Belt Squat
Quadriceps/WtSquat.preparation: Place weight on dip belt around waist. Step up onto boxes or benches spaced apart; foot on each one. Arms can be extended forward throughout exercise.
Quadriceps/WtSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Squat up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
Quadriceps/WtSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

RectusAbdominis/BBPushCrunch.name: Barbell Push Crunch
RectusAbdominis/BBPushCrunch.preparation: Position feet under foot pad and lie supine on steep incline bench. Pull barbell from floor or grasp from rack behind with overhand grip. Position barbell over chest with shoulder width or slightly wider grip.
RectusAbdominis/BBPushCrunch.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso from bench, keeping low back on bench. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline board. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BBPushCrunch.comments: Keep weight above shoulders throughout movement. A

RectusAbdominis/BBPushSitUp.name: Barbell Push Sit-up
RectusAbdominis/BBPushSitUp.preparation: Position feet under foot pad and lie supine on flat or incline bench. Pull barbell from floor or grasp from rack behind with overhand grip. Position barbell over chest with shoulder width or slightly wider grip.
RectusAbdominis/BBPushSitUp.execution: Raise torso from bench as high as possible by bending waist and hips. Keep weight positioned above shoulders. Achieve near upright posture (hip flexibility, incline, and initial hip position permitting). Return to original lying posture with back of shoulders contacting padded incline board. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BBPushSitUp.comments: Keep weight above shoulders throughout movement. Incline can also be elevated to increase resistance. If upper back does not come completely down at end of movement, abdominal muscles may only be

RectusAbdominis/BWBallCrunch.name: Ball Crunch (on stability ball)
RectusAbdominis/BWBallCrunch.preparation: Sit on exercise ball. Walk forward on ball and lie back on ball with shoulders and head hanging off and knees and hips bent. Gently hyperextend back on contour of ball. Place hands behind neck or beside head.
RectusAbdominis/BWBallCrunch.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso. Return to original position. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWBallCrunch.comments: Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. Some individuals may experience low back discomfort if hips are not bent so they must use smaller

RectusAbdominis/BWBallCrunchX.name: Crunch (on stability ball, arms crossed)
RectusAbdominis/BWBallCrunchX.preparation: Sit on exercise ball. Walk forward on ball and lie back on ball with shoulders and head hanging off and knees and hips bent. Gently hyperextend back on contour of ball. Cross arms on chest.
RectusAbdominis/BWBallCrunchX.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso. Return to original position. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWBallCrunchX.comments: Some individuals may experience low back discomfort if hips are not bent so they must use smaller

RectusAbdominis/BWBallRollout.name: Stability Ball Rollout
RectusAbdominis/BWBallRollout.preparation: Kneel on floor or mat facing stability ball within arm's reach. Straighten hips with subtle bend. Also straighten arms with slight bend, down in front of body. Place fists side by side on upper side of ball closest to hips.
RectusAbdominis/BWBallRollout.execution: Lean forward and roll ridged arms out over ball. Roll forward as far as possible. Raise body back up by pulling arms back until kneeling upright in original position. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWBallRollout.comments: Try to keep elbows nearly straight throughout exercise. Also known as Stability Ball Kneeling Rollout.

RectusAbdominis/BWCrunch.name: Crunch
RectusAbdominis/BWCrunch.preparation: Lie supine on mat with lower legs on bench. Place hands behind neck or head.
RectusAbdominis/BWCrunch.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso from mat. Keep low back on mat and raise torso up as high as possible. Return until back of shoulders contact mat. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWCrunch.comments: Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. See

RectusAbdominis/BWCrunchUp.name: Crunch Up
RectusAbdominis/BWCrunchUp.preparation: Lie supine on mat or floor with bent leg and arms pointed up.
RectusAbdominis/BWCrunchUp.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso from floor. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline board. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWCrunchUp.comments: Hip may move slightly during exercise. Exercise can be performed with added resistance if needed, by holding weight above. Quadriceps were not listed under stabilizers since they are not under significant resistance. Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. See

RectusAbdominis/BWCrunchAD.name: Crunch (arms down)
RectusAbdominis/BWCrunchAD.preparation: Lie supine on mat or bench. Bend knees and hips and place feet on floor. Extend arms down to sides.
RectusAbdominis/BWCrunchAD.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso from mat or bench. Keep low back on floor or mat and raise torso up as high as possible. Extend hands toward sides of heels. Return until back of shoulders contact mat or bench. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWCrunchAD.comments: Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum, particularly if hands are placed behind head. See

RectusAbdominis/BWFrontPlank.name: Front Plank
RectusAbdominis/BWFrontPlank.execution: Lie prone on mat. Place forearms on mat, elbows under shoulders. Place legs together with forefeet on floor.
RectusAbdominis/BWFrontPlank.comments: Raise body upward by straightening body in straight line. Hold position.

RectusAbdominis/BWCrunchX.name: Crunch (arms crossed)
RectusAbdominis/BWCrunchX.preparation: Lie supine on mat with lower legs on bench. Cross wrists on chest.
RectusAbdominis/BWCrunchX.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso from mat. Keep low back on mat and raise torso up as high as possible. Return until back of shoulders contact mat. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWCrunchX.comments: Leg elevation keeps pelvis tilted back, keeping low back on mat. See

RectusAbdominis/BWHangingLegHipRaise.name: Hanging Leg-Hip Raise
RectusAbdominis/BWHangingLegHipRaise.preparation: Stand below ab straps hanging from high bar. Place upper arms in straps and grasp straps above.
RectusAbdominis/BWHangingLegHipRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are fully flexed. Continue to raise knees toward shoulders by flexing waist. Return until waist, hips, and knees are extended downward. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWHangingLegHipRaise.comments: Exercise can be performed hanging from ab straps. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques only

RectusAbdominis/BWHangingLegHipRaiseAbSt.name: Hanging Leg-Hip Raise (with ab straps)
RectusAbdominis/BWHangingLegHipRaiseAbSt.preparation: Stand below ab straps hanging from high bar. Place upper arms in straps and grasp straps above.
RectusAbdominis/BWHangingLegHipRaiseAbSt.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are fully flexed. Continue to raise knees toward shoulders by flexing waist. Return until waist, hips, and knees are extended downward. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWHangingLegHipRaiseAbSt.comments: Exercise can be performed without ab straps just by

RectusAbdominis/BWHangingStraightLegHipR.name: Hanging Straight Leg-Hip Raise
RectusAbdominis/BWHangingStraightLegHipR.preparation: Grasp and hang from high bar.
RectusAbdominis/BWHangingStraightLegHipR.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips until fully flexed. Continue to raise feet toward bar by flexing waist. Return until waist and hips are extended downward. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWHangingStraightLegHipR.comments: Attempt to decrease shoulder flexion during movement. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques only

RectusAbdominis/BWInclineCrunch.name: Incline Crunch
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineCrunch.preparation: Hook feet under foot brace and lie supine on incline board with hips bent. Place hands behind neck or head.
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineCrunch.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso from bench. Keep low back on bench and raise torso up as high as possible. Return until back of shoulders contact incline board. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineCrunch.comments: If no knee support is built in to incline board, ball can be placed under legs. Hip and knee flexors may be involved as stabilizers if incline is steep and no calf support is used. Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. See

RectusAbdominis/BWInclineLegHipRaise.name: Incline Leg-Hip Raise
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineLegHipRaise.preparation: Lie supine on incline board with torso elevated. Grasp feet hooks or sides of board by head for support.
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineLegHipRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are fully flexed. Continue to raise knees toward shoulders by flexing waist, raising hips from board. Return until waist, hips and knees are extended. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineLegHipRaise.comments: When raising hips, keep knees fully flexed, so as not to throw weight of lower legs over head. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques

RectusAbdominis/BWInclineCrunchDown.name: Incline Crunch (arms down)
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineCrunchDown.preparation: Hook feet under foot brace and lie supine on incline board with hips bent. Extend arms down to sides or cross arms on chest.
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineCrunchDown.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso from bench. Keep low back on bench and raise torso up as high as possible. Return until back of shoulders contact incline board. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineCrunchDown.comments: If no knee support is built in to incline board, ball can be placed under legs. Hip and knee flexors may be involved as stabilizers if incline is steep and no calf support is used. See

RectusAbdominis/BWInclineSitUp.name: Incline Sit-up
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineSitUp.preparation: Hook feet under support and lie supine on incline bench with hips bent. Place hands behind neck or on side of neck.
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineSitUp.execution: Raise torso from bench by bending waist and hips. Return until back of shoulders contact incline board. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineSitUp.comments: Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. If no knee support is built in to incline board, ball can be placed under legs. If upper back does not come completely down at end of movement, abdominal muscles may only be

RectusAbdominis/BWInclineSitUpX.name: Incline Sit-up (arms crossed)
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineSitUpX.preparation: Hook feet under foot brace and lie supine on incline board with hips bent. Cross arms on chest.
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineSitUpX.execution: Raise torso from bench by bending waist and hips. Raise crossed arms over knees at top. Return until back of shoulders contact incline board. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWInclineSitUpX.comments: If no knee support is built in to incline board, ball can be placed under legs. If upper back does not come completely down at end of movement, abdominal muscles may only be

RectusAbdominis/BWInvertedSitup.name: Inverted Sit-up
RectusAbdominis/BWInvertedSitup.preparation: Hang inverted from high bar with gravity boots on each leg. Lie supine with hands on floor over head.
RectusAbdominis/BWInvertedSitup.execution: Raise trunk as high as possible by flexing hips and waist. Return to starting position. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/BWLegHipRaiseExBall.name: Leg-Hip Raise (on stability ball)
RectusAbdominis/BWLegHipRaiseExBall.preparation: Position ball against sturdy support. Lie with back on ball and heels on floor with legs straight. Grasp sturdy bar(s) near head for support.
RectusAbdominis/BWLegHipRaiseExBall.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are fully flexed. Continue to raise knees toward shoulders by flexing waist, raising hips from board. Return until waist, hips and knees are extended. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWLegHipRaiseExBall.comments: When raising hips, keep knees fully flexed, so as not to throw weight of lower legs over head. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques

RectusAbdominis/BWLyingLegHipRaise.name: Lying Leg-Hip Raise
RectusAbdominis/BWLyingLegHipRaise.preparation: Lie supine on bench or floor. Grasp sides of bench for support.
RectusAbdominis/BWLyingLegHipRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips while flexing knees until hips are fully flexed. Continue to raise knees toward shoulders by flexing waist, raising hips from board. Return until waist, hips and knees are extended. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWLyingLegHipRaise.comments: When raising hips, keep knees fully flexed, so as not to throw weight of lower legs over head. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques

RectusAbdominis/BWSitUp.name: Sit-up
RectusAbdominis/BWSitUp.preparation: Hook feet under foot brace or secure low overhang. Lie supine on floor or bench with hips bent. Place hands behind neck or on side of neck.
RectusAbdominis/BWSitUp.execution: Raise torso from bench by bending waist and hips. Return until back of shoulders contact incline board. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWSitUp.comments: instead of foot bar. Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. If upper back does not come completely down at end of movement, abdominal muscles may only be

RectusAbdominis/BWSitUpX.name: Sit-up (arms crossed)
RectusAbdominis/BWSitUpX.preparation: Hook feet under foot brace or secure low overhang. Lie supine on mat or bench with hips bent. Cross arms and place hands in front of shoulders.
RectusAbdominis/BWSitUpX.execution: Raise torso from mat or bench by bending waist and hips. Raise crossed arms over knees at top. Return until back of shoulders contact mat or bench. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWSitUpX.comments: If upper back does not come completely down at end of movement, abdominal muscles may only be

RectusAbdominis/BWSitUpAD.name: Sit-up (arms down)
RectusAbdominis/BWSitUpAD.preparation: Lie supine on mat or bench with hips bent and feet on floor or bench. Hook feet under foot brace or secure low overhang if required to keep feet down. Extend arms down to sides.
RectusAbdominis/BWSitUpAD.comments: Raise torso from mat or bench by bending waist and hips. Extend hands toward sides of heels. Return until back of shoulders contact mat or bench. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/BWVertStraightLegHipRais.name: Vertical Straight Leg-Hip Raise (parallel bars)
RectusAbdominis/BWVertStraightLegHipRais.preparation: Stand between parallel bars and grip bar on each side with overhand grip. Lift body off floor and balance body upright with arms straight.
RectusAbdominis/BWVertStraightLegHipRais.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips until fully flexed. Continue to raise feet toward bar by flexing waist. Return until waist and hips are extended downward. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/BWVerticalLegHipRaise.name: Vertical Leg-Hip Raise
RectusAbdominis/BWVerticalLegHipRaise.preparation: Position forearms on padded parallel bars with hands on handles, and back on vertical pad.
RectusAbdominis/BWVerticalLegHipRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are fully flexed. Continue to raise knees toward shoulders by flexing waist, raising hips from back board. Return until waist, hips, and knees are extended. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/BWVerticalLegHipRaiseBos.name: Vertical Leg-Hip Raise (Bosu support)
RectusAbdominis/BWVerticalLegHipRaiseBos.preparation: Position forearms on padded parallel bars with hands on handles and back on convexed surface.
RectusAbdominis/BWVerticalLegHipRaiseBos.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees. As hips approach full flexion, lean back. Continue to raise knees toward shoulders by flexing waist and raising hips and low back from convexed surface. Return until waist, hips, and knees are extended. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/BWVerticalLegHipRaisePB.name: Vertical Leg-Hip Raise (parallel bars)
RectusAbdominis/BWVerticalLegHipRaisePB.preparation: Stand between parallel bars and grip bar on each side with overhand grip. Lift body off floor and balance body upright with arms straight.
RectusAbdominis/BWVerticalLegHipRaisePB.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are fully flexed. Continue to raise knees toward shoulders by flexing waist. Return until waist, hips, and knees are extended. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/BWVup.name: V-up
RectusAbdominis/BWVup.preparation: Sit on floor or mat. Lie supine with hands on floor over head.
RectusAbdominis/BWVup.execution: Simultaneously raise straight legs and torso. Reach toward raised feet. Return to starting position. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/BWVup.comments: Keep knees straight throughout movement. Begin each repetition with upper back on floor to allow abdominal muscles to work dynamically. The Rectus Abdominis and Obliques

RectusAbdominis/CBKneelingCrunch.name: Cable Kneeling Crunch
RectusAbdominis/CBKneelingCrunch.preparation: Kneel below high pulley. Grasp cable rope attachment with both hands. Place wrists against head. Position hips back and flex hips, allowing resistance on cable pulley to lift torso upward so spine is hyperextended.
RectusAbdominis/CBKneelingCrunch.execution: With hips stationary, flex waist so elbows travel toward middle of thighs. Return and repeat.
RectusAbdominis/CBKneelingCrunch.comments: Note movement occurs in waist, not hips. See

RectusAbdominis/CBLyingCrunchStabilityBa.name: Cable Lying Crunch (on stability ball)
RectusAbdominis/CBLyingCrunchStabilityBa.preparation: Sit on stability ball against low pulley column. Roll back away from low pulley column, so back is on ball. Reach back and grasp cable rope attachment with both hands and place inside of wrists on sides of head. Allow weight to hyperextend lower back against stability ball.
RectusAbdominis/CBLyingCrunchStabilityBa.execution: With hips stationary, flex waist so elbows travel toward thighs. Return and repeat.

RectusAbdominis/CBLyingLegHipRaise.name: Cable Lying Leg-Hip Raise
RectusAbdominis/CBLyingLegHipRaise.preparation: Attach cable ankle straps to both ankles then attach ankle straps to cable. Lie supine on floor or mat, back far enough so cable is taut. Grasp support behind head.
RectusAbdominis/CBLyingLegHipRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips while flexing knees until hips are fully flexed. Raise hips from floor by flexing waist. Return until waist, hips and knees are extended downward. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/CBLyingLegHipRaise.comments: Movement can also be performed on bench. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques only

RectusAbdominis/CBLyingLegHipRaiseBench.name: Cable Lying Leg-Hip Raise (on bench)
RectusAbdominis/CBLyingLegHipRaiseBench.preparation: Attach cable ankle straps to both ankles, then attach ankle straps to cable. Lie supine on floor or mat, back far enough so cable is taut. Grasp support behind head.
RectusAbdominis/CBLyingLegHipRaiseBench.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips while flexing knees until hips are fully flexed. Raise hips from floor by flexing waist. Return until legs are extended horizontally. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/CBLyingLegHipRaiseBench.comments: Training partner or trainer may need to assist attaching ankle cuffs to cable. Ankle cuffs may also be attached to cable pulley in lowest position when feet are on floor, but assistance may be needed to raise pulley to bench height.

RectusAbdominis/CBLyingStraightLegHipRai.name: Cable Lying Straight Leg-Hip Raise
RectusAbdominis/CBLyingStraightLegHipRai.preparation: Attach cable ankle straps to both ankles, then attach ankle straps to cable. Lie supine on floor or mat, back far enough so cable is taut. Grasp support behind head.
RectusAbdominis/CBLyingStraightLegHipRai.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips until fully flexed. Raise hips from floor by flexing waist. Return until waist and hips are extended downward. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/CBOverheadSeatedCrunch.name: Cable Overhead Seated Crunch
RectusAbdominis/CBOverheadSeatedCrunch.preparation: Sit on bench or seat below two very close high pulleys. Grasp two separate cable stirrups, one with each hand. Pull stirrups down with palms facing back over each shoulder. Holding arms in place, allow weight to pull torso up, hyperextend lower back slightly.
RectusAbdominis/CBOverheadSeatedCrunch.execution: With arms fixed in place, flex waist so shoulders travel forward and downward toward thighs. Return until chest is high and back is hyperextended. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/CBOverheadSeatedCrunch.comments: Keep arms fixed in position keeping them close to body throughout movement. See

RectusAbdominis/CBSeatedCrunch.name: Cable Seated Crunch
RectusAbdominis/CBSeatedCrunch.preparation: Seat with back support away from medium high pulley. Grasp cable rope attachment with both hands and place securely over both shoulders. Allow weight to lift chest up with spine arched back slightly.
RectusAbdominis/CBSeatedCrunch.execution: With hips stationary, flex waist so elbows travel toward hips. Return and repeat.

RectusAbdominis/CBSeatedCrunchPL.name: Cable Seated Crunch (plate loaded)
RectusAbdominis/CBSeatedCrunchPL.preparation: Sit on apparatus with back on back support. Grasp cable rope attachment with both hands and place securely over both shoulders. Allow weight to lift chest up with spine arched back slightly.
RectusAbdominis/CBSeatedCrunchPL.execution: With hips stationary, flex waist small of back pushes into back of seat as upper back travels forward. Return and repeat.

RectusAbdominis/CBStandingCrunch.name: Cable Standing Crunch
RectusAbdominis/CBStandingCrunch.preparation: Position back against back pad with knees slightly bent, shoulders back, and chest high. Position both cable ropes over shoulders, one in each hand. Place hands with cable ropes in front of each shoulder so that cable is taut. If available, place hand in rope slot that allows cable to be taut when hands are in position.
RectusAbdominis/CBStandingCrunch.execution: Flex waist so torso pulls ropes forward and downward. Return until back of shoulders return to surface. Repeat alternating twists with opposite sides.
RectusAbdominis/CBStandingCrunch.comments: Padded hump should be adjusted to height of low back. See

RectusAbdominis/CBStandingOverheadCrunch.name: Cable Standing Overhead Crunch (multi-exercise bar)
RectusAbdominis/CBStandingOverheadCrunch.preparation: Stand below high pulley. Grasp multi-exercise bar cable attachment with parallel grip. Position hands near sides of head. Squat down slightly with hips flexed, allowing resistance on cable pulley to lift torso upward so spine is hyperextended.
