RectusAbdominis/CBStandingOverheadCrunch.execution: With knees and hips stationary, flex waist so elbows travel toward middle of thighs. Return and repeat.
RectusAbdominis/CBStandingOverheadCrunch.comments: Note movement occurs in waist, not hips. Hyperextension of spine at top of motion is achieved by anterior rotation of pelvis with flexed hips. See

RectusAbdominis/CBStandingOverheadCrunch.name: Cable Standing Overhead Crunch
RectusAbdominis/CBStandingOverheadCrunch.preparation: Stand below high pulley. Grasp cable rope attachment and place wrists against head. Squat down slightly with hips flexed, allowing resistance on cable pulley to lift torso upward so spine is hyperextended.
RectusAbdominis/CBStandingOverheadCrunch.execution: With knees and hips stationary, flex waist so elbows travel toward middle of thighs. Return and repeat.
RectusAbdominis/CBStandingOverheadCrunch.comments: Note movement occurs in waist, not hips. Hyperextension of spine at top of motion is achieved by anterior rotation of pelvis with flexed hips. See

RectusAbdominis/DBPushCrunch.name: Dumbbell Push Crunch
RectusAbdominis/DBPushCrunch.preparation: With dumbbells in each hand, position feet under foot pad and lie supine on steep incline bench. Position dumbbells straight over shoulders.
RectusAbdominis/DBPushCrunch.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso from bench, keeping low back on bench. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline bench. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/DBPushCrunch.comments: Keep weight above shoulders throughout movement. A

RectusAbdominis/DBPushSitUp.name: Dumbbell Push Sit-up
RectusAbdominis/DBPushSitUp.preparation: Position feet under foot pad and lie supine on flat or incline bench. Position dumbbells straight over shoulders.
RectusAbdominis/DBPushSitUp.execution: Raise torso from bench as high as possible by bending waist and hips. Keep weight positioned above shoulders. Achieve near upright posture (hip flexibility, incline, and initial hip position permitting). Return to original lying posture with back of shoulders, contacting padded incline board. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/DBPushSitUp.comments: Keep weight above shoulders throughout movement. Incline can also be elevated to increase resistance. If upper back does not come completely down at end of movement, abdominal muscles may only be

RectusAbdominis/LVLegRaiseCrunch.name: Lever Lying Leg Raise Crunch (plate loaded)
RectusAbdominis/LVLegRaiseCrunch.execution: Lie supine on machine with lower legs between padded bars. Grasp handles on each side.

RectusAbdominis/LVLyingCrunch.name: Lever Lying Crunch
RectusAbdominis/LVLyingCrunch.preparation: Lie on machine with legs over pads or feet on foot bar. Grasp bars near head at each side.
RectusAbdominis/LVLyingCrunch.execution: With hips stationary, raise upper back pad by flexing waist. Return and repeat.
RectusAbdominis/LVLyingCrunch.comments: Lever fulcrum should be aligned with waist, not hips. Some lever lying crunch machines have

RectusAbdominis/LVLyingLegHipRaise.name: Lever Lying Leg-Hip Raise
RectusAbdominis/LVLyingLegHipRaise.execution: Lie supine on machine with lower legs between padded bars. Grasp handles on each side.

RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunch.name: Lever Seated Crunch
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunch.preparation: Sit on machine with back and hips against back supports. If available, place lower legs under pads or on platform. Grasp handles above and position back of arm against pads to each side.
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunch.execution: With hips stationary, flex waist so elbows travel downward. Return and repeat.

RectusAbdominis/LVPushCrunch.name: Lever Push Crunch
RectusAbdominis/LVPushCrunch.preparation: Sit on machine with back of hips against hip support. Push hips securely back by pushing feet against foot bar. Grasp handles and push resistance lever until arms are extended in front of body.
RectusAbdominis/LVPushCrunch.execution: Push resistance lever forward by flexing waist. Return by allowing upper body to be pushed back until low back is hyperextended. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/LVPushCrunch.comments: Foot bar should be adjusted to allow for slight bend in knees as hips are forcefully being pushed against hip pad. Throughout exercise, keep arms straight and hips securely pushed back against hip pad. See

RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunchArmBar.name: Lever Seated Crunch (arm bar)
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunchArmBar.preparation: Sit on machine with back and hips against padded supports. Place feet on floor or feet bars so thigh is approximately horizontal. Grasp handles and position forearms on bars or pads.
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunchArmBar.execution: With hips stationary, flex waist so arms and upper torso travel forward and downward. Return and repeat.
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunchArmBar.comments: Taller individuals will place feet on floor, whereas shorter individuals will place feet on feet bars. See

RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunchArmPad.name: Lever Seated Crunch (arm pad)
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunchArmPad.preparation: Position seat so shoulders are same height of padded lever. Sit on machine and place arms over lever pad. Push padded lever down slightly until shoulder is fixed at approximately 90º or slightly greater.
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunchArmPad.execution: With hips stationary, flex waist in "C" shape so elbows point downward. Return and repeat.
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunchArmPad.comments: Maintain shoulders fixed at 90º or greater so upper arm and upper back are close to perpendicular. Men should keep chest close to padded lever. Women may choose to position chest as close as possible without making contact with inside of lever. See

RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunchChestPad.name: Lever Seated Crunch (chest pad)
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunchChestPad.preparation: Position seat so chest is same height of padded lever. Sit on machine with back of hips against hip pad. Place hands on outside of lever pad.
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunchChestPad.execution: With hips stationary, flex waist in "C" shape so shoulders travel forward and downward. Return and repeat.
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedCrunchChestPad.comments: On some models, feet can be positioned behind pad under seat. See

RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedLegRaiseCrunch.name: Lever Seated Leg Raise Crunch
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedLegRaiseCrunch.execution: Sit on machine with back against back support and lower legs under padded bar. Grasp handles above to each side.

RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedLegRaiseCrunchPL.name: Lever Seated Leg Raise Crunch (plate loaded)
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedLegRaiseCrunchPL.preparation: Sit on machine with back against back support and lower legs under padded bar. Grasp handles above to each side.
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedLegRaiseCrunchPL.execution: Pull handles down while pulling lower leg bar up by flexing waist and pelvis. Return and repeat.
RectusAbdominis/LVSeatedLegRaiseCrunchPL.comments: Weight plates added to upper segment adds resistance, whereas weight plates added to lower segment decreases resistance. Seat can also be

RectusAbdominis/LVVerticalLegHipRaise.name: Lever Vertical Leg-Hip Raise (plate loaded)
RectusAbdominis/LVVerticalLegHipRaise.execution: Grasp handles slightly to front and stand on foot bar with knees slightly bent and hips against pad.

RectusAbdominis/LVSideLyingLegHipRaise.name: Lever Side Lying Leg Hip Raise
RectusAbdominis/LVSideLyingLegHipRaise.execution: Lie on side with head on elevated head pad and legs between padded rollers. Flex hips slightly until rear and front of thighs are snugly positioned against pads. Flex knees so back of lower leg is against furthest padded roller. Grasp handles in front of head.

RectusAbdominis/MBSitUp.name: Medicine Ball Overhead Throw Sit-up (machine)
RectusAbdominis/MBSitUp.preparation: Position feet under support with knees bent. With two medicine balls at bottom of chute, grasp closest medicine ball with both hands.
RectusAbdominis/MBSitUp.execution: With ball in both hands, lie down onto back support while lowering medicine ball behind head. Raise torso from back support by bending waist and hips while raising ball overhead. Immediately throw ball into target and grasp other medicine ball at bottom of chute. Repeat movement.
RectusAbdominis/MBSitUp.comments: Intensity can be increased by using heavier medicine ball or by performing movement faster. Movement can be made easier by using

RectusAbdominis/MBSitUpChest.name: Medicine Ball Chest Throw Sit-up (machine)
RectusAbdominis/MBSitUpChest.preparation: Position feet under support with knees bent. With two medicine balls at bottom of chute, grasp closest medicine ball with both hands.
RectusAbdominis/MBSitUpChest.execution: With ball in both hands, lie down onto back support while lowering medicine ball to chest. Raise torso from back support by bending waist and hips while pushing ball away from chest. Immediately throw ball into target and grasp other medicine ball at bottom of chute. Repeat movement.
RectusAbdominis/MBSitUpChest.comments: Intensity can be increased by using heavier medicine ball, by performing movement faster, using

RectusAbdominis/SLLegHipRaise.name: Sled Leg Hip Raise (ab coaster)
RectusAbdominis/SLLegHipRaise.preparation: Straddle machine facing handles. Grasp handles on each side and place forearms on pads. Place shins on padded sled with knees forward and feet hanging off of back end. Sit back toward heels without bending over.
RectusAbdominis/SLLegHipRaise.execution: Slide forward and up by pulling knees up high. Deliberately attempt to flex waist in a "C" shape. Return sled down and back arching spine in opposite direction while keeping hips bent. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/SLLegHipRaise.comments: If low back does flex near top of motion, abdominal muscles may only be

RectusAbdominis/STHangingLegHipRaise.name: Suspended Hanging Leg Hip Raise
RectusAbdominis/STHangingLegHipRaise.preparation: Stand below suspension trainer handles positioned up high. Grasp handles above.
RectusAbdominis/STHangingLegHipRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are fully flexed. Continue to raise knees toward shoulders by flexing waist. Return until waist, hips, and knees are extended downward. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/STHangingLegHipRaise.comments: If handles cannot be positioned high enough, knees can be kept partially bent near bottom so hips can be extended fully. If knees are not extended at botton, Rectus Femoris becomes synergist. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques only

RectusAbdominis/STJackknife.name: Suspended Jack-knife
RectusAbdominis/STJackknife.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Place right foot in left lower loop. Cross left leg over right leg placed in right lower loop. Turn body to right and place hands on floor, shoulder width apart. Turn body to kneel on hands and knees. Reposition hands squared with desired distance from suspension trainer, shoulder width or slightly wider. With arms straight, raise knees from ground so body is supported by arms and suspension trainer.
RectusAbdominis/STJackknife.execution: Pull legs under torso by bending hips and knees. Pull knees toward chest hips and knees until completely flexed. Return by extending hips and knees to original position. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/STPullThrough.name: Suspended Pull Through
RectusAbdominis/STPullThrough.preparation: Sit on floor with feet under suspension trainer loops in low position. Reach and grasp bottom of loops and lay back supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles (or ankles through loops as shown). Extend legs out straight. Sit up and place hands on floor to sides at desired distance from suspension trainer. Raise hips from floor supporting upper body with arms.
RectusAbdominis/STPullThrough.execution: Pull hips back while flexing spine in C shape. Raise hips up high by straightening spine and hips until straight.
RectusAbdominis/STPullThrough.comments: This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer. See

RectusAbdominis/STJackknifePike.name: Suspended Jack-knife Pike
RectusAbdominis/STJackknifePike.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Place right foot in left lower loop. Cross left leg over right leg placed in right lower loop. Turn body to right and place hands on floor, shoulder width apart. Turn body to kneel on hands and knees. Reposition hands (shoulder width or slightly wider) at desired distance from suspension trainer so that body is square with suspension trainer straps. With arm straight, raise knees from ground so body is supported by arms and suspension trainer.
RectusAbdominis/STJackknifePike.execution: Pull knees toward shoulders while raising hips very high. Lower hips by extending body to original straight position, while keeping shins close to horizontal. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/STRollout.name: Suspended Kneeling Rollout
RectusAbdominis/STRollout.preparation: Kneel on floor or mat and grasp suspension trainer handles. Position body upright with subtle bend through hip. Also, straighten arms in front of body with slight bend.
RectusAbdominis/STRollout.execution: Lean body forward while maintaining small bend in hip. Allow arms to bend forward to sides of head. Bend over as far as possible. Raise body back up by pulling arms back until kneeling upright in original position. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/STRollout.comments: Try to keep elbows nearly straight throughout exercise. Target muscle, Rectus Abdominis practically contracts

RectusAbdominis/STStandingRollout.name: Suspended Standing Rollout
RectusAbdominis/STStandingRollout.preparation: Stand facing suspension trainer handles. Bend over slightly at hips and grasp suspension handles with each hand. With handles together, extend arms with slight bend angled forward and downward.
RectusAbdominis/STStandingRollout.execution: Lean body forward while extending hips and allowing arms to extend forward to sides of head. Bend over as far as possible. Raise body back up by pulling arms back until standing while being bent over slightly at hips in original position. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/STStandingRollout.comments: Try to keep elbows nearly straight throughout exercise. Target muscle, Rectus Abdominis practically contracts

RectusAbdominis/WTVerticalLegHipRaiseBos.name: Weighted Vertical Leg-Hip Raise (Bosu support)
RectusAbdominis/WTVerticalLegHipRaiseBos.preparation: Place weight between ankles. Position forearms on padded parallel bars with hands on handles and back on convexed surface.
RectusAbdominis/WTVerticalLegHipRaiseBos.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees. As hips approach full flexion, lean back. Continue to raise knees toward shoulders by flexing waist and raising hips and low back from convexed surface. Return until waist, hips, and knees are extended. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/WtBallCrunch.name: Weighted Crunch (on stability ball)
RectusAbdominis/WtBallCrunch.preparation: Sit on exercise ball. Walk forward on ball and lie back on ball with shoulders and head hanging off and knees and hips bent. Gently hyperextend back to contour of ball. Hold plate behind neck or on chest with both hands or use no weight.
RectusAbdominis/WtBallCrunch.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso. Return to original position. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/WtBallCrunch.comments: Certain individuals may need to keep their neck in neutral position with space between their chin and sternum. Exercise can be performed without added weight until more resistance is needed. Movement can be made easier by positioning hips low on ball. In contrast, exercise can be made more challenging by using positioning ball lower on back and hips higher. Some individuals may experience low back discomfort if hips are not bent so they must use smaller

RectusAbdominis/WtCrunch.name: Weighted Crunch
RectusAbdominis/WtCrunch.preparation: Lie supine on bench with head hanging off and knees and hips bent. Hold plate behind neck.
RectusAbdominis/WtCrunch.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso from bench. Keep low back on bench and raise torso up as high as possible. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline board. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/WtCrunchX.name: Weighted Crunch (plate on chest)
RectusAbdominis/WtCrunchX.preparation: Lie supine on mat with lower legs on bench. Hold plate on chest with both hands.
RectusAbdominis/WtCrunchX.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso from mat. Keep low back on mat and raise torso up as high as possible. Return until back of shoulders contact mat. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/WtHangingLegHipRaise.name: Weighted Hanging Leg-Hip Raise
RectusAbdominis/WtHangingLegHipRaise.preparation: Place weight between ankles or use no weight. Grasp and hang from high bar.
RectusAbdominis/WtHangingLegHipRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are fully flexed. Continue to raise knees toward shoulders by flexing waist. Return until waist, hips, and knees are extended. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/WtHangingLegHipRaise.comments: Exercise can be performed without added weight until more resistance is needed. Also see

RectusAbdominis/WtInclineCrunchX.name: Weighted Incline Crunch (arms crossed)
RectusAbdominis/WtInclineCrunchX.preparation: Hook feet under foot brace and lie supine on incline board with hips bent. Hold plate on chest with both hands or use no weight.
RectusAbdominis/WtInclineCrunchX.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso from bench. Keep low back on bench and raise torso up as high as possible. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline board. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/WtInclineCrunch.name: Weighted Incline Crunch
RectusAbdominis/WtInclineCrunch.preparation: Hook feet under support and lie supine on incline bench with hips bent. Hold plate behind neck or clasp hands behind neck with no weight.
RectusAbdominis/WtInclineCrunch.execution: Flex waist to raise upper torso from bench. Keep low back on bench and raise torso up as high as possible. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline board. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/WtInclineLegHipRaise.name: Weighted Incline Leg-Hip Raise
RectusAbdominis/WtInclineLegHipRaise.preparation: Sit on incline board. Place weight between ankles or use no weight. Lie supine on incline board with torso elevated. Grasp feet hooks or sides of board by head for support.
RectusAbdominis/WtInclineLegHipRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips while flexing knees until hips are fully flexed. Continue to raise knees toward shoulders by flexing waist, raising hips from board. Return until waist, hips and knees are extended. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/WtInclineLegHipRaise.comments: Exercise can be performed without added weight until more resistance is needed. Elevate incline to increase resistance. When raising hips, keep knees fully flexed, so as not to throw weight of lower legs over head.

RectusAbdominis/WtInclineSitUp.name: Weighted Incline Sit-up
RectusAbdominis/WtInclineSitUp.execution: Hook feet under support and lie supine on incline bench with hips bent. Hold plate behind neck or clasp hands behind neck with no weight.
RectusAbdominis/WtInclineSitUp.comments: Raise torso from bench by bending waist and hips. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline board. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/WtJackKnifeSitUp.name: Jack-knife Sit-up
RectusAbdominis/WtJackKnifeSitUp.preparation: Sit on floor or mat. Lie supine with hands to sides.
RectusAbdominis/WtJackKnifeSitUp.execution: Simultaneously raise knees and torso until hips and knees are flexed. Return to starting position with waist, hips and knees extended. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/WtJackKnifeSitUp.comments: Begin each repetition with upper back on floor to allow abdominal muscles to work dynamically. The Rectus Abdominis and Obliques

RectusAbdominis/WtInclineSitUpX.name: Weighted Incline Sit-up (arms crossed)
RectusAbdominis/WtInclineSitUpX.preparation: Hook feet under foot brace and lie supine on incline board with hips bent. Hold plate on chest with both hands or use no weight.
RectusAbdominis/WtInclineSitUpX.execution: Raise torso from bench by bending waist and hips. Return until back of shoulders contact padded incline board. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/WtLegHipRaise.name: Weighted Lying Leg-Hip Raise
RectusAbdominis/WtLegHipRaise.execution: Place weight between ankles or use no weight. Lie supine on bench or floor. Grasp sides of bench for support.

RectusAbdominis/WtOverheadBallCrunch.name: Weighted Overhead Crunch (on stability ball)
RectusAbdominis/WtOverheadBallCrunch.preparation: Sit on exercise ball with medicine ball in hands. Walk forward on ball and lie back on ball with shoulders and head hanging off and knees and hips bent. Gently hyperextend back to contour of ball. Position medicine ball over upper chest with arms extended.
RectusAbdominis/WtOverheadBallCrunch.execution: Keeping arms extended and medicine ball over upper chest, flex waist to raise upper torso. Return to original position. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/WtOverheadBallCrunch.comments: If ball is positioned lower than upper chest (eg: over waist), effective resistance dramatically diminishes. See how

RectusAbdominis/WtSitUp.name: Weighted Sit-up
RectusAbdominis/WtSitUp.preparation: Hook feet under support and lie supine on floor or mat with hips bent. Hold plate behind neck.
RectusAbdominis/WtSitUp.execution: Raise torso from floor by bending waist and hips. Return until back of shoulders contact with floor or mat. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/WtSitUp.comments: instead of foot bar. Exercise can be performed

RectusAbdominis/WtSitUpX.name: Weighted Sit-up (arms crossed)
RectusAbdominis/WtSitUpX.preparation: Hook feet under support and lie supine on floor or mat with hips and knees bent. With both hands, hold plate on chest with forearms crossed or use no weight.
RectusAbdominis/WtSitUpX.execution: Raise torso from floor by bending waist and hips. Return until back of shoulders contact with floor or mat. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/WtSitUpX.comments: If feet are close to hips, bent arms can be lifted above knees, allowing for complete range of motion resulting in a more

RectusAbdominis/WtVUp.name: Weighted V-up
RectusAbdominis/WtVUp.preparation: Sit on floor or mat. Place dumbbell between feet. Lie supine with hands on floor over head.
RectusAbdominis/WtVUp.execution: While keeping feet together, simultaneously raise straight legs and torso. Reach toward raised feet. Return to starting position. Repeat.
RectusAbdominis/WtVUp.comments: Weight can also be held with hands and feet at same time. Keep knees straight throughout movement. Begin each repetition with upper back on floor to allow abdominal muscles to work dynamically. The Rectus Abdominis and Obliques

RectusAbdominis/WtVerticalLegHipRaise.name: Weighted Vertical Leg-Hip Raise
RectusAbdominis/WtVerticalLegHipRaise.execution: Place weight between ankles or use no weight. Position forearms on padded parallel bars with hands on handles and back on vertical pad.

RectusAbdominis/WtVerticalLegHipRaisePB.name: Weighted Vertical Leg-Hip Raise (on parallel bars)
RectusAbdominis/WtVerticalLegHipRaisePB.preparation: Place weight between ankles. Stand between parallel bars and grip bar on each side with overhand grip. Lift body off floor and balance body upright with arms straight.
RectusAbdominis/WtVerticalLegHipRaisePB.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are fully flexed. Continue to raise knees toward shoulders by flexing waist. Return until waist, hips, and knees are extended. Repeat.

SerratusAnterior/BBInclineShoulderRaise.name: Barbell Incline Shoulder Raise
SerratusAnterior/BBInclineShoulderRaise.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench. Dismount barbell from rack with shoulder width overhand grip. Position barbell over upper chest with elbows extended.
SerratusAnterior/BBInclineShoulderRaise.execution: Raise shoulders toward bar as high as possible. Lower shoulders to bench and repeat.
SerratusAnterior/BBInclineShoulderRaise.comments: Keep arms straight throughout execution. For convenience, exercise can be performed immediately after warm up on

SerratusAnterior/BWPushUpPlus.name: Push-up Plus
SerratusAnterior/BWPushUpPlus.preparation: Lie prone on floor with hands slightly wider than shoulder width. Raise body up off floor by extending arms with body straight.
SerratusAnterior/BWPushUpPlus.execution: Keeping body straight, lower body to floor by bending arms. Push body up until arms are extended. Continue lifting body further up by pushing shoulders infront of chest. Repeat.
SerratusAnterior/BWPushUpPlus.comments: Both upper and lower body must be kept straight throughout movement. See similar

SerratusAnterior/CBInclineShoulderRaise.name: Cable Incline Shoulder Raise
SerratusAnterior/CBInclineShoulderRaise.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp stirrups to each side. Push stirrups out at 30º to 45º until arms are straight and parallel to one another.
SerratusAnterior/CBInclineShoulderRaise.execution: Raise shoulders toward stirrups as high as possible. Lower shoulders down and back and repeat.
SerratusAnterior/CBInclineShoulderRaise.comments: Keep arms straight throughout execution. For convenience, exercise can be performed immediately after warm up on

SerratusAnterior/CBOneArmInclinePush.name: Cable One Arm Incline Push
SerratusAnterior/CBOneArmInclinePush.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp stirrup with one hand. Position elbow out to side, slightly lower than shoulder height. Position hand down, slightly higher than shoulder height, slightly narrower than elbow width.
SerratusAnterior/CBOneArmInclinePush.execution: Push stirrup forward and up at 30º to 45º while rotating torso away allowing shoulder to be extended forward. Return stirrups to original position, until slight stretch, and repeat. Continue with opposite side.

SerratusAnterior/DBInclineShoulderRaise.name: Dumbbell Incline Shoulder Raise
SerratusAnterior/DBInclineShoulderRaise.preparation: Sit down on incline bench with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. Kick weights to shoulders and lean back. Position dumbbells above shoulders with elbows extended.
SerratusAnterior/DBInclineShoulderRaise.execution: Raise shoulders toward dumbbells as high as possible. Lower shoulders to bench and repeat.
SerratusAnterior/DBInclineShoulderRaise.comments: Keep arms straight throughout execution. For convenience, exercise can be performed immediately after warm up on

SerratusAnterior/LVInclineShoulderRaise.name: Lever Incline Shoulder Raise
SerratusAnterior/LVInclineShoulderRaise.preparation: Sit on lever chest press machine with shoulders aligned with lever grips. Grasp lever grips with shoulder width overhand grip. Push weight up so arms are straight.
SerratusAnterior/LVInclineShoulderRaise.execution: Raise shoulders toward lever grips as far as possible. Lower shoulders to bench and repeat.
SerratusAnterior/LVInclineShoulderRaise.comments: Keep arms straight throughout execution. For convenience, exercise can be performed immediately after warm up on

SerratusAnterior/LVInclineShoulderRaiseP.name: Lever Incline Shoulder Raise (plate loaded)
SerratusAnterior/LVInclineShoulderRaiseP.preparation: Sit on lever chest press machine with shoulders aligned with lever grips. Grasp lever grips with shoulder width overhand grip. Push weight up so arms are straight.
SerratusAnterior/LVInclineShoulderRaiseP.execution: Raise shoulders toward lever grips as far as possible. Lower shoulders to bench and repeat.
SerratusAnterior/LVInclineShoulderRaiseP.comments: Keep arms straight throughout execution. For convenience, exercise can be performed immediately after warm up on

SerratusAnterior/SMInclineShoulderRaise.name: Smith Incline Shoulder Raise
SerratusAnterior/SMInclineShoulderRaise.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench with shoulders under bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width overhand grip. Extend elbows. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SerratusAnterior/SMInclineShoulderRaise.execution: Raise shoulders toward bar as high as possible. Lower shoulders to bench and repeat.
SerratusAnterior/SMInclineShoulderRaise.comments: Keep arms straight throughout execution. For convenience, exercise can be performed immediately after warm up on

Soleus/LVSeatedCalfExtension.name: Lever Seated Calf Extension
Soleus/LVSeatedCalfExtension.preparation: With leg pads in upper position, sit on seat and place feet on lever platform with legs under pads. Lower leg pads on legs so they are snuggly adjusted just behind knees. Place hands on top of thigh pads.
Soleus/LVSeatedCalfExtension.execution: Push lever platform down by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Soleus/LVSeatedCalfExtension.comments: This machine design is very rare in comparison to

Soleus/LVBentKneeSeatedCalfExtension.name: Lever Bent Knee Calf Extension
Soleus/LVBentKneeSeatedCalfExtension.preparation: With seat close to lever platform or foot pedals, sit on seat. Position forefeet on lever platform or foot pedals. Grasp handles to sides. Push feet into lever platform or foot pedals to prevent knees from coming back during lift.
Soleus/LVBentKneeSeatedCalfExtension.execution: Push lever by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Soleus/LVBentKneeSeatedCalfExtension.comments: Movement is predominately Soleus. Gastrocnemius are in

Soleus/LVSeatedCalfRaise.name: Lever Seated Calf Raise
Soleus/LVSeatedCalfRaise.preparation: Sit on seat facing lever. Reach forward and pull hand lever toward body. Place forefeet on platform with heels extending off. Position lower thighs under lever pads. Release hand lever by pushing away from body. Place hands on top of thigh pads.
Soleus/LVSeatedCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
Soleus/LVSeatedCalfRaise.comments: Movement is predominately Soleus. Gastrocnemius are in

Soleus/LVAltBentKneeSeatedCalfExt.name: Lever Alternating Bent-knee Seated Calf Extension
Soleus/LVAltBentKneeSeatedCalfExt.preparation: Sit on seat and position forefeet on pedals. Grasp handles to sides and extend knees but maintain small bend in knees.
Soleus/LVAltBentKneeSeatedCalfExt.execution: Push left pedal by extending ankle knee Simultaneously allow right pedal to return back by relaxing ankle and bending knee more. Reverse motion by pushing right pedal and allowing left pedal to return back by same means. Continue to alternate motion.
Soleus/LVAltBentKneeSeatedCalfExt.comments: Position seat to allow full range of motion. Gastrocnemius act as dynamic stabilizers because when they 'contract' at ankle they are simultaneously 'stretched' at knee. It could be argued they also act as synergist since bend at knee could be considered relatively smaller range of motion as compared to ankle articulation resulting in net contraction of Gastrocnemius. See

Soleus/LVSeatedCalfRaiseH.name: Lever Seated Calf Raise (plate loaded)
Soleus/LVSeatedCalfRaiseH.preparation: Sit on seat facing lever. Place forefeet on platform with heels extending off. Position lower thighs under lever pads. Grasp handles if available or place hands on lever pad. Lift lever slightly by pushing heels up. Release support lever.
Soleus/LVSeatedCalfRaiseH.execution: Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Repeat.
Soleus/LVSeatedCalfRaiseH.comments: Movement is predominately Soleus. Gastrocnemius are in

Soleus/SBSeatedCalfRaise.name: Safety Bar Seated Calf Raise
Soleus/SBSeatedCalfRaise.preparation: Place safety bar on rack approximately lower leg height with calf block slightly rear of safety bar. Sit on bench facing safety bar and place toes on lower portion of platform with heels extending off. Scoot forward to edge of bench and position lower thighs under safety bar. Grasp bar to sides and lift bar from rack by pushing heels up. Slide back to center of bench.
Soleus/SBSeatedCalfRaise.execution: Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Repeat.
Soleus/SBSeatedCalfRaise.comments: Slide forward to edge of bench and rack safety bar when finished. See suggested

Soleus/SMSeatedCalfRaise.name: Smith Seated Calf Raise
Soleus/SMSeatedCalfRaise.preparation: Position bar slightly higher than lower leg height. Wrap bar pad around center of bar. Place calf block under bar and bench near bar. Sit on bench facing bar and place toes on lower portion of platform with heels extending off. Grasp bar to sides and extend ankles to raise knees so lower thighs are under padded bar. Push heels further up. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Soleus/SMSeatedCalfRaise.execution: Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Repeat.
Soleus/SMSeatedCalfRaise.comments: Safety stops can be used to support bar at lowest position, particularly if it is difficult to rack bar to original height. If possible, adjust height of bench or calf block so thigh is close to horizontal. Movement is predominately Soleus. Gastrocnemius are in

Splenius/BRNeckRetraction.name: Band Resistive Neck Retraction
Splenius/BRNeckRetraction.preparation: Stand with back of neck against exercise band strapped accross rack. Position both arms behind bands to each side. Hold horizontal bar above if within reach.
Splenius/BRNeckRetraction.execution: Push back of neck into band by retracting head. Returning head to neutral postion and repeat.
Splenius/BRNeckRetraction.comments: This exercise may be prescribed for

Splenius/BWRearNeckBridge.name: Rear Neck Bridge
Splenius/BWRearNeckBridge.preparation: Lying supine on well cushioned mat. Position feet very close to hips. Raise buttocks and low back slightly off of floor and fold hands on abdomen.
Splenius/BWRearNeckBridge.execution: Extend hips and knees while pushing head back into floor. Roll back on head while arching spine high off of floor. Hyperextend neck back in attempt to bring forehead toward mat. Return body to close to mat until back of head and shoulders make contact with mat. Repeat.
Splenius/BWRearNeckBridge.comments: Also known as wrestler's bridge. See

Splenius/BWWallRearNeckBridge.name: Wall Rear Neck Bridge
Splenius/BWWallRearNeckBridge.preparation: Hold small or folded cushioned mat behind head. Facing away from wall or column position head and back of shoulders low on wall or column with mat between. Stand with feet far away from wall or column so body is angled back. Position hips and back straight and bend knees just slightly. Place arms to side or hold hands on abdomen.
Splenius/BWWallRearNeckBridge.execution: Push head back into mat and roll head upward. Arch spine and straighten knees. Hyperextend neck so head is facing up. Return to original position by rolling head down while allowing low back to straighten and knees to bend slightly. Continue down until back of head and shoulders make contact with mat. Repeat.

Splenius/CBNeckExt.name: Cable Neck Extension
Splenius/CBNeckExt.preparation: Sit on bench facing pulley. Place neck in harness cable attachment. Place forearms on lower thighs for support.
Splenius/CBNeckExt.execution: Move head away from pulley by hyperextending neck. Return by bending neck forward until chin touches upper chest. Repeat.

Splenius/CBNeckExtBelt.name: Cable Neck Extension (with belt)
Splenius/CBNeckExtBelt.preparation: Sit on bench facing low pulley. Attach belt on low pulley cable by attaching carabiner on belt buckle. Place head in belt loop. With belt above ears, clamp belt snugly around head by tightly gripping ends close to forehead. Place other hand or forearm on lower thighs for support.
Splenius/CBNeckExtBelt.execution: Pull head up and back by hyperextending neck. Return by bending neck forward until chin touches upper chest. Repeat.
Splenius/CBNeckExtBelt.comments: Use neck to pull belt rather than allowing hand to assist. Keep clinched grip on belt against forehead throughout movement. Woven cotton or cloth belts tend to slip less, particularly on bald head. If belt slips from head, place small towel between belt and head.

Splenius/LVNeckExt.name: Lever Neck Extension
Splenius/LVNeckExt.execution: Sit on seat in machine. Place back of head under padded lever. Position body so neck is in line with lever axis. Grasp handles for support.

Splenius/LVNeckExtentionH.name: Lever Neck Extension (plate loaded)
Splenius/LVNeckExtentionH.preparation: Sit on seat in machine. Place back of head under padded lever. Position body so neck is in line with lever axis. Grasp handles for support.
Splenius/LVNeckExtentionH.execution: Move head back by hyperextending neck. Return by bending neck forward until chin touches upper chest. Repeat.

Splenius/STNeckExtension.name: Suspended Neck Extension
Splenius/STNeckExtension.preparation: Place belt or strap around end of suspension trainer. Place belt around head above ears and clamp belt snugly around head by tightly gripping ends close to forehead. Step back facing direction of suspension trainer until it is taut. Lean back at angle against support of belt and suspension trainer by stepping forward slightly while keeping head and body straight.
Splenius/STNeckExtension.execution: Lower angle of body by bowing head until chin is near upper chest. Increase angle of body by raising head. Repeat.
Splenius/STNeckExtension.comments: This exercise can be performed with belt looped on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings. Throughout movement, keep body straight and maintain tight grip on belt against forehead. Use neck to pull belt rather than allowing hand to assist.

Splenius/WtLyingNeckExtension.name: Weighted Lying Neck Extension
Splenius/WtLyingNeckExtension.preparation: Lie prone on bench with head extended off of end and folded towel and weight plate(s) on floor. With both hands, place plate(s) on back of head with towel placed in between for comfort.
Splenius/WtLyingNeckExtension.execution: Move head up by hyperextending neck up as high as possible. Return by bending neck down until chin touches upper chest. Repeat.
Splenius/WtLyingNeckExtension.comments: Balance weight on back of head with both hands throughout movement. Weight plate(s) can be tilted slightly to   higher point on head to keep resistance slightly more consistent throughout movement. Tilt weight forward slightly at top and back slightly at bottom. Also see same movement with

Splenius/WtNeckExt.name: Weighted Seated Neck Extension
Splenius/WtNeckExt.preparation: Place folded towel on weight plate. On bench or stool, sit bent over on thighs. With both hands, place plate(s) on back of head with towel placed in between for comfort.
Splenius/WtNeckExt.execution: Move head up by hyperextending neck up as high as possible. Return by bending neck down until chin touches upper chest. Repeat.
Splenius/WtNeckExt.comments: Balance weight on back of head with both hands throughout movement. Weight plate(s) can be tilted slightly to   higher point on head to keep resistance slightly more consistent throughout movement. Tilt weight forward slightly at top and back slightly at bottom.

Splenius/WtNeckExtension.name: Weighted Neck Extension
Splenius/WtNeckExtension.preparation: Kneel on side of bench with weight plates on end of bench. With both hands, hold weight plate(s) cushioned with towel. Position upper body prone and perpendicular on bench with head and arms extending off of side. With both hands, place weight plate(s) on back of head with towel placed in between for comfort.
Splenius/WtNeckExtension.execution: Move head up by hyperextending neck up as high as possible. Return by bending neck down until chin touches upper chest. Repeat.
Splenius/WtNeckExtension.comments: Balance weight on back of head with both hands throughout movement. Weight plate(s) can be tilted slightly to higher point on head to keep resistance slightly more consistent throughout movement. Tilt weight slightly forward at top and back slightly at bottom. Also same see movement with

Splenius/WtNeckHarnessExt.name: Weighted Neck Harness Extension
Splenius/WtNeckHarnessExt.preparation: Sit on bench with weighted neck harness on head. Allow weight to dangle in front by bending over.
Splenius/WtNeckHarnessExt.execution: Move head up by hyperextending neck. Return by bending neck down until chin touches upper chest. Repeat.
Splenius/WtNeckHarnessExt.comments: Exercise can also be performed by bending over with hands on bent knees.

Sternocleidomastoid/BWFrontNeckBridge.name: Front Neck Bridge
Sternocleidomastoid/BWFrontNeckBridge.preparation: Kneel on all fours on well cushioned mat. Place head on mat between hands. Rise and straighten knees. Fold hands behind low back or hips.
Sternocleidomastoid/BWFrontNeckBridge.execution: Roll back onto forehead until nose touches mat. Roll forward onto top of head until chin touches upper chest. Repeat.
Sternocleidomastoid/BWFrontNeckBridge.comments: Exercise involves neck flexors as well as neck extensors. See

Sternocleidomastoid/BWWallFrontNeckBridg.name: Wall Front Neck Bridge
Sternocleidomastoid/BWWallFrontNeckBridg.preparation: Place small or folded cushioned mat on wall or column approximately chest height. With hands supporting mat on each side, stand back so feet are away from wall or column with body leaning forward. Place top of forehead on mat. Fold hands behind low back or hips.
Sternocleidomastoid/BWWallFrontNeckBridg.execution: Roll down onto forehead until nose touches mat. Roll up onto top of head until chin touches upper chest. Repeat.
Sternocleidomastoid/BWWallFrontNeckBridg.comments: Keep body somewhat straight bending spine and hips slightly as head rolls down. Exercise involves neck flexors as well as neck extensors. See

Sternocleidomastoid/BWWallSideNeckBridge.name: Wall Side Neck Bridge
Sternocleidomastoid/BWWallSideNeckBridge.preparation: Place small or folded cushioned mat on column or at end of wall approximately shoulder height. With hands supporting mat, stand with side toward mat. Step far to side so feet are away from wall or column forward. Place side of head on mat with shoulder extending over end of adjacent side of column or wall so body leans to side. Fold hands behind low back or hips.
Sternocleidomastoid/BWWallSideNeckBridge.execution: Push side of head into mat and roll onto top of head moving body away from mat. Return to original position by rolling back down to side of head while bringing shoulder back over end of column or wall. Repeat.
Sternocleidomastoid/BWWallSideNeckBridge.comments: Keep body somewhat straight allowing waist to bend outward away from mat slightly at end of lift. See all muscle used in Lateral Flexion:

Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckFlx.name: Cable Neck Flexion
Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckFlx.preparation: Sit on bench facing away from middle pulley. Place neck in harness cable attachment. Place arms on lower thighs for support.
Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckFlx.execution: Move head away from pulley by bending neck forward until chin touches upper chest. Return head by hyperextending neck and repeat.

Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckFlxBelt.name: Cable Neck Flexion (with belt)
Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckFlxBelt.preparation: Attach belt on low pulley cable by attaching carabiner on belt buckle. Grasp attached belt, face away from pulley, and place head in belt loop. With belt above ears, clamp belt snugly around head by tightly gripping ends close to back of mid-head. With neck braced and assistance of arm, lunge forward to angle torso forward with feet staggered. Place hand on lower thigh for support.
Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckFlxBelt.execution: Pull head forward and down by flexing neck until chin touches upper chest. Return by hyperextending neck until head is angled upward. Repeat.
Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckFlxBelt.comments: Use neck to pull belt rather than allowing hand to assist. Keep clinched grip on belt against back of mid-head throughout movement. Clamping belt higher up further from base of skull will permit torque throughout fuller range of motion, particularly range of motion nearer full flexion.

Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckLtrFlxBelt.name: Cable Lateral Neck Flexion (with belt)
Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckLtrFlxBelt.preparation: Adjust pulley approximately height of neck or head when seated. Attach belt on low pulley cable by attaching carabiner on belt buckle. Sit on bench with pulley to one side and feet apart. Place head in belt loop. With belt above ears, clamp belt snugly around head by tightly gripping ends close to side of head. Pull torso upright by bracing opposite hand on far side of bench.
Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckLtrFlxBelt.execution: Pull head away from pulley cable by laterally flexing neck. Tilt head back toward cable pulley and repeat. Sit on bench the opposite direction and continue with other side.
Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckLtrFlxBelt.comments: Sit at distance away from pulley so weight does not bottom out at lowest range of motion. Keep clinched grip on belt against side of head throughout movement. Woven cotton or cloth belts tend to slip less, particularly on bald heads. If belt slips from head, place small towel between belt and head.

Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckRotationBelt.name: Cable Neck Rotation (with belt)
Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckRotationBelt.preparation: Place workout chair or bench with vertical back support facing to one side near adjustable height cable pulley. Adjust pulley approximately height of head when seated. Attach belt on low pulley cable by attaching carabiner on belt buckle. Sit on bench, grasp attached belt from side. Face toward cable pulley and place head in belt loop. With belt above ears, clamp belt snugly around head by tightly gripping ends close forehead. Position torso upright with feet wide apart and hand nearest cable pulley on lower thigh for added support.
Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckRotationBelt.execution: Turn head away from pulley cable by rotating head away from pulley. Turn head back toward cable pulley and repeat. Turn seat the opposite direction or attach belt to pulley on opposite side and continue with other side.
Sternocleidomastoid/CBNeckRotationBelt.comments: Sit at distance away from pulley so weight does not bottom out at lowest range of motion. Keep clinched grip on belt against side of head throughout movement. Use heads friction on belt to pull belt rather than pushing with the hand used to keep belt tight around head. Keep back against back pad to minimize torso movement, reducing rotation below cervical spine.

Sternocleidomastoid/LVLateralNeckFlexion.name: Lever Lateral Neck Flexion (plate loaded)
Sternocleidomastoid/LVLateralNeckFlexion.preparation: Sit on seat in machine with feet apart   . Position padded lever on side of head. Center body so neck is in line with lever axis. Grasp handles for support.
Sternocleidomastoid/LVLateralNeckFlexion.execution: Move head down to side by laterally flexing neck. Return head to opposite side and repeat. Sit in machine backwards and continue with opposite side.
Sternocleidomastoid/LVLateralNeckFlexion.comments: See all muscle used in Lateral Flexion:

Sternocleidomastoid/LVNeckFlexionH.name: Lever Neck Flexion (plate loaded)
Sternocleidomastoid/LVNeckFlexionH.preparation: Sit on seat in machine. Position padded lever on face. Position body so neck is in line with lever axis. Grasp handles for support.
Sternocleidomastoid/LVNeckFlexionH.execution: Move head forward by flexing neck until chin touches upper chest. Return head by hyperextending neck and repeat.

Sternocleidomastoid/LVNeckFlx.name: Lever Neck Flexion
Sternocleidomastoid/LVNeckFlx.preparation: Sit on seat in machine. Position padded lever on face. Position body so neck is in line with lever axis. Grasp handles for support.
Sternocleidomastoid/LVNeckFlx.execution: Move head forward by flexing neck until chin touches upper chest. Return head by hyperextending neck and repeat.

Sternocleidomastoid/LVNeckLtrFlx.name: Lever Lateral Neck Flexion
Sternocleidomastoid/LVNeckLtrFlx.execution: Sit on seat in machine with feet apart. Position side of head on padded lever. Center body so neck is in line with lever axis. Grasp handles for support.

Sternocleidomastoid/STNeckFlexion.name: Suspended Neck Flexion
Sternocleidomastoid/STNeckFlexion.preparation: Place belt or strap around end of suspension trainer. Face away from suspension trainer with belt in hand. Place belt around head above ears and clamp belt snugly around head by tightly gripping ends close to back of mid-head. Step forward until suspension trainer is taut. Lean forward at angle against support of belt and suspension trainer by stepping back slightly while keeping head and body straight.
Sternocleidomastoid/STNeckFlexion.execution: Increase angle of body by bowing head until chin touches upper chest. Lower angle of body by raising head. Repeat.
Sternocleidomastoid/STNeckFlexion.comments: This exercise can be performed with belt looped on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings. Throughout movement, keep body straight and maintain tight grip on belt against back of mid-head throughout movement. Use neck to pull belt rather than allowing hand to assist. Clamping belt higher up further from base of skull will permit torque throughout fuller range of motion, particularly range of motion nearer full flexion.

Sternocleidomastoid/WtLyingNeckFlexion.name: Weighted Lying Neck Flexion
Sternocleidomastoid/WtLyingNeckFlexion.preparation: Place folded towel on weight plate(s). Lie supine on bench, head extending off of end of bench. Place plates on forehead with towel placed in between for comfort.
Sternocleidomastoid/WtLyingNeckFlexion.execution: Move head up by flexing neck until chin touches upper chest. Return by hyperextending neck and repeat.
Sternocleidomastoid/WtLyingNeckFlexion.comments: Balance weight on back of head with both hands throughout movement. Weight plate(s) can be tilted slightly to higher point on head to keep resistance slightly more consistent throughout movement. Tilt weight forward slightly at bottom and back slightly at top. Also see

Sternocleidomastoid/STNeckLateralFlexion.name: Suspended Lateral Neck Flexion
Sternocleidomastoid/STNeckLateralFlexion.preparation: Place belt or strap around end of suspension trainer. Hold belt in hand and stand away from suspension trainer so it hangs to one side. Place belt around head above ears and clamp belt snugly around head by tightly gripping ends close to head above ear closest to suspension trainer. Step further away from suspension trainer until it is taut. Lean away at angle against support of belt and suspension trainer by positioning feet closer to side of suspension trainer while keeping head and body straight.
Sternocleidomastoid/STNeckLateralFlexion.execution: Lower angle of body by tilting head to side of suspension trainer. Increase angle of body by tilting head away from side of suspension trainer. Repeat and continue in opposite position.
Sternocleidomastoid/STNeckLateralFlexion.comments: This exercise can be performed with belt looped on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings. Throughout movement, keep body straight and maintain tight grip on belt against side of head throughout movement. Use neck to pull belt rather than allowing hand to assist.

Sternocleidomastoid/WtNeckFlx.name: Weighted Neck Flexion
Sternocleidomastoid/WtNeckFlx.preparation: Place folded towel on weight plate. Lie supine perpendicular on bench with low back and hips extending off and feet on floor. Place weight and towel on forehead. Place plates on forehead with towel placed in between for comfort.
Sternocleidomastoid/WtNeckFlx.execution: Move head up by flexing neck until chin touches upper chest. Return by hyperextending neck and repeat.
Sternocleidomastoid/WtNeckFlx.comments: Balance weight on back of head with both hands throughout movement.Weight plate(s) can be tilted slightly to higher point on head to keep resistance slightly more consistent throughout movement. Tilt wei   ght forward slightly at bottom and back slightly at top. Also see

Sternocleidomastoid/WtNeckLateralFlex.name: Weighted Lateral Neck Flexion
Sternocleidomastoid/WtNeckLateralFlex.preparation: Place folded towel on weight plate. Lie on bench on side with knees and hips bent and arm hanging over edge. Position weight and towel on side of upper head. Hold weight on side of head with hand of upper arm. Place hand of lower arm on floor for support.
Sternocleidomastoid/WtNeckLateralFlex.execution: Move head up to side by laterally flexing neck. Lower head to opposite side and repeat. Lie on other side and continue.
Sternocleidomastoid/WtNeckLateralFlex.comments: See all muscle used in Lateral Flexion:

Subscapularis/CBInternalRotation.name: Cable Seated Shoulder Internal Rotation
Subscapularis/CBInternalRotation.preparation: Sit with side to low pulley. Grasp cable stirrup with near arm. Position elbow against side with elbow bent approximately 90°.
Subscapularis/CBInternalRotation.execution: Pull cable stirrup toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Subscapularis/CBInternalRotation.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position throughout exercise. Exercise may be performed

Subscapularis/CBStandingInternalRotation.name: Cable Standing Shoulder Internal Rotation
Subscapularis/CBStandingInternalRotation.preparation: Stand with side to elbow height cable pulley. Grasp cable stirrup with near arm. Position elbow against side with elbow bent approximately 90°.
Subscapularis/CBStandingInternalRotation.execution: Pull cable stirrup toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Subscapularis/CBStandingInternalRotation.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position throughout exercise. Exercise may be performed

Subscapularis/DBInternalRotation.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Internal Rotation (on bench)
Subscapularis/DBInternalRotation.preparation: Hold dumbbell in one hand. Lie on bench close to edge on side with dumbbell in hand. Position elbow on edge of bench against side of body with elbow bent approximately 90°. Position legs on bench for support.
Subscapularis/DBInternalRotation.execution: Maintaining 90° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell away from body until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is across belly. Continue with opposite arm.
Subscapularis/DBInternalRotation.comments: Maintain elbow's bend and position at edge of bench against side of body throughout exercise. Elbow can be held with opposite hand for additional support.

Subscapularis/DBInternalRotationFloor.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Internal Rotation (on floor)
Subscapularis/DBInternalRotationFloor.preparation: Hold dumbbell in one hand. Lie on mat with dumbbell in hand. Position upper arm on mat close to body. Bend elbow approximately 90° with dumbbell held upright above elbow.
Subscapularis/DBInternalRotationFloor.execution: Maintaining 90° bend in elbow, lower dumbbell toward floor until slight stretch is felt in shoulder. Lift dumbbell toward body by internally rotating shoulder until forearm is vertical and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Subscapularis/DBInternalRotationFloor.comments: Torso can lean back slightly allowing for fuller range of motion at the bottom of movement. In which case, forearm does not need to travel any closer than vertical toward body. Elbow can be held with opposite hand for additional support.

Subscapularis/LVInternalRotation.name: Lever Shoulder Internal Rotation
Subscapularis/LVInternalRotation.preparation: Place elbow on forearm pad and grasp handle with upper arm to side of body and forearm away from body.
Subscapularis/LVInternalRotation.execution: Pull lever toward from body. Return and repeat. Adjust lever to opposite side and repeat with other arm.
Subscapularis/LVInternalRotation.comments: Adjust lever and body orientation to achieve full range of motion.

Subscapularis/LVShoulderInternalRotation.name: Lever Shoulder Internal Rotation (plate loaded)
Subscapularis/LVShoulderInternalRotation.preparation: Lie supine on section of bench furthest away from pads to each side. Position body so shoulders and elbows are aligned to fulcrum on each side. Place wrists or hands on under lower set of pads to each side of head.
Subscapularis/LVShoulderInternalRotation.execution: Pull lever arms upward and toward each side of torso as far as possible by simultaneously rotating upper arms. Lower lever arms to original position and repeat.
Subscapularis/LVShoulderInternalRotation.comments: Those with shorter forearms whose wrists do not make contact with pad would utilize

Subscapularis/LVUprightInternalRotation.name: Lever Upright Shoulder Internal Rotation
Subscapularis/LVUprightInternalRotation.preparation: Primary lever should be positioned back with lever handle resting forward on elbow pad. Lift lever handle and sit on seat with arm pads and lever to side. Place elbow in elbow pads at shoulder height and grip handle with over hand grip so forearm is orientated upward and back. With opposite hand, grasp seat handle if available, for added stability.
Subscapularis/LVUprightInternalRotation.execution: Pull lever handle forward and downward as far as possible by rotating upper arm. Allow lever to return to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

Supinators/DBLyingSupinationDown.name: Dumbbell Lying Supination (arm down)
Supinators/DBLyingSupinationDown.preparation: Grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell with pinkie finger next to weight side. Lie on bench on side with weight and position arm with "half dumbbell" on bench. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and tuck bent elbow under body. Position thumb up (pronated).
Supinators/DBLyingSupinationDown.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns downward (supinated). Return and repeat.
Supinators/DBLyingSupinationDown.comments: Bench can be flat or slightly incline (0-30 degrees) so resistance occurs during final range of motion. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with thumb against inside surface. Also see conventional

Supinators/DBLyingSupinationUp.name: Dumbbell Lying Supination
Supinators/DBLyingSupinationUp.preparation: Lie on bench or mat. With hand of upper arm, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; thumb next to side with weight. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place forearm on hip, or side of waist. Position thumb downward (pronated).
Supinators/DBLyingSupinationUp.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns upward (supination). Return and repeat.
Supinators/DBLyingSupinationUp.comments: Pad or firm pillow may be placed between hip and arm. Elevation of elbow allows resistance during final range of motion. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with pinkie against inside surface. Also see

Supinators/DBSeatedSupination.name: Dumbbell Seated Supination
Supinators/DBSeatedSupination.preparation: Sit next to elevated surface, approximately arm pit height. With hand of arm next to elevated surface, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; thumb next to side with weight. Bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place upperarm on elevated surface. Position thumb downward (pronated).
Supinators/DBSeatedSupination.execution: Rotate dumbbell so thumb turns upward (supination). Return and repeat.
Supinators/DBSeatedSupination.comments: If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with pinkie against inside surface.

Supinators/LVSeatedSupination.name: Lever Seated Forearm Supination
Supinators/LVSeatedSupination.preparation: Sit on seat. Grasp rotating handles with overhand grip on each side and place forearms on pads.
Supinators/LVSeatedSupination.execution: Rotate shafts by turning palm upward. Return and repeat.
Supinators/LVSeatedSupination.comments: Depending on participant's range of motion and machine's design, handles may need to be prerotated so resistance is present throughout movement, particularly initial phase of rotation. See

Supinators/LVSupination.name: Lever Standing Forearm Supination
Supinators/LVSupination.preparation: Grasp open handle at end of shaft with overhand grip.
Supinators/LVSupination.execution: Rotate shaft by turning palm upward. Return and repeat.
Supinators/LVSupination.comments: Depending on participant's range of motion and machine's design, handle may need to be prerotated so resistance is present throughout movement, particularly initial phase of rotation.

Supinators/LVSupinationPronation.name: Lever Forearm Supination/Pronation
Supinators/LVSupinationPronation.preparation: Grasp open handles with both hands
Supinators/LVSupinationPronation.execution: Rotate shaft by turning palm upward. Rotate shaft by turning palms downward. Repeat.

Supraspinatus/CBSeatedFrontLateralRaise.name: Cable Seated Front Lateral Raise
Supraspinatus/CBSeatedFrontLateralRaise.preparation: Sit on seat above twin cable pulleys. Grasp stirrups on each side. Sit upright with arms nearly straight down to each side. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows point out to sides.
Supraspinatus/CBSeatedFrontLateralRaise.execution: With elbows straight or slightly bent, raise upper arm away from low pulley to side, slightly to front (30° to 45°) until upper arm is shoulder height or slightly higher. Lower and repeat.
Supraspinatus/CBSeatedFrontLateralRaise.comments: Maintain straight or nearly straight elbow position with elbows pointing outward throughout exercise.

Supraspinatus/CBFullCanLateralRaise.name: Cable Full Can Lateral Raise
Supraspinatus/CBFullCanLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp stirrup cable attachment and stand facing with side of resting arm toward low pulley. Grasp ballet bar if available.  Position palm of hand holding cable attachment facing forward.
Supraspinatus/CBFullCanLateralRaise.execution: With thumb side up, raise arm to side until elbow rises just above shoulder. Lower down to side and repeat. Perform with other arm in opposite position.
Supraspinatus/CBFullCanLateralRaise.comments: Maintain straight elbow position throughout exercise. Exercise may also be performed with shoulder traveling up to 30º forward, more inline with plane of scapula.

Supraspinatus/CBFrontLateralRaise.name: Cable Front Lateral Raise
Supraspinatus/CBFrontLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbell cable attachment. Stand facing side with resting arm toward low pulley. Grasp ballet bar if available for support. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows point out to sides.
Supraspinatus/CBFrontLateralRaise.execution: With elbow straight or slightly bent, raise upper arm away from low pulley to side, slightly to front (30°) until upper arm is shoulder height. Lower and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Supraspinatus/CBFrontLateralRaise.comments: Maintain straight or nearly straight elbow position with elbows pointing outward throughout exercise. If low pulley is fixed, turn slightly away from low pulley.

Supraspinatus/DBFrontLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Front Lateral Raise
Supraspinatus/DBFrontLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbell and position in front of thigh with arm straight. Turn pinkie finger side outward.
Supraspinatus/DBFrontLateralRaise.execution: Raise arms to side, slightly to front until shoulder height or slightly higher. Lower and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Supraspinatus/DBFrontLateralRaise.comments: Raise toward 10 o'clock with left arm and toward 2 o'clock with right arm. Maintain straight elbow position with elbow pointing outward throughout exercise.

Supraspinatus/DBFullCanLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Full Can Lateral Raise
Supraspinatus/DBFullCanLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbells with each hand with palms facing forward.
Supraspinatus/DBFullCanLateralRaise.execution: Raise arms to side with thumb side up. Lower and repeat.
Supraspinatus/DBFullCanLateralRaise.comments: Maintain straight elbow position throughout exercise. Exercise may also be performed with shoulders traveling up to 30º forward, more inline with plane of scapulas.

Supraspinatus/DBFrontLateralRaiseSeated.name: Dumbbell Seated Front Lateral Raise
Supraspinatus/DBFrontLateralRaiseSeated.preparation: Sit on stool or end of bench with dumbbell. Position dumbbell down to side with arm straight. Turn pinkie finger side outward.
Supraspinatus/DBFrontLateralRaiseSeated.execution: Raise arms to side, slightly in front until shoulder height or slightly higher. Lower and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Supraspinatus/DBFrontLateralRaiseSeated.comments: Raise toward 10 o'clock with left arm and toward 2 o'clock with right arm. Maintain straight elbow position with elbow pointing outward throughout exercise.

TibialisAnterior/BBReverseCalfRaise.name: Barbell Reverse Calf Raise
TibialisAnterior/BBReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Place barbell on power rack upper chest height and calf block under barbell. Position back of shoulders under barbell with both hands to sides. Position heels on forward edge of calf block. Lean barbell against rack and raise from supports by extending knees and hips. Support barbell against verticals with both hands to sides.
TibialisAnterior/BBReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/BBReverseCalfRaise.comments: Throughout exercise, keep knees and hips straight and support barbell against verticals with both hands to sides. The exercise can be made more difficult by positionin   g heels closer to edge of platform. Notice barbell makes contact with only non-painted surface (plastic or metal surface). See

TibialisAnterior/BWReverseCalfRaise.name: Reverse Calf Raise
TibialisAnterior/BWReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Position heels on forward edge of calf block or platform. Grasp support with other hand for balance.
TibialisAnterior/BWReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/BWReverseCalfRaise.comments: Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. See

TibialisAnterior/BWSingleLegRevCalfRaise.name: Single Leg Reverse Calf Raise
TibialisAnterior/BWSingleLegRevCalfRaise.preparation: Position one heel on forward edge of platform. Grasp support with other hand for balance. Lift other leg to rear by bending knee.
TibialisAnterior/BWSingleLegRevCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending foot until toes are pointed downward. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
TibialisAnterior/BWSingleLegRevCalfRaise.comments: Keep knee and hip straight throughout exercise. Exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform. See

TibialisAnterior/CBReverseCalfRaise.name: Cable Reverse Calf Raise
TibialisAnterior/CBReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Place cable belt or dip belt around waist. Kneel before low pulley and attach it to cable. Stand and position heels on forward edge of platform. Grasp support bar for balance.
TibialisAnterior/CBReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefeet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/CBReverseCalfRaise.comments: A short chain may be used to add length to cable so belt can be more easily attached to cable as long as it is short enough to allow full range of motion. Calf block or exercise step that will not overturn can be used as platform. Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. The exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform. See

TibialisAnterior/CBSingleLegReverseCalfR.name: Cable Single Leg Reverse Calf Raise
TibialisAnterior/CBSingleLegReverseCalfR.preparation: Place cable belt or dip belt around waist. Kneel before low pulley and attach it to cable. Stand and position heel on forward edge of platform. Raise other leg off block. Grasp support bar for balance.
TibialisAnterior/CBSingleLegReverseCalfR.execution: Pull forefoot up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/CBSingleLegReverseCalfR.comments: A short chain may be used to add length to cable so belt can be more easily attached to cable as long as it is short enough to allow full range of motion. Calf block or exercise step that will not overturn can be used as platform. Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. The exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform. See

TibialisAnterior/DBReverseCalfRaise.name: Dumbbell Reverse Calf Raise
TibialisAnterior/DBReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbell in one hand to side. Position heels on forward edge of platform. Grasp support with other hand for balance.
TibialisAnterior/DBReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/DBReverseCalfRaise.comments: Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. The exercise can be made more difficult by using only

TibialisAnterior/DBSingleLegRevCalfRaise.name: Dumbbell Single Leg Reverse Calf Raise
TibialisAnterior/DBSingleLegRevCalfRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbell in one hand to side. Position one heel on forward edge of platform. Grasp support with other hand for balance. Lift other leg to rear by bending knee.
TibialisAnterior/DBSingleLegRevCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending foot until toes are pointed downward. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
TibialisAnterior/DBSingleLegRevCalfRaise.comments: Keep knee and hip straight throughout exercise. Exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform. If you need to assist with hands used for support, use lighter load (or

TibialisAnterior/LV45ReverseCalfPress.name: Lever 45° Reverse Calf Press (plate loaded)
TibialisAnterior/LV45ReverseCalfPress.preparation: Sit on seat with back on padded support. Place feet very high on platform, grasp handles to sides, and extend knees.
TibialisAnterior/LV45ReverseCalfPress.execution: Pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. Return feet down to platform and repeat.
TibialisAnterior/LV45ReverseCalfPress.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight and back of hips can remain on back pad. The angle of back pad may be lowered back to keep back of hips on lower portion of back pad. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. See

TibialisAnterior/LV45ReverseCalfRaise.name: Lever 45° Reverse Calf Raise (plate loaded)
TibialisAnterior/LV45ReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Sit on machine with lower back against padding. Grasp handles to sides and place feet on top portion of platform. Straighten knees and position heels on top edge of platform.
TibialisAnterior/LV45ReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up and back toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet return to platform. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/LV45ReverseCalfRaise.comments: When finished, engage dock lever (if it automatically disengaged), and lower seat to original position. Feet should be place highest position that still allows forefeet to make contact with platform. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. Exercise is performed on apparatus design to perform

TibialisAnterior/LVDonkeyReverseCalfRais.name: Lever Donkey Reverse Calf Raise
TibialisAnterior/LVDonkeyReverseCalfRais.preparation: Position lower back and hips under upper lever pad. Place forearms on supports. Position heels on forward edge of platform.
TibialisAnterior/LVDonkeyReverseCalfRais.execution: Pull forefoot up and toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed away from body. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/LVDonkeyReverseCalfRais.comments: Often bending significantly at hips as shown in

TibialisAnterior/LVReverseCalfExtension.name: Lever Reverse Calf Extension
TibialisAnterior/LVReverseCalfExtension.preparation: Sit on seat and position heels on lever platform with fore feet extended off top. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
TibialisAnterior/LVReverseCalfExtension.execution: Pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. Return feet down to platform and repeat.
TibialisAnterior/LVReverseCalfExtension.comments: Care must be taken to avoid heels from slipping off platform. Begin with very light weight to insure shoes have adequate traction. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. See

TibialisAnterior/LVReverseCalfRaise.name: Lever Reverse Calf Raise
TibialisAnterior/LVReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Place shoulders under padded lever. Stand erect by extending hips and knees. Position heels on forward edge of platform placed under padded lever. Grasp handles or sides of padded lever.
TibialisAnterior/LVReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/LVReverseCalfRaise.comments: Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. The exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform. See

TibialisAnterior/LVReverseCalfRaisePL.name: Lever Reverse Calf Raise (plate loaded)
TibialisAnterior/LVReverseCalfRaisePL.preparation: Place shoulders under padded lever. Stand erect by extending hips and knees. Position heels on forward edge of platform placed under padded lever. Grasp handles or sides of padded lever.
TibialisAnterior/LVReverseCalfRaisePL.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/LVReverseCalfRaisePL.comments: Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. The exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform as well as adding weight. See

TibialisAnterior/LVReverseVCalfRaiseH.name: Lever Reverse Calf Raise (on v-squat machine, plate loaded)
TibialisAnterior/LVReverseVCalfRaiseH.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Position feet far forward on platform. Grasp handles or sides of padded lever.
TibialisAnterior/LVReverseVCalfRaiseH.execution: Pull forefeet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/LVReverseVCalfRaiseH.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still contact platform with knees straight. Bring feet no further forward than back half of feet remaining on platform. Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. See

TibialisAnterior/LVSeatedReverseCalfExtH.name: Lever Reverse Calf Extension (plate loaded)
TibialisAnterior/LVSeatedReverseCalfExtH.preparation: Sit on seat and position heels on lever platform with fore feet extended off top. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
TibialisAnterior/LVSeatedReverseCalfExtH.execution: Pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. Return feet down to platform and repeat.
TibialisAnterior/LVSeatedReverseCalfExtH.comments: Care must be taken to avoid heels from slipping off platform. Begin with very light weight to insure shoes have adequate traction. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. See

TibialisAnterior/LVSeatedReverseCalfPres.name: Lever Seated Reverse Calf Press
TibialisAnterior/LVSeatedReverseCalfPres.preparation: Place seat away from platform. Sit on seat with lower back against padding and place feet very high on platform. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
TibialisAnterior/LVSeatedReverseCalfPres.execution: Pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. Return feet down to platform and repeat.
TibialisAnterior/LVSeatedReverseCalfPres.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still contact platform with knees straight and back of hips can remain on back pad. The angle of back pad may be lowered back to keep back of hips on lower portion of back pad. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. Also see on

TibialisAnterior/LVSeatedTibiaRaisePL.name: Lever Seated Tibia Raise (plate loaded)
TibialisAnterior/LVSeatedTibiaRaisePL.preparation: Sit on bench or stool. Place both feet under padded lever with heels on pedal.
TibialisAnterior/LVSeatedTibiaRaisePL.execution: Lift forefeet upward as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/LVSeatedTibiaRaisePL.comments: Avoid using other muscles to push pedal down with heels as lever is lifted. Insure full range of motion is practiced. In starting lower position, scoot back on bench just slightly until full

TibialisAnterior/LVSingleLegSeatedSeated.name: Lever Single Leg Seated Tibia Raise (plate loaded)
TibialisAnterior/LVSingleLegSeatedSeated.preparation: Sit on bench or stool. Place foot under padded lever with heel on pedal and other foot off to side.
TibialisAnterior/LVSingleLegSeatedSeated.execution: Lift forefoot upward as far as possible. Return by extending foot until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/LVSingleLegSeatedSeated.comments: Avoid using other muscles to push pedal down with heel as lever is lifted. Insure full range of motion is practiced. In starting lower position, scoot back on bench just slightly until full

TibialisAnterior/LVStandingTibiaRaisePL.name: Lever Standing Tibia Raise (plate loaded)
TibialisAnterior/LVStandingTibiaRaisePL.preparation: Standing behind machine hold on to support for balance. Place foot under padded lever with heel on pedal.
TibialisAnterior/LVStandingTibiaRaisePL.execution: Lift forefoot upward as far as possible. Return by extending foot until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/LVStandingTibiaRaisePL.comments: Avoid pushing pedal down with heel as lever is lifted. Insure full range of motion is practiced. In starting lower position, lean back slightly until full

TibialisAnterior/SBReverseCalfRaise.name: Safety Bar Reverse Calf Raise
TibialisAnterior/SBReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Standing facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height and calf block on floor just below. Position heels on forward edge of calf block. Place hands on bar to each sides or on vertical rack bars. Position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. Dismount bar from rack by standing erect with safety bar, away yet close to rack.
TibialisAnterior/SBReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefeet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/SBReverseCalfRaise.comments: Position rack just below lowest range of motion. Calf block should be positioned so safety bar is close to but does not make contact with rack. Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. See

TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfPress.name: Sled 45° Reverse Calf Press
TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfPress.preparation: Sit on seat with back on padded support. Place feet very high on platform, grasp handles to sides, and extend knees.
