TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfPress.execution: Pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. Return feet down to platform and repeat.
TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfPress.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight and back of hips can remain on back pad. The angle of back pad may be lowered back to keep back of hips on lower portion of back pad. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. See

TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfRaisePL.name: Sled 45° Reverse Calf Raise (plate loaded)
TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfRaisePL.preparation: Sit on machine with lower back against padding. Grasp handles to sides and place feet on platform. Straighten knees and position heels on top edge of platform.
TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfRaisePL.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up and back toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed away from body. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfRaisePL.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise. Also known as Sled Donkey Reverse Calf Raise. Also see movement performed on

TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfRaise.name: Sled 45° Reverse Calf Raise
TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Sit on machine with lower back against padding. Grasp handles to sides and place feet on platform. Straighten knees and position heels on top edge of platform.
TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up and back toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed away from body. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfRaise.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise. Also known as Sled Donkey Reverse Calf Raise. Also see movement performed on

TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfRaiseHac.name: Sled 45° Reverse Calf Raise (on hack press)
TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfRaiseHac.preparation: Sit on machine with lower back against padding. Grasp handles to sides and place feet on top portion of platform. Straighten knees and position heels on top edge of platform.
TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfRaiseHac.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up and back toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet return to platform. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/SL45ReverseCalfRaiseHac.comments: Feet should be place highest position that still allows forefeet to make contact with platform. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. Exercise is performed on apparatus design to perform

TibialisAnterior/SLDonkeyReverseCalfRais.name: Sled Reverse Donkey Calf Raise (plate loaded)
TibialisAnterior/SLDonkeyReverseCalfRais.preparation: Position lower back and hips under upper pad. Place forearms on supports. Position heels on forward edge of platform.
TibialisAnterior/SLDonkeyReverseCalfRais.execution: Pull forefoot up and toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed away from body. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/SLDonkeyReverseCalfRais.comments: Often bending at the hip typically reduces range of motion at ankle during

TibialisAnterior/SLHackReverseCalfRaise.name: Sled Hack Reverse Calf Raise
TibialisAnterior/SLHackReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Lie supine on back pad with shoulders against pads. Place feet very high on platform. Extend hips and knees. Release dock levers.
TibialisAnterior/SLHackReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed away from body. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/SLHackReverseCalfRaise.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. Dock levers may not need to be released depending on machine model and body height. See

TibialisAnterior/SLLyingReverseCalfPress.name: Sled Lying Reverse Calf Press
TibialisAnterior/SLLyingReverseCalfPress.preparation: Position sled away from platform. Lie supine on sled with shoulders against pad and place feet very high on platform. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
TibialisAnterior/SLLyingReverseCalfPress.execution: Pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. Return feet down to platform and repeat.
TibialisAnterior/SLLyingReverseCalfPress.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. See

TibialisAnterior/SLLyingReverseCalfPress.name: Sled Lying Reverse Calf Press (plate loaded)
TibialisAnterior/SLLyingReverseCalfPress.preparation: Position sled away from platform. Lie supine on sled with shoulders against pad and place feet very high on platform. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
TibialisAnterior/SLLyingReverseCalfPress.execution: Pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. Return feet down to platform and repeat.
TibialisAnterior/SLLyingReverseCalfPress.comments: If sled bottoms out on dock lever, disengage it to allow full range of motion. Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. See

TibialisAnterior/SLReverseCalfRaise.name: Sled Standing Reverse Calf Raise
TibialisAnterior/SLReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Place shoulders under padded bars. Stand erect by extending hips and knees. Position heels on forward edge of platform positioned under padded bars. Grasp ends or sides of padded bars.
TibialisAnterior/SLReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/SLReverseCalfRaise.comments: Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. The exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform. See

TibialisAnterior/SLReverseCalfRaisePL.name: Sled Reverse Calf Raise (plate loaded)
TibialisAnterior/SLReverseCalfRaisePL.preparation: Place shoulders under padded bars. Stand erect by extending hips and knees. Position heels on forward edge of platform positioned under padded bars. Grasp handles or sides of padded bars.
TibialisAnterior/SLReverseCalfRaisePL.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/SLReverseCalfRaisePL.comments: Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. The exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform. See

TibialisAnterior/SLSeatedReverseCalfPres.name: Sled Seated Reverse Calf Press
TibialisAnterior/SLSeatedReverseCalfPres.preparation: Sit on seat and place feet very high on platform. Grasp handles to sides and extend knees.
TibialisAnterior/SLSeatedReverseCalfPres.execution: Pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. Return feet down to platform and repeat.
TibialisAnterior/SLSeatedReverseCalfPres.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight and back of hips can remain on back pad. The angle of back pad may be lowered back to keep back of hips on lower portion of back pad. See

TibialisAnterior/SMReverseCalfRaise.name: Smith Reverse Calf Raise
TibialisAnterior/SMReverseCalfRaise.preparation: Position bar upper chest height and place calf block under bar. Position back of shoulders under bar and grasp bar to sides. Position heels on forward edge of calf block. Disengage bar by rotating bar back. Stand erect with knees and hips straight.
TibialisAnterior/SMReverseCalfRaise.execution: Pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. Return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. Repeat.
TibialisAnterior/SMReverseCalfRaise.comments: Throughout exercise, keep knees and hips straight. The exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform. See

TibialisAnterior/SVSingleLeg45ReverseCal.name: Sled Single Leg 45° Reverse Calf Press
TibialisAnterior/SVSingleLeg45ReverseCal.preparation: Sit on seat with back on padded support. Place feet very high on platform, grasp handles to sides, and extend knees. Position one foot on floor within machine.
TibialisAnterior/SVSingleLeg45ReverseCal.execution: Pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heel. Return foot down to platform and repeat.
TibialisAnterior/SVSingleLeg45ReverseCal.comments: Foot may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight and back of hips can remain on back pad. The angle of back pad may be lowered back to keep back of hips on lower portion of back pad. Keep knee of exercising leg straight throughout exercise. See

TransverseAbdominus/AbdominalVacuum.name: Abdominal Vacuum
TransverseAbdominus/AbdominalVacuum.preparation: Pull navel into spine and hold.

TrapeziusUpper/BBShrug.name: Barbell Shrug
TrapeziusUpper/BBShrug.preparation: Stand holding barbell with overhand or mixed grip; shoulder width or slightly wider.
TrapeziusUpper/BBShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/BBShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/BWInvertedShrugPB.name: Inverted Shrug (on parallel bars)
TrapeziusUpper/BWInvertedShrugPB.preparation: Stand between parallel bars. Squat down and grasp parallel bars from above. Kick legs up inverting and balancing body upside down. Legs can be kept bent or straight, positioned vertically.
TrapeziusUpper/BWInvertedShrugPB.execution: Raise body up a high as possible by pulling shoulders toward ears. Lower body to original position and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/BWInvertedShrugPB.comments: Falling from an inverted position or hitting head on structural bar when flipping body may result in very serious injury. Adequate clearance must be allowed for head to clear any obstruction during both inversion and dismount.

TrapeziusUpper/CBBarShrug.name: Cable Bar Shrug
TrapeziusUpper/CBBarShrug.preparation: Position adjustable pulleys at low position. Stand close to cable bar and grasp with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip.
TrapeziusUpper/CBBarShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/CBBarShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate, depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/BWInvertedShrugRings.name: Suspended Inverted Shrug
TrapeziusUpper/BWInvertedShrugRings.preparation: Grasp gymnastics rings, one in each hand. Sit on mat between parallel bars. Kick legs up inverting and balancing body upside down.
TrapeziusUpper/BWInvertedShrugRings.execution: Raise body up a high as possible by pulling shoulders toward ears. Lower body to original position and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/BWInvertedShrugRings.comments: Falling from an inverted position may result in very serious injury. To decrease potential of injury, position gymnastic rings over well padded surface, only high enough to allow full range of motion.

TrapeziusUpper/CBOneArmShrug.name: Cable One Arm Shrug
TrapeziusUpper/CBOneArmShrug.preparation: Grasp stirrup with one hand and stand close to low pulley to side.
TrapeziusUpper/CBOneArmShrug.execution: With arms straight, elevate shoulder as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/CBOneArmShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/CBSeatShrug.name: Cambered Barbell Seated Shrug
TrapeziusUpper/CBSeatShrug.preparation: Sit on end of bench and grasp cambered bar from beneath with overhand or mixed grip.
TrapeziusUpper/CBSeatShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/CBSeatShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/CBShrug.name: Cable Shrug
TrapeziusUpper/CBShrug.preparation: Stand facing low pulley and grasp cable bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Stand close to pulley.
TrapeziusUpper/CBShrug.execution: With arms straight, elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/CBShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/CBShrugDualPulley.name: Cable Shrug (dual pulley)
TrapeziusUpper/CBShrugDualPulley.preparation: Stand between two low pulleys and grasp stirrups to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to each side.
TrapeziusUpper/CBShrugDualPulley.execution: With arms straight, elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/CBShrugDualPulley.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/CBShrugStirrups.name: Cable Shrug (with stirrups)
TrapeziusUpper/CBShrugStirrups.preparation: Stand between two low pulleys and grasp stirrups to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to each side.
TrapeziusUpper/CBShrugStirrups.execution: With arms straight, elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/CBShrugStirrups.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/LVBBShrug.name: Lever Barbell Shrug (plate loaded)
TrapeziusUpper/LVBBShrug.preparation: Stand behind bar mid-thigh height. Stand grasping bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back and stand upright.
TrapeziusUpper/LVBBShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/LVBBShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/DBShrug.name: Dumbbell Shrug
TrapeziusUpper/DBShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/DBShrug.comments: Exercise may be performed standing perfectly upright or very slightly bent over. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/LVSeatXGripShrug.name: Lever Seated Gripless Shrug
TrapeziusUpper/LVSeatXGripShrug.execution: Sit on seat and place forearms in padded bars.

TrapeziusUpper/LVSeatedShrug.name: Lever Seated Shrug (plate loaded)
TrapeziusUpper/LVSeatedShrug.preparation: Sit on bench and grasp lower handles to each side. Sit upright.
TrapeziusUpper/LVSeatedShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/LVSeatedShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/LVShrug.name: Lever Shrug
TrapeziusUpper/LVShrug.preparation: Stand holding lever bar with shoulder width overhand or mixed grip.
TrapeziusUpper/LVShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/LVShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/LVShrugH.name: Lever Shrug (plate loaded)
TrapeziusUpper/LVShrugH.preparation: Stand between lever handles to sides. Squat down with feet flat on floor and grasp upper handles to sides. Stand upright by extending hips and knees to full extension.
TrapeziusUpper/LVShrugH.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/LVShrugH.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/LVShrugNarrowH.name: Lever Narrow Grip Shrug (plate loaded)
TrapeziusUpper/LVShrugNarrowH.preparation: Stand very near to close lever handles. Bend over and grasp handles with each hand. Stand upright.
TrapeziusUpper/LVShrugNarrowH.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/LVShrugNarrowH.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/LVXGripShrug.name: Lever Gripless Shrug
TrapeziusUpper/LVXGripShrug.preparation: Stand with shoulders under padded lever.
TrapeziusUpper/LVXGripShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/LVXGripShrug.comments: If possible, position lever height high enough so weight will not need to be squat up that high, but not so high that weight stack bottoms out during exercise. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/LVXGripShrugPL.name: Lever Gripless Shrug (plate loaded)
TrapeziusUpper/LVXGripShrugPL.preparation: Stand with shoulders under padded lever.
TrapeziusUpper/LVXGripShrugPL.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/LVXGripShrugPL.comments: If possible, position lever height high enough so weight will not need to be squat up that high, but not so high that weight stack bottoms out during exercise. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/SBShrugStand.name: Trap Bar Shrug (elevated stand)
TrapeziusUpper/SBShrugStand.preparation: Step into elevated trap bar stand. Bend down and grasp handles of apparatus to sides. Stand upright.
TrapeziusUpper/SBShrugStand.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/SBShrugStand.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate, depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/SLXGripShrug.name: Sled Gripless Shrug
TrapeziusUpper/SLXGripShrug.preparation: Stand with shoulders under padded bar.
TrapeziusUpper/SLXGripShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/SLXGripShrug.comments: If possible, position lever height high enough so weight will not need to be squat up that high, but not so high that weight stack bottoms out during exercise. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/SMShrug.name: Smith Shrug
TrapeziusUpper/SMShrug.preparation: Stand grasping smith bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
TrapeziusUpper/SMShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/SMShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

TrapeziusUpper/TBShrug.name: Trap Bar Shrug
TrapeziusUpper/TBShrug.preparation: Step into trap barbell and stand holding handles of trap bar to sides.
TrapeziusUpper/TBShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
TrapeziusUpper/TBShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see

Triceps/ASTriDip.name: Machine-assisted Triceps Dip
Triceps/ASTriDip.execution: , arms straight with shoulders above hands. Step down onto assistance lever. Keep hips and knees straight.
Triceps/ASTriDip.comments: Lower body until slight stretch is felt in shoulders. Push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.

Triceps/ASTriDipKneeling.name: Machine-assisted Triceps Dip (kneeling)
Triceps/ASTriDipKneeling.execution: , arms straight with shoulders above hands. Kneel on padded platform, lowering it down slightly so hips are slightly bent.
Triceps/ASTriDipKneeling.comments: Lower body until slight stretch is felt in shoulders. Push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.

Triceps/ASTricepsDipBand.name: Band-assisted Triceps Dip
Triceps/ASTricepsDipBand.preparation: Place one foot on middle of exercise band with ends looped on
Triceps/ASTricepsDipBand.execution: . Push band down partially by extending leg. Mount dip bar with arms straight and shoulders above hands. Place other foot on exercise band next to other foot. Keep hips straight.
Triceps/ASTricepsDipBand.comments: Lower body until slight stretch is felt in shoulders. Push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.

Triceps/ASTricepsDipSelf.name: Self-assisted Triceps Dip
Triceps/ASTricepsDipSelf.preparation: Stand on bench or elevation between parallel bars. Mount
Triceps/ASTricepsDipSelf.execution: , arms straight with shoulders above hands. Bend knees and place toes on bench or elevation behind and below body.
Triceps/ASTricepsDipSelf.comments: Lower body by bending arms back. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees to bend, keeping toes in contact with bench or elevation. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders push body up until arms are straight. Repeat with minimal assistance from legs.

Triceps/BBCloseGripBenchPress.name: Barbell Close Grip Bench Press
Triceps/BBCloseGripBenchPress.preparation: Lie on bench and grasp barbell from rack with shoulder width grip.
Triceps/BBCloseGripBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to chest with elbows close to body. Push barbell back up until arms are straight. Repeat.
Triceps/BBCloseGripBenchPress.comments: Grip can be slightly narrower than shoulder width but not too close. Too close of grip can decrease range of motion, may tend to

Triceps/BBCloseGripInclineBenchPress.name: Barbell Close Grip Incline Bench Press
Triceps/BBCloseGripInclineBenchPress.preparation: Lie on bench with bar above chest. Grasp bar from rack with shoulder width or slightly narrower grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Triceps/BBCloseGripInclineBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to chest with elbows close to body. Push barbell up until arms are straight. Repeat.
Triceps/BBCloseGripInclineBenchPress.comments: Grip can be slightly narrower than shoulder width but not too close. Also see

Triceps/BBDeclineTriExt.name: Barbell Decline Triceps Extension
Triceps/BBDeclineTriExt.preparation: Lie on decline bench with narrow overhand grip on barbell. Position barbell over shoulders with arms extended.
Triceps/BBDeclineTriExt.execution: Lower bar by bending elbows. As bar nears head, move elbows slightly back just enough to allow bar to clear around curvature of head. Extend arms. As bar clears head, reposition elbows to its former position until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Triceps/BBDeclineTriExt.comments: With arms fully extended, bar can be brought back over shoulders. Shoulders can be internally rotated between repetitions as needed to allow for relative release of tension in muscles. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used.

Triceps/BBLyingTriExt.name: Barbell Lying Triceps Extension
Triceps/BBLyingTriExt.preparation: Lie on bench with narrow overhand grip on barbell. Position barbell over forehead with arms extended.
Triceps/BBLyingTriExt.execution: Lower bar by bending elbows. As bar nears head, move elbows slightly back just enough to allow bar to clear around curvature of head. Extend arms. As bar clears head, reposition elbows to their former position until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Triceps/BBLyingTriExt.comments: With arms fully extended, bar can be brought back over upper chest. Shoulders can be internally rotated between repetitions as needed to allow for relative release of tension in muscles. Barbell can be received from the floor or from rack either situated over abdomen or from behind head. Exercise can also be performed with straight barbell. Movement with cambared bar as shown above is also known as EZ Barbell or EZ Bar Lying Triceps Extension.

Triceps/BBInclineTriExt.name: Barbell Incline Triceps Extension
Triceps/BBInclineTriExt.preparation: Lie on slightly incline bench with narrow overhand grip on barbell. Position barbell over shoulders with arms extended.
Triceps/BBInclineTriExt.execution: Lower bar by bending elbows. As bar nears head, move elbows slightly back just enough to allow bar to clear around curvature of head. Extend arms. As bar clears head, reposition elbows to their former position until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
Triceps/BBInclineTriExt.comments: With arms fully extended, bar can be brought back over shoulders. Shoulders can be internally rotated between repetitions as needed to allow for relative release of tension in muscles. Either

Triceps/BBJMPress.name: Barbell JM Bench Press
Triceps/BBJMPress.preparation: Lie on bench with back flat on bench and grasp barbell from rack with shoulder width or slightly narrower grip.
Triceps/BBJMPress.execution: Lower in straight line toward neck while keeping elbows relatively high and bending them out to sides, approximately 45° from midline of body. Flex wrists slightly as bar is lowered as to keep weight of bar on base of palms. Pause when forearms mak   e solid contact with biceps. Push barbell back up until arms are straight. Repeat.
Triceps/BBJMPress.comments: Movement is hybrid between Bench Press and Triceps Extension. A false grip or standard thumb opposing grip can be taken, approximately 16" (40 cm) apart for men. Bar is brought downward anywhere between chin and upper chest. As to minimize shoulder involvement, keep elbows up, allowing elbow to fold upon itself. Range of motion is determined by muscle mass of forearm and biceps. After mastering form and gradually progressing in resistance, push barbell upward more rapidly for greater power development.

Triceps/BBLyingTriExtSC.name: Barbell Lying Triceps Extension "Skull Crusher"
Triceps/BBLyingTriExtSC.preparation: Lie on bench with narrow overhand grip on barbell. Position barbell over shoulders with arms extended.
Triceps/BBLyingTriExtSC.execution: Lower bar to forehead by bending elbows. Extend arms and repeat.
Triceps/BBLyingTriExtSC.comments: Slow barbell's descent as it approaches forehead. Exercise can also be performed with

Triceps/BBReclinedTricepsExtension.name: Barbell Reclined Triceps Extension
Triceps/BBReclinedTricepsExtension.preparation: Sit on incline bench angled at 70° to 80° with barbell. Position barbell overhead with narrow overhand grip.
Triceps/BBReclinedTricepsExtension.execution: Lower barbell behind neck by flexing elbows allowing forearms to travel behind upper arms with elbows remaining overhead. Raise barbell overhead by extending elbows until arms are positioned straight and vertical. Lower and repeat.
Triceps/BBReclinedTricepsExtension.comments: Reclined position can be used instead of

Triceps/BBTriExt.name: Barbell Triceps Extension
Triceps/BBTriExt.preparation: Sit on utility weight bench with barbell. Position barbell overhead with narrow overhand grip.
Triceps/BBTriExt.execution: Lower barbell behind upper shoulders by flexing elbows allowing forearms to travel behind upper arms with elbows remaining overhead. Raise barbell overhead by extending elbows until arms are positioned straight and vertical. Lower and repeat.
Triceps/BBTriExt.comments: Let barbell pull arm back to maintain full shoulder flexion. Exercise may be performed standing or on seat with or without back support. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used.

Triceps/BWBenchDip.name: Bench Dip
Triceps/BWBenchDip.preparation: Sit on inside of one of two benches placed parallel, slightly less than leg's length away. Place hands on edge of bench, straighten arms, slide rear end off of bench, and position heels on adjacent bench with legs straight.
Triceps/BWBenchDip.execution: Lower body by bending arms until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder, or rear end touches floor. Raise body and repeat.
Triceps/BWBenchDip.comments: Bench height should allow for full range of motion.

Triceps/BWBenchDipBentKnee.name: Bench Dip (knees bent)
Triceps/BWBenchDipBentKnee.preparation: Sit on side of bench. Place hands on edge of bench. Place feet on floor away from bench. Straighten arms, slide rear end off of edge of bench, and position feet on floor with knees bent.
Triceps/BWBenchDipBentKnee.execution: Lower body by bending arms until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder, or rear end touches floor. Raise body and repeat.
Triceps/BWBenchDipBentKnee.comments: Bench height should allow for full range of motion.

Triceps/BWCloseGripDeclinePushup.name: Close Grip Decline Pushup
Triceps/BWCloseGripDeclinePushup.preparation: Kneel on floor with bench or elevation behind body. Position hands on floor with hands under shoulders or slightly narrower. Place feet on bench or elevation. Raise body in plank position with body straight and arms extended.
Triceps/BWCloseGripDeclinePushup.execution: Keeping body straight, lower upper body to floor by bending arms. To allow for full descent, pull head back slightly without arching back. Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
Triceps/BWCloseGripDeclinePushup.comments: Both upper and lower body must be kept straight throughout movement. Range of motion will be compromised if

Triceps/BWBenchDipFloor.name: Bench Dip (heels on floor)
Triceps/BWBenchDipFloor.preparation: Sit on side of bench. Place hands on edge of bench. Position feet away from bench. Straighten arms, slide rear end off of edge of bench, and rest heels on floor with legs straight.
Triceps/BWBenchDipFloor.execution: Lower body by bending arms until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder, or rear end touches floor. Raise body and repeat.
Triceps/BWBenchDipFloor.comments: Bench height should allow for full range of motion.

Triceps/BWCloseGripInclinePushupBar.name: Close Grip Incline Push-up (on bar)
Triceps/BWCloseGripInclinePushupBar.preparation: Grasp horizontal bar (lower than chest height) with hands shoulder width or slightly narrower. Position forefeet back from bar with arms and body straight. Arms should be perpendicular to body.
Triceps/BWCloseGripInclinePushupBar.execution: Keeping body straight, lower chest to bar by bending arms. Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
Triceps/BWCloseGripInclinePushupBar.comments: Both upper and lower body must be kept straight throughout movement. Height of bar affects difficulty of movement. See

Triceps/BWCloseGripPushup.name: Close Grip Push-up
Triceps/BWCloseGripPushup.preparation: Lie prone on floor with hands under shoulders or slightly narrower. Position body up off floor with extended arms and body straight.
Triceps/BWCloseGripPushup.execution: Keeping body straight, lower body to floor by bending arms. Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
Triceps/BWCloseGripPushup.comments: Both upper and lower body must be kept straight throughout movement. See

Triceps/BWCloseGripPushupKnees.name: Close Grip Push-up (on knees)
Triceps/BWCloseGripPushupKnees.preparation: Lie prone on floor with hands under shoulders or slightly narrower. Position body up off floor with extended arms and body straight.
Triceps/BWCloseGripPushupKnees.execution: Keeping body straight, lower body to floor by bending arms. Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
Triceps/BWCloseGripPushupKnees.comments: Both upper and lower body must be kept straight throughout movement. Forefeet can remain on floor as long as body is pivoting on knees. Also see

Triceps/BWCloseGripPushupMB.name: Close Grip Push-up (on medicine ball)
Triceps/BWCloseGripPushupMB.preparation: Kneel before medicine ball. Place hands on upper part of ball on each side. Balance upper body above ball with arms extended. Straighten body and place forefeet back, away from ball on floor shoulder width apart.
Triceps/BWCloseGripPushupMB.execution: Keeping body straight, lower body by bending arms until chest touches ball. Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
Triceps/BWCloseGripPushupMB.comments: Both upper and lower body must be kept straight throughout movement. Also see

Triceps/BWSuspendedTricepsExtension.name: Suspended Triceps Extension (with rope)
Triceps/BWSuspendedTricepsExtension.preparation: Grasp triceps rope hanging from secured bar (chest height or lower). Position forefeet on floor, back from bar with body straight. Elbows can be either be completely bent or straight during mount with upper arms somewhat perpendicular with body.
Triceps/BWSuspendedTricepsExtension.execution: Keeping body straight, raise body up and back up until arms are extended. Lower body by bending elbows, allowing head to travel between ends of rope. Repeat.

Triceps/BWTriDipBenches.name: Triceps Dip (between benches)
Triceps/BWTriDipBenches.preparation: Stand between ends of two benches. Place hands on ends of benches with fingers off end of benches. Grip should be somewhat
Triceps/BWTriDipBenches.execution: . Position feet out in front with legs straight, heels on floor, and torso upright.
Triceps/BWTriDipBenches.comments: Lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to point back. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.

Triceps/BWTriDip.name: Triceps Dip
Triceps/BWTriDip.execution: , arms straight with shoulders above hands. Keep hips straight.
Triceps/BWTriDip.comments: Lower body until slight stretch is felt in shoulders. Push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.

Triceps/BWTriDipBenchesBentKnees.name: Triceps Dip (bent knees between benches)
Triceps/BWTriDipBenchesBentKnees.preparation: Stand between ends of two benches. Place hands on ends of benches with fingers off ends of benches. Grip should be somewhat
Triceps/BWTriDipBenchesBentKnees.execution: . Position feet in front with legs bent and torso upright.
Triceps/BWTriDipBenchesBentKnees.comments: Lower body by bending arms, allowing elbows to point back. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.

Triceps/CBAlternatingSeatedPushdown.name: Cable Alternating Seated Pushdown
Triceps/CBAlternatingSeatedPushdown.preparation: Sit on seat or bench in font of two close high pulleys. Grasp stirrup with each hand (over or underhand grip). Position elbows to side.
Triceps/CBAlternatingSeatedPushdown.execution: Push one stirrup down by extending elbow until arm is straight. Return until forearm returns to original positon, keeping elbow close to side. Repeat with opposite arm and alternate.
Triceps/CBAlternatingSeatedPushdown.comments: If seat is positioned back behind pulleys as shown, bending forward can provide resistance at top of motion. See

Triceps/CBBarBentoverTriExt.name: Cable Bar Bent-over Triceps Extension
Triceps/CBBarBentoverTriExt.preparation: Stand facing outward behind cable bar and pulleys. Grasp cable bar from medium high pulley with narrow or shoulder width overhand grip. Push cable bar down to straighten arms. Lunge forward and bend over with arms positioned straight forward. Allow bar to be pulled back over neck under resistance of weight while keeping elbows pointed forward.
Triceps/CBBarBentoverTriExt.execution: Extend forearms forward until elbows are straight. Allow cable bar to return back over neck. Repeat.
Triceps/CBBarBentoverTriExt.comments: Let cable resistance pull arms back to maintain degree of shoulder flexion, dependent upon flexibility.

Triceps/CBBarLyingTriExt.name: Cable Bar Lying Triceps Extension
Triceps/CBBarLyingTriExt.preparation: Lie on bench and grasp cable bar with narrow overhand grip. With arms extended, position bar over face.
Triceps/CBBarLyingTriExt.execution: Lower cable bar by bending elbow. As cable bar nears head, move elbows slightly back just enough to allow cable bar to clear around curvature of head. Extend arm. As cable bar clears head, reposition elbows to its former position until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
Triceps/CBBarLyingTriExt.comments: Cable bar may be propped up on end of bench to allow easier access. With arms fully extended, shoulders can be internally rotated between repetitions as needed to allow for relative release of tension in muscles.

Triceps/CBBarPushdown.name: Cable Bar Pushdown
Triceps/CBBarPushdown.preparation: Position adjustable pulleys slightly above head. Face cable bar and grasp with overhand narrow grip. Position elbows to side.
Triceps/CBBarPushdown.execution: Extend arms down. Return until forearm is close to upper arm. Repeat.
Triceps/CBBarPushdown.comments: The elbow can travel up slightly at top of motion. Stay close to cable to provide resistance at top of motion.

Triceps/CBBarPushdownHeavy.name: Cable Bar Pushdown (forward leaning)
Triceps/CBBarPushdownHeavy.preparation: Face high pulley and grasp cable bar attachment with overhand grip. Position one leg back and bend forward leg with body leaning forward. Position revolving bar down in front of face with forearms nearing vertical.
Triceps/CBBarPushdownHeavy.execution: Push cable bar downward by extending arms until elbows are straight. Return to front of face until forearms are nearly vertical and close to upper arm. Repeat.
Triceps/CBBarPushdownHeavy.comments: Position face close to cable to provide resistance at top of motion. Elbows is brought close to body so arms are vertical at bottom of motion, either at or near the end of full extension, or in one movement as bar is pushed downward.

Triceps/CBBentoverTriExt.name: Cable Bent-over Triceps Extension
Triceps/CBBentoverTriExt.preparation: Grasp cable bar from medium high pulley with narrow or shoulder width overhand grip. Turn body away from pulley apparatus and position turned cable bar behind neck. Bend over downward with cable bar positioned behind neck, gripped at each side. Lunge forward with one leg. Allow elbows to be pulled back under cable resistance.
Triceps/CBBentoverTriExt.execution: Extend forearms forward until elbows are straight. Allow cable bar to return back over neck. Repeat.
Triceps/CBBentoverTriExt.comments: Let cable resistance pull arm back to maintain degree of shoulder flexion, dependent upon flexibility.

Triceps/CBBentoverTriExtRope.name: Cable Bent-over Triceps Extension (with rope attachment)
Triceps/CBBentoverTriExtRope.preparation: Grasp rope attachment from medium high pulley. Turn body away from pulley apparatus and position turned rope attachment behind neck. Bend over downward with rope attachment positioned behind neck gripped at each side. Lunge forward with one leg. Allow elbows to be pulled back under cable resistance.
Triceps/CBBentoverTriExtRope.execution: Extend forearms forward until elbows are straight. Allow cable bar to return back over neck. Repeat.
Triceps/CBBentoverTriExtRope.comments: Let cable resistance pull arm back to maintain degree of shoulder flexion, dependent upon flexibility.

Triceps/CBDeclineTricepsExt.name: Cable Decline Triceps Extension
Triceps/CBDeclineTricepsExt.preparation: Position legs under lower leg pad and lie back on bench. Grasp bar with narrow overhand grip. Position bar near forehead or top of head.
Triceps/CBDeclineTricepsExt.execution: Extend elbows to raise bar attachment until arms are straight. As arms extended, position them vertically. Lower bar by bending elbows. As bar nears head, reposition elbows back just enough to allow bar to clear around curvature of head. Repeat.
Triceps/CBDeclineTricepsExt.comments: A very low pulley and/or high decline is needed to achieve full range of motion at bottom position. With arms fully extended, shoulders can be internally rotated between repetitions as needed to allow for relative release of tension in muscles.

Triceps/CBForwardTricepsExt.name: Cable Forward Triceps Extension
Triceps/CBForwardTricepsExt.preparation: Grasp stirrup from medium high pulley. Turn body away from pulley apparatus and position stirrup over shoulder with palms down. Step forward with one foot so cable is taut. Position elbow forward about shoulder height.
Triceps/CBForwardTricepsExt.execution: Push stirrup forward by extending forearm until elbow is straight. Allow stirrup to return back over shoulder. Repeat and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Triceps/CBForwardTricepsExt.comments: Keep elbow approximately same position throughout movement.

Triceps/CBInclinePushdown.name: Cable Incline Pushdown
Triceps/CBInclinePushdown.preparation: Lie on incline bench facing away from high pulley. Grasp cable attachment overhead with overhand narrow grip. Position elbow to sides, slightly up.
Triceps/CBInclinePushdown.execution: Extend arms with elbows stationary. Return until forearm is close to upper arm. Repeat.
Triceps/CBInclinePushdown.comments: If high pulley is adjustable, lower pulley slightly to provide resistance at top of motion. If high pulley is fixed, position bench distance away from cable column. If incline is positioned too high, range of motion at lower position may be compromised.

Triceps/CBKneelingTriExt.name: Cable Kneeling Triceps Extension
Triceps/CBKneelingTriExt.preparation: Grasp cable bar from middle pulley with narrow or shoulder width overhand grip. Turn body away from pulley apparatus with cable bar above head. Kneel before bench, bend over and place elbows on edge of bench. Maintain upper arms parallel with shoulders as low as possible.
Triceps/CBKneelingTriExt.execution: Extend forearms over head until elbow are fully extended. Return and repeat.
Triceps/CBKneelingTriExt.comments: Let cable attachment pull arm back to maintain full shoulder flexion.

Triceps/CBInclineTriExt.name: Cable Incline Triceps Extension
Triceps/CBInclineTriExt.preparation: Grasp cable bar from behind with narrow overhand grip. Position elbows overhead.
Triceps/CBInclineTriExt.execution: Extend forearm overhead until elbows are straight. Lower until forearms are against upper arms. Repeat.
Triceps/CBInclineTriExt.comments: Avoid using shoulders by attempting to press bar over head. If incline is designed to pivot back, lean seat back for

Triceps/CBLyingTriExt.name: Cable Lying Triceps Extension
Triceps/CBLyingTriExt.preparation: Lie on bench and grasp bar with narrow overhand grip. With arms extended, position bar over face.
Triceps/CBLyingTriExt.execution: Lower bar by bending elbow. As bar nears head, move elbows slightly back just enough to allow bar to clear around curvature of head. Extend arm. As bar clears head, reposition elbows to its former position until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
Triceps/CBLyingTriExt.comments: Bar may be propped up with one end leaning against head of bench to allow easier access. With arms fully extended, shoulders can be internally rotated between repetitions as needed to allow for relative release of tension in muscles.

Triceps/CBOneArmPushdown.name: Cable One Arm Pushdown
Triceps/CBOneArmPushdown.preparation: Grasp dumbbell cable attachment with underhand grip. Position elbow to side.
Triceps/CBOneArmPushdown.execution: Extend arm down. Return until forearm is close to upper arm. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Triceps/CBOneArmPushdown.comments: The elbow can travel up few inches at top of motion. Step close to cable to provide resistance at top of motion.

Triceps/CBOneArmTriExtPronated.name: Cable One Arm Triceps Extension (pronated grip)
Triceps/CBOneArmTriExtPronated.preparation: Grasp stirrup cable attachment from behind. Place hand with cable behind neck; palm toward neck and elbow positioned upward.
Triceps/CBOneArmTriExtPronated.execution: Extend arm upward. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Triceps/CBOneArmTriExtPronated.comments: Let cable pull arm back to maintain full shoulder flexion. Also see exercise with

Triceps/CBOneArmTriExt.name: Cable One Arm Triceps Extension (supinated grip)
Triceps/CBOneArmTriExt.preparation: Grasp stirrup cable attachment from behind. Place hand with cable behind neck; palm toward neck and elbow positioned upward.
Triceps/CBOneArmTriExt.execution: Extend arm upward. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Triceps/CBOneArmTriExt.comments: Let cable pull arm back to maintain full shoulder flexion. Exercise can also be performed on traditional

Triceps/CBPushdown.name: Cable Pushdown
Triceps/CBPushdown.preparation: Face high pulley and grasp cable attachment with narrow overhand grip. Position elbows to side.
Triceps/CBPushdown.execution: Extend arms down. Return until forearm is close to upper arm. Repeat.
Triceps/CBPushdown.comments: The elbow can travel up slightly at top of motion. Stay close to cable to provide resistance at top of motion.

Triceps/CBPushdownRope.name: Cable Pushdown (with rope attachment)
Triceps/CBPushdownRope.preparation: Face high pulley and grasp rope attachment with clinched hands side by side (palms in). Position elbows to side.
Triceps/CBPushdownRope.execution: Extend arms down. Turn palms down at bottom. Return until forearm is close to upper arm and hands are in original position. Repeat.
Triceps/CBPushdownRope.comments: The elbow can travel up slightly at top of motion. Stay close to cable to provide resistance at top of motion.

Triceps/CBPushdownHeavy.name: Cable Pushdown (forward leaning)
Triceps/CBPushdownHeavy.preparation: Face high pulley and grasp revolving bar cable attachment with overhand grip. Position one leg back and bend forward leg with body leaning forward. Position revolving bar down in front of face with forearms nearing vertical.
Triceps/CBPushdownHeavy.execution: Push cable bar downward by extending arms until elbows are straight. Return to front of face until forearms are nearly vertical and close to upper arm. Repeat.
Triceps/CBPushdownHeavy.comments: Position face close to cable to provide resistance at top of motion. Elbows is brought close to body so arms are vertical at bottom of motion, either at or near the end of full extension, or in one movement as bar is pushed downward.

Triceps/CBPushdownSupport.name: Cable Pushdown (with back support)
Triceps/CBPushdownSupport.preparation: Place back against vertical back support. Grasp cable attachment from high pulley with narrow overhand grip. Position elbows to side.
Triceps/CBPushdownSupport.execution: Extend arms down. Return until forearm is close to upper arm. Repeat.
Triceps/CBPushdownSupport.comments: Keep back against back pad throughout exercise.

Triceps/CBPushdownVBar.name: Cable Pushdown (with V-bar)
Triceps/CBPushdownVBar.preparation: Face high pulley and grasp V-bar attachment with narrow overhand grip. Position elbows to side.
Triceps/CBPushdownVBar.execution: Extend arms down. Return until forearm is close to upper arm. Repeat.

Triceps/CBStandingTricepsExtensionRope.name: Cable Triceps Extension (with rope)
Triceps/CBStandingTricepsExtensionRope.preparation: From low pulley cable, grasp ends of rope attachment just under enlarged ends. Raise one arm over head while turning body away from pulley. Face away from pulley with feet staggered. Position ends of ropes behind head or neck and elbows upward over head.
Triceps/CBStandingTricepsExtensionRope.execution: Raise ends of rope overhead by extending forearms until arms are straight. Lower rope attachment until forearms are against upper arms. Repeat.
Triceps/CBStandingTricepsExtensionRope.comments: Let cable attachment pull arm back to maintain full shoulder flexion.   Exercise can also be performed seated on bench or seat with back support just below shoulders.

Triceps/CBSideTricepsExt.name: Cable Side Triceps Extension
Triceps/CBSideTricepsExt.preparation: Grasp stirrup from medium high pulley. Turn body so pulley is to side of free arm while lifting stirrup over head. Step forward, just slightly to allow stirrup to be placed behind head, just over shoulder. Place elbow just slightly higher than shoulder height and position palm down.
Triceps/CBSideTricepsExt.execution: Push stirrup out to side by extending forearm until elbow is straight. Allow stirrup to return back over shoulder. Repeat and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Triceps/CBSideTricepsExt.comments: Stand far enough away from pulley to keep cable taut in lowered position. Keep elbow approximately same position throughout movement.

Triceps/CBTriDip.name: Cable Triceps Dip
Triceps/CBTriDip.execution: with dip belt around waist. Kneel as close to low pulley and attach cable to dip belt. Stand up and mount dip bar, arms straight with shoulders above hands. Keep hips straight.
Triceps/CBTriDip.comments: Lower body by bending arms until slight stretch is felt in shoulders. Push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.

Triceps/CBTriExt.name: Cable Triceps Extension
Triceps/CBTriExt.preparation: Stand or sit on bench or seat with back support just below shoulders. Position cable bar behind neck or shoulders with narrow overhand grip. Position elbows overhead.
Triceps/CBTriExt.execution: Raise cable bar overhead by extending elbows until arms are positioned straight and vertical. Lower cable bar behind neck by flexing elbows allowing forearms to travel behind upper arms with elbows remaining overhead. Repeat.
Triceps/CBTriExt.comments: Let cable attachment pull arm back to maintain full shoulder flexion.

Triceps/DBInclineTricepsExt.name: Dumbbell Incline Triceps Extension
Triceps/DBInclineTricepsExt.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench with back of head on upper corner of bench. Position dumbbells over head with arms extended.
Triceps/DBInclineTricepsExt.execution: Lower dumbbells by bending elbow until they are to sides of head. Extend arm and repeat.
Triceps/DBInclineTricepsExt.comments: Movement can also be performed on old fashioned incline bench without seat.

Triceps/DBDeclineTriExt.name: Dumbbell Decline Triceps Extension
Triceps/DBDeclineTriExt.preparation: Lie on decline bench and position dumbbells over shoulders with arms extended.
Triceps/DBDeclineTriExt.execution: Lower dumbbells by bending elbow until they are to sides of head; dumbbells touch shoulder. Extend arm. Repeat.
Triceps/DBDeclineTriExt.comments: Keep elbows pointed up or just slightly back throughout movement.

Triceps/DBKickback.name: Dumbbell Kickback
Triceps/DBKickback.preparation: Kneel over bench with arm supporting body. Grasp dumbbell. Position upper arm parallel to floor.
Triceps/DBKickback.execution: Extend arm until it is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Triceps/DBKickback.comments: For greater range of motion, upper arm can be positioned with elbow slightly higher than shoulder. Also see

Triceps/DBLyingTriExt.name: Dumbbell Lying Triceps Extension
Triceps/DBLyingTriExt.preparation: Lie on bench and position dumbbells over head with arms extended.
Triceps/DBLyingTriExt.execution: Lower dumbbells by bending elbow until they are to sides of head. Extend arm. Repeat.
Triceps/DBLyingTriExt.comments: With arms fully extended, dumbbells can be brought to upper chest between repetitions as needed to allow for relative release of tension in muscles.

Triceps/DBOneArmReclinedTricepsExtension.name: Dumbbell One Arm Reclined Triceps Extension
Triceps/DBOneArmReclinedTricepsExtension.preparation: Sit on bench with dumbbell in one hand. Place other hand on bench behind body and recline back so arm supports body. Position dumbbell overhead with arm straight up.
Triceps/DBOneArmReclinedTricepsExtension.execution: Lower dumbbell behind neck or shoulder while maintaining upper arm's vertical position throughout exercise. Extend arm until straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Triceps/DBOneArmReclinedTricepsExtension.comments: Reclined position can be used instead of

Triceps/DBOneArmTriExtBench.name: Dumbbell One Arm Triceps Extension (on bench)
Triceps/DBOneArmTriExtBench.preparation: Position dumbbell behind neck with elbow positioned upward.
Triceps/DBOneArmTriExtBench.execution: Extend arm until straight while maintaining upper arm's vertical position throughout exercise. Return until dumbbell is behind neck or shoulder and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Triceps/DBOneArmTriExtBench.comments: Let dumbbell pull back arm to maintain full shoulder flexion. Consider using seat with

Triceps/DBOneArmTriExt.name: Dumbbell One Arm Triceps Extension
Triceps/DBOneArmTriExt.preparation: Sit on seat with back support just below shoulder height. Position dumbbell overhead with arm straight up or slightly back.
Triceps/DBOneArmTriExt.execution: Lower dumbbell behind neck or shoulder while maintaining upper arm's vertical position throughout exercise. Extend arm until straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
Triceps/DBOneArmTriExt.comments: Let dumbbell pull back arm slightly to maintain full shoulder flexion. Keep elbow in so movement does not resemble overhead press. Back support should not be so high that it interferes with dumbbell being completely lowered (ie: full range of motion). See

Triceps/DBReclinedTricepsExtension.name: Dumbbell Reclined Triceps Extension
Triceps/DBReclinedTricepsExtension.preparation: Sit on incline bench angled at 70° to 80° with dumbbells in each hand. Position dumbbells over each shoulder with arms straight and vertical.
Triceps/DBReclinedTricepsExtension.execution: Lower dumbbells behind each side of neck by flexing elbows allowing forearms to travel behind upper arms with elbows remaining overhead. Raise dumbbells overhead by extending elbows until arms are positioned straight and vertical. Lower and repeat.
Triceps/DBReclinedTricepsExtension.comments: Reclined position can be used instead of upright position for those who lack ability to fully flex shoulder. Bench inclined 70° to 80° is equivalent to reclined upright position 10° to 20° from vertical. Back support should not be so high that it interferes with dumbbells being completely lowered (ie: full range of motion). Keep elbow pointed upward so movement does not resemble overhead press.

Triceps/DBTriExt.name: Dumbbell Triceps Extension
Triceps/DBTriExt.preparation: Position one dumbbell over head with both hands under inner plate (heart shaped grip).
Triceps/DBTriExt.execution: With elbows over head, lower forearm behind upper arm by flexing elbows. Flex wrists at bottom to avoid hitting dumbbell on back of neck. Raise dumbbell over head by extending elbows while hyperextending wrists. Return and repeat.
Triceps/DBTriExt.comments: Position wrists closer together to keep elbows from pointing out too much. Let dumbbell pull back arm to maintain full shoulder flexion. Consider using seat with back support as illustrated. Back support should not be so high that it interferes with dumbbell being completely lowered (i.e. full range of motion). If shoulder flexion flexibility is not adequate, position hips slightly forward (as illustrated) so elbows are positioned upward. Position body more upright if shoulder flexion flexibility is adequate. See suggested

Triceps/LVBBCloseGripBenchPress.name: Lever Barbell Close Grip Bench Press (plate loaded)
Triceps/LVBBCloseGripBenchPress.preparation: Lie on bench with bar above chest and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Triceps/LVBBCloseGripBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to chest with elbows close to body. Push barbell back up until arms are straight. Repeat.
Triceps/LVBBCloseGripBenchPress.comments: Grip can be slightly narrower than shoulder width but not too close. Also see

Triceps/LVAltTriExt.name: Lever Alternating Triceps Extension
Triceps/LVAltTriExt.preparation: Sit on seat. Grasp handles and place back of upper arms on padding.
Triceps/LVAltTriExt.execution: Push one lever out and down until arm is fully extended. Return until forearm contacts upper arm. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue alternating movement between arms.
Triceps/LVAltTriExt.comments: If machine has secondary lever (as shown), elbows do not have to be exactly aligned with primary fulcrum.

Triceps/LVCloseGripBenchPressH.name: Lever Close Grip Bench Press (plate loaded)
Triceps/LVCloseGripBenchPressH.preparation: Lie on bench with lever handles above sides of chest. Grasp handles with narrow overhand grip just above each side of chest.
Triceps/LVCloseGripBenchPressH.execution: Press lever up until arms are extended. Return weights down to starting position. Repeat.
Triceps/LVCloseGripBenchPressH.comments: Hands will be closer together at top of movement as compared to

Triceps/LVCloseGripInclineBenchPress.name: Lever Close Grip Incline Bench Press
Triceps/LVCloseGripInclineBenchPress.preparation: Lie on incline bench with parallel lever bars close to sides of chest. Grasp handles with shoulder width grip.
Triceps/LVCloseGripInclineBenchPress.execution: Press lever until arms are ext   ended. Return weight until wrists are at side of chest. Repeat.

Triceps/LVInclineTricepsExtension.name: Lever Incline Triceps Extension
Triceps/LVInclineTricepsExtension.preparation: Sit on seat and lie back on back support. Push foot lever down with foot and grasp lever handles from behind. With lever handles behind head, place both feet on support or floor.
Triceps/LVInclineTricepsExtension.execution: Push lever handles up over head until arms are fully extended. Return and repeat.
Triceps/LVInclineTricepsExtension.comments: When finished, push foot lever down, release handles, then release foot lever.

Triceps/LVOverhandTriDip.name: Lever Overhand Triceps Dip
Triceps/LVOverhandTriDip.preparation: Sit on seat with back against pad. Gra   sp end of handles with overhand grip and position elbows back.
Triceps/LVOverhandTriDip.execution: Push levers down by straightening arms downward. Allow lever bar to raise with elbows pointing back until shoulders are slightly stretched. Repeat.

Triceps/LVPushdown.name: Lever Pushdown
Triceps/LVPushdown.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles by shoulders. Position elbows to sides.
Triceps/LVPushdown.execution: Push lever down beyond hips until arm is fully extended. Return and repeat.

Triceps/LVTriDip.name: Lever Triceps Dip
Triceps/LVTriDip.preparation: If possible, place handles in narrow position. Sit on seat with back against pad. Grasp handles and position elbows back.
Triceps/LVTriDip.execution: Push levers down by straightening arms downward. Allow lever bar to raise with elbows pointing back until shoulders are slightly stretched. Repeat.

Triceps/LVTriDip2.name: Lever Triceps Dip
Triceps/LVTriDip2.preparation: If possible, place handles in narrow position. Sit on seat with legs under pads. Grasp handles and position elbows back.
Triceps/LVTriDip2.execution: Push levers down by straightening arms downward. Allow lever bar to raise with elbows pointing back until shoulders are slightly stretched. Repeat.

Triceps/LVSeatedCloseGripPress.name: Lever Seated Close Grip Press
Triceps/LVSeatedCloseGripPress.preparation: Sit on seat with chest at height of handles. Grasp handles with shoulder width or slightly narrower overhand grip, just against sides of chest; elbows somewhat down to sides.
Triceps/LVSeatedCloseGripPress.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until forearm is against upper arm. Repeat.
Triceps/LVSeatedCloseGripPress.comments: If lever arms freely move together or apart, keep moderately close grip throughout movement. Triceps will not be as involved in movement if grip is lower than chest. Seat height should be adjusted so bar is at least lower chest height. Also

Triceps/LVTriExt.name: Lever Triceps Extension
Triceps/LVTriExt.preparation: Sit on seat. Grasp handles and place back of upper arms parallel on padding with elbows approximately in line with lever's fulcrum.
Triceps/LVTriExt.execution: Push lever down until arms are fully extended. Return until forearms contact upper arms. Repeat.
Triceps/LVTriExt.comments: With heavy resistance, back pad will need to be adjusted to keep torso close to arm pad. Adjust seat height, so back of upper arms rest on padding. If seat is too high, shoulder will need to rise near end of extension to complete final range of motion since forearms will make contact with pad before lockout. If seat is too low, range of motion will be compromised because elbows will not be completely flexed at beginning of movement.

Triceps/LVTriDipH.name: Lever Triceps Dip (plate loaded)
Triceps/LVTriDipH.preparation: Sit upright on seat. If possible, place handles in narrow position. Grasp handles.
Triceps/LVTriDipH.execution: Push levers down with elbows pointing back. Allow lever bar to raise until shoulders are slightly stretched. Repeat.

Triceps/LVTriExt2.name: Lever Triceps Extension
Triceps/LVTriExt2.preparation: Sit on seat with arm pads apart to sides. Slide arm pads closer together to sides of the chest. Grasp handles and places back of upper arms on padding.
Triceps/LVTriExt2.execution: Push the lever down until arms are fully extended. Return until forearms contact upper arms. Repeat.
Triceps/LVTriExt2.comments: To position elbows higher than the shoulder, position seat lower. To position elbows lower than shoulders, position seat higher. Also, see

Triceps/LVTriExtGripless.name: Lever Triceps Extension (plate loaded)
Triceps/LVTriExtGripless.preparation: Sit on seat. Place forearms on lever pad and back of upper arms, parallel on padding with elbows in line with lever's fulcrum.
Triceps/LVTriExtGripless.execution: Push lever down until arms are fully extended. Return and repeat.
Triceps/LVTriExtGripless.comments: With heavy resistance, back pad will need to be adjusted to keep torso close to arm pad. Adjust seat height so back of upper arms rest on padding. If seat is too high, shoulder will need to rise near end of extension to complete final range of motion since forearms will make contact with pad before lockout. If seat is too low, range of motion will be compromised because elbows will not be completely flexed at beginning of movement. Also see

Triceps/LVTricepsExtensionNoSeatPL.name: Lever Triceps Extension (no seat, plate loaded)
Triceps/LVTricepsExtensionNoSeatPL.preparation: Stand behind arm pad facing lever handles. Place one foot forward under arm pad and opposite foot back on foot bar. Grasp handles with narrow overhand grip. Squat down and position chest up against side of pad and back of upper arms on upper angled padded surface.
Triceps/LVTricepsExtensionNoSeatPL.execution: Push lever down until arms are fully extended. Return and repeat.
Triceps/LVTricepsExtensionNoSeatPL.comments: In effort to achieve fuller range of motion, head can be positioned down so handles can clear over head. With heavy resistance, back pad will need to be adjusted to keep torso close to arm pad. Position armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement.

Triceps/SLStandingTricepsDip.name: Sled Standing Triceps Dip
Triceps/SLStandingTricepsDip.preparation: Stand between handles facing machine. Grasp parallel handles and position elbows back. Squat down slightly by bending hips and knees, just enough to raise selected weight up from remaining weight stack.
Triceps/SLStandingTricepsDip.execution: Push levers down by straightening arms downward. Allow lever bar to raise with elbows pointing back until slight stretch is felt in shoulders. Repeat.
Triceps/SLStandingTricepsDip.comments: This particular machine design is rare. See typical dip machines:​​​​

Triceps/LVTricepsExtensionOH.name: Lever Overhead Triceps Extension
Triceps/LVTricepsExtensionOH.preparation: Sit on seat. Push foot lever down with foot and grasp lever handles from behind. With lever handles behind neck, place both feet on support or floor.
Triceps/LVTricepsExtensionOH.execution: Push lever handles up over head until arms are fully extended. Return and repeat.
Triceps/LVTricepsExtensionOH.comments: When finished, push foot lever down, release handles, then release foot lever.

Triceps/SMCloseGripBenchPress.name: Smith Close Grip Bench Press
Triceps/SMCloseGripBenchPress.preparation: Lie on bench with bar above chest and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Triceps/SMCloseGripBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to chest with elbows close to body. Push bar back up until arms are straight. Repeat.
Triceps/SMCloseGripBenchPress.comments: Grip can be slightly narrower than shoulder width but not too close. Also see

Triceps/SMCloseGripInclineBenchPress.name: Smith Close Grip Incline Bench Press
Triceps/SMCloseGripInclineBenchPress.preparation: Lie on incline bench with bar above chest and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
Triceps/SMCloseGripInclineBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to chest with elbows close to body. Push bar back up until arms are straight. Repeat.
Triceps/SMCloseGripInclineBenchPress.comments: Grip can be slightly narrower than shoulder width but not too close. Also see

Triceps/STSelfAssistedTricepsDip.name: Suspended Self-assisted Triceps Dip
Triceps/STSelfAssistedTricepsDip.preparation: Stand between two suspension handles, approximately mid-thigh height. Grasp handles on each side and straighten arms with shoulders above hands. Holding position firmly and place bodyweight on handles. Place toes on floor behind with knees bent and feet back.
Triceps/STSelfAssistedTricepsDip.execution: Lower body by bending arms back. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees to bend, keeping toes in contact with floor. When slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, push body up back up until arms are straight. Repeat with minimal assistance from legs.
Triceps/STSelfAssistedTricepsDip.comments: If lower body is used for assistance,

Triceps/STTriDip.name: Suspended Triceps Dip
Triceps/STTriDip.preparation: Stand between two suspension handles and grasp handles on each side of torso. Hold position firmly and lift feet from floor.
Triceps/STTriDip.execution: Push body up until arms are straight. Lower body until slight stretch is felt in shoulders. Repeat.
Triceps/STTriDip.comments: This exercise can be performed on

Triceps/WtBenchDip.name: Weighted Bench Dip
Triceps/WtBenchDip.preparation: Sit on inside of one of two benches placed parallel, slightly less than leg's length away. Place hands on edge of bench. Straighten arms, slide rear end off of edge of bench and position heels on adjacent bench with legs straight. Have assistant place weight on lap near hips.
Triceps/WtBenchDip.execution: Lower body by bending arms until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder, or rear end touches floor. Raise body and repeat.
Triceps/WtBenchDip.comments: Bench height should allow for full range of motion. If assistant is not available, place weight on lap sitting on floor or edge of bench.

Triceps/WtPushup.name: Weighted Close Grip Push-up
Triceps/WtPushup.preparation: Lie prone on floor with hands under shoulders or slightly narrower. Position body up off floor with extended arms and body straight. Partner can place weight plate(s) on back if needed.
Triceps/WtPushup.execution: Keeping body straight, lower body to floor by bending arms. Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
Triceps/WtPushup.comments: Both upper and lower body must be kept straight throughout movement. Exercise can be performed without additional weight (See

Triceps/STTricepsExtension.name: Suspended Triceps Extension
Triceps/STTricepsExtension.preparation: Grasp handles and step forward between suspension trainers. Position arms downward and slightly forward, nearly parallel with suspension straps. Lean forward, placing upper body weight onto handles with arms straight, while stepping back onto forefeet so body is leaning forward at desired angle. Straighten body, so torso is in-line with legs.
Triceps/STTricepsExtension.execution: Lower body by bending elbows, allowing head to travel between suspension handles. Raise body up and back up until arms are extended. Repeat.
Triceps/STTricepsExtension.comments: Both upper and lower body should be kept straight throughout movement. Angle of body affects difficulty of movement. See

WristExtensors/BBReverseWristCurl.name: Barbell Reverse Wrist Curl
WristExtensors/BBReverseWristCurl.preparation: Sit and grasp bar with narrow to shoulder width overhand grip. Rest forearms on thighs with wrists just beyond knees.
WristExtensors/BBReverseWristCurl.execution: Raise barbell by pointing knuckles upward as high as possible. Return until knuckles are pointing downward as far as possible. Repeat.
WristExtensors/BBReverseWristCurl.comments: Keep elbows approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion.

WristExtensors/CBReverseWristCurl.name: Cable Reverse Wrist Curl
WristExtensors/CBReverseWristCurl.preparation: Sit and grasp cable bar with narrow to shoulder width overhand grip. Rest forearms on thighs with wrists just beyond knees.
WristExtensors/CBReverseWristCurl.execution: Raise stirrup by pointing knuckles upward as high as possible. Return until knuckles are pointing downward as far as possible. Repeat.
WristExtensors/CBReverseWristCurl.comments: Do not allow elbows to rise.

Triceps/WtTriDip.name: Weighted Triceps Dip
Triceps/WtTriDip.preparation: Place weight on dip belt around waist or place dumbbell between lower legs just above feet. Mount
Triceps/WtTriDip.execution: , arms straight with shoulders above hands. Keep hips straight.
Triceps/WtTriDip.comments: Lower body until slight stretch is felt in shoulders. Push body up until arms are straight. Repeat.

WristExtensors/CBOneArmReverseWristCurl.name: Cable One Arm Reverse Wrist Curl
WristExtensors/CBOneArmReverseWristCurl.preparation: Sit and grasp cable stirrup. Rest forearm on thigh with palm facing down and with wrist just beyond knee.
WristExtensors/CBOneArmReverseWristCurl.execution: Raise stirrup by pointing knuckles upward as high as possible. Return until knuckles are pointing downward as far as possible. Repeat.
WristExtensors/CBOneArmReverseWristCurl.comments: Do not allow elbow to rise. Hand may be placed under wrist (as demonstrated) to offer stability and to maintain horizontal orientation of forearm.

WristExtensors/DBRadialFlexion.name: Dumbbell Radial Deviation
WristExtensors/DBRadialFlexion.preparation: Grasp half loaded dumbbell with plate on thumb side. Position arm down to side.
WristExtensors/DBRadialFlexion.execution: Bend wrist so weighted side is pulled upward. Lower until weighted side is pointing downward. Repeat.
WristExtensors/DBRadialFlexion.comments: If half loaded dumbbell is not available, one of two substitutes can be used.

WristExtensors/CBRollerWristExtention.name: Cable Roller Wrist Extension
WristExtensors/CBRollerWristExtention.preparation: Stand behind weight plate(s) on floor and grasp wrist roller handle with both hands; over hand grip.
WristExtensors/CBRollerWristExtention.execution: With left hand gripping handle, relax grip of right hand and slide grip in front of handle (by flexing wrist) and regrip. Relax grip of left hand and hyperextend right wrist. Repeat sequence with opposite hands, alternating back and forth until weight plate has raised up near hands. Lower weight steadily with opposite movement.

WristExtensors/LVRadialFlexion.name: Lever Radial Deviation
WristExtensors/LVRadialFlexion.preparation: Rotate handle under and over so handle is in slightly upward position toward head. Grasp handle with thumb ups grip so thumb side of fist is pulled away under resistance.
WristExtensors/LVRadialFlexion.execution: Bend wrist so thumb side of fist is pulled up. Return to starting position and repeat.

WristExtensors/DBReverseWristCurl.name: Dumbbell Reverse Wrist Curl
WristExtensors/DBReverseWristCurl.preparation: Sit and grip dumbbell with overhand grip. Rest forearm on thigh with wrist just beyond knee.
WristExtensors/DBReverseWristCurl.execution: Raise dummbell by pointing knuckles upward as high as possible. Return until knuckles are pointing downward as far as possible. Repeat.
WristExtensors/DBReverseWristCurl.comments: Keep elbow approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion. Hand may be placed under wrist to offer stability and to maintain horizontal orientation of forearm.

WristExtensors/LVReverseWristCurl.name: Lever Reverse Wrist Curl
WristExtensors/LVReverseWristCurl.preparation: Grasp handles with overhand grip to each side. Place forearms on arm pads.
WristExtensors/LVReverseWristCurl.execution: Raise handles until wrist is fully hyperextended. Lower handles until wrists are fully flexed. Repeat.
WristExtensors/LVReverseWristCurl.comments: Keep forearms horizontal, flat on arm pads throughout exercise. See

WristExtensors/LVReverseWristCurlPL.name: Lever Reverse Wrist Curl (plate loaded)
WristExtensors/LVReverseWristCurlPL.preparation: Grasp bar with overhand grip. Place forearm on padded platform.
WristExtensors/LVReverseWristCurlPL.execution: Raise bar until wrist is fully hyperextended and return until wrist is fully flexed. Repeat.
WristExtensors/LVReverseWristCurlPL.comments: Some units, as one illustrated above, may be placed on sturdy table top or on floor. Keep forearm flat on padded platform throughout exercise.

WristExtensors/LVRollerRadialFlexion.name: Lever Roller Radial Deviation
WristExtensors/LVRollerRadialFlexion.preparation: Place hands on knobs at each end of roller.
WristExtensors/LVRollerRadialFlexion.execution: With left hand gripping knob, relax grip of right hand and slide grip downward so fingers are under bottom of knob (by
WristExtensors/LVRollerRadialFlexion.comments: ) and regrip. Relax grip of left hand and rotate knob with right hand so thumb travels closer to body (by

WristFlexors/BBWristCurl.name: Barbell Wrist Curl
WristFlexors/BBWristCurl.preparation: Sit and grasp bar with narrow to shoulder width underhand grip. Rest forearms on thighs with wrists just beyond knees.
WristFlexors/BBWristCurl.execution: Allow barbell to roll out of palms down to fingers. Raise barbell back up by gripping and pointing knuckles up as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
WristFlexors/BBWristCurl.comments: Keep elbows approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion.

WristExtensors/LVRollerWristExtention.name: Lever Roller Wrist Extension
WristExtensors/LVRollerWristExtention.preparation: Grasp wrist roller handle with both hands; over hand grip.
WristExtensors/LVRollerWristExtention.execution: With left hand gripping handle, relax grip of right hand and slide grip in front of handle (by flexing wrist) and regrip. Relax grip of left hand and hyperextend right wrist. Repeat sequence with opposite hands, alternating back and forth until weight plate has raised up near hands. Lower weight steadily with opposite movement or loosen grip slightly to control descent of weight stack. Repeat.

WristFlexors/CBOneArmWristCurl.name: Cable One Arm Wrist Curl
WristFlexors/CBOneArmWristCurl.preparation: Sit and grasp cable stirrup. Rest forearm on thigh with palm up and wrist just beyond knees.
WristFlexors/CBOneArmWristCurl.execution: Allow cable bar to roll out of palms down to fingers. Raise cable bar back up by gripping and pointing knuckles up as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
WristFlexors/CBOneArmWristCurl.comments: Hand may be placed under wrist (as demonstrated) to offer stability and to maintain horizontal orientation of forearm.

WristFlexors/CBWristCurl.name: Cable Wrist Curl
WristFlexors/CBWristCurl.preparation: Sit and grasp cable bar with narrow to shoulder width underhand grip. Rest forearms on thighs with wrists just beyond knees.
WristFlexors/CBWristCurl.execution: Allow cable bar to roll out of palms down to fingers. Raise cable bar back up by gripping and pointing knuckles up as high as possible. Lower and repeat.

WristFlexors/CBRollerWristFlexion.name: Cable Roller Wrist Flexion
