WristFlexors/CBRollerWristFlexion.preparation: Stand behind weight plate(s) on floor and grasp wrist roller handle with both hands; over hand grip.
WristFlexors/CBRollerWristFlexion.execution: With left hand gripping handle, relax grip of right hand and slide grip behind handle (by hypexending wrist) and regrip. Relax grip of left hand and flex right wrist. Repeat sequence with opposite hands, alternating back and forth until weight plate has raised up near hands. Lower weight steadily with opposite movement.

WristFlexors/DBUlnarFlexion.name: Dumbbell Ulnar Deviation
WristFlexors/DBUlnarFlexion.preparation: Grasp half loaded dumbbell with plate on pinkie side. Position arm down to side.
WristFlexors/DBUlnarFlexion.execution: Bend wrist so weighted side is pulled upward. Lower until weighted side is pointing downward. Repeat.
WristFlexors/DBUlnarFlexion.comments: If half loaded dumbbell is not available, one of two substitutes can be used.

WristFlexors/DBWristCurl.name: Dumbbell Wrist Curl
WristFlexors/DBWristCurl.preparation: Sit and grasp dumbbell with underhand grip. Rest forearm on thigh with wrist just beyond knee.
WristFlexors/DBWristCurl.execution: Allow dumbbell to roll out of palm down to fingers. Raise dumbbell back up by gripping and pointing knuckles up as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
WristFlexors/DBWristCurl.comments: Keep elbow approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion. Hand may be placed under wrist to offer stability and to maintain horizontal orientation of forearm.

WristFlexors/LVGrip.name: Lever Grip
WristFlexors/LVGrip.preparation: Sit on seat. Grasp lever handles on each side; fingers around lever handles and base of thumbs around stationary bars.
WristFlexors/LVGrip.execution: Squeeze bars together with both hands until lever makes contact with stationary bars. Lower to original position and repeat.

WristFlexors/LVGripPL.name: Lever Grip (plate loaded)
WristFlexors/LVGripPL.preparation: Sit on seat, straddling apparatus. Grasp lever handles on each side; fingers around lever handles and base of thumbs around stationary bars.
WristFlexors/LVGripPL.execution: Squeeze bars together with both hands until lower lever makes contact with upper bars. Lower to original position and repeat.

WristFlexors/LVRollerUlnarFlexion.name: Lever Roller Ulnar Deviation
WristFlexors/LVRollerUlnarFlexion.execution: Place hands on knobs at each end of roller.

WristFlexors/LVWristCurl.name: Lever Wrist Curl
WristFlexors/LVWristCurl.preparation: Grasp bar with underhand grip to each side. Place forearms on arm pads.
WristFlexors/LVWristCurl.execution: Raise handles up until wrist is fully flexed. Lower handles until wrists are full hyperextended. Repeat.
WristFlexors/LVWristCurl.comments: Keep forearms horizontal, flat on arm pads throughout exercise. See

WristFlexors/LVUlnarFlexion.name: Lever Ulnar Deviation
WristFlexors/LVUlnarFlexion.execution: Rotate handle over and under so handle is in slightly downward position toward thighs. Grasp handle with thumb ups grip so fist is pulled up under resistance.

WristFlexors/LVRollerWristFlexion.name: Lever Roller Wrist Flexion
WristFlexors/LVRollerWristFlexion.execution: Grasp wrist roller handles with both hands; over hand grip.

WeightTraining/LowBack.name: Lower Back Exercises, Recuperation & Program Design
WeightTraining/LowBack.execution: , adequate recuperation of the lower back (
WeightTraining/LowBack.comments: muscles and the joints of the

WristFlexors/LVWristCurlPL.name: Lever Wrist Curl (plate loaded)
WristFlexors/LVWristCurlPL.preparation: Grasp bar with underhand grip. Place forearm on padded platform.
WristFlexors/LVWristCurlPL.execution: Raise bar up until wrist is fully flexed. Lower and repeat.
WristFlexors/LVWristCurlPL.comments: Some units, as one illustrated above, may be placed on sturdy table top or on floor. Keep forearm flat on padded platform throughout exercise.

WristFlexors/SLGripPlateLoaded.name: Sled Grip (plate loaded)
WristFlexors/SLGripPlateLoaded.preparation: Bend over and grasp bar grips with both hands; fingers under lower bar and base of thumbs over top stationary bar.
WristFlexors/SLGripPlateLoaded.execution: Squeeze bar grips together until lower bar makes contact with upper bar. Release to original position and repeat.

WristFlexors/SLGrip.name: Sled One Hand Grip
WristFlexors/SLGrip.preparation: Stand in front of apparatus. Grasp bar grips with one hand; fingers around far bar and base of thumb around near stationary bar.
WristFlexors/SLGrip.execution: Squeeze bar grips together until far bar makes contact with nearest bar. Release to original position and repeat.

WristFlexors/SLOneHandGripPlateLoaded.name: Sled One Hand Grip (plate loaded)
WristFlexors/SLOneHandGripPlateLoaded.preparation: Bend over and grasp bar grips with one hand; fingers under lower bar and base of thumb over top stationary bar.
WristFlexors/SLOneHandGripPlateLoaded.execution: Squeeze bar grips together until lower bar makes contact with upper bar. Release to original position and repeat.

WristFlexors/SLOneHandPinchGripPL.name: Sled One Hand Pinch Grip (plate loaded)
WristFlexors/SLOneHandPinchGripPL.preparation: Place hand around horizontal surfaces; fingers along lower surface and thumb on upper surface.
WristFlexors/SLOneHandPinchGripPL.execution: Pinch surfaces together until lower part makes contact with upper part. Release to original position or just before surfaces become too far apart. Repeat.

RectusAbdominis/LVLyingCrunchPL.name: Lever Lying Crunch (plate loaded)
RectusAbdominis/LVLyingCrunchPL.preparation: Lie on machine with feet on foot bar. Place forearms on bars at sides or grasp handles above to each side.
RectusAbdominis/LVLyingCrunchPL.execution: With hips stationary, raise upper back pad by flexing waist. Return and repeat.
RectusAbdominis/LVLyingCrunchPL.comments: Lever fulcrum should be aligned with waist, not hips. See
